reviews.review: Quite place after noisy visiting. this is a very nice garden to visit. if you are tired of noisy thamels' streets, this is the place to go. there is also a very nice restaurant inside (lunch, coffee break)
Relaxed. Top spot for coming down from the mountains after long trek. Very quiet, green, good food, mattresses in the garden for laying down

A little oasis of calm amidst the chaos. The gardens are much smaller than we were expecting. But don't let that put you off - this is a little oasis of peace and tranquility amidst the chaos of Kathmandu.
The cafes inside are very expensive compared to most in the city, but you are paying for the setting, for some peace and quiet.
Picturesque. This is a great place-it is right in the heart of Thamel along the main street-easily accessible by walking
Beautiful garden. I visited garden of dreams yesterday. A super beautiful appointed garden. Nice restaurant are there. Just a great location to have a rest from all the traffic and honking.

Green and peaceful place on the map of Kathmandu. in the busy and crowded / polluted Kathmandu find a green place to rest and relax. It was the best choice to spend there few hours just after trekking. 200NR on entrance, wi-fi and cafe inside
Lovely, green and romantic. :)

Relaxing place. The gardens are very nice and a step away from the hectic life outside the walls.
We had lunch which was very good but very highly priced.
Well worth a visit .

Great place to get away from the traffic/noise. It costs 200 nepali rupees to get in but it was a refuge from the noise of busy, polluted Kathmandu. We went to the cafe and had a vegetarian thali plate-it was big, enough to share for 2 (not for a full dinner though).
Very Pretty and Informative. Go ahead and stop here all of the gardens are well maintained and the lunch looked awesome. A quiet time alternative.

Offers a little respite from Thamel. The garden itself is nicely cared for and is a good place to dash into for a break from the hustle and bustle outside. Surprisingly peaceful place to enjoy a little meal in the cafe or restaurant. Also has an attached gallery and more than enough room for a couple to sit away from view.

Nice but small. It's a place to hang out with your loved one for an hpur or two outside the Thamel. But don't expect much more.
Oh, and it costs about 200 NRs to enter, per person.
Lovely oasis . Great place to hang out if your staying in the tourist ghetto of Thamel. I went here to read, resturant very expensive. Go prepared as you can't reenter on the same ticket.
Lovely Gardens. A refuge from the traffic and horn honking! Even though it was full of people it didn't seem crowded. I spent a few hours just relaxing and reading in the quiet space.

Quiet oasis in heart of the city. I had seen this listed on the things to do in Kathmandu and we happened to walk just by it. It's a nice oasis. Once inside, it's got very well laid out gardens with lots of areas to sit and relax. We saw lots of people from all walks of life. The lovers sitting on benches in the corner, the tired travels laying on the grass to get a respit and everyone in between. Worth a stop when you're ready to get away from the noise and bustle just outside the doors.
A very pleasant retreat from busy Kathmandu. Lots of green grass, trees, flowers and fountains. A beautiful oasis in the midst of dirty, dusty, boisterous Kathmandu.

Afternoon relaxation . Such a great place to spend a day or an afternoon chilling out. Wonderful manicured gardens with plenty of seating and shade, a little cafe with what looked like yummy food. My advice- bring a rug, some books, drinks and snacks and lie down in the sunshine.

Hidden gem!. All you can see from the outside is a big brick wall -- we weren't even sure if we wanted to bother checking it out -- but the Garden of Dreams ended up being a highlight of our trip. Such a contrast to the busy streets of Kathmandu, the garden is lush and green with so many flowers, and beautiful ponds and fountains are littered throughout. You can get a mat (although we didn't figure out how) or just spread out a blanket and lie on the grass. Nothing really to do there but to relax, take a few pictures and enjoy the beauty. Loved it.

A great break from the busyness of Thamel. We stopped here for tea and coffee after a busy morning of errands in Thamel. What a beautiful and peaceful setting. We visited during Dashain and saw children playing on the bamboo swing,
Old garsen. Hi I amreally happy with this garsen in kathmandu is really good locetion really greeny and historical botanical harden
Excellent. This is a beautiful place to visit. It's an exquisitely laid out formal garden with some very nice special features. You won't be disappointed.

$200 NPR. Costs to get in but it is a lovely garden. Great for kids to get a clean place to play and sit. There are 3 locations to eat or drink coffee. Lots of seating but there are also many people visiting.
an Aussie place inside KTM. You can never find a place with nice seat, friend hangout or picnic nicer than it when in KTM. An aussie environment and nice people

Excellent Place for a Cofee. Guys if you need calmness, serenity of a small palace turned into a garden cum restaurant then please visit this place. The variety of flowers, cultural museum about Kathmandu and history of that small palace if what you would love to see. If you are on your honemoon and want a perfect location for a shoot, you will love this place. This place has got perfect spots to make your memories cherish for a lifetime.

Must Visit for Lovers of Parks and Gardens. If you are a lover of parks and gardens then this is a must visit! It's lush and beautiful and smells nice and reminds you of a botanical garden. It's big and there's lots of room to sit and picnic or read or play music or just relax. Very nice place but it is surrounded by some of the very very strong beggars outside the gates of the garden so be firm and say no! You are only continuing to big problem of begging when you give them money

Nice enough but needs investment. I visited in October and it was clear that effort has been put into making this a lovely area of tranquility in a chaotic city. It is lovely with some nice flowers but it just misses the mark. A lot of gates are closed where there is still too much damage to view so a bit limited once you get into the garden. Ok for a half hour visit.

Garden of Dreams + Kaiser Cafe Restaurant & Bar. Very pictureque gardenAdmission fee is NPR200 per personNot too crowded, clean, nice array of plants and flowersLarge garden settingPlenty of seatings available to just sit and enjoy the flowers and garden surroundingsRomantic garden settingGreat place for couples
Garden of Dreams or Peace. Its a beautiful and serene place to visit. Very beautiful and a great place to have lunch or dinner. Was designed by an Australian couple. A must visit.

Got a flu in Kathmandu, was looking for a hot drink in a fresh air place. It is amazing, how the noise background changes once u enter! Very peaceful place, have to pay for the entrance, but i agree with that policy.Rather clean toilets.Plenty of couples around spending some romance time.Cafe serves veeeeery good irish coffee ( was just what the doctor prescribed for me) and great sandwiches!
Good garden. One of the best old ro yalgarden in Thames and good restaurants inside also good caffeine around granny

Escape from Thamel. The hustle & bustle of Thamel was getting too much for us and we need a nice quiet place to relax with the family. Our baby loved the garden and had fun running around in the open space. It seemed like a popular dating place for locals.

Nice place to meat people and chill. I went here one afternoon. 200 rupies entry is alright. It is a very clean place and service is great. There are mats on the floor on which you can relax and when it started to rain they offered us umbrellas to get around the garden.Also it's easy to meet other tourists there and chat for a while. Locals though only come as couples. The café is a bit pricey though but you can take your own food in and not eat there. On a nice day I would totally come back only to escape the crowds for a while.

A true oasis is the middle of Kathmandu!. From the outside wall I had no idea what lay inside! It is a beautifully designed garden, restaurant, library that appears to be so under used. I went three times while visiting Kathmandu. Once for dinner, once just to wander around the gardens, and once for lunch. Each time was fabulous and I will definitely make an effort to visit it again the next time I'm in Nepal.
Serenity amongst squalor. A very serene place amongst the squalor of Kathmandu. Gardens are well maintained and there is obvious pride in their upkeep. For a few hundred Rs, well worth a visit.
No spectacular. Nice garden with good view. Green area is quite hard to find in the center of Kathmandu. Entrance is about 200 roepies per person

Peace and tranquility a stone's throw from the city noise and bustle.. Need a break from Kathmandu's ever-present throngs, noise and bustle. This lovely colonial-era garden is a secluded retreat where you can while away the time amidst cool fountains, pavilions and lawns. Popular with Nepali couples as a romantic getaway, it's also a heaven for the stressed visitor looking for a respite.

Beautiful garden and oasis in the city. Had time to walk here from my hotel. Was surprised how beautiful place was. If you have time in Kathmandu you should head over, enjoy and had a cup of coffee while taking in the view.
place to relax. Right in the middle of this loud city you can find peace in this small garden. Its is indeed a place where you can dream. We needed a break and that was the best.

An oasis in the midlle of busy and noisy area. What a relief to enter the Garden of Dreams. This place is actually funded by the Austrian Govt. ItThe landscape Garden is simply beautiful. There many rare plants, and beutiful flowers and plants to photograph. This garden is also popular with young Nepalis. A very nice feelin to be there if you have been wandering in the streets beforehand. There is avery nice restaurant/ cafe and also a little museum which is worth looking into so you hve a complete picture of how the garden came about. Enjoy.
Superb. Small but just fantastic, in this so loud and busy city this is an oasis of peace and quiet.We also had lunch in the Kaiser cafe, just wonderful food

Amazing. This hidden little gem is just one place you have to visit while ur in nepal. In the middle of a busy city the garden of dreams is the perfect place to sit, relax, read a book or just people watch you can relax in the well maintained grounds on provide blankets and pillows. It is just the most perfect place to spend for the day after you come back from trekking or walking around the city of kathmandu.

Nothing special. Was in Nepal for yoga retreat but managed to spend two days in Kathmandu. This was the last thing we visited since our guide rated it as "not high priority" to visit. And he was right. Garden with just a few flowers???? Half of the garden was closed. I expected more. Ok, if you spend few hours in noisy busy Thamel is perfect place to have a break and have a cup of coffee (entrance is only 200 rs) and go to the toilet.

Respite from the chaos. As the title says a small respite from the chaos, noise and dust of Kathmandu. Lovely formal garden though it is small in size. Great place to come and read a book or simply take in the beautiful flowers and surrounds.

heavenly haven. Beautifully kept gardens. I went here right when they opened. Stepping right out of the chaos of Kathmandu and into a serene secret garden. I took tea and had a light breakfast here. My only wish is that some of the poorer residents of Kathmandu got to enjoy it.

take a rest. if you need a place for rest your body and your mind , while in Kathmandu, this is the perfect place, grab your book, and lay down in one of the mat in the garden...or just sit and breath!peaceful and green placelove it

A serene place to be.... Its a hidden gem right in the middle of all the hustle bustle of traffic, shops and busy pedestrians and very close to Thamel. A nice tranquil little park to relax and enjoy a chilled beer in the mid day heat.

A haven away fromThe chaos of Thamel. I visited 3 times . Each timeI just loved the experiences . Had a solo lunch in gardens , was sublime . Had an afternoon tea with friend perfecto and lunch with friend , remembered . Highly recommend visiting and experiencing .
Nice location for a coffee break. Quiet and relaxing place that makes you forget you're in a big, busy city for a moment. The coffee is pretty good. Entrance fee = 200 rupees per person.

First visit . Lovely and calm after the hustle and bustle of Thamel. It seems to be a place where courting couples go. However a place to visit to sit outside in lovely gardens in the shade. (Can still hear the car horns) .
Good. One of the individual palace to expend time and consideration with history call dreams of garden is really important and good garden

Nice, serene and peaceful hangout place great for outdoors on a sunny day. Very pretty garden in the heart of Kathmandu City. Lovely old architecture. Great place to chill, relax with a book in your hands. Good for solo, couple and group visits. Restaurant inside offers good selection of food. Entry fees is on the higher end with respect to Nepal tourist spots.
Quiet space in a busy city. The Garden of Dreams is a beautiful getaway for anyone who finds the excitement of Kathmandu a little too much.

Nice place to drink a coffee. If you are exhausted from the busy streets of Thamel, take a rest in this beautiful garden, where love couples are scattered everywhere. You can sit in the nice cafe and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.

beautiful getaway from the chaos of the city. such a lovely garden and cafe. came here to enjoy some time away from the hustle and bustle of the city. quiet and serene with a nice cafe that serves a full menu. i ended up staying for several hours, just laying out and reading my book

Wonderful café in a serene garden. The Garden of Dreams is a nice place to relax and breathe away from the hectic streets of Kathmandu. The gardens themselves are lovely, but there is a bit of sadness from the adjacent palace, which is dilapidated and damaged by the 2015 earthquake.The café in the garden has delicious food and sitting at a garden table allows you to imagine yourself a guest of the garden's owner. It's quite lovely, and the food is delicious.

Nice garden with nice cafe inside. A must visit place in Kathmandu. You need to pay to enter this place. The garden is beautiful however the ticket officer and guard there do not havea beautiful smile. Iwas a bit disturb with their 'no expression' face andnot so friendly welcome attitude. However, the beauty of the garden made my day better. There few nicecafe inside this garden. And what surprise me on the wall of one of the cafe is crafted a beautiful poem written by Omay Khayyam which is i learned it duringmy secondary school. He is a great poemist :)
Greeny. In side tawn is nat much greeny but dream of garden is one of the greeny palace in side city also nice and old and good cafe restaurent inside
Just wonderful!. Almost the most beautiful and peaceful place to visit inside kathmandu. The name really suits this place!

Beautiful garden in the middle of Kathmandu hustle and bustle. Beautiful garden with cafes and restaurants.Many couples go here to lie together in this beautiful surroundings. Worth a visit for relaxing if your stressed walking the streets of Tamel.

Serene atmosphere in a center of thamel. You can pass a very tranquil day after your busy day sightseeing around kathmandu when you want to rest in a relaxing atmosphere. The menu is quite expensive there along with the entrance fee however it is a recommended address to escape the crowd and buzz of the thamel city. Nearby is a himalayan java coffee to enjoy freshly brewed coffee. You will spend a very quality time with your loved ones inside the garden.

Exactly as named !! or alternately Eden in KTM !. No holds barred - this is a must for all who are in KTM . have been travelling to Nepal for over 30 years ( going again in 2 weeks ) and this is somewhere we will always visit each trip . A calm sis of tranquility in the chaos that is Thamel . Have a cocktail in the restaurant or a meal - both are worth the money , just to allow you to sit and take it all in from the slightly raised aspect of the terrace I would love to see/hear Kutumba play in the gardens as they are superb and would complement the surroundings perfectly If you don't know of them check out Kutumba on line - they are truly superb

Peace in chaos. If you get tired of the hustle and bustle and heavy duty tourist scene of Thamel, and want a little peace, the Garden of Dreams is the place to go. Sitting on the main drag into Thamel, the Garden of Dreams can be easy to miss. You will be charged a nominal fee (RS200) for entry. Enjoy the green and the sudden, surprising quiet. Food and drinks are available though I found the prices a little high. Worth it though!

Lovely garden in the city centre. This is a lovely place to spend a couple of hours relaxing. After wandering around the various small sections, we had afternoon tea in the cafe looking out over the pond. Well worth the small entrance fee.

Nice on a sunny day. We finally caught a break in the monsoon season and went to visit the "garden of dreams" on a sunny day and it was absolutely gorgeous. This beautiful Park offers a nice place for eating or drinking and enjoying a beautiful garden in the middle of the city.

Spread your love in garden of dreams. If you are couple looking for nice garden and want to enjoy the ambience then this place is for you. The garden is well decorated, has lots of flowers and there are few restaurants. You will find many couples hanging around. The restaurant inside is too expensive but the service as well as food is good.

Not worth going at all!!. It's like paying just to enter to see couples making-out in the gardens. Nothing much to see, can't take many photos as you will have all the shots with couples cuddling, making-out, kissing etc.
Nice view but not worth the time. If you don't have enough time then don't go. But if you do then might as well pass by, they have a cafe inside where u can have a few drinks .
Beautiful gardens and upscale food.. Very beautiful gardens rich with history. Museum is small but interesting. Still able to see most of the garden, even with earthquake damage. food was great.
Very meditative place. Garden of Dreams is a small paradise of Kathmandu. It is very clean, quite, very meditative place. You can also enjoy coffee in a nice cafe.
Nice for couple . I would recommend any couple to spend few romantic hours here. Place is nice but not very big. You cover it in less than 20 minutes

A quiet dinner. Very nice environment with excellent attentionate service. Beutiful garden remote fron city noise and quite refreshing. The menu is quite vaired and I recommend the traditional nepalese thali to get the real flavour of Nepal.

A welcome relief from the noise . For a two dollar fee you can just about escape the noise and pollution for a while. Nice for a stroll or sit on the grass watching chipmunk run about. Nice cafes and landscaping. So much more could be done with the balance estate, perhaps over time, until then though it's a daily must.

Nice place near thamel to skip the hustle and bustle. Green grass, beautiful flowers and peaceful surrounding overall. Well, nice place to hang around with friends. I saw many couples having private time, so it must be a popular dating site in Ktm as well.
garden of dreams. The Garden of Dreams, also, the Garden of Six Seasons, is a neo-classical garden in Kaiser Mahal Kathmandu, Nepal, built in 1920.
central locetion. dream of garden ir one of the old neture botinical garden in central of tawn also really good organic food cafe in side

A dreamy night. I went there in a nice evening. It looks more beautiful and dreamy in night. it is a romantic place. if you want to have a romantic date in Kathmandu, you can surly go there in evening. there is a restaurant inside. the food is also good.

Sublime. Inside the hustle and bustle of Thamel is an oasis of peace and tranquility. A palace restored by the Austrian people with extensive flower gardens and lilly-filled ponds this is a must see experience.

Good for relaxation. Although tourists have to pay 200 rupees each, it's a great place right outside the craziness of Thamel. A great place to relax and get some peace and quiet. A very beautiful garden.
An Oasis in the midst of the chaos & noise of the Kathmandu traffic. It is nice to be able to escape from the chaos and dirt in Kathmandu to one of the few green and welll-kept places in the city.

Unexpected place in the middle of the city. As suggested by the our tour guide we went to this place, we were really amazed to seeing place like this in the middle of the concrete jungle. The garden is very relaxing and peaceful and quite bit crowed as is famous among the local coupels. I recommend every tourist to visit this garden.

Relaxed & Peaceful Amidst The Chaos . Nice peaceful park amidst the madness of Kathmandu. Unfortunately it's a small space but better than nothing. Nice pools and manicured grass & plants. There's even a quaint coffee shop.
Entrance is R200pp and it's about 15min walk from Thamel.

A bit pricy. The restaurant is situated in 'The Garden', but they charge you to enter 'The Garden', even if its too dark to actually see the gardens, which are quite pretty by day. The restaurant is nicely situated, but the chairs are really uncomfortable, having no backs to lean on. Background music is nice and low, and waiter service is good, and the food is generally good, except that portions of Duck seem to be very small? I had to ask double in order to ensure a decent amount, and they then tried to charge double, but relented when I protested. The wine is seriously expensive for a good bottle, varying from about $35 to $70 and then you can add 10% service charge and 13% tax. All in all though, I like going there, and it's relatively quiet and if they could just serve the food a little hotter, then there is not too much to complain about! The staff tend to hurry you a bit after 9:30pm, when they want to go home. Pricy, flawed, but recommended.
Thanks. One of the important great garden of dreams in kathmandu valley and restaurants also good inside gardens and greeny we love the palace

For Relaxing. I visit this place almost everytime i go to kathmandu. Its a best place to get relax for sometime, specially when you are roaming and doing shopping in thamel area. Spare some time and go to this garden to spend some quality time with family. Entry fee is 100 Npr for local people and 200 Npr for foreign national. Close to thamel and narayanhiti museum.

A calm and perfecct place for spending few hours lonely or with friend(s). A nice and aristocratic place for hangout alone or with friend(s), or family members. There is a cafe and bar in there, and you will definitely enjoy your times here.
Just relax and read a book. Quiet and beautiful this garden is a good spot to unwind. Just walk around, enjoy the flowers and the ponds; then take a tea and read a book.

Blissfull garden in the midst of concrete chaos. Great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the Kathmandu streets, beautiful and broad range of blossoming flowers and trees, squirrels running around, little cafe to soak up the serenity. Good stuff.

Nice place to escape the chaos of Kathmandu. I spent an afternoon reading there, because I was getting a bit overwhelmed with the pollution and the crowds. It was a nice quiet place to unwind and take a few pictures. Bring a book, a snack, or even a picnic.

You can't hear the noice from cars ect they wrote. Well didn't exactly call this garden silence, but is"s nice break from the busy and more noisy Thamel area.Today lotts'a squirrels was running around, fun to look at
Peaceful Paradise. A place of beauty, peace and tranquility right in the midst of a chaotic city. Beautiful place to sit and meditate or contemplate.

Love is always in the air here. Really amazing and peaceful place. Should visit with your partner. Friends and family can also visit. Best around the evening when the sun starts to hide away and the temperature is pleasant. They have a restaurant as well.
Real dreams place.. For peaceful environment its really closest place. Wonderful architect and garden for stayed and make peacefully mind
good . dream of darden is onurture dotinacal ne of the netueal botinacal garden in tawn also there good cafe testament
Oasis from madness of Kat. Well kept gardens in central Kathmandu. Sunset best time to visit due to low temperature. Restaurant looked lovely, but pretty pricey.

Nice but Expensive. The garden of dreams is a peaceful spot in the middle of a crowded city. The restaurant makes excellent food but I wouldn't go if you're travelling on a tight budget. However I did have a nice lunch there.

Peace!!. Perfect place to get hide from hustle and bustle of Thamel.....
gorgeous, clean and elating environment!

Serene. I loved having this beautiful garden in the middle of chaos. I came here to just reflect on life. It's a beautiful garden and you just lay around and contemplate life. Lots of world travelers doing the same

Small paradise in noisy Thamel. This is a beautiful place where you can take a break from Thamel life and chill while enjoying a nice surrounding. The coffee place is also great although a little more expensive than other coffee shops near, yet the place is worth it!
Nothing special . Been there as its near to thamel, but no major attraction to watch, cafe inside is nice, museum is with some pictures to see,

A calm, romantic, get away from it all place. We really enjoyed our visit here. It is so relaxing and you feel away from the hectic life of Kathmandu. I visited here with my daughter, but there were quite a lot of young couples here. It did seem a very romantic place to be.

small and quiet jewel in the middle of noisy city . it is a small and nicely designed garden with many different plants placed carefully between historical looking like small buildings. Restaurant with traditional Nepali music serving delicious food and fantastic tasty masala tea. Quiet and relaxed atmosphere, place to relax and be in meditative state ...
a moment of inner peace. after a day visit, a quiet moment to read a book and have a cup of coffee in this beautiful garden is a must

Something totally different inside the Kathmandu . Garden of dreams is an oasis inside the Kathmandu! It's a big garden with fountains , flowers and benches. It's like an escape from the city dust!!There is also cute Kaiser coffee, like in the fairytale! However, if you want to have a coffee/ brunch there, I recommend you to reserve your place in advance!Entrance fee is around 200-250rp
Dream land. This garden is one of the dream land botinacal historical butic old garden also central of city and inside nice cafe must visit

A quiet oasis. It's amazing how as soon as you enter this small garden area in the city, all noise from outside seems to disappear. It was more a break from the hustle and bustle of outside that I thoroughly enjoyed - a break from people trying to sell you things to the lack of car horns sounding. While I am not into plants or botany I could still appreciate the serene setting. Plenty of perfect photo opportunities too. I also recommend sitting and having a pot of tea at the restaurant here overlooking the gardens.
Awesome. It was the greatest place in Kathmandu quite and relaxing. I've been twice in this month.after long working day and to dusty roads when I am there I feel in heaven....

No flowers in August but the garden is still beautiful. The garden is an ornamental and well designed garden around a magnificent building which is now a restaurant with open tables on a patio. The garden features ornamental ponds with lotus, mazes, topiary trees, old trees intricately locked together with vines and when in flower would be stunningly beautiful...

Slice of heaven. After a hectic day with pollution, traffic and honking, this place is a great place to get away from it all, see something that is green and relax. They even occasionally have wi-fi.The cafe pretty pricy and mostly western, but cold beer is the same no matter what.Its not that big and could have more spots to lay in the grass or sit on a bench.
Tranquil Gardens. If you are tired of the cars, pollution, horns street vendors, etc....this is the place to go, especially if you are with your special someone. Beautiful.

Lovely place to relax. It is a great place located in the heart of Kathmandu to escape the noise, dust and crazy capital city. A beautiful lush green garden. If you are in the area, and you need a cool place to just chill, relax and spend a few hours, do pay a visit.

Small Park in a Big City. We visited the park just to chill for a bit after a long day of walking around the city. Theres an entrance fee to enter the park and when we were there, the crowd was mostly local youngsters taking their selfies. i think if youre travelling to kathmandu you can just pass by this park if you have enough but don't plan your day around it. Its clean at least with an overpriced and mediocre cafe inside.
if you have 10 minutes free.... Tinny place, but with a certain charm, dont expect the big, a complete tour can easely be done in 10 to 15 minutes. Not too much scares about earthquake,

So peaceful and beautiful.. I've been in Kathmandu for 3 months and I only this week visited here. I come from a country where gardens are abundant and we don't have to pay.But curiosity got the better of me and its only 200 rupies for entrance fee.Wow the gardens are really beautiful. We chilled out for hours reading and people watching.The earlier you go the more options you have to choose your seating.I suggest taking snacks with you because the cafe is pretty expensive.Enjoy this little haven....its beautiful and a lot bigger than I thought it would be.

Lovely vibe. An amazing parc where you can really escape the buzz of Kathmandu. The great thing is that locals love it too and you'll see lots of Nepalees 'love birds'. There are only two downsides: The seats and benches are over occupied which makes it hard to find seeting, and the cafés and lunchrooms located in the parc are relatively expensive. Which is quite a pitty but also obvious because of the beautiful, absolutely stunning, but probably expensive location.

Good place for strolling. 200 NRP to get in if you're a foreigner, which isn't bad value. Lots of courting couples smooching on the stone benches. A couple of decent cafes, but the whole place is quite small - there's a big, wild space at the back which needs reclaiming, and adding to this, to make a decent-sized park.

Nice place to relax for a while. Garden of Dreams is probably one of the prettiest places in the centre of Kathmandu. Its a great place to escape from the noise and craziness on the streets for an hour or two.

Place to enjoy and relax. A recommendable place near Thamel to enjoy and admire nicegardens and wonderful archtecture.Ideal to escape from thehectic Kathmandus town sceneries to have some time to relax.
Relaxing. Amazingly in the middle of the bustling city of Kathmandu is this oasis of beauty and serenity. A garden to challenge any around the world!

An oasis in busy Thamel, Kathmandu, when you need a change of pace.. A really lovely spot to take a break from the action, noise and dust. A beautiful, spacious garden with many places to relax. Delicious food too.

To much hype. Really small garden and you can still hear the noise from the streets! The cafe food was more expensive than a regular cafe with nothing great on the menu. You literally stand at the entrance, look left, right and forward and you have scanned the whole garden!
Beautiful place middle of the city. Very clean and peaceful environment. Well maintained garden area. Should try the Kaiser Cafe within the garden premises. Good escape in the middle of crowded city.

Amazing place to run from Kathmandu. I hope you'll understand the title. I was here today and it's amazing place to run from town crowd, mess and pollution.
The garden is absolutely amazing. Peaceful. Quiet. Green. Colorful. Just amazing place to relax and drink coffee.
Must see!
Ticket price is also fair!
Tranquil with great restaurant. beautifully naicured massive garden. and after you walk around , you enjoy luck, dinner or coffee at the Kaiser Cafe
Great escape. Very peaceful and romantic atmosphere. WIFI offered. Please visit this place when you are in Kathmandu - won't regret it!

Pretty. Recommended to stop for an hour for a coffee or lunch, sit amid statues and garden plants, look out over the walks and the pond, and enjoy time away from the crowded, noisy, dusty streets of Kathmandu.

Calm in the Storm. Beautiful landscaped gardens with flowers and seating areas. Complete contrast to what's on the outside of the walls.
Must do on a dry afternoon with a good book, smooth drink and great company.

Pleasent place in a hectic city. During my stay in Kathmandu I was really pleasently surprised by the ' oasis of quietness and beauty' right in the centre of this busy - hectic city. A visit should therefore surely be a part of a tour through the city - completing the total picure ot it.

Far from the Maddening Crowd. We had lunch in this beautiful garden with little chipmunks scurrying around and a lovely view onto the gardens. It's not big but if you need to take a break from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu; this is the place to go.
Peace within noisy area. It has got beautiful garden, library, fountains and cafe. It is right in the heart of Kathmandu and just next to Thamel.

must visit place. the garden is beautiful and its really kept well. its clean and loved spending time here
and reading.
the cafe is good too

Beautiful serene garden just outside Thamel. A tad on the expensive side - entry fees about 200 Nepali Rupees and the café inside is fairly expensive . The garden is not too large - one hour to 2 hours depending upon your pace . Would recommend as it is so very clean and so different from the other attractions . You shall see a fair sprinkling of lovey dovey couples
A beautiful place to relax. The garden is amazing. Peaceful and beautiful simplicity. The old Rana garden and buildings are an amazing contrast to Thamal

Very small. When you hear the name for the first time, your imagination will take you far for a land of dreams, but when you visit this place you will be very disappointed, the reality is shocking the area is polluted and fees are expensive to what you see, major issue is that the garden is very small you can walk around it and finish within 3 minutes Decoration is nice but still very small
oasis of the city. really neat and beautiful garden, you won't believe you're in the middle of the hectic city, you'll feel elsewhere and not in kathmandu, must visit!

Pretty outdoor setting. Didn't try the cafe/restaurant, but it's a nice outdoor setting--grassy lawn, benches in little nooks all around garden--and has some history, too. If you go on a weekend, it may be busy, including lots of young teenage couples and tourists.

Relaxing stop. Relaxing stop in the middle of the city, just near Thamel hub. There is a beautiful neo classical garde and reaturant, bar, free wifi , it costs a couple of dollars to enter, but it is worth the ticket

A little haven away from the beep beep of Kathmandu traffic. This Garden was just a beautiful place to visit after a busy few weeks in Kathmandu. Totally peaceful and hard to believe it's a stones throw away from a busy intersection?! I am convinced the birds recognise chip bags (even without them being open) so it wasn't an ideal snacking place! Definitely popular with local couples, but take a book and settle in (or just enjoy people-watching).

A delightful oasis in busy Kathmandu. Such a lovely place. Come for lunch or dinner, or just a drink in the evening, but it's simply the space, (relative) quiet and special architecture that impresses. Very romantic, by the way!
great. great place to visit. best garden even experienced. Food is tasty and the staffs were too good. Highly recommended

Beautiful Oasis in Kathmandu . The Garden of dreams is beautiful and definitely worth the visit. There is a cafe where you can order drinks or food while you are there. There are several water displays and different types of flora. My personal favorite were the chipmunks. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because of how rude the man selling tickets was. Not sure what the deal was, but he seemed extremely angry and impatient with me as I bought my ticket and interrupted his flirting with the group of girls in front of me... But aside from him, the garden was wonderful.

A Pleasant Oasis in a Dusty City. After touring Kathmandu Durbar Square, and then winding my way on foot north through the warren of hot, dusty streets to the other side of Thamel, I stumbled upon the Garden of Dreams, which is a splendid little walled park. It costs two or three hundred rupees to enter but is well worth it. It's an early-20th century garden on an Italianate-English hybrid model. There's a small two-story building on the north side of the gardens that contains a tranquil sitting area and a display of photos about the construction and history of the gardens.Be aware, however, that these gardens are apparently a magnet for amorous, apparently affluent, adolescents. Young couples were everywhere on the Monday afternoon when I visited. It might make one a bit uncomfortable, though it didn’t bother me. In the absence of shopping malls I suppose I can understand why they congregate here. It was a bit funny, in fact.In any event, go and enjoy the Garden of Dreams. It’s a marvelous respite from this crowded, polluted city.
An oasis of calm in the city. The setting is beautiful, the food delicious, the historical restoration of the buildings is something wonderful to see.

So beautiful and relaxing . The garden of dreams is an unbelievably beautiful spot in a busy and crowded city. We only planned to walk around but ended up relaxing there for hours. It is a great place to hang out with friends, go on a date, or even read alone. There is an entry fee, but it's well worth it. The value for money is better when you bring activities to fill time and food to avoid the overpriced restaurant. Definitely worth a look-in!

A beautiful garden in the middle of chaos . Stopped by this garden and wasn't expecting much. It was pleasantly surprised. This is a small garden with lots of beautiful architectural structures that are well maintained. If you need a respite from the noise and traffic plan a visit to this garden.

Lovely Greenery. I really enjoyed sitting at a little restaurant in the corner of the gardens. My disappointment was that it was very crowded (probably because it was a Saturday afternoon) so it took out some of my plans to sit on a bench and read as all the spots I could see were taken. It is still worth a visit as it somehow managed to maintain a certain tranquility and calm even with lots of people milling about. And the greenery is a sight to behold. Well maintained/manicured lawns everywhere; really pretty!

Little green in Thamel. If you tired of all the structure of Thamel/Katmandu then be here to relax with your dear ones to just lay on the green of the place. The Kaiser Cafe at the corner of Garden of Dreams is a must visit for their food, little expensive than the other small bakeries in Thamel but every penny worth it for the chocolate mud cake or the pasta they make there

Nice. It's a nice little change from the hustle outside unfortunately the ambiance is ruined by the incessant honking of the motorists just outside. There's a restaurant there which is pretty damn over priced. Worth an hour chilling out there, there are chipmunks which run around which we enjoyed.

A great find in the city. This is a really pretty place near Thamel. The is nice grass and flower gardens to walk around or sit on bench near. There is a restaurant here as well but didn't try it. I was pleasantly surprised with this attraction. It's a great place to catch your breath.
What an Unexpected Treat...... In stark contrast to the world around it....you can pop into this little pocket of lush and exotic garden calm....and be delighted !!!
Lovely peaceful visit. A real oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Thamel. Cafe was good but pricey compared to the local area. A great place to sit and relax for an afternoon.

Pretty place.. Very pretty place to get away from the craziness of the city. Very clean. Lots of couples and people clearly taking photos for their new profile picture. Not a must visit, but if you have some free time it's worth checking out. Don't need much time there. Costs NPR200 (about USD$2) to get in.

Nice Place. After taking a long walk at Thamel, we decided to visit this place. it was a nice place. And turns out there's a restaurant inside.
we were just having a drink and a nice dessert

Beautiful place. It gives a good feeling to be here, after been to many places in kathmandu...its good to relax and rest to settle down all the tiredness.
Though restaurant here is expensive its fine to be here and capture the beauty of garden here. Truly the Garden Of Dreams....

An oasis in busy Thamel. Nice, small garden escape. Expensive in the restaurant but very nice food. Open all day and easy access once you find the entrance in the long wall. Lots of black and white squirrels running over the lawns for the next tree.

An oase. A very special garden- so peaceful!
If you need a break in Kathmandu go and visit this place, bring your camera

Decent place but over priced. The place is very good, hard to miss if you are coming straight from the bus stop. Located right towards the entry of Thamel, and still away from all the bustle and bustle of the place. However, the place is over priced for my liking

A quiet oasis in Thamel. This is a nice walled garden with a small entry fee. There is a nice looking cafe that I didn't use and toilets that we clean and usable.
The best thing about this small garden is that it is a nice place to have a breather when the frantic Thamel streets get too much for you.
Expensive and small. Ok it's a relaxing retreat from the bustle of Kathmandu but its smaller rand the cafes is over priced. It's usually full of young middle class local school holographic get e

Peaceful and Fresh Air. A beautiful little treasure hidden amongst the chaos of wonderful Kathmandu.
To see wild Chipmunks running over your toes is a real treat and the flora is also beautiful.
There is a very small charge to enter but it is worth it to rest and re-charge your batteries.

city treasure. we saved this for the end of our stay. walked from our accommodation,20 min only easy to find. this sight is a must for all types of tourists. quiet, clean, well maintained, small kiosk , lots to see & a photographers dream. wall around every path, climb all stairs, there is more to see

An Oasis in the KTM Jungle. This is an unexpectedly beautiful and tranquil setting in an urban jungle where you find squirrels on an open amphitheatre amidst lush greenery and architectural excellence. There is a great cafe with great desserts !

Am I in heaven or just the Garden of Dreams?. After a long day of travelling to Kathmandu, and getting settled in our accommodation, Garden of Dreams was the relaxing getaway that my friends and I needed. We paid the 200 rupee entrance fee, but stayed for about 2 hours just relaxing, people watching, and taking in the scenery. The Garden is perfect for anyone, there were families, couples, and groups of friends all enjoying the atmosphere. We were pleasantly surprised at how the walls around the Garden drown out the noise of the traffic outside, so much so that you nearly forget it exists.
Lovely . This is indeed an oasis of calm. I had a lovely cup of tea (how English) and enjoyed the sounds of birds and the lovely surroundings. I sat reading for 30 mins and felt altogether calm.

A real oasis. If you are tired of the noise and the dust and the Dal Bhat, invest some money to get into this perfect oasis. It is quiet, clean and they serve really good (but rather expensive) food. I would recommend to go here after your hiking trip to relax and allow yourself some luxury.
Loved this quiet place.. The gardens were beautiful. you could just sit for hours here. There were many good food places to go to as well.

Definitely go. I went to the Garden of dreams because is was close by. Traveling by myself, a lot of people recommended going to different Stupa's and the Zoo, but they always seemed to brush past the Garden of Dreams. I saw that it was close by decided to go in and as soon the I stepped into the place I was instantly stunned by the magnificence or this place. It's closed in by brick walls to you could walk straight passed it. I had tea and fruit looking over these beautiful gardens and it was perfect. Everything is well maintained and it's cute to see the little squirrels playing in the trees. I went in the morning (9:30am) and I had the garden almost completely to myself. It's a diamond

Small gardens. Only if you have extra time. Difficut to understand why the guides put this tiny gardens on the top. Perhaps because they are the only ones in kathmandu. The best is to see the people enjoying, and relaxing in this well care gardens.

Place to relax. It is small place and has a nice lotus pond in the centre. If u like to spend time with nature and flowers, then this is good place however there is nothing special about this place. You will find lot of couples sitting in the shade and on the benches and it is more like a lovers park.

Quiet haven amidst the hustle and bustle. A beautiful and peaceful place to rest on the grass, stretch out, read a book or watch the squirrels. Had a delicious lunch from the small cafe and ice cold beer. Fantastic.

Surprising oasis. . Cost is 200 rupees (about 2 bucks) but worth a stop for coffee or a beer. Located near a noisy busy intersection but when you enter it is like an oasis. Beautiful well kept gardens. Good place to stop and plan your day.

An oasis, seasonal changes. This garden grounds is worth the entry fee to get a break from the bustle and sounds of Thamel. If you have inclination, you can splurge on something to eat or drink inside, but it's not necessary. Just relax in the healthy space of a somewhat manicured garden, look at the structures, read about history of this particular place and renovation.

Escape from the city in the city. Wow, what an escape, I asked a Nepali friend where I could take a girl on a date in kathmandu, and this was his suggestion. Asked if he'd ever been there and the answer was no, too expensive for Nepali. Even if you have a dinner reservation at the restaurant, you have to pay the entrance fee for the gardens, too-bad, but this is Nepal, get it any way you can, besides we aren't talking more than a couple of bucks anyway. The restaurant, mostly outside in good weather was perfect, tables not too close together, plenty of privacy, and excellent service. You pay for what you get, probably true anywhere in the world, and here is no exception. Still great value for the experience, but I will probably go to many other places before returning. The food was as good as I have had in Nepal Give them credit for that.

Peaceful garden sureounded ny chaos. Great place to go to just chill for a couple hours. Lots of cute lil squirrel type things. Would be perfect for families or dates. Cheap entry and no hasslers. Great for people watching ;)

Lovebirds destination, not a must visit place. Place is near the thamel, in first view It seems a favourite place for lovebirds, was quite crowded. It is just a nicely maintained garden with varieties of plants and flowers, there is a café where you can spend some time. But certainly does not justify the amount being charged as entry ticket. We just spend some 30-40 minutes here certainly not qualify for a must see list

Beautiful Spot in Busy Kathmandu. Get out of the hustle and bustle of the streets and transport yourself into this beautiful garden oasis. Beautifully restored and a great restaurant to eat at as well.
very beautiful. this place is very beautiful and breath taking. i found alot of couples likes to come here to get away from the city. its very romantic

one step away from the Hustle and Bustle. Very near Thamel, but it is an Oasis from the city, very pleasant relaxing garden with some nice building and shrines in , and the odd chipmunk, Does not take long to visit ,it is not a must see in Kathmandu, but if you have the time and need to chill, then go for it as good for the soul

Beautiful, serene garden.. Separated from the often extreme hubbub of the city by only a wall, but that was good enough! Interesting historical photo exhibit; strong, sad hints of the imperialistic past.
nice place to relax. The grounds of the garden are really well kept, considering its surroundings. There's a small fee to enter, and it seemed packed with young couples canoodling.

Cleanest place in Kathmandu . A breath of fresh air inside it's walls. A place that's away from the cities pollution and chaos. Well manicured place with perfect lotus blossoms in its pools. Good coffee in the cafe. The grounds are a perfect place to read or write with some shade.

Awesome date. Very good garden in the center of the city.. went there with my fiance and he proposed at the garden.. of course i said yes... the garden if dreams definetly is a place to remember for me

A Place to Relax in a Polluted City. we spend almost 4hours inside the garden. its a nice place to relax and just sit. or you can ask them for a mat and voila, you can lie down and sleep. it wasnt that full when we arrived. there are locals and foreigners escaping from the busy and dirty city. we paid 200rupees each for entrance. inside is a cafe, average price and always keep in mind the 10% (service charge) and 13% (vat)i will visit his again if i have a chance.

Good hang out spot. Initially we weren't planning on visiting the GOD; we only wanted to have some lunch at their cafe. However, it looked quite nice so we took some photos afterwards. It is a nice place to take nice pictures and enjoy the scenery.

A stunning retreat. Garden of dreams is such a wonderful little spot in the midst of the dust, dirt and pollution of Kathmandu. It is genuinely like stepping into a dream. When the noise and congestion is proving too much, head to the garden for a few hours to unwind.

Revived old world elegance. A quiet(ish) reprieve from the din of the city. A well-frequented garden close to Thamel , can be a nice spot for a quiet read while catching some sunshine . A favorite place for local young couples courting , chatting , hanging out , in addition to the tourists .

It is worth to visit. Garden of dream which is the I am happy to paid entrance fee. Actually it worth more. When you enter suddenly get rid of chaos of Kathmandu. Sometimes horn sounds come over walls but then you forget it. Best thing is the squirrels, they come very close to you.

Garden of dreams in Kthmandu. It is beautiful garden and nice relaxing sight when it is very hot in the city. It is also reminder how people take care of the place that was built many years ago and rebuilt again for everyone who wants to visit.

Garden Escape . For Kathmandu this was a garden escape from the rubble and dirt. A nice place to kick back and enjoy a small place of greenery. There are a couple of eating places, but most people took a picnic and found shade and grass. There are mats available to lay on. Nice to appreciate some quite green space before the hustle of Thamel.

Fabulous Garden. Garden of dream is located in Thamel street with a natural beauty. We went there with our friends to hangout there. This Dream of garden main thing is to capturing the picture because location was fabulous for to taking the picture

A little place of peace. Although 200 rupees to get in, it is well worth it to get away from the traffic and noise of the outside world.The garden is well looked after, has cushions for lounging on the grass and has wifi for a little extra.Just down the road from Thamel, it is worth a visit to relax and get your senses back!

Beautiful grounds set back from the busy roads of Thamel.. These gardens are an area of peace, quiet and fresh air in noisy, busy Thamel. Since the 2015 earthquake there is damage to some of the buildings which means that you can't access all areas but the grounds are well tendered and have a range of beautiful trees, flowers, ponds filled with Koi carp and lilies and chipmonks keen to take titbits from you. When I visited (June 2016) there was an exhibition of old photos showing how the gardens had been developed. The café serves a good variety of food and drinks and was clean with highly professional staff. Wifi can be bought on an hourly basis. The garden is well worth a visit and the 200 rupee entrance fee (about £2) ensures its upkeep and pays for repairs.

Gorgeous night and day!. Beautiful place to visit if you'd like a break from the chaos and wanted to walk into the gardens and have a nice meal. 200Rps entry fee. Food is a little pricey but well worth it, great place to spend reading or simply take in the flowers and breeze.

A quiet and peaceful place in Kathmandu. In the center of Kathmandu there is a small park with beautiful architecture, quiet and peaceful. The best place to get away from the madness and pollution of the city
A little bit of peace within the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. This secret garden is just waht we needed after the noise and chaos of Thamel. It is beautifully kept and very quiet.

Beautiful garden in Kathmandu. This was originally owned by a rich businessperson and is now open to the public for a nominal entrance fee. We were there on a Saturday, which is their day off from school and work, so many families were there. After walking through the narrow and crowded streets of Kathmandu, this was a true oasis. It was a hot and sunny afternoon (what else is new in June), so sitting in the shade and looking at the greenery was a pleasant respite. It's well worth a visit after a hectic day of any activity.

SERENE GARDEN NEAR TO THAMEL. It is a nice place for relaxing after a busy time in Central Thamel. It is only 2 minutes walking from buzzing and chaotic streets. It is a good place for reading or seeing local people enjoying his free time. Very good terrace for drinking. Calm atmosphere and stylish european garden.

What a change!!. Stepped out of busy and dusty Thamel into Garden of Dreams and you will be very surprised to find this european inspired garden with its lush and greenness. We were very happy and decided to grab coffee and drinks for over 2 hours and watch the locals enjoy themselves.

Stunning!. A break from the hustle and bustle! Gorgeous gardens and sense of history, a peaceful place to relax with good options for food and refreshments. Birds and tree squirrels abound and an amazing display of floral colour. Highly recommend.
well maintained and quiet. Quiet and calm place in a busy capital of Nepal. Could be bigger. Restaurant inside the garden looks very nice but is very expensive

Hardly lives up to name. After visiting various gardens in other cities around the world this place hardly lives up to its name. Very small, can still hear all of the traffic which is very loud and in desperate need of some grooming. The entrance fee (extremely expensive for Nepal) is the reason why I wrote this. Maybe use some of this towards improvements.
A quiet, relaxing place. All kinds of tourists come here to have a quiet time. You can enjoy the flowers and have a meal in the nearby cafe (expensive but worth it for once!)

Serene. The Garden of Dreams is a serene escape from the chaos and filth. We had a great lunch at the cafe and spent a lot of time exploring the gardens. There is some preservation construction going on but that does not away from the beauty.

Quiet except for generator noise. Kaiser Shumsher J.B. Rana once lived here. After it has been renovated it is a quiet Oasis in Kathmandu except for the noise from the generators. Worth a visit in the evening with good food in the cafe. With too much starters the main course became to large, but that was my mistake.
Excellent park in central area. Great peace in busy location. Went in to eat at the restaurant and was pleasantly surprised at the beauty of these gardens

Heaven of Kathmandu. forget about the busy crowd kathmandu, this place will take you away from everything, specially if you were lucky and weather was good,
a lot of setting places for reading and also a good restaurant inside.
Very expensivebe food. nice garden, large grounds. You have to pay to enter. The food is very expensive, but it is. nice tranquil place to eat.

Garden of Dreams. If you want to get away from the musty town, and just relax with a friend, thats the place to go while in Kathmandu!
They even provide some mat and pillow for you to lay your head as you enjoy the quiet and surreal ambience!

Nice Garden and food. Really it's like a Alice in wonderland. Full of greeneries , nicely maintained garden. Really one will be amazed . The food at restaurant is also good. You will surely enjoy it .

Can be seen & done in 15 min or 4 hours. . If you bring a book and sit on the grass it's a really nice place to chill for awhile. It cost 200 ruprees to get it and there are 3 places to get refreshments. 2 small cafes / restraunts and one tea salon which are really pretty and overlook the gardens but are very expensive for even small things like a coffee. The garden is quite small and some of it is still under repair but has a great combination of water features, plants and flowers. There are two levels as the surrounding walls also have seats where the restaurants serve you so you can see the entire garden from there. There are lots of seats on the ground aswell to relax and its common to take a seat on lawn and lay, I even saw someone had brought like a blow up mat to sleep on. Worth a visit but not a main attraction.

Paradise in hectic Kathmandu . Beautiful! Step inside and get rest. Hectic Kathmandu remains outside, you only will hear some weak noises. Food and drinks are good, but relatively more expensive.Staff is friendly, I left one day a present I bought at the garden, the next day when I came back to see if it still was there, they kept and registered it and it was no problem to receive it.Entrance is 200 Rupee per person.

Oasis in Kathmandu. Being told about the garden of dreams in Kathmandu was a "life saver". stepping in through the gate was like entering a different world "Paradise" The traffic, noise and pollution in the city was quiet a shock and a bit hard to take but after spending some time in the garden we felt refreshed and ready for some more shopping and browsing through Thamel.

Garden of Dream. I loved it! it a great escape from the hustle and chaos of Kathmandu. i only made one visit but if back in Kat id go many more times as its such a beautiful place to relax and get some nice food.

Peaceful oasis amidst the busy streets . The garden is really well presented and a lovely place to recuperate after a couple of days traversing Kathmandu's hectic streets.It seems popular with couples and families, and people just generally relaxing on the lawns and benches, which I did with my book. There are plenty of shady spots to get out of the sun. Nice spot to enjoy a latte from the cafe, which was delicious.
Ok. It was ok. Calm and nice, good food. But nothing really special or nothing special happens there (just cafe and restaurant)

Romance amidst the urban setting. The Garden of Dreams is a romantic oasis situated within Kathmandu. Easy to walk to from our hotel in Thamel with a very affordable entrance fee to boot. Full of couples whispering sweet nothings, taking selfies, feeding squirrels and enjoying the fresh air

Chill out at this peaceful place. Such a great way to escape from Thamel's busy centre. There are mats and cushions available and the vibe is very relaxed. Take some food and drinks if you don't want to spend fortunes in the expensive restaurant attached to it.

Great place to relax away from the noise and the traffic. Very pleasant gardens, sometimes quiet, sometimes pretty full but still a good place to take a break from shopping or sightseeing. Entrance fee for foreigners is a bit steep by Nepal standards.
Pretty but small. I found the pond to be the best part of the gardens. It's nice to take a stroll through th garden, good peaceful area to visit on a busy day.

Oasis in the bedlam of Kathmandu . When in Kathmandu you want to see Nepalese culture and architecture. But when you need a rest from the bedlam go here.Behind the walls that separate this oasis from the hustle and bustle of Thamel is a beautiful, well maintained, formal garden. Complete with pond and cafe that does great coffee. Top spot to read a book, chill for a couple of hours and recharge the batteries.

Peaceful, beautiful, serene. The title to my review says it all!You have to pay an entrance fee for this garden but I spent an afternoon feeling completely relaxed, people watching and completely in my own world. Its a beautiful, busy garden (but not noisy busy) and would highly recommend it if you are looking for somewhere to read, relax and chill out for an afternoon.

Beauty, piece and quiet so close to Thamel. Less than a couple of km's or perhaps 15min's easy walk from Thamel you will find this small piece of quiet.Behind a high concrete wall lies beautiful gardens, grassed areas, ponds, fountains, squirrels, plenty of bench seating and a cafe.If you want to take a break from the fast pace of Kathmandu city then pack a picnic and enjoy a couple of hours in another world.Don't worry on walking back out, Thamel will still be the same and you won't have missed anything except perhaps a couple of hours of dust.
Beautiful garden!. If you need a break from the dust and the city, step into that beautiful park/garden. Don't get me wrong, this is not Versailles' gardens but it is pretty and quiet-ish.

A diverse, stylish, enjoyable place. A diverse place you wouldn’t expect to see beside the traditional architecture of old Kathmandu. A quiet relaxing garden, unfortunately now available for roughly half of the original size, but still very welcoming. A creative mix of architectural styles are present: the well manicured flowerbeds arranged in the ‘char-bagh’ style of Persian origin so much present in India; a small amphitheatre reminding the bigger traditional Greek (and Roman) venues; a rotunda-like small pavilion overlooking the amphitheatre, reminiscent of Mediterranean environment? All of this can be enjoyed while sipping a tea at one of the all-day-dining cafeterias. Worth of a quick look are also the historical pictures shown in the Kaiser Gallery, hosted in a charming tower-like building along the side opposite to the main entrance. Overall, a great place to pass the good part of a morning.

Miserable man taking the entrance fee .... what was wrong with him I do not know, but he practically grabbed my money & threw my ticket at me! Not so peaceful as they were cutting the grass the whole time we were there, I know it has to be done. We didn't eat as there were smokers there, & the other place seemed a bit expensive. Nevertheless it was beautiful & we killed a happy hour there.
Nothing Much!. Just another place on the Tourist Trail. Nothing much to see. I know better places to escape within Thamel.
quiet place in the traffic chaos of Kathmandu. a quiet place in the traffic chaos of Kathmandu. Gives life-giving breath of calm and allows you to take a breath.
Garden of tranquility.. You'll be amazed that this beautiful spot can exist only metres away from the madness of the traffic outside.
Something very unexpected. A very beautiful place. Haven't expected place like this in the middle of the city or downtown. Away from the crowd and noise. And the delicious food in the café.

Beautiful and peaceful. We came here on a Saturday so it was probably a little busier than normal, looks like they were setting up for a wedding. Sat in the cafe and had an iced coffee and the best apple pie ever! Was beautiful, clean, and fresh....hard to believe it's there after being on the other side of the wall lol! Take a book and kick back on the grass for awhile, great place to just relax and breathe

Hidden Garden - Magical Experience. Visit this! There is a doorway in a wall on a busy, dusty, noisy street; the only sign of something unusual is the name above. Enter, pay the modest entrance fee and be amazed! The noise of the street drops away, trickling water replaces it, birdsong, scampering squirrels; you wander, you go further, yet another corner, another vista... It is only later that you realize how enclosed and comparatively small the space is; how clever are the designs used, the continuing canal, the changes of levels, the narrow water cascade between 2 walls. Whether you come for peace & relaxation, to eat your horticultural heart out (delicate UK houseplants grown outside), to marvel at the exhibition showing the restoration of the gardens, to eat at the cafe, or to note design ideas to take home, this is not to be missed when you visit Kathmandu.
A tranquil haven in Kathmandu.. Our regret was that we ran out of time to visit it again. We had heard that the cafe was excellent. Maybe on our next visit?
Good place to unwind. A short walk from Thamel, this well kept gardens are a nice escape from the busy city. Good for a pre-trek relaxation.

a oasis of calm in busy Kathmandu. A really beautiful ,quite place, walking distance from Thamel.
The restaurant is very pleasant and local food reasonably priced

It's like walking into a whole 'nother world.. Imagine walking in from the dust and chaos of hectic Thamel and entering a lush green oasis abundant with colourful blooms, clean white neoclassical style architecture, crystal clear ponds, complete with swings and benches to rest your weary limbs upon.The entrance fee for foreigners is nominal, but the prices at the Kaiser Cafe are exorbitant. The food and service, however, were impeccable.

The place to collect your thoughts. An unexpected quiet place hidden in the all day/all night pulsing life of the city. As much as a moment of solitude for a crowded city like Kathmandu, same moment of recollection for one's thoughts. Best visiting it early mornings, where number of visitors is quite low and you can really enjoy the silence, hear the birds singing and watch squirrels and monkeys living peacefully around. Take a tour of Thamel before heading to this garden for enjoying the contrast.

Good architecture building. I'm trying to get inside because i'm curious. I thought it was free, apparently not, It's cost NPR 400 each person. Just a garden inside (good for taking a picture). There's a restaurant inside this garden. Nothing to do in here, unless you're going to read a book with a mattress above the garden's grass
beautiful and great food. awesome food in a very beautiful setting in thamel!!! The garden was landscaped work of art belonging to a former defense minister. The best food in thamel.
Overrated. Yes the garden is beautiful, but paying entrance fee for the small garden is not really worth it. The cafe inside is overpriced.

Kathmandu's secret paradise. When you want to escape the dirty hustle and bustle, find yourself in this peaceful retreat nestled on the outskirts of Thamel. You can sip coffee or relax on a bench. Be warned: because it's so lovely, many local daters come here. Ignore the smooching and canoodling and focus on the greenery. It's beautiful.

Beautiful garden in the middle of dusty Kathmandu. This is a lovely little garden. I want to emphasize on little here, it is not a park. Very nice to come and have a lay down on the grass or read a book. There were lots of young Nepali couples when we were there - very cute. It does not take more than 15 minutes to see all that is has to offer... There is an overpriced cafe in the Garden. Please note that you will need to pay an entrance fee. Come here if you are looking for a break from Thamel for an hour or so. It is less than a 5 minute walk from the busy streets of Thamel.

Getaway. To escape the hustle and bustle of the Kathmandu city, me and my friend went to the Garden of Dreams. I loved how it was designed in a very eye pleasing manner. It is a good destination to just sit and relax or enjoy your favourite author's book. An entry fee is charged and also there's a cafe inside, which is comparatively quite expensive then the other cafe outside the garden.
Peaceful. A lovely peaceful garden in the hearth of Thamel. Lunch and cafes are available or you can just chill out in the beautiful garden enjoying some shade with a nice book!

Oasis in Thamel. A Beautiful and Relaxing garden in the middle of busy Thamel. Good place to relax, away from hustle and bustle.
Need to pay admission fee.
nice place for peace. me and my friend been at dream of garden. it is really quite place. i like the decoration and other things which are place there
Greeny. Dream of garden is one of the good tourist palace near tourist hud palce good musium good coffi grinni so must visit

Excellent refuge from the bustle of the city right in the heart of the city. When you need a place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel and just relax on some green grass beside some trees, then this is the place. Within walking distance from Thamel the high stone walls keep the noise of the traffic away and it seems like you're in a completely different place. There is even a licensed restaurant inside if you want to extend your stay. Right now there is reconstruction of a couple of the buildings happening and their methods of building is very interesting to watch.

Oasis of calm. Gardens aren't too beautiful and full of young couples taking posed photos however worth visiting for a coffee and rest when dealing with the madness, noise and dirt of wonderful Kathmandu

Garden of Dreams. What a beautiful place to visit we were here three years ago and to see what damage has been done by the earthquakes was very sad and upsetting. But restoration is well on its way and it will be back to its former glory. A must visit.

Surprise Birthday Dinner. A excellent venue with excellent food and service in the heart of Kathmandu. The food is to almost to European standard and the view of the Garden at daylight as well at night is smashing. Perfect place to surprise your partners or family members who deserves that extra attention at times.

A change of view and mood. I went there on a Saturday pm. I expected it would be busy but I had several hours gap to kill. There were tons of love birds sitting everywhere-in the open, under the trees or behind a wall. And groups of girlfriends holding selfies sticks fighting for the best flower.I assume in a normal weekday, it should provide some serenity next to the crazy Thamel centre. Also if you are a bit overwhelmed by typical Nepalese architectures and moods, this place can provide you a change of European garden environment. There is a cafe inside, but when I was there, they were preparing for a big function the next day, it closed.R200 for the entry. May be not too much to hide inside a moment from busy shopping.

Not worth the entrance fee (winter). Underwhelming. Spend your time exploring Thamel rather than going here. Gardens aren't that well maintained or worth a visit (in winter time). I've heard good things about the cafe inside, but didn't get a chance to try it myself.
Overrated places... This is the most overrated place in town. Nothing interesting but very busy. Don't who why.There are so other nicer attractions.

Nothing special. Pretty enough garden away from the dust and bustle of the streets, but not worth a trip if it is out of your way. We didn't see anything particularly unusual or exotic there. We were a bit disappointed and didn't stay more than ten minutes.

Very nice . In a hectic city like Khatmandu it is sometimes hard to get away from it all. Garden of dreams however is a very beautiful garden ideal for some relaxing after a long day of sight seeing. Ideal for couples but also for lone travelers

Beautiful Garden. Such a lovely hideaway from the chaos of the streets of Kathmandu and the traffic and its pollution. This is a quiet, peaceful haven and a peaceful spot, with a chance to catch a good meal.

Peaceful and beautiful. The Garden of Dreams is a peaceful and a very beautiful place. It is an ideal place to hangout, chill, take photos, read or write and do various sorts of activities. Also ideal for couples i'd say for there were many during our visit.

Beautiful Boutique Garden. I was here in first hour nine am it open gate i paid 100 rupee but it worth more early in the morning i was there oh my god i never know about this place and i question my self why? ethnic and awesome place with restaurant library booming flower green garden little little Squirrel
everything good

A little oasis away from the busy streets of Thamel. There is an admittance fee of about 200 rupees, but it's worth it., There are a couple of lovely restaurants and there are mats on the grass for you to sit and read or catch up with friends. It really is beautiful and well worth a visit. There is parking opposite which you have to pay for too, but at least it's convenient and it's open until about 10pm. While we were there we saw chipmunks running around the garden and they aren't shy either. It's a hidden gem and we loved our visit there, especially after a busy day morning shopping! We felt totally relaxed and would recommend a visit.

Kathmandu's Oasis. The Garden of Dreams is an ideal place to chill out, read, write, listen to music, nap, in the heart of Kathmandu. It is incredible how peaceful you feel almost immediately after entering. Would really recommend going on a sunny day when the hustle-bustle of Asia's getting you down.

Peaceful oasis in the middle of Central Kathmandu. Although a small garden, it was very pretty and peaceful, a relaxing retreat away from the city centre few streets down. Enjoyed a coffee at Kaiser restaurant on the second floor, which gives a nice view of the garden as well.

Escaping from the crowd. I admit that Kathmandu is very crowded.But when you step into here, Garden of Dreams, you can feel like it's in different world.The bird, grass, sky, it's such a beautiful calming garden. Many tourists go there to picnic.Well, there are many mosquitoes at night, so you better go there before dawn.
Relaxing and Tranquil . Kathmandu is a very busy city that almost never sleeps. This is a great place where you can relax and unwind after spending a day touring the city.
Oasis in Kathmandu. Nice oasis just on the edge of the busy shopping area of Thamel. Popular by all, to get away from the hustle and bustle. You will hear some traffic noise, but its still peaceful.

Little oasis just outside of Thamel. The title say it all: the garden is small and beautiful. It has seats and wifi. Also a restaurant and a bar. Hihly recommend when tired of going around sightseeing
Nice place to get away from the Kathmandu traffic. Great place to grab a picnic and watch the locals. You're in the heart of the city but enclosed in a beautiful garden
good. me and my wife been in dream of garden good food good series good mesuom good tree good loceyionso I must recumbent

Oasis, but interrupted with the noise of car horns outside!. I went to the Garden of Dreams which is within walking distance of Thamel, the tourist quarter. It is laid out as a formal garden that are encouraged to lie in with mats and headrests and lots of chairs set about the gardens. It is well attended with the Kaizer Cafe/restaurant in one corner which is a pretty place for a drink and/or a meal. There is not a lot to see and it was smaller than I thought, but it was peaceful and a place to watch the birds and the chipmunks whose silence was only punctuated by the nose of car horns outside its perimeter. It is a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours away from the madness of Katmandu's roads but please bring a book or a sketch pad!
A little corner of peace. A great place to escape Kathmandu noise and dust, with good coffee and cakes too. A tranquil retreat for a couple of hours.

Dream of Chuang Zhu. I quite liked the time i spent with my family in the Garden of Dreams and it was very peaceful. However, don't have too high expectations. You can walk around the entire complex in a few minutes. It is a good place to recharge your batteries a bit and sit in the shade for a few quiet moments and catch your breath. I quite liked the table up on the second floor of the parapet where they had a plaque detailing the Dream of the Butterfly. it was in fact quite nice to sit on the parapet and ruminate on the meaning of Chuang Zhu's dream.....As you do so, you have a bird's eye view of the whole garden and can see the various groups of tourists milling about. It is obviously also a place for young people to hang out and they are flopped out on the grass in front of the amphitheater.It is reasonably close to the Yak&Yeti and so you can plan to visit there after your visit here.

Better appreciated by residents than tourists. My husband and I were dying to come here. Gardens are kind of our thing. We came in and were amusingly surprised. It's MUCH smaller than advertised and after coming in, walking to the end, and using the toilet, we were ready to go. It's not so much a garden as it is a miniature park with statues and neat architecture. This is a great place if you simply want to escape the chaos of the city and sit on the lawn and read a book or take a nap. Be forewarned that it is quite crowded though. I think it's better appreciated by those who live in KTM and like to come here to retreat for a little bit. But as a tourist, there's nothing to see. If you come in not expecting a garden, you may enjoy yourself more.

Much ado about nothing. Garden of Dreams-an alluring name that conjures up images of exotic well designed landscapes, quietly flowing streams, rows upon rows of flowers, tiered fountains , lush lawns,lots of love seats etc. Well the Garden of Dreams in Kathmandu has none of these elements. Fairly small and overcrowded with a high entrance fee (Rs 200/- per person including Indians), it offers little in the name of a garden. Certainly not a 'must do' item on your list. If one has nothing to do and if one is passing by then it may not be a bad idea to go in for a round.. The cafe inside is quite expensive too. The high wall surrounding the garden add an element of allure .

A slice of tranquil heaven . My visit to the garden was a much needed escape from the constant chaos of Thamel. You could be a million miles away as you relax on the scatter mats provided admiring the well maintained gardens with a good book.
