A great escape. A perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. Quiet, full of flowers and architecture, and the cafe serves good coffee and treats.

Not much to do but pretty flowers. It was a small garden, very well maintained and quite a few varieties of flowers(not much I'd say) . Entrance for foreigners (for Indians as well) was 200 NPR. We wouldnt say it was worth the value. The garden was packed, we didnt get a place to sit. Clicked some flowers but definitely not on the must-visit list.We visited it as we were almost done for the day and didnt wanna go anywhere far.

Quiet and peaceful away from the noise of Kathmandu. Beautiful oasis away from the noise of the city. You have to pay 200Rs to enter and food/drink at the cafe is quite pricey, but a good place to have. Break when busy sightseeing

A Jem!. A walking distance from Thamel but a world away. Well maintained and tranquil. Not as big as I expected it to be or as it was in it glory days though. There is B/W photo exhibition that depict the glory days. 200 Rps entrance fee. Opens at 9am.

"Lovely but brief". The garden was pretty but very small, only took 5 mins to walk round and there were several plants/flowers you could easily find in the UK. It seems to appeal to the Nepalese younger generation for sitting and relaxing together. We were disappointed as were expecting more, probably more from the garden title !!!The cost of entrance was 200 NP Rupee, not a lot but questionable was it worth that ?.
Hidden gem. If you looking for an escape from hustle and noise, then this is a perfect place to go and relax. The menu offers great variety, I would recommend Nepali thali.
Tranquility in Katmandu. A lovely garden area which offers tranquility in the bustling city of Katmandu. Well maintained and a place to sit and relax

Beautiful . Definitely a must visit garden if you want to relax and enjoy a wonderful afternoon with a beautiful view. There's plenty of trees, flowers, and squirrels that make you feel in paradise. There is also a restaurant inside that serves delicious food.

A Place for Couples. The gardens are very well maintained and the place is nice and quite... A good place to read a book while having a coffee cup...There's a restaurant inside the complex.. Didn't try the food but the place was packed for dinner.A good option in Kathmandu.
Amazing architectural structure. This place is very relaxing and peaceful. The place built in European style is a treat to visit. It is maintained very well. You have buy tickets to visit it.
Little Europe. Why come to Nepal to look at the Europen kind of Garden?Also the cafe was very expensive. Kathmandu has better things to do.

Lovely place. Nice place to relax and sit for a while. Simple but lovely surroundings. Bring a book and a bottle of water and spend the afternoon chilling here and I'm sure you'll have a pleasant day!
A piece of heaven away from the bustle of Thamel. Sadly a little damaged by the earthquake but nearly back to its old self, you can easily spend a few restful hours here.
Good Place to visit. This is a good place to visit within Thamel. The Kaiser cafe is a good place to have snacks and coffee.

Restful and peaceful. Located walking distance to Thamel. It is garden oasis in the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. It cost me 200NPR to enter. The gardens are green, lots of flowers, well maintained. There are a lot of seats around the garden. There is also a cafe. You can spend as long as you like there.

If you need a break from the craziness of Thamel. This very nice garden is almost in another world from Thamel. It's actually a few degrees cooler in this area and is a nice place to relax.
We came here in the morning and it was quite empty and peaceful. The garden itself is not so big, but very green and lush. Nice place to take a break.

Good place to chill but don't expect anything amazing!. A good place to relax and escape the busty streets if you're with a partner or if you want to read a book etc lying on the grass. Apart from that it is very small and if exploring, you can walk round it in 3-4 minutes. A little cafe there offering refreshments which is never a bad thing on a hot day.
Peace and wuiet. Nice to get some peace and quiet and get away from the hustle and bustle of thamel.Nice fresh green plants and trees make you feel like you can breathe.Lovely break

Nice but not more. If you want a quiter place in Thamel just for reading then you can go here. It is relaxing but the Garden is much smaller then expected - if you mind seeing couples dont go here, this is a dating spot for the locals

A local tourist spot. I was surprised that it cost tourists 200 rupees to enter. It was kind of disappointing since Katmandu is at such a loss is public space. This was the one place to chill out outside and relax without feeling the chaos of the city, and yet it still isn't a public park. It's beautiful though honestly. Definitely something to check out while you're in the city it just is a reminder that Katmandu should set aside space for the public.. Space that isn't crowded with merchants trying to sell things, that's outdoors, and free if not cheaper for foreigners.

good if you feel tired to walk around city. nothing special, just green and quite place near Thamel. but can be nice if you're tired of dust and noise in city. Have few mattress to lie down or grass but not enough for all guests
Good service. Romantic place, good service by waiters..good food, beautiful garden and quiet, close to hotels and crowds thamel.. Highly recommended

Fee makes no sense.... It is realy a pity when you need to pay to enter a green area in any city. The amount is 200NPR, nothing much for tourists, and the prices are different for locals. You have to buy wifi if you want it, we did not visit the cafe, the toilets were somewhat clean, but not really clean. The green areas are nice, you do not hear noise from the street, it is great to sit, enjoy the sun, make photos, smell flowers, look at squirels... It is very easy to walk to this park, no need for taxi if you are staying in Thamel.Picnics are not allowed.

Refreshing break from Kathmandu hustle and bustle!. An amazingly peaceful spot in a busy city. The cafe is very expensive but good. Very clean facilities. Lots of courting couples but spacious gardens with an interesting history.
Relaxing area. Relaxing area in Thamel, you need to pay to get in and for wifi, but it is worthy price, you can just reading book or listen music.

Beautiful oasis. This is a very special garden. Kathmandu can be very congested & noisy. Garden of Dreams is an oasis in Thamel. You walk in and it's green and peaceful. The restaurant is really charming. Great place to have a drink at the end of the day... totally worth the entrance feel.

oasis of peace & quiet. we loved this garden... so beautifully restored, full of history and so relaxing compared to the hustle & bustle of the city... the cafe is nice, playing lovely music. the kids loved the flowers and the squirrels.. massive success !

Excellent place to relax. If you are getting bored in Kathmandu and feels like doing nothing? Just take a little walk if you are somewhere in Thamel or ask public transport to drop you at Garden of Dreams! You will have wonderful time in there, this place is highly recommended!

Very relaxing. A great escape from the city but within easy walking distance from Thamel It is set up like an English garden but with many tropical plants. It is a really nice place to sit and hang out, read , people watch...

Hemingway atmosphere. Great place to unwind from the rush of Kathmandu. Read a book, write or listen to music- even just go for a walk. Incredibly scenic and reminds me of something from an 1940's royal garden.

Love the place. If your looking for a place to get away from "it", this is the place to go.
It's the place to go and chill out.
Love the place.

Peaceful to say the least. Absolutely stunning garden with a lot of rich history. Great for couples and I hear it is a hot spot for first dates! It has been recommended to me (and I support this recommendation) to just go along with a book and relax on a bench. I do also recommend checking the display of photos and captions about the history. It's a cheap ticket for the day!
A little slice of paradise.. If you're looking for a little place to replace, away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel, make your way into this place!

Artificial garden, overcharged entrance fee. Perhaps a nicely designed garden with some landscape designing highlights. But paying 200 Rs. to get in for a cup of coffee is not worth it. Such places should just be free

Not Quite as Large as I Expected.. If you have a day in Thamel, visiting the Garden of Dreams is a worthwhile use of an hour or two of your time. The Garden was built in the 1920s by a man named Kaiser (he apparently preferred the German spelling) but after he passed away it gradually became overgrown and parts of it fell into disrepair. But the early 1990s it was largely forgotten.Since then however the Garden has gradually been restored and now hosts a lovely cafe, many works of art, and some pleasant walking. It was not as large as I had expected based on the map, but it is pleasant and surprisingly peaceful. The walls surrounding the Garden keep out most of the nearby street sounds and the entry price is very reasonable, about $2 US.The Garden is also popular with local residents of Kathmandu. The photo shows a young girl who took the opportunity to run off and explore every time her parents (lower left corner) looked away. She's my type of kid, and you should follow her lead. Take some time off from the shops in Thamel and explore the Garden of Dreams for an hour or so. It's worth your time.

Beatiful oasis in the middle of crazy Kathmandu. The Garden of Dreams is completely different from anything else in Kathmandu - its quiet, serene and created in the style of old European gardens - plus it has a great restaurant.

Fantastic place. It is a garden of large spaces to take rest, to read, to take sun path, it is a very good place for reading.. It contains flowers of fantastic colours, the ticket is only for 200 rubees (2 $) and they makes discounts for numbers.

Good place to hang around. I think it is one of the best place in thamel. A beautiful garden where you can relax by having some tea or coffee. just one thing is may be the entrance is little expensive.

Nice little garden. It's a very nice garden and in the middle of the city, when visited felt like a calm oasis. However, it was pretty crowded, and to be completely honest, i would go back only for the peace it offers in its surroundings, it's not the most extraordinary thing you can visit in Kathmandu.

an oasis in the city. A beautiful lace to relax and enjoy a serene garden in bustling Kathmandu. We thoroughy enjoyed our visit to the garden and appreciated some down time ina very pleasant ands relaxing location.

It grows on you. The first sight was disappointing. Lots of youngsters making out virtually elbow to elbow. Seemed like lawn of a urban college. But as you move around the garden, the small stairs, platforms and terrace, you start appreciating the design and layout of the complex. A small museum showcases 'then' and 'now' pictures which are a testimony to the efforts having gone into the rejuvenation. Work is still in progress though and some parts of the garden are out of bound for the public. The park also houses an open-air restaurant for the hungry. Overall, a good experience.

The name is fitting . This teenage date spot is a stunning and peaceful haven in the middle of the hustle of a tourist zone. I thought it strange they had an entry fee but upon entering, it all made sense. This place is well maintained and relaxing that it's worth visiting in between all your daily sightseeing
relaxing. place is relaxing with very nice flowers and greenery but was a bit small - should be done if on way- perhaps not worth special effort
Peace. A lovely garden with terraces and a superb restaurant... a genuine respite from the hustle and bustle of the street.

A haven of tranquility in bustling, noisy Kathmandu. I went into the Garden of Dreams on a whim and was so pleased that I did. Outside, Kathmandu and the nearby Thamel, is busy, noisy, packed. Step inside and you are transported to a different world. It is beautiful, peaceful, green and tranquil. A haven. There is a cost to this - an entrance fee of 200 rupees - but, after paying you can wander around, lie on the grass, sit on a bench and relax. There are cafés and restaurants at the corners of the gardens offering good food and excellent coffee (something that is a struggle to find elsewhere in Kathmandu).

Lovely garden away from the hustle and bustle. A real gem, well worth the entrance fee. A beautiful oasis away from the hectic streets. Still being restored but this will only make the gardens even nicer

Indeed a garden of dreams. A very lovely and peaceful place in the heart of Thamel. We took our own food to have it like a picnic on a sunny day as its bit expensive on the restaurant. You can get a mat there and even like a booster pillow if available. Lovely place to have some beautiful photo shoots too.

Beautiful garden and restaurant. Enjoyed a fabulous private party in the restaurant of this stunning secret garden. It is amazing how you can step in from the noise, traffic and dust into a sanctuary of peace and beauty. Sadly one of the Art Deco buildings where we were originally supposed to have the dinner was damaged during the earthquake last year but it is slowly being restored. We enjoyed drinks on the terrace and had a wonderful meal with attentive service in the restaurant upstairs. Very atmospheric and I would love to come back and visit again.
So relaxing . Lovely and relaxing garden in the middle of all the chaos. Great coffee too. Bring a book or just unwind with friends. Tiny squirrels to watch too.
Western Library. This looks like the outside of a large western library. It's nice but not that great. Lots of couples all over which is kind of cute. Ended up leaving after an hour or two.
great place. beautiful garden . felt much more relaxed. love the moment when those lovely cutie squirrel come close by you asking if we could feed them. loved to play with them.
STUNNING. 100% Recommend this place to visit, has a nice restaurant in the middle where you can cool down with a beer and listen to the birds chirp away on a sizzling hot day.
Oasis of calm!. Lovely gardens, nice restaurant. Small entry fee for non Nationals. This was a real oasis of calm, a stones throw from bustling Thamel.

An enchanting oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. Gorgeous grounds hidden off a busy street in Kathmandu. It's a great respite from the chaos outside the walls. It's well-loved by the locals--we saw families picnicking, couples walking hand in hand, schoolchildren on a field trip. Beautiful for a stroll, but they also offer wifi for 50 rupees/hour, and there's a good cafe on site too. Entry fee is 200 rupees, and worth it!

Quiet place for time out. We wandered into the Garden of Dreams lured by the cafe sign and the promise of a garden to explore. We weren't disappointed as the gardens are lovely and the palace is beautiful - although you can only go into a couple of rooms. We sat and enjoyed a drink in the lovely quiet gardens - something of a novelty in Kathmandu. It was well worth the entrance cost of 200 RPs.

A little piece of serenity. This place was a little piece of heaven amongst the noise and busyness of Thamel.You have to pay 200 rupees entry but it is so worth it. The restaurant has delicious well presented food and the service is great

pleasant for a stroll. Pretty garden which is relaxing place for a stroll or to sit and read a book. Some nice architectural details. The cafe serves good quality food but it expensive- paying for the setting.

Good Food and Serene Place. The food is pretty good. The location is beautiful and in the middle of the city, but you would not know that. Only downfall is you have to pay to get in, even to the restaurant.

A bit peaceful place to relax. While im waiting for my friend relatives to meet up..i went to this place & it was lovely enviroment..the entrance fee cost 200 rupees for foreigner..i took alot of pictures of the garden..i can take relax here & squarials were moving around here and there..some building were under renovation a bit to maintain the design..but i dont go to the cafe because too expensive

Peace in the midst of chaos. Kathmandu is anything but peaceful,it is a buzzing city that slows down only at night.But in the middle of that there is a place that slows down even the most stressed individual.Gardens of dreams is the place to chill and relax for an hour or two,great garden with a pretty good restaurant on site.A visit is in my book a must if you spend any lenght of time in the city.

Peaceful place to stop. Lovely, peaceful place - a burst of colour to the senses. It's all about sitting relaxing, trying different areas for differing perspectives and just resting your mind and forgetting about the hustle and bustle on the streets outside.

Relaxing spot. I enjoyed a very pleasant afternoon here. It costs 200 rupees to get in and you can relax there.It's a little oasis in the madness of Kathmandu but you still might need to wear your face mask.I didn't eat at the restaurant as it was expensive but the setting is lovely.

Walk in the Park. Probably the best experience I had whilst in Thamal. Although they are still rebuilding post 2015 earthquake this place is peaceful where you can sit back and relax. They also have a restaurant there but didn't try that.Don't expect too much from the Garden, it's more about relaxing rather than what it has to offer.
Peaceful and beautiful. It's a delight to enter this haven of quiet from the bustle of Thamel. An ideal place to sit, wander around or enjoy a cold lime soda and lunchtime snacks.
Garden of dreams and lunch. A beautiful quiet place to visit and relax. Lovely dinning area but obviously a lot more expensive than on the streets.

A haven of tranquility with a good cafe and beautiful grounds. Visiting Kathmandu and looking for somewhere peaceful to relax? Then do go and visit these beautiful gardens which provide an oasis of calm. The cafe is excellent, if somewhat pricey. I recommend the green pumpkin soup. There's also an excellent bookshop, The Tibetan Bookshop nearby.

A place away from the hustle and bustle. This is about the only place in kathmandu you will find any solace, it is quiet and peaceful, a lovely setting with plenty of space for you to find your 'own corner' to do work, relax etc. The buildings have suffered earthquake damage so there is scaffolding in place etc. But this doesn't massively detract from the setting, but may not make your photos quite as pretty as they might otherwise be.Not quite excellent, as I feel could be a bit more interesting as a venue, with areas to explore and such, also would be nice for a well kept children's area, a sandpit, paddling pool and a few swings in one corner of the garden, and if they were maintained to Western standards this would definitely add huge value and attract families too.

An oasis of calm. Once inside this garden the noise and chaos of Kathmandu just disappears. The cool, calm and beautiful grounds are a delight to wander around and to sit there in the cafe sipping tea was a perfect start to our trip to Nepal.

A little green strip in urbanised concrete jungle. A little garden area, an brilliant idea of Keshar Shumsher, lies next to the Ministry of Education, Keshar Library... This is a great place for sunlight, reading books, sitting on the green lawn and breathing oxygen in this busy polluted city. Natures best next to busy Thamel.
An amazing garden. An amazing garden at the center of Kathmandu, minutes away from the Thamel. An english style garden with a Caffe and restaurant for relaxation or running around for kids.

Well dreamed. . The garden , one who dreamed about was wonderful dream to enjoy four seasons flora and founa in one garden now known as the Garden of Dream . The great dreamer was philosopher Kesher Samser Rana one of the Rana prime minister of dark period of Nepal. Dream garden was beautiful restored even its half in size, is worth visiting and enjoy with whole heart.
Nice...... An oasis in a mad city!. Yep, definite nice to have a little respite in this mad city! Nice to visit and chill before going back into the Kathmandu jungle!

Time to relax. If you want an exclusive cup of tea in a quiet surrounding in Kathmandu this might be it. Conveniently located on the edge of Thamel. Quite a small garden with only a few things to see. More for a quiet reflect.

Out of Hustle & Bustle. You can forget all about the hustle outside and relax either in the gardens or the integral Kaiser Cafe. compared to the chaos of Kathmandu, the Garden of Dreams is a haven. Have a cup of coffee and find a comfortable place to enjoy the greenery, flowers and calm.There is a small house with very interesting photos of what the garden used to look like back in the 1990's before restoration.
Environment *_*. Place with the best natural environment and refreshing air..attracts a lot of tourist. Best for couples and friends.
Overcrowded. This place used to be a beautiful and peaceful area once, the formal one is still existent but I'm doubtful about later one, nowadays it is too crowded that it was before.

lovers dream. This beautiful garden in the heart of Thamel ( Kathmandu district ) gives out so much peace, you can sit and talk with a loved one or friends for hours, even though the place has many visitors it is very calm and tranquil and sets your mind on slow mode. There are some cafes in case one gets hungry or thirsty.we were their in December so it was cold, so it was interesting to observe how the people in the park move with the sunshine to get warmth . on the lush yard you can find some kind of mats and bolsters to relax on. These are provided by the garden.What fascinated me was how many different kind of flowers were in bloom during this season.Another amazing observation i made was how clean and tidy every corner of the park is kept. No litter at all to be seen. During our time we could not enter some of the historical buildings in the garden since they were partially destroyed during the 2014 earthquake.Overall it's just a simple but beautiful place to spend some quiet time

Good for a quick walk around.. Again a high price for tourists or foreigners. That said I paid npr 200 to get in spent an hour escaping the hustle of thamel the garden is western In style with well maintained plants and fountains. Lots of people reading books and relaxing in the sun.

A miniature oasis. I think the size of the gardens is the biggest disappointment and even the lack of native plants - it's very English countryside. Nonetheless it's a lovely little oasis in the midst of lots of noise and chaos and a great central meeting point.

Great and relaxing visit to this beautiful site. We spent a couple of hours at the Garden of Dreams in Feb. 2016. It was very relaxing, with many locations to just lay on the grass and enjoy the beauty and nice weather.
I love Nepal. Good place and good landscaping near to thamel one of the fine and cheap place foe shopping but not guaranteeing the authenticity of the items you will purchase

Waste of money and time. Do not go there.
Waste of money and time.
Even the restaurant is not good and very expensive.
It's a garden that's all.
Nothing much to see. There's nothing much to see in this place. I don't understand why they collect payment just to get inside this area.

Get away from the noise and dust. Beautifully restored historic formal garden hidden away from the main street behind a high wall. You can forget all about the hustle outside and relax either in the gardens or the integral Kaiser Cafe. There is a small house with very interesting photos of what the garden used to look like back in the 1990's before restoration.
Peaceful environment. Visit this place as it's near Thamel and offers great place for relax and find some peace. Enjoy staying out of crowded streets of Thamel and give yourself some peace!

Heaven in Kathmandu!. After some hours in busy and noisy Thamel, Garden of Dreams is the place to BREATH, get your shoulders down again! Its an oasis for relaxing! A totally different world. Here you can lay down on the lawn, take a cup of coffee, study a fantastic diversity of bushes, trees and perennials. (If you have some questions about the flowers, ask for the friendly and extremly wellknowledged head-gardener mr. Tara).
Relaxed place to go reading and chill!. Small quiet spot in the middle of border of Thamel. Really good for reading and having a beer with friends.
Nice Place to Spend the Afternoon. As the name suggests, the garden is a beautiful attraction aimed at displaying various botanical specimens to the public.

Okay park, but crumbling down. Came here with family. Admission fee is 200 Rs, half if you are Nepali-- signs for local rates written in Nepali.. Ticket sales official not very user-friendly. Fairly nice grounds, but there is an air of tiredness about the place... Gardens are not kept up.. there are quiet areas where folks can lay down and read, etc... Place is a bit run down, did not visit local restaurant on the premises...

Serene and inviting. It was nice to relax over some masala tea, then explore the gardens and old buildings. There is a small museum, which has some historical photos of before and after the reclaimation project. They are currently refurbishing some of the main structures, but that adds to the charm of the place.

For sitting a relaxing. After a two day hike to and from Nagarkot, our first day back in Kathmandu was destined to be a slow one, and after a late breakfast and slow walk through the shops of Thamel a 3/4 hour break to read write and people watch was perfect! The garden is beautiful, not large enough for a stroll but ideal if you just want to sit and take it all in. If you are white do not be too surprised if locals ask to take a photo of you or with you while you are there!
Fun place to visit. This is a super cool garden in the middle of Kathmandu. Great way to spend a couple of hours or sit and relax enjoying the beautiful grass and garden away from the city.

Nice little escape. I was here 6 years ago so felt very sad to see the damage done to this lovely little place by the 2015 earthquake. There is building going on just now so not as peaceful as it was but still a lovely place to spend an afternoon. The cafe is very good, if a little pricey, and the air of young love is all around - lots of local couples go there to hang out - all very sweet.

peaceful place but quite damaged. if you need a bit of a break from the dust and the honking this is your place. you can even have a cup of tea in the garden area. however, there was aquite a bit of damage from the 2015 earthquake. it's an easy place to visit if you are doing some shopping in the area.

Small, well-maintained, peaceful garden. Lots of people go to this small, walled garden (enter via a small gate and pay 200 rupees per ticket) to escape (mostly) the noise and bustle of the streets outside. Although the buildings have sustained earthquake damage, the gardens are mostly intact and well maintained by Nepalese standards. A pleasant place to have a picnic or just relax for a while.
Oasis. Lovely place to to get away from the busy city and rest and read. I spent a month in Kathmandu and went to the garden of dreams 5 times in this period.
Good for time pass. Good place to hang around when you want to relax and just use the internet with some tea or coffee. Not expensive to go inside and you will feel comfortable inside.

Bring a book and chill out. A beautiful park in the city, like a nice oasis. Well-laid out gardens and water features. Many locals were also here to relax, and since you pay to get in, there weren't any people selling stuff. Very relaxing & I wish I could have spent more time.

Most Beautiful Place in all of Kathmandu. Great place to come relax and to bask in beauty.Why cannot other parts of Kathmandu look like this I wondered?Nice restaurant.Many local lovers roaming about.

Nice retreat with a European twist. In the centre of Kathmandu, you can find this nice garden retreat surrounded by walls, a slightly overpriced restaurant serving Western dishes and a museum, the whole thing inspired by European neoclassic architecture. People stroll around the garden, relax on the grass watching the fountain, and young couples are hiding behind umbrellas in every dark or hidden corner of the garden. If you are looking for a break from the bustling city right outside the beige walls, or being of Western European origin and feeling a little homesick and craving for the closest thing you get to a fresh green salad, this is the place to be.
Nice Place. Relaxing place in a busy city. A lot of Nepalese lovers are visiting there. Nothing much to see, but really relaxing.
retreat from the city. Nice park, a good place for photos and the chicken panini is so good. Had a little damage from the earthquake.

Relaxing and delightful. This is a quiet oasis of tranquility in the middle of bustling Kathmandu, on the edge of Thamel, hidden behind high walls revealing no hint of the formal Edwardian style garden beyond. Young couples come here to spend private time away from onlookers, and tourists visit to enjoy the pretty floral displays and Western design, which includes rotundas, pergolas, fountains, sculptures, urns, terraces, ponds, and an unusual bamboo swing.There is also an open-air amphi-theatre for performances.Large cushions are available for hire, and also wifi. Refreshments are available at the shady Kaiser cafe. One of the pavilions has an interesting photographic display of "before and after" shots, showing the garden before it had been restored, renovated and remodelled to it's current well-tended state, after many years of neglect.Depending on the season you will enjoy blooming jasmine, bougainvillea, geranium, salvia, arum lilies, magnolia, snapdragons, alyssum, roses, and many others, plus a variety of trees and ornamental grasses. It's not a botanical garden but many plants and trees are identified and tagged.It's a bargain for NPR200, and is particularly pretty at night. Take a break and enjoy this unexpected pleasure. Be sure to look for the "sphinx" and read about it's riddle.
Garden of my dream . Oh! Its really a garden from my dreams.i slike this very much where you can enjoy sunshine and good foods too.especually i like the design of this garden!

Not really worth the entrance fee. Don't be fooled by the plans displayed outside, the garden is tiny. I took a very slow wander but you can take in the place very quickly. The earthquake damage is still being repaired, but even fully open the garden is pretty small and appeared to be the main place for young couples to lol about. Fountain was empty and the borders being replanted so I guess I didn't see it at it's best, but I wouldn't rush back in any case.

Superb place. Today visited this place with a local friend. Very beautiful place. And very good coffee shop where one can enjoy tea coffee or beer or very good foods.Also beautiful campus to seat in a cozy ambience and lush green surrounding. Must to visit.
A Lovely Haven in Kathmandu. Costs 200NPR to get in but well worth it. It is peaceful and clean and there are little squirrels everywhere. a great place to sit and relax.
Gem of Kathmandu. This garden is simply beautiful and amazing. You may spent hours here, very calm and serene. Cafe / Restaurant is available inside the garden if you wanna have lunch or dinner.

Beautiful 🌹. Beautiful gardens in the heart of kathmandu and a wonderful place to stroll then sit in the warm sunshine for a while. Lots of students and couples seen chatting and sharing a lovely space. The kaiser cafe is also on site but is expensive, very good coffees and light meals however. Worth a look.

Slice of peace in the middle of Kathmandu. After wandering around the busy streets of Thamel, the Garden Of Dreams is a great place to relax at the end of a day. Lovely garden although not as large as I expected, it is well worth a stop.

Romantic place. A must see and have lunch during a shopping day in Tamil. Located in a museum, clean and well operated restaturant.Best think to say is, the place is peacefull and quiet compared to all the noise in KTM city. A lot of young lovers sitting close, kissing and holding hands is such a lovely thing. Nothing to see in the garden and the toilets are really extremely awfull, but that seems unfortunately to be official standard for all KTM toilets :-(

Really calm place in the middle of Kathmandu . This is a really nice and calm place in the middle of chaotic Kathmandu. It's beautiful, and really romantic and it seems like every couple in Nepal is here.
Perfect food, international cuisine, Indian , Italian. A must see and have lunch during a shopping day in Tamil. Located in a museum, clean and well operated restaturant

Really nothing to see and awfull dirty toilets. Best think to say is, the place is peacefull and quiet compared to all the noise in KTM city. A lot of young lovers sitting close, kissing and holding hands is such a lovely thing. Nothing to see in the garden and the toilets are really extremely awfull, but that seems unfortunately to be official standard for all KTM toilets :-(

Lost charm in the busiest road of Kathmandu. We were expecting a well maintained garden with some serenity. However it turned out to be opposite. Its not up to the mark and needs serious maintenance. Good to do some evening and morning walk and seriously should not have any great experience.

Garden of dreams is indeed the dream land.. Despite being at the heart of city, the environment abruptly changes to heart of nature and peace. If you want to spend some quality time, this is definitely the place to be.

Lovely place to visit. If you like reading in quite, or have a look at pretty things or meet your friends in a different place, this is the place to be. Well maintained and well thought of, Garden of Dreams is a smorgasbord for different people. The entry fee is required but you can stay as long as you want. Also they have restaurant inside which is a bit expensive but provides quality food.

A wonderful oasis, popular with young lovers.. Rediscovered 20 years ago and lovingly restored, this oasis of calm on the edge of the old town is a must for a quiet, reflective sitdown. Only 200 NPR to enter [2USD at time of writing] which is a fair price. There is a cafe / restaurant in the grounds, but the food in it was a bit overpriced. Just take in the gardens and the small museum

Serene greens and flowers in the middle of bustling ktm. Loved it. Small but beautiful. And it has a great cafe and restaurant too. A bit sad for all the rest of buildings with cracks and closed after the earthquakes.

Glance of What Nepal could be. Nepal can be a beautiful place like that. Absolutely wonderful and stunning. Good place for people who seek silent environment with beautiful atmosphere while ignoring the hustle and bustle area of Thamel.

A little oasis. Just a few blocks from Thamel, the gardens are a refreshing change from the traffic onslaught of Kathmandu. There is some earthquake damage but the buildings and gardens are mostly intact. Possibly not the best time to visit in winter as the plants are mostly dormant. Worth a few hours for the tranquility.

Winter Visit. Cute gardens - but winter visit - its obviously a place where all The young lovers of Kathmandu go - photos with loved ones, holding hands and hot drinks at the cute café. it has a great exhibition of the before and after photos of the garden before it was renovated ..they are really interesting !
Meh. Not much to do or see here. If you can combine the visit with a coffee or a tea break, you'll be better off. Though be prepared to pay more here than the rest of Kathmandu.

Oasis. This garden is a lovely haven in the middle of Kathmandu. It costs a little bit to get in but it is a lovely garden with a fair restaurant. Some nice historical displays inside. Gets a bit crowded on holidays.

Peaceful and pretty. A great place to bring a book on a sunny day. Nice atmosphere to relax in. The photo display is nice and gives insight into the changes that Kathmandu has experienced. It is a nice find in the middle of a busy city. I didn't eat at the restaurant as it seemed overpriced.

An oasis in busy Kathmandu. Not a huge garden but a pleasant refugee from the hectic pace of Kathmandu. A short walk from central Thamel. This garden also offers a cafe for lunch or morning or afternoon tea. At the time of our visit the restaurant was closed due to repair work after the April 2015 earthquake. Good for families with children which can play and explore the gardens which are full enclosed so safe for kids to play unsupervised. A lot of local school groups have excursions here on school days.

not very remarkable. 200 Rupees and I stayed 20 minutes. It was winter time so the gardens were a little brown. The cafe looked nice, so I would have stayed and had coffee, but I was more interested in seeing other sights.
Peace and tranquility in the heart of Kathmandu. Beautiful serene gardens with great cafe located in the heart of Kathmandu. Great place to visit and chill out for a few hours.

Pathetic. With a charge of 200 odd Nepali Rupeea for an entry, the Garden is a bit of a dampener for tourists. It does have cafes where one can try their luck. But, as a whole, the place is a strike off as it doesn't offer a value for money proposition.

Set apple pie ever!. whilst it is pricey compared to other venues in Nepal. The dessert/cakes were fabulous. The service very friendly and happy also. The gardens are lovely and it is definitely a great place to chill for a while.

A bit of peace in the midst of chaos. Although not completely quiet and peaceful, compared to the chaos of Kathmandu, the Garden of Dreams is a haven. Have a cup of coffee and find a comfortable place to enjoy the greenery, flowers and calm.

Real garden of dreams . If you fell bored during your stay in Kathmandu you may go to this place which is with in walking distance to main tourist hub 'Thamel'.A very nicely designed and decorated garden to make your day really good.also you can enjoy with the food of their restaurant. Garden from dream!

my fav place to be in ktm. garden of dream is best place to be in ktm to relax and to have some peaceful time. Lovely garden with many animals like squirrel and birds. Restaurant is also nice but little expensive for local.

breathe of fresh air. This is a lovely place to get away from the noise and pollution of the city. Many locals spend time here sunning themselves on a chilly morning. Great place to chill and have a hot cup of tea.

quiet in a otherwise loud location. this is my favorite place to read a book in a green and quiet location.
the restaurant within the complex is also nice.
Some buildings have been hit by the earthquake, but the restaurant is functional.

A beautiful relaxing escape. I love this place, and every time I stay in Thamel I come here to escape the city. Bring a book l, a blanket and sometimes there are cushions already there to use. People wander the gardens or chill out on the lovely lawn. There is a cafe inside and a restaurant if you fancy it.
Truly peaceful and beautiful. A very peaceful place to sit back and relax. You step inside from busy traffic and enter a truly mesmerizing relaxed place.
Nice place . Good to wander around and just chill right in the middle of Kathmandu. Thamel is super close too, 5min walk to the busy area. Handy

Such a peaceful place. Lovely garden in the middle of Kathmandu, very peaceful and quiet. Very different from the city, and all the noice! There is a nice cafe in the garden, where you can enjoy a drink and enjoy the view.

Slice of heaveb. We spent a few hours here one afternoon in Kathmandu. It was so peaceful and relaxing. We read our books and enjoyed the sunshine. You step off the busy road and into a tranquil haven.
Its ok. Its a good place to relax with a very expensive cafe plus you need to pay an entrance fee. Its ok if total peace is needed

Peaceful sport inside busy Thamel. This is a small garden just next to Thamel city, very much recommended for travelers looking to get our of busy city. This place is very good, beautiful and very clean. Recommended for a day visit!
Nice place to get away from the busy Thamel streets. I enjoyed this place, reading a book and sitting in the beautiful garden in the sun. Good place to get away from all the traffic in the city.
a secluded garden to withdraw from the crowd. True hidden place with fish pond and lovely flower green garden. No place like that elsewhere to keep you away from the crowd and sound of town.

Beautiful hidden garden and restaurant. Behind a great wall in busy, polluted Kathmandu lies the most beautiful, hidden garden and restaurant! Such a lovely place to relax and enjoy the fountains and flowers and have a delicious meal as well. I would highly recommend taking time to visit this jewel of a garden as a break from the hectic city. Locals as well as tourists find peace here.
Peaceful Oasis. Taking a break from the intense and exhilarating street shopping that characterizes the area, this is a respite of calm and beauty.

A bit earthquake damaged, but a nice tranquil place. This was a tranquil and pleasant spot in Thamel, easy to get to and lots of nice squirrels and Belladonna plants! The gardens are pretty and the buildings, though a little damaged by the earthquake, worth a visit if you're nearby.

good place to visit. located in front of SAARC headquater building just next to thamel n dubar marg.. faiser cafe n barkha bar good eating joints inside the garden premises n provides good continental food n drinks.. Beautiful green grass lawns, walk way and ampithreatre is a attraction for couples n family to spend good time together under the open sky!!!!
Oasis in Thamel. A place to relax and enjoy the garden in the busy Thamel. Definitely an oasis of the chaotic Thamel.

Expensive. This garden is lovely and very close to Thamel, but is quite small and expensive to get in. There are cafes inside, and you can order an inexpensive drink and sit there, or sit on the grass. I expected it to be much bigger from the reviews I read in LP and online. I was happy to pay the entry and then pay for a drink and spent a few hours there writing letters and reading, but I don't know that it is worth the effort and expense just to see the garden itself. It would be much better if it were free/discounted entry.

A Piece of Peace in the middle of the city. After passing through busy Thamel, one can always find Garden of Dreams a peaceful place to relax. Every time I am in Kathmandu I make sure I spend few hours or a day here. Number of trees and greenery will make you feel close to nature. I have been to two different restaurants but not very impressed with the service. May be they are nice to tourists, I am not very sure. Quality of food was also not very impressive. But if you just want a lazy walk and want to enjoy sunshine, it's a great place to be.

Nice garden. We came here on our last day in Kathmandu, garden setting is nice but too many visitors sitting on the grass and ruining the grass.. we went to Kaiser cafe foods are good and friendly staffs.. recommended..

It's surrounded by high walls. Garden of dreams is a pleasant park in the northern area of Thamel in Katmandu and it's easily accessible by walking from any part of Thamel. It's fun to wander around and take photos or to sit and read. Admission is a reasonable 200 NR. It's surrounded by high walls and is quieter than the main street outside but it's not country quiet - you know you're still in the city.

Beautiful Escape. This for me is an amazing attraction slap bang in Thamel. It's an oasis of calm with stunning sculptures and décor with a nice little (yet expensive) restaurant. Definitely worth a visit!

Thank you for the greenery & tranquility. The only garden/park in Kathmandu where one can reconnect to nature right on the doorstep of Thamel, the heart Kathmandu's tourist district. There is a restaurant and a bar. The prices are slightly above the average. Especially in Winter, this place allows you to soak in the sun.

Garden's architectural framework. The Garden of Dreams is in our short visit after the Narayanhiti Palace museum. Within the Garden walls the founders created an exquisite ensemble of pavilions, fountains, decorative garden furniture, and European-inspired pergolas, balustrades, urns, and statues. The Garden's design has much in common with formal European gardens: paved perimeter paths, punctuated by pavilions, trellises, and various planting areas, surrounded by a sunken flower garden with a large pond at its center. It is an architectural landscape that encourages the visitor to stroll around and discover the Garden's treasures from many different vantage points.Next to the Gardens is Kaiser Cafe, where we have fun with an international standard lucnh. Like the garden itself, the cafe offers a tranquil atmosphere and seating is available within the neo-classical Basanta Pavilion.

Beautiful historic park. The 'Garden of Dreams' is said to be the only public park in Kathmandu. It is actually fairly small, but well worth a visit. It has lovely greenery, colourful flower beds and pavilions in traditional style. There is a good cafe to relax in after a stroll round. It's a real oasis from the noise and fast pace of Kathmandu. PS - I don't know what damage might have been done to the buildings in the earthquake!

Quiet haven in the middle of town. We were recommended by friends to visit here, and if they hadn't told us we never would have known about it. It's very unassuming from the outside, but inside is a really pleasant garden that's well protected from the outside noise

A quiet contrast to the neighborhood. The Garden of Dreams is the antitheses of the Thamal neighborhood that surrounds it. Beautiful set-piece gardens (I think Victorian English) walled off from the city. It is a contrast, but one that many local Nepalese take advantage of.

Relatively peaceful. Compared to the very busy streets of Katmandu centre this is a good place to escape it all but it was extremely busy with many couples trying to find a peaceful place for a deep meaningful conversation. I would recommend it, good value for the minimal entry cost
Close, quiet & Beautiful park. Peaceful place near Thamel one of the awesome place around Kathmandu Town. IF you are in Kathmandu and you don't want to go or walk too far go there :)
very small. Garden of Dreams is really nice place to eat or to play or to read but its realy so smal just in 10 min we can visit all

Oasis of Calm. A nice place to realx within the walled area. You will not see any traffic but you will hear it screeching and honking away outside.
Lovely plants and flowers inside ,and well kept lawns . Also a cafe ,
If you leave the garden ,you have no access to the cafe.
An entrance fee is also required.

Peaceful respite from the noise of the city.. An oasis 200m from bustling Thamel. Plenty of places to sit amongst the gardens and water features. An amphitheater where mats and pillows are provided for lazing in the sun. Cafe/restaurant offers coffee or a full menu, you choose. 200 rupees for entrance and wifi available to purchase.

Nice but not very large. With very well maintained grounds and pavilions inside nicely separated from the street outside with a brick wall, this park just about a five-minute walk east from the eastern edge of Thamel is definitely worth checking out (where you could even lie down on the pads, which I suppose are provided by the garden, scattered on the miniature "amphitheater" landscape on the left side).The main feature of the garden, I would say, is this neat pond (with a concrete edge around it) on the right side in front of the café pavilion with two elephant sculptures nearby (actually three, one is a baby elephant), and the nice thing is you can also view that pond from above the ground if you go up onto the upper area (like a deck) above the steps on the far side of the garden; and a little walk to the right after coming down from that area will take you to the building where you could learn the history of the park from the display of pictures & information on the first level, and I learned from that display that the baby elephant (beside one of the elephants near the pond as mentioned above) actually used to be in the pond!Also don't miss the beautiful fish swimming in the circular waterway around the semicircular steps at about the center of the garden (near the amphitheater landscape as mentioned above). And as for food, apart from the café pavilion near the pond on the right side (mentioned above), there's the pavilion for liquors on the far left side; and I also saw (just before leaving actually) a small area for meals on the entrance side of the garden, though the prices of 700 or 1,000 nepalese rupees (about US$ 7 or 10) written on the board were "definitely" on the high side in a place like Kathmandu where about 150 will buy you a decent meal at a decent restaurant.

Another side of Kathmandu. Only minutes walk from Thamel, this garden was a sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. Here you will see another side of Nepal's history, savour the peace and quiet, and get to see up close with squirrels. At only $R200, the entry into the garden will warrant you a nice, restful day for some reflection and down time.

Nice, beautiful, peaceful. Not the best botanical garden I've seen, but wonderful stop-by in the middle of the noisy and busy Kathmandu. It is amazing that such a peaceful and tranquil place is situated right in the middle of more or less chaotic Kathmandu. I visited here in October and definitely it is not at its best in autumn. I bet spring and summer would be the best times. (As in every garden I guess.) However, I recommend this to everyone, even if just a short visit. The entrance fee is anyway very cheap.

An escape within city. A well maintained garden, splendid view, a reflection of Rana's time, perfect place for warm sunshine, it can be wonderful destination if you are looking for leisure walk Over priced restaurants , coffee was terrible. Take your own food unless if you are looking for fine dining

Quiet spot. The garden itself is a rare quiet refuge from the hustle and bustle of Thamel. My low rating is because of its admission price. Granted, 200npr is little by Western standard, but I can imagine it being a bar to locals. Gardens like this should be communal and enjoyed by everyone - from restaurant prices (mains charge upwards of 1500npr), you could tell the Garden is reserved for the riches and foreigners.

Nice respite from Kathmandu's pace. We decided to go inside of the Garden of Dreams after a long walk around Kathmandu. It was evening and the Garden was lit so beautifully. We really enjoyed walking around in this peaceful place. We had dinner in the restaurant there. A bit pricier than other places, but still quite reasonable by Western Standards.

Oasis In The Busy City. A great spot to escape from Thamel's noise. There are places to lay down and rest. Some private corners for the couples. A bamboo swing to play and laugh. A cafe where you can enjoy some food and drinks. It is highly recommended to visit after the treck.
The only disadvantage is that you have to pay for wifi.

Peaceful break from busy Thamel. I passed here on the way to Thamel district and after a few hours walking in circles, browsing shops and dodging traffic it was a relief to walk back to the garden for a break. It costs 200rupees to get in. It's a very tranquil spot to site and relax and have a cup of tea or food at their cafe. Worth a visit if you need a break from the crazy traffic!

Oasis in the heart of Kathmandu city. This gem of a garden is a beautiful space to visit. Timeless, tranquil , romantic and historic. A great place. It also has a first class outdoor restaurant overlooking the ponds and gardens, serving delicious meals.

A retreat. If you want to sit and retreat from the smog and honking horns this is a great place to go. It is possible to read a book all day, if it's warm enough.The cafe is expensive but serves very good food. At western prices.

More than a ordinary garden. A beautiful garden filled with flowers and ponds. Many squirrels and wild birds come in to greet and a fantastic place to take pictures. Loved the layout of the garden. A good place to pop by during the day time.

Just a wonderful place to sit and read. This isn't some epic garden but it is very lovely with many flowers, a reflective pool and lots of grass. It is very cheap to visit and there is a little restaurant where you can have some tea.
Amazing peaceful place . It is wonderful oasis in crazy dirty Kathmandu. Very peaceful and quiet place, full of incredibly beautiful trees and flowers.

Nice but expensive !. It is indeed a beautiful place to spare some leisure time. Well maintained & decorated garden which use to the King's one of the garden. But starting from the entrance fee to the food availble there is a bit expensive.

A small nicely tailored garden in thamel. It was away from the mad traffic of thamel but very busy with locals cuddling up, but it's the best they have as a botanical garden I guess. It is very small and can be walked around in a few minutes.

A MUST Visit in Kathmandu!. This place was shockingly beautiful! The cafe serves delicious food and there are pillows out for you to lounge and read and relax. There is internet if you want to work and it is quiet and peaceful. I went twice, I just loved it!

Peace and Quiet. Absolute heaven! An oasis in the mind blowing noise of Thamel. Only a few minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of Thamel but could be a different world. Yes it costs 200 rupees but worth it.

Garden of dreams. Garden of Dreams has enthralled the visitors ever since it was opened to their delight. To take things into perspectives, Garden of Dreams is our identity as well as national heritage where we can feel proud. It has improved the quality of life of the denizens of Kathmandu valley as well as the tourists want to spend. It refreshes and rejuvenates the mind, body and soul with its ambience and amenities.
Quite amid Town. Inice place amid town & busy Thamel. Chilly out place . Clean and quit.not only foreigners but the nepali couple are seen here to enjoy the loving moments of tranqulity.
Great . It was nice places in busy thamel. Chilly out place . Clen and quit. Lager place. Many Nepal couple are can see there to

Grandiose Rip Off. I thought that I would like to visit these gardens and spend a tranquil morning. Garden of Dreams is the dream of the owner deciding to become a millionaire at the hands of the tourist. The entrance fee for foreigners is excessive for what it entails. Then there is the overpriced water, coffee and soft drinks to contend with. no thanks, I have my own dreams.
No words. . No words... can't even count the times I've been there..A must if you want to hide from the busy Thamel.Nice place to relax, read a book and they have good food too

Bautiful garden oasis in the midst of Thamel.... I stumbled upon Garden of Dreams while wandering around Thamel district. If you have been to Thamel you understand the wonderful mess of cars, rickshaws and pedestrians beeping and speeding around. Iwent into Garden of Dreams and was able to relax for an hour. It was inexpensive (about $2.00) and worth the fee. There were mats and pillows for people to relax on the grass. I spent some time writing and snoozing until it got too dark to see. There is also a nice restaurant that looked like it would be a nice spot for dinner.

A nice quiet retreat from the chaos. Stumbled upon this place when walking around town. Good thing I had a book with me because this place is perfect for just relaxing for a few hours and escaping the madness that is Thamel. The garden is really well maintained and walking through the gallery was a great experience, seeing the history of the place and how it became what it is today from the neglected jungle garden decades ago. Cafe is a little expensive but they made a good coffee. Would recommend for anyone looking for a little retreat while in Kathmandu.

Peaceful garden. Lovely garden! A quiet place to get out of the craziness on the street. You do need to pay Rs. 200 to get in, and the coffee is just okay. But, if peace and quiet in a natural setting are what you are after, this is the place for you.

Our post trek meal could not have been better. The setting of the restaurant is gorgeous and you can certainly go earlier and walk around the gardens. The setting is ideal with outdoor and indoor options although outdoors is preferred. The menu is first class and they will do anything you want in any way you want it. I changed up several things to get exactly what I wanted and they couldn't have been easier to deal with. Food was best we had in 8 days in KTM. Highly recommend!

Not as my Dreams Garden :D. Good place to have some peace and have some food while having some chat with your love once. Good to be there. Feels good to be in grass. Its just in walking distance from Thamel and if you're on Narayanhiti Palace Museum. Happy Travel. :)

In Kathmandu you must visit the Garden of Dreams. Garden of Dreams is a surprising island of tranquility in Kathmandu. Take a book, have lunch, stroll and enjoy the gardens,the birds and squirrels. A local lovers hideaway. A world within an amazing world

A lovely spot in the middle of town. We just happened across this gem of a garden as we were walking around town one day. Lovely spot to relax and enjoy the lovely plants, fountains, and sitting areas.

great location, not so great food. In a beautiful place like the garden of dreams, you would expect the food to be a cut above average. But it's not that good. Expensive, yes. And the surroundings are truely beautiful. But don't go here if you expect fine dining, it's just not that good.

An amazing island of beauty in the city. I went to this attraction because I had heard that it was a good place to watch birds. There was not a very wide variety of birds there, but some were beautiful. The birds however were dominated by an extremely large flock of house crows, whose cries were absolutely constant. It created a rather unpleasant constant very loud din. The layout of the garden was quite beautiful, however, and the flowers were amazing. There is also a nice café there with a pleasant selection of food. In my opinionin this is a part of Kathmandu that it would be very profitable to visit.

The Calm Within the Storm. While spending a few days in Kathmandu I stumbled upon this place. It was roughly 20 cents USD to get in, and I decided to take a look and see what the Garden was about. In the hectic surroundings of the Thamel district, this is truly a wonderful place to visit. The Garden is surrounded by high walls which does a fantastic job of drowning out the city noise. There were a few dozen people visiting while I was there, and many were reading or enjoying a cup of coffee. The Garden has a substantial variety of plant life, many of which are native to other parts of the world. Bamboo, succulents, tropical flowers, and cactus are among some of the variety you will see. Fish ponds are also found in a few areas and the beautifully manicured grounds are worth a look.Should you find yourself in Kathmandu and are looking for a little peace and quiet, I would suggest a visit to the Garden of Dreams.

Oasis of calm in Kathmandu. The garden is small so if you are used to parks in European cities be prepared to scale down your expectations. It is however well kept and a pleasant place to while away some down time.
Lovely oasis in heart of Thamel. Relaxing lovely gardens and nice cafe. Interesting photographic display of before and after of the restoration of the garden
Very nice Garden!. Go and enjoy this peaceful place, just sitting in the gras and enjoy the sun and nothing to do! It is an amazing place and outside the busy Thamel

Do you want to read a book over coffee in the midst of chaos Thamel! This is the place!. Whenever I am tired of the crowd, traffic and noise, I just pay 50 rupees and get inside the Garden of Dreams . I always enjoy to spend few hours or chat with your colleagues or business partner over drink. This is very popular place for hang out of young Nepalese and foreigners.

"A BIG JOKE". I have been a few times to lovely Kathmandu and this time, i thought, i would pay a visit to the so called 'GARDEN OF DREAMS'Very, very disappointing, with what i saw,incredibly very small gardens and it will take you, no more than 3 minutes to see the whole gardens.The entrance fee is 200npr,i think it is very expensive,while you can visit the Ratna Park, which is much better and bigger and as it is a state park, will cost you only a fraction of what you pay at Garden of dreams,only 25npr !!!!!!!!!The title of the GARDEN OF DREAMS is deceiving,to say the least,no relation at all, with the word 'dream"and lastly i would like to mention the prices in the cafe,no prices for guessing what they are :i was very, very angry with them,that says it all

Away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. If you're a foreigner you must pay 200 rupees to enter, but if you appreciate peace and quiet, greenery, flowers, and a delicious cup of coffee, then the Garden of Dreams is definitely worth a visit! It has places to lounge on cushions in the grass, plenty of benches, and lots of flora to see! I was impressed the first time I went! It is a great place to get away from the city - or at least feel like it !

Garden of dreams. A beautiful garden hidden in the middle of Thamel, such a lovely place to go and relax and to get away from the busy city. Lovely flowers, lovely pond, got some lovely photos. A really good café shop with yummy cakes and buns.
Really a dream. Wonderful quite place in noisy Kathmandu. The restaurant excellent but little expensive. One of the best food in whole Kathmandu. Friendly staff and very clean place.

Beautiful place to escape the busy Thamel!. It is a few blocks from Thamel main street. It is about 200 ruby at the entrance. You can rent a matt to lay down in the garden. There is a Kaiser cafe for quick snack. The garden is small but beautiful and relaxing... For a quick relaxation and picnic or just simply escaping the street noice!

Beautiful garden in the heart of Kathmandu.. This place is a gem, you don't know it's there until you walk through the gates. It's an immaculate garden that's hidden from the hustle and dirt of downtown Kathmandu. They have mats you can lay on in the grass and chill for the day, the cost is only about 200 Nepalese Rupees, which is like 3 USD. Worth spending an afternoon, bring a book or some music to listen to. Lovely little cafe as well.

Peaceful gardens. Easy to find, 200rs entry. Can buy wifi.Mats lying around on the frass for people to use but grass isn't uncomfortable if there aren't any left. Signs saying don't feed the squirrels but staff around are equipped with breadsticks and happily give you some to feed the critters. Café/restaurant/bar inside.

Peaceful oasis in the City. A lovely escape from the busy, dusty streets of Kathmandu city to a small but beautiful formal garden - definitely worth a visit. There are lots of benches to sit and read a book or lie on the grass (special mats/beds provided).Built in 1920 for Kaiser Shamsher and restored with help from the Austrian government it also gives a taste of the Rana dynasty. Only NPR200 and there is a library and an interesting photo exhibition. Glanced at the restaurant menu - expensive my local standards. Enjoy :-)
Quite Dream. if you are in Love, you can feel it visiting here, a calm place mid the city where you can enjoy some foods to bite the time of joy.
Gem in the midst of a busy, dirty city. Lovely place to just take a book and waste away a day with mats to lay on the grass, a little cafe (albeit overpriced) and lovely gardens to view.

Beautiful Garden. A beautiful garden at the center of the city, Thamel. I enjoyed the view and the pond. I mostly saw couples :) and the surrounding supported them. There is Kaiser cafe in the garden which served amazing food but the price is higher than normal cafes.

GREAT PLACE TO RELAX. In a city full of noise and dust this is a great place to chill out even for a couple of hours. Grab a park bench and a good book and just enjoy the peace in this small area is amazing. Had a lovely lunch, not the cheapest but well worth it. Tourists have to pay to get in but only RS 200 so not expensive. Would love to come back and visit at night I reckon it would be beautiful!!!

A hidden little gem behind the walls. This was being recommended by a nepalese friend. Its a little garden with lots of flowers. You feel relaxed almost immediately. If you will like to take a nap or just lie on the grass to read a book, they can provide you with a mattress and pillow which are already included in the entrance fee. Even though its a small garden, you can easily spend an hour or so inside.

Pretty & Laid back.. This is a lovely garden to laze around in and to get away from the busy bustling streets of Kathmandu. I think that the entry fee is a little steep for what the garden offers, but still, it is well kept and a nice way to spend a couple of hours.
Forget the noise of Chaos City Kathmandu.. Located in the heart of Kathmandu, the Garden of dreams make you forget blowing horns, shouting people and the usual chaos of a busy capital.
Great oasis in Thamel. The place is very beautiful. Very well kept and provides respite for visitors tired of bazaars and shopping places. Too small if you want to see a lot or bigger space.

A beautiful place to escape from the bustle of Kathmandu. I visited the Garden of Dreams twice while I was in Thamel with different group members. We enjoyed a lovely lunch and the beautiful garden. I visit yearly and always look forward to spending time there.

Peaceful haven. Recently restored garden in the heart of Thamel, water features, flowers, trees,lots of seats and cushions of the grass. Great place to snooze or read a book and the only hassle free green space in Kathmandu! You can eat in the cafe but it's a bit pricey compared to the surrounding area.
Artistic garden. Historical place with nice garden and beautiful landmark. Nice food serving restaurant. Good place to hangout with friends for a small day out.

Lovely place for lunch. Peaceful and well maintained gardens in central Kathmandu. A lovely break fro the chaos of the city. Elevated restaurant perfect for lunch.Small entry fee - nice toilets made it worth it!

Great escape from noise and people. Katmandu is noisy, smelly and full of people and can definitely get on your nerves. This place was a nice oasis where you can relax a few hours. There is a small entrance fee, but it is worth it.

A great attraction !!. Situated not far from the centre of Thamel , the Garden of Dreams was a great choice for a short visit !! Not very big , but it containers beautifully manicured gardens and will hopefully soon be back to its best once the buildings have been restored.

Nice place to retreat to take a breath from the rush of the Kathmandu streets. Spent a couple,of hours here on a recent stay in Kathmandu. The pace of the streets with all its vehicles and the interesting road rules, along with lots of horn honking can be a bit tiring. The minute you step through the gate of the gardens, the atmosphere is completely different. The sounds of the street are largely muffled, the sights are green and serene and the controlled chaos of the streets are quickly forgotten. Good place to take a short breather.

An oasis in the hustle of Kathmandu. Definately recommend going to the Garden of Dreams when you are staying in Kathmandu. Just a short walk from central Thamel, but a world away from the hustle and bustle of the streets. Take a book and have a coffee in the peaceful gardens.

Excellent breathing space in the middle of Kathmandu. My wife and I came back here twice, as this was just an oasis for us, especially after a day of walking around. Though you can hear the cars in the street outside, it just feels more quiet. And sitting on a bench crumbling a bag of biscuits, we attracted chipmunks, who went all the way up to sit on my leg to eat out of my hand. Definitely worth a visit.

Peaceful. It is unusual to find somewhere this peaceful on the outskirts of Thamel but it is a lovely space with some fantastic buildings and a couple of cafes. (Although they are quite expensive). An ideal spot to sit and daydream or read in a lovely green space.
recomended. Wery nice place with excellent food, not expencive consedered how good it was. Would recomend it to food enthusiasts. The garden was also wery nice.

Pure delight. The garden is beautifully kept, wonderfully tranquill (almost quiet despite the close vicinity of busy traffic), and the restaurant (Kaiser Café) offers excellent food and impeccable service. This is a must for any visitor to Thamel who wants to get away from the hustle and bustle.

Excellent dinner spot. Had an excellent meal here. After 14 days trekking to EBC we were ready for some solid tasty food. We had the Wiener schnitzel for mains with soup for a starter. They even talked us into the chocolate brownie with ice cream which we shared for dessert. Maybe not "cultural" but good solid food. There is a $2 charge to get into the gardens and the guards were jerks but whatever. It was too dark when we were there to really appreciate the gardens but it was pretty with the few lights they had on.

A Peaceful Retreat from the Loud City. Inside the walls of the garden is really a dream come true when you're a little overwhelmed by traffic or just wanting somewhere to read. They are well maintained and truly beautiful, with a little cafe inside too. Small entry fee but worth it and if you ask you get a mat to sit on too.
nice open place. been few times, only open place in thamel district, here is also one restaurant nice for dinner time and drinks. really peaceful in the middle of crowed.

Tranquil oasis amidst the bustle of Thamel. As the day was heating up we decided to do what most locals were doing and that was find relief from the dust, traffic and bustle in the Garden of Dreams. This green and gorgeous oasis in the middle of downtown Kathmandu is not just for tourists – locals (free of charge) flock to the manicured lawns, picnicking, lying on rattan mats reading. It was once a private garden, considered the most sophisticated of its time, before the neo-classical buildings and pavilions began to crumble due to neglect. It has only recently been restored thanks to the help of the Austrian government (whose assistance can be seen in many parts of the city), and is now a spot not to be missed on a visit to Kathmandu.We were enjoying ourselves so much that we decided to linger over a crazily expensive glass of bubbles in the bar in the corner of the gardens where the chirping of birds were only upstaged by the ceaseless honking of horns beyond the high walls.
Nature escape in town. Beautiful garden in the middle of the city, nice place to get away from the busy town for a little while :)
Nice espace. A nife oasis in Thamel, entry fee of 200npr. Bring a book and grab one of the madreses for a nice rest

City escape. When you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu this is a great place to visit. The serenity is fantastic and you can sit amongst the green in the café with a cuppa. Great place.
A Real MUST. For Couples; its a real Must . Its a romantic place to be in . Its real Garden of Love You fall in Love when you are in it.

A wonderfully serene spot in the midst of chaos!. We visited the gardens twice - once in the evening and also whiled away a late afternoon. We were delighted by the cultured gardens, reflective pool, and the many secluded spots to relax.

An oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. It is very British there. A garden full of flowers in the center of Thamel. The restaurants and Cafes are very expensive. So if you want to have a break between shopping it is ok. Wifi is possible for a charge.

A Kathmandu must. It's not often that you can escape the craziness of Kathmandu and still be in the city. Garden of Dreams allows you to eave the hustle and bustle behind and focus on peace and tranquility.

Beautiful gardens in which you can escape the hussle and bustle . Visited in the late afternoon and really enjoyed relaxing in the afternoon sun. Great atmosphere inside, not too busy when we visited. Ate in the cafe and enjoyed the vegetable Thali. Popular with local young couples. Very well maintained. Make sure you go inside the gallery to look at the before restoration pictures.
so peaceful!. This must be visited by anyone who travels to Kathmandu. Gorgeous well kept gardens which you can either sit to view or lie on the grass to chill.
Oasis of calm. Great place to chill out and escape the noise and pollution of the city, beautiful and well maintained garden

Wonderful retreat. Beautiful landscaped gardens and pavilions in the heart of Thamel provide a great place to stop for a tea or drink. Visitors stretched out on the lawn areas and found cozy spots to relax under arbors.

A Breath of Serenity within the Chaos. Although the gardens will be worth visiting during the day for lively photos, the gardens exude a certain fairy tale charm at night with its low lighting and cool air. So good to unwind from the day's heat and chaos beyond the walls. Drinks and nicely prepared mains were served in style. Try visiting in the evenings for a sundowner. Tip: head here for a perfectly infused cuppa masala tea in Kathmandu. It's worth it!

Peaceful pretty garden in the midst of crazy Thamel. A great place to hide from the mad crowd and noise of Thamel. An unlikely gem and a great place to have some solo time or to read a book. You can pay to use wifi in the gardens. There are benches or mats for you to lay on the grass to chill. Wonderful getaway despite it's elegant simplicity. If you come in the late afternoon, you can stay till the grounds are lighted up but the insects come out around that time too ;)

Very nice oasis in the bustle of Thamel. We visited the Garden of Dreams primarily to go to the onsite restaurant, but we're surprised at the pleasant atmosphere of the gardens. It cost $2 US to enter, and it was worth the cost. The restaurant is a little pricey by Kathmandu standards, but excellent food and service. A very nice meal costs about $10-15 US.

Beautiful Oasis. Step through the gate and you forget the city on the outside. Funding has done a lot to renovate and there is no litter. Not always easy to find a quiet spot but beautiful nonetheless. Not sure of damage as we were there prior to earthquakes.

Ok garden. It's a nice garden but there are areas under construction. Can't reentry the garden once you exited. There's a nice cafe inside. It might take 1 hour to walk through the whole thing for 200Rps
Rel in a quiet haven in Kathmandu. A haven within the bustle of Kathmandu. Extremely relaxing and well worth a walk around. The coffee is good as well

Respite. Visit at dusk to enjoy its quiet beauty. Or in between sightseeing if you need a respite from the sun and dust. There is a restaurant, pretty overpriced though, but you pay to dine quietly, I guess.

Little Oasis to Relax in Kathmandu. The Garden of Dreams is a lovely little oasis in the bustling city of Kathmandu. The grounds are beautiful, relaxing, clean and casual. There are several pools and fish ponds, and, a grassy amphitheater with a number of mats and pillows where visitors can relax. Nice place to escape to for an afternoon.

Nepalese taj mahal. Former King of Nepal built this garden to his wife. Beautiful garden and a good peaceful place to chill out after hectic thamel. They charge 200 nrp from tourists to visit the garden.
Wonderful respite from the busy city. Very peaceful and restful, romantic lush garden, appealing statuary and a very nice garden restaurant.

2nd visit on a Sunday. This was our second visit The place is still beautiful but Sundays are busier and full of families and courting couple so not so tranquil If you want a little peace and quiet go mid week
Oasis in the middle of KTM. A nice quiet garden which feels a bit out of place in Kathmandu. Many of couples cosied up as there are lots of little romantic nooks to hang out in.

Quite place in noisy Kathmandu. Very quite place close to Thamel if you need a break from the noisy Kathmandu. However it was also a dissapointment as you have to pay the entrace fee (200Rs) and the restaurant is quite expensive.

Nice place to escape the city traffic. Enjoyable place to relax, but consists of a very small garden. If we didn't stop at the restaurant for morning tea we would have finished viewing the gardens in less than 10 minutes.

Peace and quiet. Really appreciated some peace and quiet after some time in Kathmandu, staying at a hostel. It was a beautiful little garden, however, the reason that it's so quiet is a little disturbing: Nepalese people are not allowed there, unless they're with foreigners. The symbolic of that is unpleasant; however, the relaxing atmosphere had me coming back. The internet wasn't the best, and at a point didn't work at all - which was sad, since I came there to quietly listen to my favorite radio show from back home.
Love the water features!. We so enjoyed relaxing and dining here the afternoon we left Nepal. The gardens are beautiful, the history interesting and the lunch was excellent!

Nice Gardens a good place to relax. This was a pretty garden but I really did not understand what the fuss was about. Maybe it is because it is a good way to take a break from the hustle and bustle of Thamel. i would recommend going for a nice coffee in the grounds but not to go out of your way to visit this attraction.

Nice garden with restaurant and cafe.. Quiet place were you can rest for the hole day you are in a copy of an Austrian garden and palace. The main building is not open. If the Austrian gouverment pay the restauration work it goes fast. 250 Rupies income is much also for Austrian people it is a shame.

Beautiful for couples but expensive. The place is beautiful to see and hang out (really gorgeous) but the food is really expensive.
I recommend take your partner on a date there (it costs 200 rupee to get in also) and walk around the park (at night would be best in my opinion)

Truly the Garden of Dreams..... A very peaceful & tranquil place that brings to life an old durbar & it's majestic garden. Very natural & equally beautiful! A must visit attraction located right in the heart of the capital city of Kathmandu but offers contrasting calmness & tranquility. The garden is majestic in itself with the multitude of plants, trees & vegetation but also strikes a profound balance with its architecture reflecting the old British era
beautiful garden. a moment of tranquility in a busy city. Great coffee-house. Garden in a very good condition, well maintained.
