Nothing much unless you like to laze the afternoon away. there are mosquitoes in the park. wifi need to be paid. nothing much fascinating around. probably for couples who wants to laze around, bask the sun and talk life.
Garden of Dreams in Kathmandu. A quiet location in the busy streets, relax and nice gardens. Restore from abandon...nice works have done.

A beautiful oasis in the middle of busy Thamel. After hours of walking and shopping around the Thamel area in Kathmandu, we decided to have lunch at a lovely restaurant inside the Garden of Dreams before heading to the airport. It is a world away from the bustling market outside of its walls. When you step inside the gate, you immediately feel calm and relaxed. There is a sprawling lawn, beautiful gardens, and fish ponds which transport you to a completely different place. You can easily spend a few hours lying on the grass, reading a book and just watch time pass by. The food offered in the Viennese restaurant was delicious and we ate at one of the outside tables, near the koi pond under the flower trellis. A wonderful way to end our magical holiday in Nepal.

First world oasis in Kathmandu. Absolutely gorgeous garden smack in the middle of busy, dirty Thamel! We had no idea what to expect when we forked over our 200RS to enter the garden, but it wasn't a lush, green oasis with beautifully landscaped trees, flowers, and fountains; perfectly maintained sitting areas; well dressed people lounging around quietly and taking photos / reading a book. Inside the Garden of Dreams you forget all about your problems - missed flights in Lukla, the griminess of 12 days of hiking, the chaotic traffic outside - it's just a beautiful, quiet place that you can rest, read a book, and relax and enjoy. Bring a book and some snacks and expect to stay here a while!

Lunch. Garden of Dreams is a nice quiet place for people trying to get out of normal excitement in Thamel, The garden is nice, though some of the structures are under repair from the earthquake. Had a pretty good lunch from the restaurant.

Oasis of green in bustling Kathmandu!. Lovely gardens and lawns -- super place to relax, read or share a quiet moment with a date or family. Nice little restaurant for a snack and coffee or full meal in a beautiful setting!

Livebirds, Tweet Tweet !!. Garden of Dreams in fact a dreamy place in Thamel. it's like an green island in a busy, rusty, human sea. You can take rest here, just laying on the green grasses. You can sit on a bench and enjoy the view, can read off a novel here without disturb. There's colorful fishes, pigeons etc. out there. You'll surely get a good time off at the garden. After all, A busy real life needs some dreamy leisure, don't it? BUT If your heart is broken, then don't dare to go there. This garden is also a popular dating spot. I've got no problem with that, but all this lovebirds will feel you more lonelier than you really are. Yeah I know alone doesn't mean lonely always and broken hearts should kept wide open, but still...memory remains...
A Haven. Amazing reconstruction where you can forget all about the traffic, noise and dust of Kathmandu while relaxing with a good book and a quiet drink

Wonderful garden in middle of the city. Wow!!! Un imaginable...right in the heart of the city, a beautiful garden. As you enter, you will notice anything, but when you get inside, then you can see the green floor and beautiful flowers in the pond in the middle of the park. Nice restaurants are available inside the garden. Couples go and sit for long and watch the light go down. Kids play a lot in that green floor full of grass.

So peaceful. I visited with a few friends, we had coffee, a bite to eat, then relaxed in such peaceful, and beautiful surroundings. Sadly, there is some earthquake damage, so renovations are being done, but still worth a visit, if you need a bit of relax time!

Calmness in the heart of mayhem. This garden is great. You pay a small fee to get in but it is worth it. It is a good place to chill because Kathmandu is quite hectic. The café there is good. You can sit around the garden take pictures, have a nice chat and relax.

Lovely romantic corner. Couples couples everywhere. I assume most youngsters go there on dates since it's the quietest place in Kathmandu. Others posing for selfies next to pretty ponds and sculptures. Very well renovated place, only a little bit damaged after the earthquake. Peaceful corner with plenty of greenery and romantic architecture.

A breath of fresh air. A slice of tranquility in the commercial mayhem which is central Kathmandu. The abundance of young locals arranged into couples sitting in the romantic niches which abound speaks volumes of it's appeal. Take in the scenic grounds, view the gallery showing the restoration of this formerly abandoned residence and get your breath back from the outside world. At 200 rupees you'll want to pay another 200 when you step back outside into the blast of heat and noise.

An oasis of quiet . I had been walking around for 2 hours in Kathmandu and then I went in. What a strange feeling! Super Zen and tidy and clean. People just sitting around reading or playing cards. Very strange to be this quiet in Kathmandu. Also bonus: squirrels!

You shouldn't miss this !. This is a must. Right in the heart of polluted and crowded city. It's perfect for couples, or if you want to have a break. For once in Nepal, some of the staff there weren't very nice, but you won't notice it.

Sanctuary. Has a really cool library of before and after photos of when it got restored very interesting. Really nice fountains would be a great place to bring a picnic. A few different areas. Some have been roped off because of earthquake damage but you can still see anyway so your not missing too much. Liked the seats ontop of the wall at the back and watching all the squirrels jumping around in the palace grounds behind they seemed to be more active earlier so cute.

Romantic gardens nestling at the heart of a hectic city. Kathmandu's Garden of Dreams provides visitors with a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of nearby Thamel with its numerous shops, restaurants and street hawkers. The beautifully-maintained gardens date back to 1920, when they were created by a Rana Field Marshal and christened the Garden of Six Seasons. Although only half of the original gardens are still in existence, a comprehensive restoration funded by the Austrian government which lasted until 2007 has secured their enduring popularity. In Kathmandu, the Garden of Dreams is synonymous with a meeting place for lovers - both Nepali and those from farther afield. Couples and friends alike lounge on the expansive lawns, enjoy tete-à-tetes on the verandas, and savour coffee or snacks in one of the restaurants. At 500 NPR (5 USD) for tourists, it's worth the money and, despite some earthquake damage, has lost none of its considerable charm.

An Oasis. This is a little gem just on one of the main entrances to Thamel.After the bustle of the streets it is a pleasant interlude to be able to rest in pleasant surroundings in a well maintained garden.Full marks to those in trying to restore part of it back to its beauty.Pity about some of the earthquake damage to some of the pavilions.
average. nice surrounding and its suits for a lovers. but management system is not to good and don't waste ur time visiting this place

Fantastic garden . In the first point of Tamel area, there is a fantastic and beautiful garden. The goverment try to make a garden acording to it's name , but this garden is too small. It is surprisingly when you see the Tel area and it's shops, then go there for rest in the quite environment. I belived it's name is actually suitable for it.
'Fresh air'. Super beautiful! Lots of young local couples finding retreat from the outside... which was very cute. Take your book and just slow your pace down.

Tranquil, beautiful oasis in middle of city. When I went to the Garden of Dreams, it was crowded. Still the gardens, fountains -- even the other people -- made for a tranquil interlude in my touring around Kathmandu. Stop by for 30 minutes of reflection or more for lunch or a cool drink. One of my favorite places in Kathmandu!

Lovers Paradise !!! 💘 ❤ 💘. Neat and clean fabulous Garden with full of historic architectural buildings surrounded by greenery !!!I went there on 24th August at around 5.30pm, it was a cloudy day and light is fading fast, paid entrance fee of 200NPR which to my opinion is too high.Hat's off to the designer, gardeners and the whole maintenance team for maintaining this wonderful place, I spent nearly 1.5 hours and too some glorious photos.With lights switched on the garden looks gorgeous !!! Lovers were sitting and roaming everywhere, it's a lover's paradise !!!One restaurant is there with all 5star dishes and corresponding rates.Thanks a lot for everything,Loving you so much,Peacefully yours.S M Bega Raaj.Happy travelling... ❤ ❤ ...

Expercience tranquillity in the middle of Kathmandu!. Also known as Kaiser cafe this beautiful garden, a former Rana Dynasty Property, has been opened for the Public a few years ago. Go there! Love the place everytime i go to Nepal.Lunches are fantistic. The Dwarika's hotel manages the restaurant in the garden. Everything in this garden is beautiful and clean. A relief to have a cup of cappucino in a dust free garden setting! In the weekends it crowded with nepali youngsters!.

Beautiful gardens and great place to relax!. Visited in January 2015, before the earthquakes, and enjoyed this location. It was a beautiful and relaxing place to hang out for a few hours and enjoy. There is food/drink to purchase and a public restroom. They do charge a small entrance fee but it is worth it.

Oasis amidst the crazy of Kathmandu. We had lunch and our first Everest beer here. A bit magical the way you just walk off the busy streets of Kathmandu through the door to this oasis. Highly recommend for a tea break.
Zen. Zen place in the middle of the madness of Kathmandu. Very simple, and at the moment the buildings are damaged by the earthquake.

Great place to find peace inside the city area.. Greenery everywhere and a peaceful environment. A good place to relax and enjoy your day off with your loved ones. Do take a good camera with you for beautiful pictures.
Garden of Love and beauty.. Garden with Love, that i want to call. when we were there every corner were with a couple spending their time enjoying.

Great Central Area Attraction, Kathmandu. Garden of Dreams located in the vicinity of Thamel Market area, is a great relief from the busy streets of the neighborhood. The place has great architecture is being well maintained. A great place to spend some quality time in the heart of Kathmandu.
Oasis of peace and rest in hectic Kathmandu. Very beautiful garden, well maintained, an oasis of peace in hectic Kathmandu. We had tea and lunch in the garden. Must see!!

Oasis. OMG what an oasis. Took me a few days to make my way there but when i finally did i did not want to leave.... Such a wonderful escape from the noise and dust and heat ....felt like i was in a dream beautiful place

An oasis in the middle of all the chaos called Kathmandu!. The Garden of Dreams is a place of peace, love and beauty. A great escape from all the hustle and bustle of the chaotic Kathmandu city's noise, traffic and pollution. You can buy a full day multiple entry ticket and go there with a good book, a soft drink and sandwich .. not to forget a collection of great classical music for complete rest and relaxation. There is a restaurant and a bar that serves good food too. The mattresses are available and you could enjoy a great afternoon siesta too.

Peaceful and relaxing..... this was my first visit to Kathmandu, Nepal. and as soon as i came here i was recommended to here from the hotel where i was staying. it is beautifully decorated and well played with the designs and greenary you will see around.

escape from Katmandu in just seconds. Beautiful peaceful garden in the heart of Katmandu. Enter and all the noise, traffic and chaos is left behind you. Inside find peace beauty and serenity and a delicious cafe as well
Perfect to read and relax. The garden was really pretty but unfortunately some parts were not accessible...but a nice place to just sit and relax.
Beautiful garden. The garden is beautiful. It's an oasis of serenity in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. You can sit down and drink tea at the cafes in it too.

Regenerate in these beautiful gardens. Fantastic spot to take a break close to the hustle and bustle of the Thamel shopping area.Well worth the small entry fee, but make sure you have the time to just relax and enjoy the gardens. It's a place to go to escape the crowds and catch your breath in a beautiful setting

Must visit. Very peaceful, excellent people, mix of European and Nepalese structures.
Food was excellent too and perfect place to visit in evening to get rid of noise and dust of Kathmandu.
Lovely & Peaceful. Very pretty & cosy right in heart of shopping area i.e. Thamel. Simple & peaceful. Nice to clear your eyes and thoughts from the hustle-bustle traffic.

Quite a small dream. Seems more of hype as the garden is quite small. Not a vast expanse of greenery you would imagine. Its more of a private garden opened for public. Also, the fee is expensive. But it does provide a nice, quite place to relax in the city center.
Good place to meditate . Such a peaceful place to relax and meditate. Also has very good restaurants. The flowers in the garden are awesome and it's a nice refreshing break from kathmandu rushing.

Only for couples . You cant imagine kathmandu having a beautiful garden like this. As i entered this serene place i just got distracted by the couples, they were getting intimidating it was awkward to visit this garden. You have a restaurant that serves delicious food but the prices are ridiculously expensive. Overall an average place to visit. I would rather walk my way to money temple than visit this place.

Expensive but nice !!. Food is very expensive but the environment is too good to spend some quality time. Its a nice place to relax, you will find many of the travelers taking sun bath. Kids are running around.

Pretty. My friends and I went to Nepal in April. We thought the garden was pretty. There were spots to sit and just relax/read a book. The restaurants within the garden are extremely priced. However, do try the Momos from the garden. Steamed momos. They are YUM! Momos in Nepal are yum everywhere.
Take a rest while traveling. Garden of dreams is very close to Thamel which has very beautiful place to relax and nearby restaurant offers variety of foods.

A tourist trap. the place itself is nice, but you have to pay to go inside, the restaurant and the bar have western prices and it doesn't look like you are in Nepal. You can't find a nepalese inside, except for the workers. A place I don't recommend.
A Visit to the Garden of Dreams. A very scenic garden and excellent architecture. There are restaurant and place to relax too. It was indeed marvelous.
nice garden.. Just a place to take picture. Got many trees and flowers. Nice place to sit in the sunshine in winter.

Oasis in the city. I visited the garden expecting to do a quick turnaround and leave but ended up getting caught up in its beauty for HOURS. I could literally spend all day here lounging and reading. And at only 200 rupees the entrance fee is very affordable. I'm planning to go back to this garden a few times during my trip to Kathmandu. It's just so relaxing and peaceful - a nice break from the city around.

Tranquil resting spot. Very nice place, right in the heart of Thamel, but it seems a bit much to have to pay an entrance fee. Since it's only a small amount, perhaps it's worth it to sit in these very well appointed, yet very small gardens, in amongst the lily ponds and trees. There are two cafes on site, which made me think they should be covering the fees through a levy. Regardless, it's nice and peaceful, right in the heart of all the bustle and noise.

A haven of calm in the centre of Kathmandu . It's difficult to describe the experience of the first time you visit the Garden of Dreams. After the intense noise and bustle of Kathmandu the Garden is an amazingly quiet and calm place. It's a perfect place for lunch when you're feeling a little dazzled by the city.
Nice but tiny. Do not go on weekends, its full of kids taking selfies and its really annoying, any other time it will do nicely as a get away from the busy street

it was nice. I just paid around 300 for me and my foreign gf. not that expensive. when I was in, then, I was like "what the....". It was very well decorated garden with various trees, flowers, ponds and I could see different kinds of bird flying above me here and there around. there were places to sit and overall it was awesome. I just though that this must be one of the most most most cleanest and quietest beautiful place in kathmandu or thamel whatever. I love this place. I recommend u all to give a visit. this garden deserves. I loved it . a very good place to relax urself and enjoy the nature.
The best garden!!!. Really nice garden with amazing flowers and trees!!! So peaceful so you can relax!! There's a nice restaurant to have a light meal and cup of tea so enjoy!!
Very nice garden. Very nice looking garden, but you won't really spend more than 10 - 15 minutes in there, unless you're using this place for a date. For $2 (200 rupees) it's probably a bit pricey.

Peaceful Tranquility. This is a nice place to spend the morning or afternoon in Thamel. The atmosphere is very quiet, peaceful that you won't be bothered with when you walk around. Grab a book, or a few friends and hang out there for a few hours. It's a nice place to take photos too as the garden was designed quite well. There is a small entrance fee but it is worth it if you spend a few hours there. A cafe is situated inside too but the prices are a bit high. It's nice to see a place like this in the middle of all the chaos in Kathmandu. If you need a quiet place to relax for the day, stop by here.

Oasis in kathmandu. Garden of dreams is a perfect place for a short nature break in the town. Some area of the garden has been sealed due to earthquake but it still remains as beautiful as before. During public holidays, it gets a bit crowded but there always a place for you to relax and enjoy the serenity.If you are visiting on evenings better have some mosquito repellent on you.

Wonderful Way to Spend an Evening!. I came here with my boyfriend in the evening time, as the sun was setting, and it was such a lovely time we spent together; he took photos, as it is a great location to take photos, and we were able to just sit peacefully and talk and read together without any distractions. It is a great place to spend hours just relaxing with good company. I recommend going a few hours before sunset, so that you can appreciate the flowers and decor in the natural light. It was walking distance from our hotel in Thamel, and I definitely recommend checking it out, especially if you can walk to it!

Ideal for children. One of the few places in Kathmandu where young children can have fun in the grass and watch birds and squirrels. The flowers, trees and fountains are beautiful. A few buildings surrounding the garden have been damaged by the earthquake but the garden is still a must see.

An oasis in three heart of Kathmandu. Whether looking for some respite from the crazy Kathmandu traffic - a quiet place to read and have drink - or for dinner, this offers a great respite. And late afternoon when there are lots of young Nepal folk about is a really good time to visit.

Totally amazing. Garden of Dreams.. Garden of Dreams is THE place to go when the hustle and bustle of Thamel starts to get you. My first visit to these beautiful gardens set behind a huge wall allows you to relax on one of the mats or seats and recharge your mind and body to a more gentle pace. The contrast is hard to explain but once you have been there you will understand why people and myself would go back. Reading a book, chatting to friends having a snooze in the sun or swinging on the giant bamboo swing is all possible. You can stay for as long as you want and bringing in some snacks and drinks of your own is ok, or you can visit the cafe there. Garden of Dreams is beautiful and such a visual contrast to Thamel. Love it.

A great place to rest. Staying in Kathmandu offers many places to visit which requires a lot of walks or traveling by taxi/bus in the heat. The Garden of dreams is probably the best place to rest there - very beautiful and quite, with nice grass ti sit and relax. They also offer wifi - it is paid, but the fee is not much. I stayed for 5 days in Kathmandu and visited the garden probably 8 times :)

Wow, Don't Miss This!. "We must cultivate our gardens" ~ Voltaire. This wonderful quote is found among others on plagues posted on the walls of this beautiful space in Kathmandu. What a relief to step away from the maniacal street traffic and find a peaceful place graced with trees, plants, fountains, water, terraces, monuments, cafés, etc. All this with only a stone wall separating one for the craziness of Kathmandu. This garden will save your sanity. Don't miss it and take the time to eat at the cafe. It's very nice.
Beautiful oasis. So gorgeous, squirrel's everywhere (sit quietly and hand feed them). A nice oasis in the middle of crazy KTM.

Awesome garden for some good Family time. If you have kids, like small kids (not teenagers, teenagers actually have OCD they get bored very quickly) and want to get away from hustle and bustle of Kathmandu, you have a place to visit. Garden of dreams though is in the center of the city amazingly no sound reaches you inside the garden. The garden is well maintained and very peaceful for you to relax and unwind. The kids can run around and if you are interested in photography then it is really really good.

Garden of Dreams. This is a nice sort of private garden that is open to the public. A nice place to relax if you have been wandering around Thamel. They have food there that is really very nice and the place over all is very genteel. Good to unwind with a cup of tea or a snack.

Excellent place ...to chill. An awesome place in the heart of the city. has been developed beautifully... seems like a far away from the dusty streets.... we really enjoyed some of the finest teas and cakes here...definitely recommended when in Kathmandu.
Peaceful heaven. After a few days spent in the heart of Thamel, I couldn't believe how quiet and peaceful the Garden was.

A beautiful haven in the midst of Kathmandu. Peaceful and easy on the eye. Local people were relaxing and enjoying the peace and quiet. We hope to come back for dinner as the menu looked really nice and the setting beautiful.
Quiet spot in the heart of Kathmandu. A special quiet spot in the heart of Kathmandu. Find beauty and peace in the heart of the city. Even a good place to eat.
A bit of clean air. If you need some rest and clean air, away from the noise of the town, this is the place to go. It has nice botanical garden, a restaurant (a bit pricey) and a gallery.

A wonderful escape from Kathmandu. A quiet bit of solace in a noisy, bustling city, this garden was my favorite place to hide from the tourists and noise of Kathmandu. Enjoying a martini while watching birds flit by, and couples lounge, was the perfect thing to take me out of the chaos of travelling in Asia. A definite must for those in the area!

Beautiful garden in Kesar Mahal.. Not so special but good place to spend time for your tea/coffee. I don't say it as a must visit place but if you are free in Kathmandu and tired it might be the best place for recreation.

Nice place to get away from the crowds if it is sunny. Not much of a garden really but a nice quiet place within walking distance from Thamel and the madding crowds. They provide mats to sit on the grass...
Beautiful gardens. The Garden of Dreams is a must of you visit Thamel. It is so peaceful and very relaxing. At this time of year the flowering trees are in full bloom. Just wonderful

Nice place to read a book, spend a quite time in the middle of busy Kathmandu. This place has been renovated well by Government of Nepal. They have kept all the ancient attics and esthetic sense. It has green lawns, park benches, nice restaurant. I took my daughters and spend half day there. They played around the garden. Then we took lunch together. The food was good, though bit costly than outside. And the entrance fee is 2 USD per person. You can take the pass-code of WiFi though it doesn't work most of the time.

An Oasis of calm and beauty. I recommend you take a book and allocate a few hours mid afternoon and go into evening to see it in daylight and then with the beautiful lights at night. We didn't go for long enough and didn't see in daylight.
Place for young couples. I really did not find the place appropriate for family during daytime. You will see mostly the couples around. For dinner, can suggest for all age groups.

Garden of Peace and Tranquility. A beautiful park-like enclosure with ponds, fountains, grass and trees. A little damaged by the earthquakes but still providing excellent food and atmosphere. Definitely worth visiting.

Another word that takes you away from busy dusty Kathmandu. Pricey but rather fine food served in the restaurant inside the Garden.WIFI is not fee and most of the time isn't workingNice and maintained European style garden200 Rupess entrance fee

Oasis in the Middle of Busy Kathmandu. I visited this place twice during my trip to Nepal last April, just a week before the earthquake hit Nepal. This place is peaceful, beautiful, and well-maintained. A perfect spot to lie down, read books, do a small picnic, before going back to the hustle-bustle streets of Thamel, Kathmandu. With only Rs. 200 entrance fee (2 USD) it's like an oasis.

Tranquil and Fragrant Garden Oasis. We recently visited the Beautiful Garden of Dreams which were restored by Gotz Hagemuller the acclaimed architect of The Patan Museum. (2004).The garden was splendid. The exquisite pink water lily were all in full bloom as it was springtime..... Snapdragons in pinks and purples abounded, the scent of gardenia wafted on the warm breeze. It is a haven for birds and of course young love! It must not be missed on your next trip to Kathmandu.There was some minor damage to the old colonial buildings and outer wall of the garden following the earthquake in April. The restaurant, The Kaiser Cafe was closed at the time we were there. The Gardens, thankfully, were open. An idyllic place for contemplation away from the dusty, busy streets.
Garden of Dream. In this situation of our country Nepal is facing trouble of earthque .so,Few days later we have provide full job for Nepal Tourism.actually the garden of dreams is not any distrube.
Lovely garden. This is a lovely, well-maintained garden. It's a nice stopover before or after the hectic frenzy of Thamel.
Name says it all. great way to escape the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. The swing inside is a must as well as an ice cream
Oasis. It's a peaceful, tranquil garden amidst the hussle & bussle of Kathmandu. A place to escape & relax on a sunny day....

Disappointing. This supposedly "secluded" garden --- is in actuality --- not.This was recommended to me by locals --- perhaps because for them it was an oasis but I did not find it to be so. For Westerners who know the hush of true botanical garden enclosures this one falls truly short of expectations. There is a hefty entrance fee of 200rps. For retirees (with passport proof) it is 100rps. Once inside it is surprisingly small.The main, very busy, thoroughfare of Tridevi Marg is adjacent to one entire wall of the garden and a side wall is another busy street. So you can hear all the horns of Kathmandu hustle and bustle.The on-sight restaurant is expensive --- the types of seating not conducive to true relaxation. Better relaxation can be had at nearby Himalayan Java Coffee House or one of the many Thamel restaurants that have truly quiet lush inner garden courtyards. These abound ---just peek in doorways.

ok place. Well, firstly there is an entrance fee. About 2 euros, I think. But that is good because it would be crowded with locals otherwise. The Garden of dreams looks nice and is not noisy. But as the cafe there was expensive and so was the wi-fi I wouldn`t suggest this place as a must see in Kathmandu. It is just a quiet little green spot in city centre, that`s all. Go there, if you have spare time to kill or just want to get out of the dusty streets for a while.

A must visit place in Kathmandu. the garden is really a 'garden of dreams'.Unbelieavable will be an appropriate term.in the hustle bustle of central kathmandu a place so serene and calm and quiet is refreshing.Its a must visit for people travelling to kathmandu.What used to be a personal garden of a Minister of yesteryears is open to all commoners.You can find couples,foreigners and family enjoying their time in the garden.
nice and soothing. The garden is a lovely place.. like a british garden… manicured.. nice way to spend a couple of hours reading or writing or just day dreaming...
Peaceful place of Thamel . This place is one of the best peaceful place I found in Nepal. I could not forget the taste of the mo mo of the restaurant inside.

Silence at last!. Thus place has to be the most tranquil place in Kathmandu I have been to date. The thick, high stone walls almost completely eliminate the traffic noise and dust just on the other side. The air even seems fresher and you can smell the flowers and grass and hear the birds chirping whole sitting on a bench and looking at one of the ponds. I think the cost was 250 rupees and for hours peace and tranquility, it is probably the best $2.50 I have spent since my first pack of baseball cards 30 years ago

Peaceful place to relax!. If you want to get away from the noisy and crowded city of Kathmandu, then the Garden of Dreams is the Place to go. Beautiful ponds and flowers and if you like sweets and cakes you should try them in same Cafe inside the Garden.

Just a garden. It appears that I am the only person on Trip Advisor that did not LOVE the Garden of Dreams. I actually went here twice, hoping to like it more the second time. I agree that it is absolutely a breath of fresh air (literally) in the midst of the chaos and dust that is Kathmandu; however, the food and beverages are overpriced, and you are required to pay for Wifi. If you really are looking for a place to relax and catch your breath, I suggest a rooftop patio in Thamel over the Garden of Dreams. However, if you are looking for expensive Westernized food and a man-made, kept garden, then this is your place.
Like a paradise. Nice and quiet escape from Thamel noise and chaos. Great place for relaxation, very nice and clean. Good food and drinks.
Oasis. An oasis in the crowded and noisy city of kathmandu. We tasted sweets, cakes and tea in a very beautiful place with gardens and pools.

Beautiful. Loved our interlude in this pretty garden with its stunning pavilions and ponds. On a sunny day there were quite a few people relaxing, but it was still a peaceful experience. Cute tiny squirrels entertained us, as we savoured our tasty momos for lunch at the cafe.It's worth having a look inside a room at the building on the far side (opposite the road) where an interesting display of photos showed before and after views of the gardens and how they were brought back from neglect. An outstanding job!

Oasis of calm but overpriced for what it is.. Visited two weeks before the earthquake and felt it was overpriced as a tourist spot. The cafe is relatively expensive also. This place is fine if you want to find somewhere calm and cool to relax in after a hard day trekking or just shopping. You can find somewhere to sit and read a book in pleasant, calm surroundings but that's about it.
pease and beauty. An experiance of beauty and tranquility in an romantic garden from a time bygone. Why not have Your lunch here overlooking the fair scenery?

An oasis. Tranquil and peaceful. The neo-classical style of the garden and building are a stark contrast with the buy and crazy traffic outside of the walls. Great food at Kaiser Cafe too. I ordered pork schnitzel and it was amazing.

Restful amid kathmandu chaos. Great food, incredible service. We went with our guide for a late lunch early dinner to thank him for his service. A little pricier than local places but an outstanding place and value.
Peace and Quite in Kathmandu. Yes you can find peace and quite in Kathmandu go to the Garden of Dreams. Wonderful place and lovely place to eat as well.Stay strong Nepal & PrayForNepal

Relief Away From The Bustling Streets. A mini oasis in the middle of the city. Walk off the busy and noisy streets into the garden and relax. There are a few cafes also and the food is great! A great spot to just sit and chill out. Keep an eye out for chipmunks.
Such a surprise . A beautiful relaxing garden hidden from the busy city. Great for a wander or a relax on the lounges. An unexpected treat and worth a visit when you need a break.

Incredibly mesmerized!!!. I went there with my hubby, found incredibly mesmerizing and soothing! It's a very good spot to click selfies so that you can keep the beautiful memory! You can also enjoy the peaceful and greenery atmosphere! Above all, its hanging lights and beautiful flower pots on each table was worth praising! Sitting arrangement between each attraction was also good! But pond seems little bit dirty! We also had one piece coconut cake but it was too costly!
Dinner with Friends. The food was absolutely excellent as was the service. Such an amzing and charming setting. Would recommend it to all as a must visit.
nice place. We were with friends for short visit it's very nice place will go there again.it's nice place to have lunch with garden view.
Garden. Good garden for climbing up and down. But the river nearby is quite dirty and there is always a waft of bad odor coming out of the river. But it is a place to visit.

Magical garden oasis. Absolutely magical garden oasis in dusty Kathmandu. A haven. But watch out for those canoodling couples as it's a v popular date spot! Lovely grassed gardens, plants, trees, tiny squirrels, architecture. Beautifully restored. So relaxing.

Superbly well renovated 1930s garden. Done up sensitively, a great haven from Thamel. Good cafe, bit pricey but worth the spend. Went back twice. Also a lovely cocktail bar for that afternoon frozen dac. Loved it.

A quiet place in Kathmandu!. It totally deserves its name. It is located next to a big and noisy street so you wouldnt actually expect it to be that calm but it really is. Once you get in, everything is quiet, clean and green. Great place to spend a day reading and walking around the gardens It offers a nice break from the sometimes overwhelming Kathmandu.

Heaven on earth. It was very peaceful there. Tourist will charge at the entrance gate. You can just lying on the grass or reading a book or even just sleep on the mattress. I could spent a whole day in here.

A little haven away from the bustle. I went here as soon as it opened one morning and it was a lovely place to take some time out and relax for a few hours. The gardens are beautiful and I found that it was nice and quiet first thing. Many people started to fill the place up as I was leaving so I was glad that I had gone early.

Peaceful walled garden. Tranquil garden with water feature. Mattresses with head rests available to lie on the lawns. Not many flowers.Restaurant rather pricey but has a lovely western menu.Entrance fee applicable. Wifi can be purchased.

Bazaar Hideaway. If you find yourself in Thamel Bazaar and just want to escape the hustle and bustle for a quiet hour or two relaxation, this place is just the ticket, the entry price is worth the tranquil setting, place to relax in the sun and a great coffee and cake menu, just what you need after all that haggling!

Relaxing in Crazy Kathmandu . After staying in the Thamel for quite a few days I needed a quiet Saturday afternoon spot to read a book and just relax and remembered having passed this place a few times.As it is surrounded by high walls I was really not ready for what I saw inside! Pretty much the opposite of Kathmandu - quiet, clean, green, peaceful...There is a 200 rupi entrance fee but they let you bring in food so you should definitely consider a picnic (the cafes are EXPENSIVE), and in the big 'amphitheater' area there are free mattresses and pillows for loan! This is a perfect place for a relaxed afternoon.Only tip is to try to avoid the weekend. Once it got to be around noon time this became the Nepali teenager date/meet-up spot which sort of changed the 'quiet' atmosphere.
Perfect Oasis. Peace quiet coffee and cake at the Restaurant, Pricey but look where you are sitting. Perfect for a quiet getaway from the chaos of Thamel.

Peace and Relaxation. I loved this place. An escape from the dust and traffic congestion of Kathmandu. A place to lie in the sun, read a good book or maybe meditate. It is quiet and so very clean. Enjoy the beautiful flowers and the sound of the birds. Very good cafe and also, a restaurant.

An oasis in the middle of Kathmandu . Very nice and well kept garden. Many exotic plants, flowers and trees. Nice but expensive restaurant and bar. Nice with the mattress on the lawn. I lay down and slept so well for two hours in the nice garden. This was really what I needed after a week in the messy city.

Utterly Restful. We went here after a very hectic visit to the Swayambhunath Stupa. We were worn out with noise and bustle and it was a haven of peace and beauty. There is a fairly steep entrance fee, but the gardens themselves are lovely, green and cool. The restaurant is delightful, if a little expensive. We spent a very pleasant afternoon there.

An Escape from the hustle. My wife and I went here for a quick escape from all of the hustle and bustle of Thamel. It was a pleasant surprise! The cost is cheap (200 NRP per foreigner).We went on a day that was a little bit rainy. It was nice because there wasn't too many people there. However, when the sun came out it became a little crowded.On a clear day, I could see spending time here lounging around and reading a book. We didn't do that because of the rain. However, we spent a little time in the "bar" and grabbed a snack and a drink during the heaviest of the rain.

Easy to miss...make sure you don't!. Beautiful despite small sizeFabulous little bar near the public toilets in left corner Restaurants looked good but didn't have time to tryIn between durbar marg and thamel areaVery peaceful and interesting history Popular with young couples in love...awww!

A little piece and quiet. This little garden is tucked away just outside Thamel district. The garden are small and well maintained. There isn't a lot to explore and I wouldn't recommend visiting if you are low on time in the area, however if you need to get away from all the hooting on the roads and are looking for a little space this place is good for a 30-45 minute break.

lovely retreat in the middle of thamal. for 2.50 US, I got admission to the garden and wifi access. This is a lovely place with lots of spots for resting. Grab a book and go through for a nice break. The restaurant is not bad either but a little over priced compared to what is outside the garden.
A Peaceful and Tranquil Oasis. After the traffic and fumes of Kathmandu, this was a great surpise and pleasure. Peaceful and relaxing.

Nice place to relax and use wifi. The restaurants are expensive but the bathrooms are beautiful (and free once you're in). There are more lounging cushions in a little storage closet if they are all in use.

Peaceful moment. After a day in the big and crowded Thamel, Garden of Dreams was the right place to relax. You have to buy a ticket for 200 rupies, but it is worth the effort if you need a relax and peaceful moment.

Nice garden. This is simple garden with a nice setting. It has coffee shop and a restaurant. If you are going here, plan to laze around or read a book. There is not a lot to see here and so don't expect to spend hours looking at things. Weather will a key to enjoy this and so watch out for the showers in the afternoon.

An oasis in chaos!. A delightful European style garden. It is surreal to sit in the peaceful well restored and maintained garden and hearing only the relentless tooting of car horns outside the walls of the garden.

Calm oasis in center of Kathmandu. I admit to some guilt in loving this place. It's a classic British colonial garden. But it's also a haven for young Nepali couples -- you'll see them enjoying a little together time very peacefully. If you are overheated and tired of the sound of blaring horns, you can duck in here and lounge on the lawn for 200 rupees (about $2 USD). I ate lunch here and loved the food (although the dessert wasn't really worth the calorie splurge). If you choose to dine here, reserve a spot the night before and plan on staying a while. Service is very courteous and not fast -- which is exactly the way it should be!
magical and tranquil retreat. beautiful formal gardens, mature trees, peace and quiet (amazing, considering the location), great restaurant.

a quiet sanctuary. we spent an afternoon here, after a hectic two week holiday in Nepal. A short walk from the Shanker Hotel, it is a very peaceful park on the outskirts of Thamel. Well worth it for a meal at the Kaiser Cafe. A little pricey, but excellent food

Beautiful. Beautiful place and very nice for couples. We spent time strolling around and taking photos. There was a spot where you could lie on mats and watch the birds and clouds. There were other semi secluded places to just sit and talk. I very much enjoyed this place.
The most beuityful place in Kathmandu. Realy peacefull and quite but still in Thamel. The have excellent restaurant but it's much more expensive than others in Thamel.

Couple heritage. If you want to breathe some fresh air away from city's noise and pollution, this is the place to go. Although located in the heart of city, it has got a very peaceful and scenic environment. You could see many couples having some of the nicest time of their life.
Gorgeous spot. Recommended to me a fellow traveller I had met whilst on a trek. Big thumbs up for this peaceful garden in the middle of a chaotic city.
Recomended. Order your meat served medium rare -and you will never order it anyway else ever again. Exelent. Top service, top food, perfect surroundings.
Oasis of calm. Beautiful garden.... so peaceful.... and the service in the cafe was excellent (loved the fruit platter!). Lovely to sit and meditate and just 'be'.

Saved my life!. O.K, that's a little extreme, but it felt almost like it. I am a VERY picky eater. Anytime I travel I have food issues. I like a few things and that is about it. Indian food is nowhere on my list of likes. So after hiking to Everest Base Camp and being back in Katmandu we had some people tell us about this place. They said the food was great and the beef was real beef and tasted like a piece of America. After loosing 17 lbs. on the trek this sounded like what the dr. ordered. So we went and first of all you have to pay 2.00 to get into the grounds which are beautiful! You are tucked away in this piece of paradise forgetting about the busyness of the city right outside the gates. It is beautiful both day and night when it is lit up. We ended up eating our last 3 meals there. I had the steak sandwich which was GREAT, fried chicken also very good, and then the filet which they bring two medallions to serve you. Plenty of food and so very good!! I was so thankful to have found this piece of happiness on the trip. By far the best food I had!

Great place to take a break, food is very good though expensive. Before visiting the place I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and honestly it seemed a bit odd that people were ranking this so high. However after visiting the garden, I am in full agreement. This is a beautiful place to walk around a bit and enjoy some moments of peace in what is undeniably a hectic and chaotic city. Considering most people will only spend 1 or 2 nights in Kathmandu, the time is spent in a rush. Garden of dreams will give you a chance to take a breather and enjoy the beautiful scenery. We both really enjoyed the Cafe and our food was very good but like the reviews say it is undeniably expensive relative to the options in the city, so the actual value will vary from person to person. Definitely worth a visit.
Restaurant. Nice restaurant in Garden. very expensive. Serves lot of continental food. favourite place of foreign visitor.

Expensive luxury. A visit to this beautiful garden is worth the 200 rupee admission fee. You can stay all day in neo-classical surroundings echoing the grandeur of Raj-style architecture. But if you're watching the rupees, take your own food. The Kaiser Restaurant is ridiculously expensive considering what you can get outside the Garden's manicured walls.Definitely worth a visit if you want to get away from the chaos of Thamel, but not if you don't want to pay European prices for a cheese panini.

What a Surprise! Love it!. It's hard to imagine such a gem in the busy and chaotic town of Kathmandu. But right next to the craziness is this beautiful spot. Excellent restaurant and beverage offerings surrounded by blooming flowers and fountains.

Beautiful place to sit, relax, and read a good book. The Garden of Dreams is pretty easy to find. It's on Tridevi Marg, and the entrance has a sign for both the Garden of Dreams and Kaiser Cafe. It is such a beautiful garden in the middle of the city, and is a nice place to just sit and relax. Although there are cafes inside, it is a bit pricey. I suggest bringing food if you are on a budget. There are mats and pillows available and their are a lot of benches where you can sit. If you want a day to yourself to read, write, or reflect, this is the best place to do it. The entrance costs NPR200 per person, per day.

Nice Respite from Chaos. Pay 200 rupees each, get a single-entry ticket for as long as you like, and escape the chaos outside the garden walls. The Garden of Dreams is peaceful, relaxing, and has a restaurant or two on the grounds. A relaxed stroll around the place probably takes 40 minutes or so. It's not very big, but it makes up for that with its well-maintained gardens and ambience.
Loved it. Beautiful garden oasis in a busy city. Great place to chill and read a book, have a nice lunch and a drink.

a common garden you can see anywhere in Europe. I came to this garden just because I saw it has a high ranking in the Tripadvisor. Unfortunately, I was extremely dissappointed. Entrance fee charged 200 Rs and inside it was a very normal garden with European style without any atmosphere of Nepal. The only two things you can do is either lie on the grass or have a coffee or tea in the shop, which both can be done anywhere in the Europe. I was there only for 20 minutes maybe and felt really nothing special. If you like lying on the grass for your casual time, then enjoy yourself. But this is just not my thing, at least not in Kathmandu.
Heavenly, away from the city chaos!. Great place to get away from the city madness. Good restaurant. We easily spent a few hours people and squirrel watching.

A place to get away from Busy Traffic and dusty road.. I was fed up with traffic and all cars use their Car horn all the time.I did not care have to pay to get in this place which was about 200 Nepalese rupees.It is not a big place but at least I can find somewhere a bit clean and comfortable to sit for a drink and had ice cream. You can bring your own food and have a picnic in the garden. However they are 2 cafe/ restaurant in the garden.I was there in March and the weather is hot, sunny and very bright. They provide you a mattress with a cushion for you to lie on it. I found a nice shady-under a tree. I spent hours lie down on a mattress and read my book.Do not forget sunglasses, hat and sun lotion.

Lil slice of European heaven. This place doesnt even feel like Nepal:) Inspired by European architecture, its expensive but totally worth it. I ended up going twice! The garden with its mats, minus the amorous couples is amazing to just lie back with a book. The little quirrels running about and the excellently manicured garden is a great place to kick back.if you have some green to burn, the restaurant is expesinve but makes for fine dining.As I am terrible with name, the manager on my first visit was super helpful with places to visit and even gave me a map. The adjoining Kaise Library ( free entry) is a heaven for book lovers and I would have loved to spend a whole day there if I had the time.A definite must do in Kathmandu.

“Nice, peaceful and lovely place. We visited the gardens on Good Friday.. A small fee was paid to enter the gardens. They were really love. We took a break from busy city and spend a few hours resting and strawing in this location.

Free from polluted ktm . Been there for many time. It makes me feel like am actually out of valley. And the restaurants are really expensive and they donot provide a quality service as per the standard.

Nice, peaceful and lovely place. You could spend hours in this charming garden. Beautiful trees, nice ponds, and cafes. We took a break from busy city and spend a few hours resting and strawing in this location.

Traquail Gardens. We visited the gardens on Good Friday April 3rd.A small fee was paid to enter the gardens.They were really lovely.A mattress and a large role cushion were provide to sit or lie on, on the grass.Lovely café and restaurant in the grounds.A lovely spot inside a very busy city.Definitely a place to visit for young and old alike.

Oasis in a not so great city. After days in the stench of Kathmandu, relaxing in between the fountains and flowers in the Garden of Dreams felt unbelievably refreshing. A great restaurant serves food in one corner, and tourists sun bathe and relax throughout the garden. Do yourself a favor, take a break from Kathmandu, and visit the garden.
A small quiet clean paradise in the heart of kathmandu.. Walking distance from most of the hotels in Thamel . Lots of squirrels and you can feed them . A lovely place to relax .

classy, quiet, clean calm in a dirty, noisy city. Austria's embassy created a place of classic architectural lines, surprising quiet given that it's in the city center, green lawns and fountains, a cafe, with attention to detail--simply a place to keep your sanity and restore your serenity. Cover charge keeps beggars out, prevents overcrowdedness and litter. My favorite place in ktm--wish i could stay here.

Dreaming. The garden of dream is a heaven where you will dream all the time. Really cool and best place to refresh after walking around noises kathmandu. Nobody can't explain the beauty of this garden by word. It is really recommended.

Quiet oasis amid the chaos of Kathmandu. The European-style Garden of Dreams was built in the 1920s by a Nepali scholar, eventually left to run down then rescued, partially. It's quite small but worth a visit, if only to sit in isolation, read a book or just watch the squirrels at play while you recover from the stress of dodging Kathmandu traffic.

A loely bit of paradice amongst the bustle. I'm a horticulturist and stumbled across this bit of heaven while passing. I thought I'd died and gone to heaven!. I walked around and admired so much beauty, peace and delightfully restored garden. And! my Australian taxes paid for the restoration. Well spent. I had a lovely afternoon tea in the gazebo overlooking the pond just like a real English lady. We went back the next day and had dinner and watched the garden all lit up. A joy.
quite place. Walking in Kathmandu is a task but sitting this garden and having a stress free hours was a good. Not a big place but we enjoyed.

tranquility amongst chaos. Really relaxing inside the gardens with a book and something to keep yourself hydrated for only about $2 entrance fee per person.Cushions and matresses are laid out on the lawn, which makes it all the more comfy.

Beautiful Oasis. Definitely worth a stop.....especially if needing a breather from the hustle and bustle. Although many visitors at the garden it was still serene and beautiful. If you have time there is a great book shop on the same side of street a few hundred metres away (going towards Thamel) grab a good book..sit in the gardens...and feel the peace of it all. Beautiful meals from sandwiches to restaurant quality. Check out the gallery to see before and after images of the garden transformation.

Beautiful Place. Garden of Dreams is one of the most serene and beautiful enclaves in Thamel, Kathmandu.This was built by Field Marshal Kaisher in Year 1920. A paid wi-fi and a Restaurant are available in Garden. Some Cultural events and exibition often takes place here.

Relaxing garden in the heart of the City......... The title "Garden of Dreams" does give this a lot to live up to. Not sure it's quite a Garden of Dreams but it is a very sweet well laid out European style walled garden right in the heart of the city a few mins walk from Thammel.It's bizzare to walk off the street into this little piece of calm greenery. Beautifully set out this could be a small garden in Vienna or Prague ! Nice to see so many people relaxing here. There is a pricey cafe where one can dine in very pleasant sourroundings.I suspect however if this attraction was more than a few minutes from Thammel it would hardly be worth a trip - and it is so popular simply it presents a contrast to the rest of the City as opposed to being great in it's own right. Still worth a visit as it's easy to get to, doesn't cost much and it's nice to have somewhere to chill in.

Nice way to spend ur Time.. When u feel u have been running from one place to other, this is the perfect Break u would love to have.Remember to visit it till there is fair bit of Sunlight, for some grt Pics and more imp. to spend the time in Garden with nearly NO NOISE.

Beautiful renovation. Renovated in 2007 by the same architect who was responsible for bhaktapur''s revival, this is a beautiful place to hang out and read a book. Green grass with white statues of elephants in the heart of the city! It has a restaurant run by Dwarika's which has great Wiener schnitzel among other things - but it pricey by KTM standards. Also has a bar with an impressive ceiling...

Little piece of paradise in the busy city. The Garden of dreams is a nice little relief from the busy surroundings of Kathmandu. however as a single traveler i felt somewhat out of place as every where i turned were young lovers cuddled up together. The garden of "love" would probably be more fitting. The gardens were still very nice to walk around. It's a great location to sit on the grass and read a book, or spend the afternoon in the cafe with tea and cake.

Pleasant Perambulation!. Short walk from hotel on our 'recover from jetlag' day. Inexpensive entry fee (£1.40). Liked the garden generally, would be better when it's dry and sunny. Photos showing pre- and post- development showed the work that's been done, and continues to be done. A haven amidst the frenzy of local traffic. May go back one evening to see how it looks then.

Relaxing oasis in the middle of Kathmandu craziness. I was in Kathmandu off and on for a month and the city is noisy, busy, exotic, and has really bad smog at times. Garden of Dreams was a few blocks from my hotel in Thamel and I escaped there when I needed a quiet peaceful moment. Even the air seemed cleaner in the garden. I would relax on a bench and read a book or enjoy a meal in the Kaiser Café. It costs about 250R to get in, but that's not much really. Lot's of local romantic couples seem to hang out here at times.

Greenery in the City. We visited the Garden of Dreams at the end of our trek. We'd had 3 days in Pokhara & 2 in Kathmandu & this was a little piece of quiet in a hectic city. The gardens are laid out lovely & seeing the squirrels running around was fun. A very relaxing place to chill for a while before going back to the hustle & bustle of the city.
Peace and quiet and beautiful. Lovely getaway from hectic and dusty city and great for just sitting there with your book for example. Restaurant there is pricy.
TRANQUILITY KATHMANDU. Simply the tranquility a million miles from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. A place to enjoy. . .

VERY PEACEFUL AND RELAXING!. This is a great stop to enjoy the beautiful scenery and relax a little bit from the hectic mayhem just outside the garden doors in Thamel. Relax on the grass with a pillow and a book and enjoy the fresh air!

A dream. A 'must' visit especially at night, fountains, low lighting, walking paths surrounded by flowers and shrubs, hidden away benches to rest weary travelers' feet, and swings to play with; there is a lovely restaurant in there too, a bit pricey for the local area, but romance of the place is very much alive;-)

Beautiful peaceful oasis. A good place to escape the hordes. Beautiful gardens restored by the same Austrian group who restored the Patan Museum (which was fantastic!). Bring a picnic as the food at the Kaiser cafe is overpriced. 2 minute walk from Thamel.
Beautiful gardens in the middle of the madness. We dropped in here in the evening and were blown away. only $2 USD entry and well worth it. would highly recommend
Okay. It's only a small garden for sitting and relaxing with bar and restaurant. Not much to do. For the amount of entrance fees it's probably not worth it.

Beautiful place; very popular on Valentine's Day!. I loved the Garden of Dreams. It is a beautiful oasis from the craziness that is Kathmandu, but if you happen to go on Valentine's Day, as I did this year, it may not be as quiet as you were expecting. It is the perfect place to take a date on Valentine's Day and it seems the people of Kathmandu have figured that out! It's also a perfect place for someone to go alone any day of the year and sit and read or draw or daydream!
getaway. a small garden of tranquility in the middle of madness200 rupies for tourists ( naturally, you are in Nepp all)

far from the maddening crowd. this is a wonderful oasis from the craziness and filth of Kathmandu. We came here after trekking and returning from our time in Pokhara. Sat in one of the cafes and had a coffee and desert..and wandered the grounds. A beautiful place to relax and give your mind and body a rest.

Peaceful retreat from the madding crowd. The gardens have been beautifully restored and it isPeaceful in there, very overpriced food and beverage at the cafes, but you are allowed to bring in a picnic. The photo gallery and interpretive signage is a great addition. It was nice to lay down on a real lawn!

A nice garden at a price. If you're on a tourist attraction hunt, you can pass this by, but if you are looking for a peaceful break, this will fit the bill.Cafe food is good to very good, at Katmandu 5Star prices. So still a lot less than you will pay in western countries.

Peace, quiet and a lovely meal. We visited this garden several times as our departure was delayed 6 days when the airport was closed.We had 3 meals in the restaurant at lunchtimes and they were all delicious and all the waiters were charming. Would thoroughly recommend a visit and then to go next door to the Kaiser Library

waste of time. we thought there was something to see but its one kind of love garden which we are having in Ahmadabad. yeah i must admit infra was too good. else it just a name. we visited it in only 15 min, we met lot of couple over their.... such a waste of money and time.....
Nice place to relax in city. Beautiful little oasis among chaos. Cafe inside. Worth a visit to walk around & read for a while. Easy walk from Thamal.

the garden but not in my dreams. A simple but not family oriented garden. A peace and quiet place to relax as if you're not in Kathmandu. You can put it last to your itinerary in Nepal and if you want to spend 200NRP to visit the garden.

A nice place for a respite. Garden of dreams is a beautifully landscaped, small "public" garden on the outskirts of the main street of Thamel. Nice for an escape from the noise and chaos of the street activity. Take a book, or sit in the restaurant. you can spend only a short while, or longer, depending on your mood. Small entrance fee.

A piece of heaven in Kathmandu. These gardens are a must to escape the noise & pollution of Kathmandu. Lay on the grass on mats & headrests provided by the gardens & simply relax while tiny squirrels dart around you.

Oasis of calm in crazy katmandu. We spent a few days in Kat after a fairly gruelling trek (nar phu up over Kang La and later over Thorong la). After the silence of the mountains kat is deafening and a bit overwhelming although the mutitude of great restaurants is very nice, as is hot water and western toilets. We spent a morning at the gardens (and I was with my usual non-gardening companions, 3 of them this time). We all liked wandering around the garden but did not have anything to eat or drink there. Some nice corners just to sit in, overall relaxing, quiet and quite pretty.. The garden is also quite close to the classic Kaiser library which is full of old books and things victorian and well a wander- ( but then we do like old and quirky, and there is some well preserved history there). Also in the garden at the kaiser is a cafe type place that is the cheapest place to buy a coke in town.

Peace and quiet amid the clamour of the city. After trekking round the streets of downtown old Kathmandu (eg Thamel area), worth a quieter hour in the Garden of Dreams. Extremely well-kept gardens, surrounded by beautiful old buildings. Reasonable entry price. Have a drink or snack in the Cafe Kaiser and comtemplate your surroundings.

A Dream come true. This place was originally built by a royal prince whi was able to fulfill his dreams of beauty in a noisy city.With its buildings, garden and restaurants it is an oasis worthwhile to visit after a sightseeing tour in Thamel. A coffee and a snack at Kaiser Café is no bad idea either
fabulous. the garden is well manicured n very relaxing to be in!!! not to miss when in kathmandu . the Cafe mocha is a must try too...

relax in the rush of the city. top endroit a 2 minutes a pieds de thamel good place to relax in ktm very nice building & garden photos good moments to make the point of your travel good place to dreams "garden of dreams" for sure nice flowers trees butterflies
Peaceful haven in the chaos of Kathmandu. Well-maintained, peaceful & worth a visit. A break from chaotic traffic & dust. They have free wi fi
commercial. it is old, good design but have to pay wifi password. Entrance fee was Rs. 200 but no include the wifi. But it is good to chill out.
Relaxing but nothing special. Calming spot in the storm of the Kathmandu - take a book and enjoy the setting but nothing to go out of your way for

Tranquil peace in a manic city. Wonderful! I came for lunch on my first day in Kathmandu and it was a wonderful haven to escape the full on street atmosphere of outside The walls. Lovely food in the cafe, with gentle service. I returned later to just sit and listen to the birds and chat with the gardeners. Such a lovely, lovely place!!
Absolutely beautiful!. This is a little peace amongst the craziness of the city. I could have spent the entire day just relaxing here

Just the place fir a great break from the hustle of Thamel.. You will be recharged by a visit here. Take a book and take some time to sit and be really rested. You will probably see some wildlife too. Tiny squirrels were diving about.

A Wonderful Evening. On recent visit to Kathmandu our driver recommended that we visit this place and eat at the restaurant. It is an unexpected delight in the middle of a nosy, bustling city. We only saw it at night as we arrived for dinner. The guards / entrance staff were not very friendly but the restaurant staff made up for this. We were a group of 4 adults and 3 children, (11, 11 and 13) and the staff ensured that our hungry children were served quickly and with the modified meals they requested. The adults enjoyed a lovely, slightly expensive wine, with our delicious very reasonably priced meals. Highly recommend the momos, a traditional Nepali dish. A great venue for a special dinner.
Tranquility. This garden was so relaxing and in my opinion a necessary part of any city. Also the café served a delicious bbq fish

lovely spot. WHAT a wonderful surprise and respite from the busy city around it. A great spot to enjoy and even nap and read sitting on the grassy lawns or have a treat or meal. It looked like you may be able to rent a pillow or cushion but not necessary. So nicely kept and beautiful. Interesting historical photgraph exhibit in one of the buildings.

Indeed, the Garden of Dreams. Located smack in the middle of the city right at the entrance to the bustling tourist areaThamel, you would not be at fault if you missed the Garden. Enclosed by sober walls with a elegant entrance, enter the tranquil Garden of Dreams. Originally the garden of one of the ruling families in Nepal, the Garden was restored and is not accessible to the public. It is a calm relaxing place with gentle waters running on the side with superbly sculpted flora. The entrance fee is not too expensive but if you are a tourist, you pay more than the locals. The Garden also has a fantastic restaurant - The Kaiser Cafe and a bar. Recommed the charcoal grilled fist at the restaurant. As you are walking about the nooks and corners of the garden, don't be surprised if you find some local couples necking around as it has become a dating spot for young people in Kathmandu.

Charming, calming and just one high wall away from madness.. It is not surprising that western tourists find the entry fee well worthwhile for the peace and serenity that the garden provides, just a wall away from the busy roadside and teeming
Thamel.
Lawns, water, tame squirrels, decent coffee and good food, a place to rest and recuperate.

Not at all. Please do not go there!!! It is a shame that this place is on the Lonely Planet guide rated as good. It is close to Thamel and so very noisy and polluted. It's also very small and the entrace fee is high ( for Nepali standards. If you have some spare time, you'd rather go somewhere else.

A Real Secret Garden. Secret Garden was one of my favorite book during childhood. When I found this little gem in Kathmandu it really excited me. It felt like I just found my own Secret Garden. The garden was really beautiful and peaceful, which is really different with the surrounding (Thamel was also beautiful in it's own way buy not as peaceful). We spent hours in this garden. From the afternoon, during sunset until all the lights are on. It really was magical.
Chill out. Awesome place to escape the pollution and chaos of Kathmandu, chill here for a couple of hours and try block out the droning of horns.

Lovely oasis of peace and calm next to Thamel. Beautifully designed, costs just Nepali Rs 200 to enter, open till 9pm. Just walk, sit, listen, watch...or visit one of the eateries, but make sure you have your fat wallet, the prices are crazy in comparison to local restaurant rates, and food not that good.. Best value is the café where u can get a yummy cake and Irish coffee for a not so extortionate amount.

love it!. Amazing place in the middle of chaotic Thamel. Going everyday and appreciating all the peace and beautiful ground it offers. Love to go there, rest , see the children play, have coffee, read a book. A great place to relax and find some peace if your based in thamel.Thank you!

Great rest spot. Killed a couple of quiet hours here while waiting for flight out.Small charge for entry which I guess keeps the numbers down, relax on the lawns, view the displays, hang out in cafe with "beans" coffee. If you're feeling wealthy you could even have a drink in the bar

Was expecting a lot more. Having read the review I was really excited about going and see the gardens. I was quite disappointed as there were very few flowers and plants. It is probably a great place to relax if you are a backpacker and want to lay down on the grass to escape the chaos outside. We didn't stay long as the drinks were expensive and had nothing else to see.

A tranquil haven. What a wonderful place to escape from the bustle of the city. I absolutely loved it. Lots of interesting little nooks - places to sit and, yes, dream! The café has Western prices though, so I didn't eat there.

Truly amazing!. Truly amazing place. Just go there!So peaceful in the middle of it all.Can't believe it's still Kathmandu.There is a restaurant and although expensive serves very good food.Worth the price!Loved it!
Haven. A respite from the noisy, dusty Thamel. Worth visiting if you have time to kill, just lounge around and let the birds' noise drown the traffic's noise.

Oasis in a chaotic city. Outside the walls of the Garden of Dreams lies the chaos of Kathmandu whilst inside is the picture of serenity and peace. You can come for a short leisurely stroll or decide to chill for the full day but if you visit Kathmandu for a few days this is a 'must see'Ground staff place out mats with bolster pillows for visitors to relax and there are several lovely features within the compound which are worth seeing.The cafe is pricey but you could bring in your own food and drink (within limits)
A paradise in Kathmandu. The Garden of Dreams is perfect if you are sick of the noise and bustle of KTM. The garden is tranquil and well maintained- perfect for escaping the city!

Dreams fulfilled. Why no-one thought of opening a place like this a long time ago, I do not know. Kathmandu is an extraordinary city but it's so busy and noisy, so dirty and full-on that a place like this is is more of a necessity than anything else. The gardens themselves are beautiful but, for me, the best thing about it is the Kaiser Cafe. No, it's not the cheapest place to eat in Kathmandu but the chocolate cake is worth the money on its own. The service is faultless - friendly but unobtrusive. I went there four days running! In the end, they reserved me my own table without being asked! Lalita was the best possible person for a chat when she was not busy. She was so welcoming: interested and interesting and I hope she reads this. I should also like to mention the gentleman who manned the entrance from 16.00. He was always so kind and allowed me, much against the rules, to leave the garden and come back later! I don't know your name but thank you!

A quiet oasis. This is a lovely place for tired tourists to lie down on mats on the grass, put their feet up and study their guidebooks, watch squirrels or snooze without being harrassed by touts. There is a clean toilet. The entry fee is 200 rupies, another 50 is you want wifi access. There is a restaurant, but it seemed rather expensive.

Quiet garden. Yep, that's what it is. A peaceful, well kept garden with an expensive restaurant and a coffee shop. Small squirrel-like animals scurried among tourists and well dressed locals who might or might not have been uni students. They had books and folders, sat on the grass and chatted. I think you could hire mats to sit on. This was the first place that I saw what the architecture might have looked like years ago.

Spoil my time!. No things special there. As it was highly rated and recommended to visit, I went there but it was a small garden only. I found few couple roaming and engaged and Kaiser cafe was really expensive without any specialty.

Peaceful garden. This is a beautifully planted garden, just down from the Royal Palace. It is so quiet and peaceful. There is a delightful cafe, restaurant serving very good coffee and food. There is a beautiful bar. You can spend time just sitting in the garden recharging your batteries. Well worth the isit.

Pleasant restaurant in lovely garden. The setting of this cafe/restaurant is wonderful, with a lovely view over the Garden of Dreams from the open first floor terrace.Food is a mix of international and Nepali, good but not special. Service is OK. Prices fairly high.
This is a hidden treasure of thamel in Kathmandu. The gardens are a place of peace and beauty in this busy bustling area of Kathmandu. A breath of fresh air. Well worth a visit.
Time out. treat yourself and spent an hour in the quiet oasis, passable and expensive food in the cafe, there is an entrance fee into the garden

where the local couples go for romantic hangout. Tranquil walled haven where you can escape from the chaos of Thamel. A few dollars to get in but worth it to stroll among the neo-classical architecture and well maintained garden. High class restaurant and well kept cocktail bar. Most of the visitors will be local couples hanging out in what are after all charming romantic surroundings compared to the bedlam outside.
place to chill out. Its nice to visit if you have lots stress. My office is nearby and i love it to hang out here to get refreshment. Food here its a bit expensive. Will keep going there!

An oasis in chaotIc Kathmandu.. Only about a 10 minute walk from the Thamel area you must visit this beautifully restored garden. It is an opportunity to feel refreshed and relaxed. There are steps up to a walkway to look down and take in the whole of the garden. There are birds chirping and tiny squirrel like creatures peeping out from flowers.. There is a cafe there and plenty of spots to sit and rest. When you are finished here if you go outside and turn to the left you will find the way to a very interesting library which is worth exploring.
Place to short visit. It is a good place to visit for short time. Good for youngsters in pair. Water fountain, restaurants are attraction.
neo classical flavour. i had some good time there. facility of the wifi, restaurent even expensive. design and art of the stones, bricks are praise-able. It give the scenes of the history of Nepal.
Beautiful Garden. Very Neat garden and it's very close to Thamel which is full of crowd but inside of the garden it's very peaceful, quiet and refreshing. Good place to take breath.

Inner Peace in Kathmandu. A beautiful garden located at the most unlikely place - the noisy Thamel in Kathmandu. It was very nice to have a rest at the dreamy garden after walking through busy streets. It was surprisingly quiet inside the garden wall.
Overrated. Small garden with ages buildings , really not much to see. Not worth the entrance fee. However might be a good option to get away from the busy streets of thamel
Little garden. Nice little garden in the hearth of the city, good for resting in between sightseeing. There is a fairly good restaurant. Architecture and plants are beautiful

Great place to relax!. Garden of Dreams is a great place to relax in Kathmandu. There isn't tons to see, but it's a beautiful set up, and if you have time to kill, it's a great break from the chaos of the city. There's a restaurant on the grounds that kind of blends in with everything, so if you're hungry, you don't have to forfeit the relaxation. Again, there isn't tons to see (you can pretty much see everything when you walk it, but it's a nice sized space, and it's a great atmosphere. I strongly recommend visiting the Garden of Dreams, as it offers a bit of serenity in chaos.

A cute place to relax. Gardens of Dreams is a nice little oasis in the middle of Thamel. It's hards to believe that such a busy streets is separated by meer trees and a ting wall. As soon you walk in, Thamel seems so far away. There are mattresses to lie on and many people go there to walk around the garden and eat in the restaurants. A place of stillness and peace in the mists of a very busy and loud Thamel.
Garden of dreams. Garden of dreams it is ! What beautiful place , peaceful quiet and a little piece of stillness in the gorgeous chaos of Kathmandu
You can breath here. With very busy thamel I visit beautiful garden,very ckean, beautifully set the flowers. Whenever you feel tired being in the thamel. Should go there and relax.

The best meal in Nepal. We walked here for dinner one night after a friend had suggested it. It cost a few dollars to get in, but it's well worth it. The food and service was amazing. It's a bit pricier than anything else in town, but trust me it's worth it. I had a 15oz filet minion for $12 USD which was incredible. This was beyond a deal to me coming from the US where that would have been easily $60 in a fine establishment. Would go back!

Garden of dreams it is. Busy Thamel street in the center of Kathmandu hides beautiful Garden of Dreams just behind the wall. When you step inside, you can relax sitting on a mat, walking the pavilions and enjoy the view to wonderful trees and flowers, little pond with lotus trees, fountains.... If you want to have lunch, drink something or have a nice romantic diner, cafe restaurant "Kaiser" is inside this garden. You will have a good meal under candlelight overlooking the garden, with the smell of summer rain in the night. Prices in this restaurant are much higher than in other Nepali restaurants. Anyway, if you are in Kathmandu you have to visit this place.

European Eden in kathmandu. This is a must visit for all who love nature, art and architecture. Garden of Eden is a surprise at every corner. Each place is unique and somewhat mysterious. The pavilion, the central pond and the rose gardens in the corner could take up all of your time there. The garden is different in the night when underground lighting comes alive and on sees a magical world full of statues. Hidden steps and symbolism. One can spend an entire day.
Lovely place to relax. This is a great place to come and relax, soak up the sun and get away from the crazy streets of Thamel.

True to its name. A lot of travelers may think what's so great about a Garden. But Garden of Dreams surpasses what you think about normal Gardens. A must visit place. It feels as if you have entered a period with Fluffy Gowns and Cinderella's party. We had gone early in the morning for breakfast and loved it to the fullest. The Kaiser café is a small and warm place, to spend time and relax.The garden is open to from 8.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. and had Entry fee, to cut down the nuisance I guess. You can find many couples too, but all scattered around the Garden near amphi theatre, in a dreamy corner, or on a huge traditional Nepali swing or just going around exploring the Garden.

Tranquil beauty. A beautifully conceptualized garden right in the middle of the city (walking distance from Thamel). Very well kept too. Great place to take pics and enjoy the peace and quiet offered there. I get nostalgic just thinking about the quality time we spent there as a family.
A suprise. Food at the kaiser was marginal. Should have had the desserts. Beautiful gardens inside walls. Places to sit on the grass and relax. Clean bathrooms
...Just a garden but. once you are in, seems like the noise of Kathmandu get away. Pleasure to walk around and do not miss a coffe in the local café. Not "friendly" prices but coffee is delicious.
