Beautiful peaceful spot in heart of City.. We had a lovely couple of hours here, so peaceful. Lovely café with beautiful food. Really worth a visit to get a break from all the hustle and bustle. Wonderful information display on how the gardens used to look.

Great place - visited twice. This is one garden which stands out. Located inside the busy Thamel area, this garden was earlier in ruins. It was restored to its present state with international assistance.
The place is great to visit.

a peaceful place within the kaos of thamel. I often go there to just get out of the kaos of thamel - it's peaceful and the air seems clean too. suggest not to go on a Saturday as all the local lovebirds meet each other there - so it can get a bit crowded. skip buying a coffee there - it will break your buget.

Worth a visit. We went shopping innThamel and on the way back we visited this smal park which is just at the entrance of Thamel. It is a lovely neo classical styled garden with some interesting plants and nice architecture. One can also sip a coffe in the restaurant inside.

200 NPR. It's 200npr to enter here, which is a bit of a joke when you wander inside and see how small it is. This is not a place to go for a walk or look around. It's only really good for sitting and (insert activity whilst sitting here).It takes all of 2mins to walk around but it is very peaceful considering the busy roads are just the other side of the wall, and it's so close to the centre of the Thamel. It's well-maintained and has a very European look and feel to it. Aside from grass and benches, there is also a pretty cool swing if you can run fast enough when the previous swing-goer has had enough. To the rear is a small room with a few pictures of the park before and after being the facelift, and it's definitely an improvement; I'm just not sure I'd ever put my money towards it again...

An Oasis in the City. I was really surprised when I wandered in, it is a beautiful garden, well maintained and with many "rooms". Situated behind a high wall, the Garden of dreams has an amphitheatre, cafe/restaurant, pavilions, fountains and decorative garden features and furniture. It is a perfect place to relax and enjoy away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. Wireless internet connections and wheel chair assistance at the main gate are available. Well worth a visit.

"An oasis". This garden is an oasis of peace and tranquillity in the urban bustle of Kathmandu. The size of the garden is over 7,000 sq m which includes 3 pavilions, an amphitheatre, ponds, pergolas, urns and smaller gardens. The garden was renovated over 7 years, financed by the Austrian government. Now, it is considered to be one of the most tranquil oases, a tourism landmark and a natural library. There are mats provided for relaxing on the grass and even a swing! Bring a camera, read a book and relax! If you are hungry, there is a café and restaurant as well. Lovely place!

Beautiful... very beatiful. The Garden of Dreams, a neo classical historical garden, is situated in the midst of Kathmandu city, Nepal. The Garden was famous as the garden of Six Seasons which was created by late Field Marshal Kaiser Sumsher Rana (1892-1964) in early 1920. After the completion of this Garden, it was considered as one of the most sophisticated private gardens of that time
Peace in Kathmandu. Great place to take a break, rest, read a book, snooze. Freedom from the craziness and pollution of Kathmandu.
Peaceful oasis in chaotic Thamel. This is a quite, peaceful and beautiful garden, which happens to be THE oasis in the middle of Thamel. Wonderful place to go for a quiet moment.

Peaceful, Quiet Haven. I went in winter so flowers weren't in bloom. Still I enjoyed sitting and enjoying the sculptures and landscape. A good place to bring a picnic or eat/have a glass of wine at their pretty outdoor cafe.

beautiful organized place but very expensive. beautiful organized place but very expensive ,
it's a one time visit place .it's good place to visit but if you have a limited budget or time you can skip it
and will not regret that

Peaceful place in crowded city. It is just a small garden to hangout and chit-chat for local people. Kinda neat and tidy in peaceful environment unlike the city outside.
For a travel who wanna sit down in quiet place, it is recommended place to read your fav book.
Oasis. Fantastic garden retreat in a dry and dusty city. Beautiful quiet garden. Exquisite design. good cafes or quiet bench to sit down and relax.

Delight. Anywhere else, it might be just a lovely garden, but to step off the surging traffic in Thamel and enter this oasis makes it seem dreamy, indeed. Great place to stretch out on the grass, sip tea in the cafe and sketch or do yoga. We were there for sunset on our last day before flying out. Perfect end to the trip.
Sad to have to pay for a park. Kathmandu is such a mess that one has to pay for a clean green space. This beeing said, the lace is lovely and calm.

Mmmmmm??. Interesting but small. The personal project of a guy called Kaiser. Apparently his main obsession.Very prettily laid out, beautiful plants and flowers, nice water features and a pleasant cafe/restaurant.I repeat, very small, I spent an hour relaxing there as it is an oasis from the traffic and crowds which are literally just yards away outside the garden wall.Go if you don't mind the entrance fee.

Classy restaurant. This isn't just beautiful area of landscaping to escape the busyness of Thamel but a fine restaurant with excellent service , fine food and a good drop of wine. You pay western prices for dining here but not exorbitant western prices. Eg $20-$30 a meal.so if you have a special occasion whilst in Kathmandu try dinner here, you won't be disappointed . PS you still have to pay the entrance fee to the garden but it is well worth it....

Lovely quiet oasis for expats or tourists in need of an escape from busy Thamel. Ask for a pillow when the sun is out. You can lie down and relax in the grass and just totally wind down.
Garden of Dreams is otherwise a quite romantic place for young couples. There is also a museum/exhibition, but not really that noteworthy. The Kaiser Cafe is excellent, but a little bit expensive compared to other places.
Nice Garden. This place is very nice to have relax and have some beer. If you are couple then do not miss this place as you only can find couple there. Nice place to chill out.

Nothing worthy of a visit. No real reason to visit this place.... It's like any other garden - had it been free entry, I would have a different review, but didn't make any sense to pay NPR 200 to enter this place.
Garden of Dreams. A quiet little garden among the bustle of Kathmandu. Didn't take a whole lot of time here, but it was a nice escape from the busyness of the street.

A haven in a loud and dirty city. This is a nice place to take a break from the honking horns of the cabs and motorbikes and the throngs of people on Kathmandu's streets and sidewalks. The grounds are lovely but some of the buildings are in need of preservation
Tranquil place in busy city. Very well kept garden. Nice admosphere. Most people come here to relax and escape the busy city. Beautiful plants and trees.

Gorgeous and frozen. You have to visit the place in warmer weather or earlier in the day. It has an expensive but decent restaurant inside. Snobby waiters and average fare. The gardens are gorgeous. There are bars inside as well. It is cooooold.

Pleasant enough. I was based in Kathmandu for one month and found the garden of dreams a good place to come to chill out, read books and chat to other long term travellers who were seeking a bit of time out from the hustle and bustle of KathmanduI definitely would not call this place a must see attraction, if you are only in Kathmandu for a few days there are much better things to go and see. If you have time you could probably wander through for about half an hour if you really felt like it. There are a few cafe's and restaurants inside which are comparatively expensive and not all that different quality wise to other places in the Thamel area.If you are in Kathmandu for an extended time period it is a nice place to come and chill out as I did/It is also appropriate if you are a part of a young Nepalese couple looking for somewhere to walk hand in hand and spend long amounts of time staring lovingly into your partners eyes. (You'll understand what I mean within 5 minutes of entering)Overall it's pleasant but it's nothing overly exciting or out of the ordinary. Check it out only if you have the time

Overpriced. What a let down. Best part of this place is the little squirrels in the trees and the local people tendering the garden. Cost 200 ru to enter and the resturant prices are very expensive so we didn't eat here, the food maybe good but there are so many other places in thamel to eat cheaply. The atmosphere was ok, not sure what the big deal is about this place...a little pretentious, not really worth the visit

Classic & Serene Garden. Beautiful, peaceful & a classic garden in the heart of Kathmandu city. I could see mostly foreigners and young Nepali couples over there.You have to buy a ticket for the entry. The price is cheap as you can spend a whole day inside with that ticket. There is a cafe inside. However, you can bring snacks from outside as well and have it in the garden. Paid WiFi facility is also available over there.
Best of the best. I like dream of garden for relax and set I like very much the place and flowers i 'd like to recommended this place for relax and set.
oasis in the city. nice quiet place to relax, nice buildings to explore, history of the garden, good place to meet locals.

Breathe of fresh air away from the noise. What a fantastic way to pass a few hours when in Thamel. Their menu is superb and so tasty after the mountain food and it is spotlessly clean. You wouldn't know that you are amongst the busy streets of Thamel. The best coffee I had the entire time I was overseas. When we visited, it was raining but it was so cosy sitting on the balcony watching the squirrels running up and down the trees looking for a dry place. The small entry fee was worth every cent. Just wished we had more time to go back a second time. i know it will be definately on my list when we return to Thamel.

Interesting if you have spare time. I went because I had a few hours spare in KTM. It was interesting however I would not place it high on the tourist attraction list if you do not have much time. It does however offer a peaceful retreat from the throngs of the street and honking traffic.

A City Oasis. We went as a family and stayed for a few hours in the afternoon. It's a beautiful garden in the middle of the city that is peaceful and a great escape. There are cushions to sit on in the garden as well as a cafe (didn't try it). Great place!

Small & Attractive. This small and attractive old garden fell into disrepair but was restored to its beautiful current condition with a lot of care. At least this what the small exhibition in one of the buildings there suggested.It is a lovely peaceful garden, which manages to keep the ugliness around it behind its walls. It's a pity it doesn't keep the air pollution at bay as well.There is a posh restaurant with prices comparable to Europe, which could be a nice idea, but since everything else in Kathmandu is at least five times cheaper we just had a tea.Worth a visit, but wouldn't be the first on my list of things to see in Kathmandu.

The great escape. It is a great place to escape the hectic streets of Thamel/Kathmandu. Lay on the grass and read a book, play on the bamboo swing, have a coffee and marvel at the beautiful gardens or sip a glass of wine in one of the bars. Don't forget to visit the little museum which has some great before and after photos and a few stories about the place.

Overpriced garden of dreams. The garden is lovely and peaceful. You pay to get in and the food is at least five times more expensive than a decent Nepali restaurant. Couldn't see what all the hype is about.

Namaste. A very peaceful and serene spot right in the middle of busy downtown Kathmandu. A must place to visit. If you need a place to just relax and collect your thoughts, this is the place. Beautiful gardens, like a little bit of heaven on earth.

A little oasis in Thamel. Right in the middle of Thamel, walking distance from most hotels is this lovely Neo-classical garden. Well worth taking the time to get away from the dusty streets of Thamel on a warm day. Friendly squirrels add to the experience, bring some nuts or nutty museli bars if you don't mind sharing.

Well worth a visit if only to find a small piece of Tranquillity.. We stumbled upon this small garden whilst ambling around Thamel. Initially I was a bit put off by the 200 NR entrance fee. However once inside it great to see that funds are being spent wisely to bring this once beautiful garden back to its former glory. Do allow yourself a couple of hours to appreciate this tranquil setting and do remember to take a book and chill. Definitely worth a visit.

Nothing much. It's a garden which is nicely designed for a place like Kathmandu, but if you have seen more historical gardens in Europe, than it's a bit of a disappointment. Foreign visitors are charged 200 Rs, and it has nothing much to offer unless you want to eat something in the restaurant or have a drink in the bar. Wifi is available for 50 Rs. This garden is mainly used by young lovers to spend some romantic time together on one of the many benches. Overall a sight one can easily skip and certainly NOT worthy of rank 4 in interesting places to visit in Kathmandu.

Quiet break from the chaos. The Garden of Dreams is just that, a dreamy little place to get away from the dust and noise of Kathmandu. It's a short walk from the center of Thamel. Costs NPRs 200 so it's a great value. Lovely trees and flowers, water fountains, benches. You can also grab a pad and pillow to take a nap and read a book. I've been here several times already in the past month and it's a wonderful place to relax!
Garden of Dreams. Beautiful calm garden secluded from the bustle of Kathmandu, good place to relax in the cool shade away from the dusty streets
nice spot to sit and read. It was a nice spot to sit with a book and felt in direct contrast to the chaos of Thamel. Entry fee was expensive though.
Restful time at Garden of Dreams. A lovely oasis in the bustle and noise of Kathmandu - a chance to escape and relax - and catch up with home using the available wi fi.

Truly an Excellent Garden !!!. Very beautiful and well maintained garden in the middle of the crowded and noisy Kathmandu city -- one can have a relaxing experience. This is a very pleasant surprise for me....

Refuge. Kathmandu is a crazy, vibrant, fast paced, smoggy city, and every now and then you need a reprieve. The Garden of Dreams is a nice refuge from the surrounding haze - a great place to read a book, relax on the lawn, have some tea (and get some WiFi for some rupees).If you're short on time, check out other sites first. But when you have a few spare hours and are tired of making sure you don't get run over - head here

Dreamy . OMG wow factor, it's an oasis of peace and beauty in the middle of craziness of KTM. I went there in the evening, after the sun set, wow, beautiful low lighting, fountains, water features. Quite romantic really, chose your company right as might fall in love:-) Swing on a swing, stroll around the fountains, explore many paths, and plants, admire the stars from the benches, chat or keep quiet as a moment of calm. There is also a beautiful restaurant, a great selection of dishes, however on a pricy side due to its amazing location. Definitely would recommended a visit.

Respite from Kathmandu chaos . Small garden just out of Thamel. Big high walls to keep the chaos and noise of Kathmandu out. Rs200 gets you in for the day and you can lay on mattresses around the garden. There is a coffee shop/ restaurant inside as well but it is not cheap.

A heaven within over busy Thamel. I LOVED it! This is a true oasis within this busy and dirty city! The place is peaceful and quiet and the food is EXCELLENT! You have to see it, although it is at the same time strange, to eat a Wiener Schnitzel in Nepal... :-).
An Oasis. Piece and tranquility in a beautiful garden. A small entrance fee keeps the hustle and bustle out. Classy restaurant options available. Don't miss this!
Garden of Dreams. Great example of landscape design and outstanding menu for daytime and nighttime dining. Good place to escape the noise and congestion of Thamel.

Oasis of Calm. This lovely garden in a busy area was a welcomed retreat from the noise and chaos. It was very clean and beautiful. Although there were quite a number of people there, in contrast to the street right outside it's gate, it was very quiet.

Oasis in busy Thamel. It's hard to find any peace and tranquility in the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu, but the Garden of Dreams provides a nice escape. With beautiful manicured gardens, it's a great place to come and lie in the sun, read a book, grab a bite to eat.They provide outdoor mats and cushions in one area of the gardens...very comfortable to just hang out, sit and read.

Just a garden. Is peaceful and serene, a drastic contradiction to the chaotic Thamel, however, not a must see sight in Kathmandu. A place to relax after you are tired with shopping in Thamel or after you done with other attractions in Kathmandu.

Tranquil oasis in Kathmandu. A beautiful garden full of paths to stroll and nooks and crannies for lovers to meet. There is also a wonderful restaurant inside to prolong your stay or if you prefer then join many others picnicking on the lawn.
Lovely and Serene. Pay a little to step into lovely tranquility in hectic Thammel. Well groomed gardens with some nice quiet resturants on the edges. Worth a look.
an oasis. A beautifully manicured garden which provided a peaceful time away within the city. A must see for relaxing!
peaceful place in chaotic thamel. amazing place and best (and most expensive) restaurant in town. Garden is so beautiful and peaceful. heaven in horrible thamel.
Beautiful, but very small. Beautiful place, just very tiny. Also has some restaurants, which are good, but quite expensive.....

The oasis of Kathmandu. The Garden of dreams is a magical oasis in the middle of an otherwise noisy, polluted and crowded city. The walls of the garden seem to keep out most of the noise and pollution, and it is a wonderful place to relax and take a break

Pleasant relaxing place. Very relaxing place to while away a few hours away from the noise and hassle of Thamel. Nice buildings and gardens with small entrance fee. The restaurant is quite pricey so BYO snacks if you are there for a while.

not worth the time for foreign visitors. This is a very small garden, looks pretty new. While it's a nice place to sit and relax, it may be a good place for locals, it's not of any cultural or historic value to foreign visotors.
Peace and Quiet. A wonderful slice of tranquility to escape to from the madness of Kathmandu. The food was good, I ordered no cheese with my pasta but it came with - my only complaint.
Lay back and relax. The place is filled with miniature views, the grass, mini ponds and also has food services. lay back on the green grass and stare into the skies.

Great place to relax in. Great place to bring a book to and spend the afternoon relaxing on the foam mattresses while the squirrels play around you!! The food/ drinks are a bit expensive, plus there's an entrance fee (rs 200), but definitely worth the visit!! The gardens there are spectacular!!!

Average garden. It was ok. It was nice to get away from the bustle of Thamel. I brought a book and read for a while, as well as walked the entire gardens. I think it was off season, so nothing was flowering. It was hard to find a place to sit, as there were so many people there. If you need a break from constantly being almost run over by vehicles, spend a couple of hours here. Can walk here from Thamel.

Oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. It's like a different world once you step inside Garden of Dreams. You can still hear the honking of the vehicles outside, but you'll soon forget about that because of the relaxing atmosphere. If you're lucky, you might even spot some chipmunks!
worth a look. The garden of dreams is really nice and worth an hour or two escaping the madness of Thamel! On the down side it was much smaller than expected and the restaurants were over priced!

A small garden and not much to see. It is an average maintained small garden. Good for a visit for like 30 minutes but not more. Entry fee is a little steep. The cafe within the park is nothing to speak of apart from the ambience.

Over-rated, Over-priced. A nice, quiet garden, but not much more. Worth a few minutes just to escape the dirt and bustle of Kathmandu, but it certainly is not a top 10 site, nor would you miss anything by not dropping by.

A snooze in the city. You walk in here and everything else just disappears. I got there early, had a walk around, read my book, used the wifi, fell asleep on the lawn and by the time I woke up it had gotten pretty busy. But it's beautiful and they put out mats and pillows so you can set yourself up for a solid day a chilling.

Oasis of calm. Situated in the top corner of Thamel, this lovely garden used to be part of an old palace garden (the fine old palace building now houses government offices next door). It has been beautifully restored and forms a handy place to meet friends, to sit and relax or to have a coffee, away from the noise and dust of the city.

Tranquility. We went here at night. The lights and the atmosphere was beautiful. A great escape from the hustle and bustle of Nepal life. Food also excellent at the Kaiser Cafe inside. Booking a table recommended.

Nice and peaceful. This is a nice peaceful garden in the middle of Kathmandu. Nice for an hour or two respite from the bustle and noise of the city. There is a lovely restaurant there. We sat outside overlooking the gardens and cooled off.
Pleasant oasis. This is the place to relax away from the hurly burly of Kathmandu. Lovely gardens with grassy lawns on which to lie; cafe and restaurants.

Garden of dreams - an oasis of tranquility. This small , immaculately manicured garden in the centre of Kathmandu is an oasis of tranquility amid the frenetic Kathmandu . The restaurant serves magnificent food , breakfast , lunch , dinner . Don't miss this hidden treasure .

"Best place midst the crowded city !". Well this place has a history too ! For foreigner this place is an astonishment for they get to be amazed by this peaceful place for a while since it's located in place like Thamel.
Wonderful. A must visit, beautiful gardens in which to escape the bustle of Kathmandu. Take a book, have a cup of tea and enjoy the peace and quiet.
Peaceful. A green oasis in the middle of the city. Good to relax and read. Restaurants inside the garden are expensive and food is not that great
Nice change from crazy Kathmandu. Peace and quiet. Nice cafe inside and place to sit on the grass. Toilets were reasonable. Well worth the entry fee
Nice but too small. It's a nice location, a getaway from the dusty city. Once you have passed the entrance wall, you'll have a great surprise - green grass, paths to walk on, a bamboo swing.

Quiet gardens. The Garden of Dreams is a nice little oasis in an otherwise hectic city. Entry is about 200 rupees which is very affordable and you can walk around and look at all the different plants etc. or you can take a book to read or have a coffee at the little cafe. It also seems to be a favourite spot for lovers.

Ah the serenity. After a strenuous 14 day trek, returned to kathmandu. To be able to sit in the sunshine, surrounded by beautifully maintained gardens, squirrels playing and peace and quiet, wonderful. The entire garden, with water features, lots of quiet seating nooks and shade areas was just lovely. The entry price is more than justified
Oasis in Kathmandu. Peaceful oasis near the busy Thamel area. Go along to recharge your batteries after experiencing all the sights, sounds & smells of Kathmandu..

Expensive, European style Garden. It's a nice oasis of calm in the center of Thamel, but is a bit European for my tastes.The cafe is overpriced, and the food was only alright.It's a great place to relax in for a few hours, but definitely not a must-see.

Peaceful + so relaxing. Can stroll, lie down on the lawns with cushion mats provided, and even several tempting cafes!. Just loved it here, away from all the shoppers and that chaos of traffic. It should be made bigger! Only 200 rupees entrance.
A quiet oasis. A quiet and peaceful place to relax the mind and body for a few hours. The chaotic streets of Kathmandu are just over a wall but they can seem like a world away.

An oasis in the craziness of Kathmandu. Although you can't avoid the traffic noises outside, this is the closest you will come to tranquility in Kathmandu. It is a delightful place to pull up a mat and spend a few hours.

Fortress of quiet solitude. This is a great spot to escape the chaos that is center Thamel. Pass through the gates of the Garden of Dreams and leave all of the honking and exhaust behind. The garden is just a great place to sit quietly and read and relieve yourself of the stress that kathmandu can easily casue
Garden of dreams. Great place to relax and drink tea with high quality service. Must visit place in Kathmandu. Thanks Austrian Government for the restoration work.

Peace and quiet. After the busy dusty streets of Kathmandu, this is a beautiful spot to relax. Lovely gardens and a nice little cafe and just 5 minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel. Bring a book and find a shady spot.

Best Place to be in ktm. It is really best place to be in around kathmandu. Before entering Thamel the Garden of Dreams is on the right. It is a beautiful little European style garden with chairs and places to sit.
for more information.
http://wevte.com

Wow!. Quite an unexpected surprise. Decided to take a walk around and felt like I was in Hyde Park. There was a nice cafe, reasonably priced and an restaurant bar type (both on either side of the garden. Wicked place to go chill by the goldfish. Ground mats provided by the garden staff. Absolute worth while visit for an minimal entrance charge. Will post pics later.

Lovely Garden in Thamel. Before entering Thamel the Garden of Dreams is on the right. It is a beautiful little European style garden with chairs and places to sit. The locals sit and talk and some kiss or get close.....foreigners reading books and just relaxing. High walls keep the noise and dust out and this little garden is a hidden gem. Have a visit it was beautiful.

No Nepali food. We tried to go here for dinner during the Festival of Lights. First of all they make you PAY to go in. Then, although the garden was beautifully decorated it was all Western food. Very disappointing. We left without eating

Oasis in KTM. Great place to get away from it all and try your photography skills, read a book or just work on your tan. Forget about the Kaiser cafe; extremely expensive and no value for money at all

A Tranquil Oasis That Shuts Out Thamel's Noise. It is said that the Garden of Dreams (1920) were inspired by Edwardian Gardens seen at the turn of the century British Empire. Not in your dreams would you think to find such a plush, quiet, regal garden in the middle of dusty, noisy, crowded Thamel! The garden features a couple of quality restaurants - one at each end if I'm not wrong. Between them, lie ponds and amphitheaters, flowers and shrubbery, victorian benches beneath verdant boughs and elaborate pavilions for a quick nap, granite statuettes and inviting gazebos. If you have an idle evening to spend at Thamel, be sure to grab your book or iPad and head over for a quiet, relaxing time here. Order a glass of wine, or a poison of your choosing, and watch the moon rise over the tall Firs.
Incredible oasis. Great restaurant and perfect after trekking. Relaxing, good food and a special place to stroll around after or before the meal.
not a must-see. This is a nice garden within the otherwise hecty and loud Kathmandu. Unfortunately it cost 200NPR to get in otherwise I'd recommend it as a nice chillout place

A peace place. It is near by the Thamel. Foreigner need pay for 200rb for ticket. Clean & Quietness but a little small . That place have some squirrels . It is beseemed reading book & drinking coffee at the quietly place .

This must be a dream in Nepal.. Kathmandu is hectic, messy and dusty. If you want to get out of it, you need to have a dream, a contrast to the normal ongoing in the streets and life of Kathmandu and that is "Garden of Dreams". This must be the wonderland for Alice if she lives in Nepal. Very beautiful garden. If you feel very peaceful and suddenly feel sleepy, you can just sleep on the garden. There are mats around. You can just spend hours here doing nothing..... Must visit !!
Haven. Quite unexpected. A calm oasis in the middle of bustling noise and traffic. Perfect place to go and reflect after a day's site seeing. The Kaiser cafe also does a good coffee.
Great place to chill out. This garden has been beautiful restored and was worth the small fee to escape from the traffic and the noise for a few hours. It is also equally peaceful and relaxing.

Island of calm. Kathmandu is generally mental (particularly Thamel) but the garden of dreams is a welcome break spot, you can rest on the grass (mats provided free), pop to the cafe for tea and just chill out and read a book.

Just a Normal Garden. Its good for Readers who requires a peaceful place to sit & relax. Else there is nothing good for Tourist. They have a option of cafe inside but it serves limited menu. WIFI is chargeable. Missing this place is not an regret.

Peaceful place. I loved this Garden, so peaceful and beautiful compared to the hurlyburly outside. A lovely cafe with friendly staff. A waiter recognised me and a friend on our second visit, even though it was two weeks later. The only downside is the entrance fee, though it was less than most places!

Wish I'd Found it Earlier. Absolutely beautiful! Peaceful and relaxing in the middle of an area of the general mayhem known as Kathmandu. Unfortunately we only visited once, on the morning that we left Nepal! What I hadn't appreciated was that it also had a restaurant and, although we didn't have a full meal there, we did manage to have a drink and a bowl of delicious soup. It was indeed expensive by Nepali standards but more than reasonable compared with Western prices. Certainly the Garden is worth visiting in its own right, but the restaurant during the evening , given its location and exquisite setting, would offer an exceptional and romantic experience

Not bad. We had some time to waste on our first day in Nepal and visited Garden of dreams since it was walking distance from our hotel in Thamel. One gets an impression it is really big but it is small but cosy. Nice and simple arrangements for people who want to chill out, read a book or for some romantic escapades. When we visited in November it was really cold which gives a nice feel overall. Restaurants are there as well. There is this unique Goddess Lakshmi statue ;) which looks a bit different than the normal ones one might have seen. Visit it to see :)
Peace and Quiet. These gardens are fantastic,such a oasis in the bustle that is Kathmandu. The structured gardens are beautiful and there is a graet coffee shop as well.

Aptly named. The Garden of Dreams is so aptly named, as after walking about in the bustle of Kathmandu, one could quite easily slip into a comfortable spot here in the gardens and nod of to sleep as was evident. It's a beautiful, romantic and tranquil area of pavilions, ponds,amphitheatre, pergolas urns and stunning shrubs, trees and flowers. Many young lovers adorn the grassed area in such a peaceful atmosphere. The Gardens have an interesting history and I recommend this place as a must visit if you're in Thamel.

a small garden. from what i read it appeared to be a big beautiful place, but it was actually a small garden. the only nice thing was the local swing which one sees in the local houses...if you are in thamel, you can visit for a few mins... but dont go just to see the garde, that would be a waste.

Haven. I had two spare days to fill so I chose spend half a day here with a good book and coffee in hand, I lay in the sun on the mats and cusions provided to escape into another world. The coffee and food here is very pricey and the coffee wasn't that great (My cappuccino was so hot that I couldn't carry it to the lawn 20m away without making regular stops and using the receipt as a barrier. It seriously took about 15mins to cool down enough to drink!).Take your lunch/snacks, go the loo BEFORE you lie down coz once you secure a spot on the grass (and you're solo) you can't move without someone else taking it over.Amazing place in the city and a MUST SEE.

Amazing Food @ Garden of Dreams.. The entrance fee was a put off .However the plate looks stunning in twilight when all the lights are on . Superb Food and the grounds are gorgeous and it is right in the middle of khatmandu. But the place is quite Expensive :-) .

Oasis of calm. Right in the middle of the bustling city is this easily missed garden. A small fee to get in and you can stay all day if toto I want. With a cafe and seats and mats to lie on the grass it's a great place to while away a few hours.

A HIDDEN GEM. The high surrounding wall is innocuous & traders hang blankets & mats on the outside. Others put up funny hats for sale or advertise cheap tours. It's not until you've walked in the little dog leg doorway, paid your R200 & then taken a big breath as you walk into the main section of the revamped garden, that you realise just what an amazing place this is. This unique garden on the edge of Thamel in Kathmandu, has taken years of patient toil & hard work to bring it up to its present high standard & is a work in progress. There are several old, grand houses surrounding the gardens that are slowly being renovated. In these grounds, you are encouraged to loll around on the finely kept, stepped lawns, or hide away in the many little discretely placed, lovers nooks. Fine dining is also available in one of several spots around the ground, the old main house being the favourite. Gardeners toil away all day in the many flower beds, ensuring the grounds are in great condition, whilst little squirrels run amok throughout the place playing hide & seek with each other. This place has been on my "to go to" list every time I visit Kathmandu

A cosy place in the surrounding hectic traffic. Garden of dreams is the place where you find moments of inner peace. Surrounded by the loud and hectic traffic, pollution, it is a wonder how quiet it can be here. People relax on the lawn, happy loving couples around, nice restaurant to eat or for a fine selection of tea.
Best restaurant in Kath. Best food in Kathmandu hands down. The grounds are gorgeous and a nice break from the traffic noise of Kathmandu.

I like it very much. The place is beautiful , you just forget where you are. It's quiet and romantic .just spend here a day, laying down on the lawn with a book. The restaurant here is nice too. We really enjoyed our big lunch here . We all love it very much.

Peaceful Garden near Thamel. I have been in garden of dream many times.I was there with my friend and with family. This place is quiet and peaceful.Once you got time need to visit that place would be memorable in your life.Any age can enjoy in this garden.

minutes walk oasis. It's really a peaceful spot, away from busy Thamel. Entrance at 200NPR for foreigner. Wifi is available at additional charge. Bring your book. Cafe and bar are available inside. A very relaxing place especially after days of trekking.

A Peaceful Escape. This place easily became our escape from the hussle and bussle of downtown Kathmandu. The landscape was beautiful and it was easy to feel like you entered a different world (peaceful). We visited this place three times during our four days in Kathmandu (a great relaxation spot after trekking to EBC)!

An oasis of peace and quiet. Thank goodness for this oasis! After the chaotic scenes, sounds and pollution of Kathmandu's Thamel comes this respite amongst the bedlam. Quiet, soothing and picturesque, this Garden of Dreams is simply that. A place to rest, read, listen to music, contemplate life and of course dream. Gardens are well kept, lovely and ablaze with different colours. Grab a mat, spread it out on one of the many levels and enjoy your respite. There is also a restaurant associated with the place, different nooks, spiritual places and a very inviting swing that I enjoyed for 15 minutes until an 11 year old told me that I had had it for too long. Sorry kid...!

Relaxing Garden. I have been to this garden many time.I found it very nice and beautiful .I was there with my friend every time and that movement was memorable for me in my life but the thing what visitors have to thing is, there will be many people there are there for reading and trying to spent there time in quite place so visitiors should visit quitely .

Relaxing . Loved this place, good place to get away from the noise and pollution of the city (even though it's right in the middle) Very relaxing and can spend hours just chilling out and listening to music or looking at the gardens Also comes with very good wifi!! Recommended if your home sick or just sick of thermal come visit this place

Close to thamel. Perhaps the only quiet part of Kathmandu,this place is easily accessible by taxi or walking from the west end of thamel square.It is a small neat botanical gardens.most people there seemed to be reading and chilling . I found it hard to spend more than 30 minutes there. It has a small cafe ,so again it might be a good place for a short break from shopping
What's all the hype about??. Average, no botanic garden or anything dazzling. Just a nice oasis in the chaos. Still dusty and noisy

A beautiful oasis in the middle of chaos. I loved this park because you don't feel like you're in Kathmandu. I would take a book, grab a sandwich, sit on the grass and then just breathe. Yes, and wifi too for a small fee.
The cleanest place in Kathmandu. A very nice place where you can have a quite time reading and enjoying beautiful scenery. the cleanest public place that we have seen in Kathmandu.
A oasis in Kathmandu. Spent hours here relaxing in peace, had a nice salad at the restaurant. There were squirrels that were entertaining to watch!

Not Much To See. This place is quite nice, but nothing much to see. If you want a short escape from the busy streets of Kathmandu, you can try this place. It is walking distance from the tourist center, thamel street. Other than the nice small garden and european style building, you'll get to see local couples romancing almost every corner of this place (and they're quite disturbing 'additional view'). O well..probablybthat's the beauty of this place. There are cafe and restaurant within the garden, with higher prices. I say, it's not a mandatory place to visit in Kathmandu.

Garden of Dreams in Divali. What a beautiful and serene place. We arrived late afternoon and had a light supper just before the hundreds of tea-lights were lit. Food and service good and the setting lovely. Well worth whiling away a couple of hours here to escape the craziness of Thamel and Kathmandu.

An Oasis of Calm. The Garden of Dreams is a lovely walled garden within walking distance of the Thamil area of Kathmandu. It's 200 rupee to enter and there's a cafe and bar. Well used by locals and tourists it's a great place to relax after a morning of sight seeing. The cafe's prices are mid range and excellent.

a real treat. After the noise and the pollution of KTM ,it is a must !We liked the rest on the lawn ,couches provided to the walkers there ,even if the admission price was a bit too much for what is to be visited ther

Dreamy garden in the middle of dusty KTM. The garden represents a bit of peace and order in the midst of this dusty busy polluted city. Watching the squirrels/chipmunks? scamper up and down the trees and the birds flitting about the pond reminds one that nature is not far away. The entrance fee may be a bit off-putting but it works to sort the number and kind of people who frequent the place. About half of the visitors there when we passed through were tourists the other half young Nepali students in small groups. In view of the entrance fee, most visitors will remain for a leisurely stay, lounging about for a few hours. Last year there were mattress-like bits that made it easy to sit on the grass and play cards or read in the shade. This year these were absent or hidden somewhere out of view.There are newspapers in English for those who want to keep up with events.There are several restaurants and cafés in the garden, not all are open at the same time. For example, I've never been there when the ice cream shop was open.The prices are... well "pricey" by any standards. No picnicking allowed.

All Laid-Back in the Garden of Dreams. What a wonderful place to go to relax. It's right in the middle of the hustle-bustle of Kathmandu, but as soon as you step into the Garden of Dreams, all becomes serene, with only the sounds of birds singing in the trees. The gardens are beautifully laid out, with lots of tasteful seating areas to take in the surroundings. I was fascinated by the miniature striped-tailed cutie-pie squirrels that darted in and out of the shrubs and undergrowth. There are lovely lawns, so green and well-kept that Wimbledon Tennis Club would be proud of. But, interestingly there are large areas of grassland that people can hang around on to either sunbathe or picnic. You can go and get sun loungers and the like from a kiosk near the entrance to the park. We spent a couple of amazing hours here a couple of times, just to get away from Kathmandu's hectic streets! This place is such a treasure. We loved it.

An extraordinary oasis. This is worth a visit specially if you want some peace and quiet after spending time in Thamel. It looks like a European garden with fountains and lawns and a place to eat. Local couples sit on the grass and converse. It is beautiful! Foam mats are provided so you can sit in comfort. Extraordinary place. A MUST see.

Change of pace. A fantastic place to relax & chill out and escape the hustle & bustle conveniently located in the middle of town.It's pretty small, you could rush round in 10mins and see the whole garden, or as I did, spend a whole morning taking a few photos & stop for a coffee.There's an interesting exhibit with before and after pictures from the renovation of the gardens

Tension Dissolves. Clutching your bag, dodging traffic, minding your step, mentally calculating your currency exchanges, suspicion of getting taken advantage of because you are a foreigner, and traveling forever upstream through the flow of people can take a lot to of you. Dreams Garden is a welcome oasis. once you enter, it is a different world, slow, calm, peaceful and tension free (unless you are counting your pennies)If your time in KTM is starting to overwhelm you, go here, spend a few hours, sit on the grass, have a good coffee or tea and breathe....
A haven of peace near Thamel . A place to relax at any time of day. Almost a typical English country garden hidden in Kathmandu. Grass to relax on and time to remove your shoes.

Great location, entrance staff and cafe were a dissapointment.. The garden itself is beautiful and a must see whilst in Thamel, it is like a small oasis of peace in a town of madness!!
But I found the entrance staff and café staff a little uninterested and a little rude.

A respite in chaos. The garden of dreams is right next to Thamel and only costs a couple of bucks to get in. On our first day in Kathmandu we had sensory overload with all the sounds, smells and sights. It was nice to go into the garden of dreams and have a quiet spot to collect ourselves. Well worth the admission!
oasis in a chaotic city. This is a lovely slice of green in a very busy city and well worth a visit. It is beautifully planted and has a grest cafe / restaurant

You wont believe you are in Kathmandu.. Such a beautiful garden. The name has been rightly choosen. Garden of dreams. Place not to.be missed. N the restautant food.is.awesome. There is a ln entrance fee for.foreigners. Not that expensive. Great place to.relax. Walking distance from Thamel.
Worth visiting. The flowers... u will love them all. Very well designed place in Kathmandu

escape. This garden is such a nice escape from the craziness of kathmandu. You can lounge on the grass all day here reading and enjoying the sunshine and you can barely hear the car horns on the other side of the wall. Entrance is 250 rupee from memory.

Worth visiting if you are staying nearby. 200 rupee entrance fee to small gardens which offered a break from the non stop traffic madness outside. Pleasant gardens, but not exceptional. Considered restaurant/coffee shop, but decided I could get better value in the nearby Thamel district.

Set aside an hour or so. As promised by other reviews, this place is a haven from the traffic and frenetic pace of the city beyond its walls. The food was very tasty, though a bit on the expensive side, compared to other places.

Very nice place to relax. Good place to sit and escape the noise and crowds of KTM, very clean and well maintained. WiFi wasn't working when I went but bring a book and you will be set for a few hrs.
The Cafe was a little overpriced in my opinion but there is no obligation to eat there so not a big deal

The dreamlike Garden of Dreams. A true garden of dreams for its spectacular scenery and atmosphere inside.When you first enter you will see a group of people relaxing on the grass to the left, and the beautifully filled landscape to the right shows an old style building which is the actual Kaiser Cafe, preceded by a splendid display of trees, plants and a big pond in the middle.Just to the right of the entrance and close to the wall separating the gardens from the busy street, is a shaded place filled with small tables for two or three. And if u happen to sit there don't miss the small squirrels that climb the pergola above you.In the garden of dreams you will find the exquisite Kaiser Cafe. Be sure to order lunch or dinner there. The cafe serves one of the best dishes in Nepal and I must say I have had one of the best grilled fish dishes in my life there!A place that you must see, sit in, relax, read a book, or eat at! It will be one of the best experiences in Kathmandu.
A real oasis in the middle of the chaos. Worth to visit both during day and night, spend some time relaxing in the gardens and then enjoy a drink in the bar.

A baroque enclave in Asia. It was a nice sunny day to visit this garden, laid out in European style and built in early 20th Century. I have to say its not to my personal taste but there were plenty of people lazing in the sunshine.
lovley spot. A visual delight, peaceful in a busy city and the food was excellent as well as great history, location and soothing to just relax after lunch.
So relaxing. Garden of dreams is in the heart of Thamel. If you have the time its a great place to check out. Chillout on the grass or take a book and just sit and read.

An oasis. Just a short walk from Thamel. Hard to believe you are on the same continent. This garden is tranquil, beautifully restored.
Restaurant prices inside are fairly high. Consider bringing a picnic to enjoy on the lawns. Lounge cushions are provided, there is shade, and washroom facilities are clean. Recommended.

Peace perfect peace. This is aptly called the Garden of Dreams. For a very modest fee you can hide away from the noise, hustle & bustle of the fascinating city of Kathmandu and enjoy the delights of a beautiful and well kept garden. Take time to stroll and as the saying goes "Take time to smell the flowers". The perfect place to sit with a cup of tea and reflect on the world either by yourself or in the company of friends. Prices for drinks etc a little more expensive perhaps than in the city but well worth it for the privilege of sitting on the restaurant/cafe balcony and contemplating the gardens.

GEM in the crowded city. As u step in, u will feel very different atmosphere. The weather is cooler here, nicer and really really turned everything from hustle and bustle outside into relaxed and lovely inside.U will feel not in Nepal, but in Europe, with the collaboration of Austrian Govt funded this garden.The only bad thing here is the rest room. The smells is like hell, though u only pass by. My suggestion is better to use the one in the restaurant, less smelly.

Great environement in the garden~. It is a great botanical garden with nice and comfortable environment, having various special plants. I was lying on grass and looking to the blue sky. It is an enjoyable and silent time.However it is not that big as shown on its map, and the built of a joint of linga and youni is made incorrectly unfortunately. That is a fault of poor study in Hindu for sure.
Peaceful hangout. Decent food, was great the first time i went, bit of a disappointment the second time. The steak sandwhich is great.
relax. If you need to get away from the dust and noise from the street then go to Garden of dreams. It is so clean and you can get very good and tasty food in there

A bit of peace among noisy Kathmandu. What a gem in the heart of the city. You walk behind the gates to find this beautiful park with lakes, flowers and benches. It's so peaceful and the perfect place to rest and get away from the madness of the streets outside.

Amazing. Definitely worth the visit. This garden is extraordinary, everywhere you look is a unique and creative. There is also a restaurant inside the gardens and it is called the Kaiser Cafe and the food and service is absolutely fantastic.
Serenity. If you are tired of craziness of Kathmandu, just come here and spend an afternoon sipping tea while admiring understated English garden. Worth a visit on a hot afternoon

Oasis of calm. A strange place - old colonial style meets Rene Macintosh. Hercule Poirot would have liked to sit sipping black tea in the cafeteria. You could spend just half an hour here or dream away two hours. The garden is not particularly spectacular as far as the plants are concerned but the position of it, right in the middle of busy traffic, makes it special.

lives up to its name... With 2/3 hours to go before getting to the airport i wandered around wondering what to do with that "waiting for Godot" time when i came across this wonderful oasis from the city's noise and bustle. A great place to sit and do nothing at all and to leave feeling refreshed by a beautiful garden.

Truly garden of a dream!. The creator Kaiser Shumshere Kunwor Rana must have been a very interesting man, with this most wonderful garden that reminds of the finest gardens of Europe or Britain!A most charming place that is always high on my list of when visiting kathmandu to get some inspiration and good energy flowing!its worth the entrance ticket!
Pleasant natural surroundings. A well break from the traffic and street noise. Nicely manicured gardens, quiet with a cafe that was an excellent choice for dinner.

A Beautiful Escape. Garden of Dreams is Kathmandu's 'Central Park'. We ended up here on our last day before heading home. Since we were there during Dashain, the traditional bamboo swing had been built. That in itself was a beautiful attraction, watching children and people of all ages, laugh and play on the swing. We had a lovely lunch in one of the outdoor restaurants, people watching and enjoying our beautiful surroundings. The garden is a beautifully maintained oasis.

Delightful oasis of calm. It was wonderful to escape from the traffic and general chaos by being able to spend a little, peaceful time here. Also, enjoyed lunch at the Kaiser cafe.Would have rated it more highly, as a place to visit, had it been a little larger and had rest rooms of better cleanliness.
easy come easy go. not far from thamek area worth going for a break from crowd. take a good book with you and you are setteled

Little oasis in the touristy Thamel. The garden is very refreshing and beautiful. My son enjoyed being there. It was raining when we were there, so could not spend much time in the garden. Otherwise one can spend a beautiful afternoon here.
Note, there's an entry fee of 200 Nepali rupee.
peace and almost quiet. Pleasant first stop to decompress with a cold drink after flying and regroup before getting to grips with Thamel

A Quiet, Hidden Gem in Bustling Kathmandu. We visited the Garden of Dreams simply because it was near our hotel but had minimal expectations. I'm so glad we visited! The walled off garden is a quiet break from hustling, bustling Kathmandu. There are lots of places to sit and read, soak up sun or enjoy a drink and bite to eat.

Peaceful escape from the madness of ThamelA. A lovely place to just hang out for a couple of hours. Peace, quiet & tranquility in Thamel! There's a cafe and loads of places to sit, watch the world go by, read a book or just lie back and chill.

Nice oasis in Kathmandu. Visited the gardens twice and was such a nice relief from the chaos of Kathmandu to enjoy some peace and serenity! A bit small but immaculately kept gardens with some interesting buildings and statues. Loved the cafe and restaurant and the food was excellentWalk around the corner to the Kaiser library. A step back in time and its free to get in.

Retreat from the noise and pollution. A place of sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the traffic right in the city. Enter the gate and you are in a whole new world! Very well restored. It isn't very big but definitely a good place to relax before you get back to the busyness and crowd outside those walls.
Dreamy! A must-go!. It's truly a paradise. Like a dreamy movie set. I can't tell how the architecture style was influenced, is it once done by Austrians?

An Oasis. The garden is a stunning oasis in the middle of a noisy and dusty city. It is peaceful and green and clean. Go early if you want to take pictures that are not full of tourists in the background taking their own pictures. Then grab a drink or bite to eat before just sitting on the grass and taking it all in. You can take your own picnic in or buy from the bar or restaurant. The food is expensive for Kathmandu but is delicious.
Paradise. In the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu is this little patch of Paradise. Well maintained, peaceful, tranquil. Loved it

Veritable Oasis. Now that I have finally visited Garden of Dreams, I can't believe that after being in Kathmandu many times & over many years, that it took me so long to go there.It is a veritable oasis in what is the chaos, mayhem & noise of Kathmandu & Thamel in particular. The garden is surrounded by a high wall which is very effective in blocking out the choas & noise that abounds all around. Take a book, lay in the sun or under a tree & visit the small museum for the before & after photos of the garden. Then you're ready to tackle Thamel once again.

Okay to spend some time in the late afternoon. Nice place to sit and relax amid the noisy city. Evenings are lovely with lights. Take food with you if you plan to do picnic. The restaurant inside costs western price!

Relaxation guaranteed in crowdy Thamel. This place is perfect if you look for a little bit of rest while you stay in loud Thamel.
Go there early in the morning and you might have the garden almost for you alone.
Bring your camera, read a book and have a nice thee in the only oase of Thamel.
Fee 200 NPR

Sharp, but beautiful contrast. with dirty, poor, polluted, noisy, and overcrowded surroundings. Typical European classical buildings set in a splendid tropical formal garden. Good but costly restaurants. A surprising oasis of calm and relax for rich (mainly Western) people.

the only place you can take a deep breath at Thamel. Thamel is crowd, dusty, full of people. I don't understand that in this tourist area can have such "unbuild" roads at city center. It makes the area, the traffic very crowd and orderless. While the Garden of Dreams is the only place you can take a deep breath at Thamel, nice peaceful garden, grass field that you can sit or take rest on it. There's a cafe that you can enjoy coffee or tea break. Many western loves to go there, even locals.
Peaceful. A gem in the middle of a crazy city! Beautiful, green, calm with water features. Once you are inside the walls of the garden you are cut off from city traffic noise. Nice restaurant as well
Hidden treasure !. Great place and just exceeds your expectation in every sense. Just chill in the sun or read a book as per your mood. Restaurants are little expensive for what they offer.

An Oasis Of Peace in Thamel. Oncew you hit Thamel you will need some peace and quiet, and this is it, the trees here are so unique I really saw nature in Nepal for the first time....so beautiful, see this, do not read and write about it.....rest and have coffee, its small and very easy to find....

LOVED it, great escape in the heart of Kathmandu. Went there for dinner, the garden was beautiful at night with all the lightsgreat place to unwind and just relax, came here the next day in the afternoon, just amazing

Peace in Thamel. Kathmandu blew me away with its bustling character, noise and uptempo pace. So the Garden of Dreams was ideal to rest up, enjoy the gardens and take a meal or coffee break. Only surprise was the discount for seniors started when you were 70 - 4 years to go then.

green oasis. Beautiful green oasis in the middle of a messy city. Lots of shady plants, tropical flowers, even a large swing for the kids, although you have to be pushy to keep your place in line. Great to relax after a pizza at "fire and ice". The ticket is only valid for one entry, so you can't go out and come back. Wifi is available but not free. The bars and restaurants inside are quite pricey. Best place for romantic couples or young children downtown in Kathmandu.

Serene. Best place - a must visit in KTM.
Quiet and serene, remember your umbrella if you're going to join the amorous couples!

Okay. Okay if you don't have much else to do in Kathmandu or you really want to take some time out in a greener location. Lots of romantic couples around. It is just a regular park and not really worth seeing as an attraction, it's just a location to pass some time.

Beautiful Oasis in the Middle of Thamel area. It is a garden in the middle of Thamel and has pools, many plants and is a beautiful garden...very popular with the local people...mats to lay down on and relax...I tool many pics...the Kaiser Café is located inside and the food is very good...a nice place to visit and relax and have lunch...

Lovely place. Lovely place, very close to Thamel,walking range...
a green and peacefull place in the very busy and noisy surrounds of Thamel,can be there for a couple of quiet hours..

Oasis in the Hectic City. We were just walking the streets of Kathmandu and found the Garden of Dreams! A beautifully manicured garden with ponds and specimen trees. We enjoyed coffees/tea and drinks and soaked in the greenery. At first turned off by the entrance fee, but were happy we stayed as it was a great reprieve.

Time Out. This was just the perfect place to escape from the hustle and madness Step inside the walls and the serenity descended upon you and the noise of the busy streets just vanished Not only during the day but at night it was a fairy wonderland A great place to spend time recharging and relaxing on the grass in the sun
just average. small complex of gardens in the city centre, 200 irs entrance, but nothing special. It was fun to feed the squirrels, although not permitted.

Not impressed compared to other attractions. A garden made for lovers, it was a nice quiet place to hang out but not that impressive. If you are short on time, skip this one - unless you're shopping in the nearby Thamel and need a break for a cappuccino. The café was nice but pricy.

Evening of dreams. Had the most amazing meal here after trekking to Everest Base Camp. pure luxury. Food was excellent, service without fault. It was just a shame we were there in the evening and the outside lighting didn't show off the gardens to it's best.

Okay. It depends on what you expect of this place. It's just a nice garden where you can relax. Nothing more, nothing less. It's not a big garden. If you have seen the gardens in China pass this one. It's not interesting then. Unless tou want to drink expensive wine and taste expensive food. They got like 3 small restaurants in this garden.
Peaceful park. Oasis of calm near busy Thamel area of Khatmandu . Quotes from the Rubiyat of Omar Khyam. Good cafe. Chipmunks in the trees to entertain you.

So peaceful!. When you get tired of the Thamel noise, fo the nightclubs, of the messy pushing and shoving on the streets, do head into this place for a whole day if you will. Not only you can relax in its beautiful gardens, you can also have breakfast, lunch and dinner here. This is very mush an oasis in the city.

Beautiful, hidden oasis.. 200rupees to get in, an amazing find. We spent a few hours here, people watching, squirrel watching, wandering around the spectacular gardens. Highly recommend.It's surprisingly quiet, considering it's right in the middle of the city. The walls keep some of the noise out.We were a little disappointed that the café was so busy - we couldn't get a table. It's probably best to bring your own snacks, lots of families had this idea.There is even free wifi here! Not that you'll need it. It's lovely to just admire the surroundings and enjoy the peace and quite. Plenty of shade to enjoy the weather.

Oasis in the cit. Arrived here late afternoon to go to dinner in the Kaiser Cafe within the garden. Lots of young couples within the gardens enjoying the sun and surroundings. There is a smal, amphitheatre area where they and families were sat around. The garden is made up of lots of different areas all interconnected with pathways ... Very colourful, great garden design ideas. Good also at night when flood,it. A must to visit.

Nice place to relax in the middle of Kathmandu. This is a lovely, well laid out and well maintained garden right inside Kathmandu city, just five minutes fro the hustle and bustle of Thamel. It is designed in the formal European style and was once a private garden of a Field Marshall who obviously had a sense of style and the means to execute his plans. After his death, it fell into neglect but fortunately, with help from the Austrian government, it has been restored to its original glory.A restaurant serves lunch, dinner and snacks besides alcoholic and soft drinks.It is the perfect place to relax : you can wander around a bit enjoying the flowers and plants and, if you choose, you can spend a whole day reading a book and having a drink or a meal.

Nice to escape to. The Garden of Dreams is a lovely place to visit and a great escape from the noisy bustle of Kathmandu. It is clean, peaceful and there is nobody in there hassling you to buy their stuff. The cafés inside are expensive so keep that in mind. It is not very big but we sat and watched the world go by for a couple of hours in there. Make sure you go to the toilet before you leave though, I got back to the entrance , didn't actually go out and decided to nip back to use the facilities and was told I would need to pay again to enter. I told them I had been in and could show them my ticket, they said they knew as they had seen us but I would still have to pay again.

An oasis in the middle of chaos. If you want to chill out from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu for a couple of hours, head over the the Garden of Dreams. You can sit on the grass (or maybe on a cushion provided) and read a book, have a cup of tea, smell the flowers, watch the fish or just wander around and enjoy the greenery.

amazing!!. such a nice place to relax and free your mind from all the tension. just lay on the grass look at the sky and forget everything but don't forget your camera. they even have a swing at times made of bamboo and rope. Its a really great experience. you can even pack food and have a small picnic there :) don't forget to visit it!!
amazing amidst kathmandu. if you want a "wow" experience away from the normal crowd and craziness of Kathandu, stop it. At the corner just before the Royal Palace museum. Great food and relaxing.

Peace and Harmony in KTM. A beautiful garden oasis worth visiting in Thamel. Great cafe serving high quality lunch and drinks menu. Certainly a place to visit and particularly to get away from the hustle and bustle of city traffic and noise.
Oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. Nice place to have a rest and relax, green and serene environment. Can have some tea or dinner at the garden.
nice but crowdy. the place is very nice, to relax and have lunch or dinner in the restaurants there, but is sooo crowdy.

Ok place to visit in middle of Kathmandu. We came to Garden of Dreams on our day 2 of Kathmandu. It was nice to find a place quiet like this in middle of the city. There were many locals in there chilling out. The gardens were indeed beautiful and well maintained. It was a nice place to have a look, however I won't say it is a must visit in Thamel since it was not very Nepalese like. The entrance fees were reasonable, however the restaurant was over-priced. Felt it was more for tourist than anything else.

A peaceful area in the middle of chaos. If you need a quick retreat from the chaotic streets of Thamel, don't miss the archway in the middle of those loooong brick walls. There's a beautiful garden inside surrounded by those thick walls that block out the hustle of the outside.The entry fee is ok but wifi is extra and the cafe and restaurant are expensive.
Didn't find it that attractive. Expected to find an elaborate garden, which it wasn't. It is a small place, but peaceful in the middle of the city.
Calm oasis in the hustle.. A totally serene, relaxing place to take time out from the craziness of Thamel. The bar is part of the lovely setting, and serves a great G&T....

Great place to relax. This place is great if you want to take a time out from the busy streets of Kathmandu. It's near Thamel but when you are there you forget that you are so close to the centre of the city. Great place to relax and read a book or take a nap.

Beautiful, quiet place. If interested in spending some quiet time in a very busy city, this is the place to go. Well maintained gardens, small shop for coffee or light refreshment or larger restaurant for a meal. Beautiful setting for quiet reflection.

BYOB. Bring your own blanket! Its a pretty chill place to just relax for a couple of hours. They hand out free mats when you go in but the smell coming off them is quite rank. If you have your own blanket you'll be fine.

Beautiful. First visit was at night and it's truly impressive with fabulous lighting showing off the neo-classical architecture at its best. The stunning bar was just being locked up but we persuaded the barman to re-open for us which he did with good grace: it's a great spot for a G & T. We had dinner there as well which was really good with top service too. I went back a couple of days later and really saw the gardens in all their glory during the day. A key feature of the gardens is its relationship to the noise and chaos just over the walls and this is an ocean of tranquillity, fresh air and order. It's well worth the £1.25 for the admission.
Tranquility in the city. This is great place to unwind with a date, right in the heart of Kathmandu. Bring a bottle of wine, perfect spot for watching a romantic sunset.
Natural and Beautifull place. The simplicity and the calmness of the place was it focal attracting force.Its green and lush gardens were really managed well.

An oasis in the midst of a busy, noisy city.. This garden was walking distance from our hotel and as soon as you step in to this walled garden, you're transported to the peace and calm that comes with beautifully manicured and landscaped green spaces and cosy garden alcoves. It's a very romantic retreat and we ate at the Kaiser Cafe and had a lovely meal with excellent service. I've seen some negative reviews of this restaurant, but that was truly not our experience and we highly recommend this place.
Some rest in hectic Kathmandu. For a little rest and some nice food I suggest to visit the garden of dreams. The garden is just a few minutes walking from Thamel.

A entirely different world.. When you get in, it is like coming back from hell to heaven. Forgetting the terrifying traffic right outside. The extreme dusty air. The semi urban rural city. The green grass and specular garden art.Finally!A place to relief!(wi-fi included)It is a great bargain for enjoying a piece of quiet for a low cost.
it is OK. Not so bad we like it because of big green garden but entrance fee is bad why they take entrance fee

Escape the Chaos. This garden is a great place not only because of its beauty but because of the stark contrast of the Kathmandu's dirty and dusty streets. Here everything is green and peaceful. There are small walking areas and plenty of places to sit There are two cafes here operated by the same owner. The cafes are good for drinks and teas. I did eat dinner here and the steak was not good. Everything else was very pleasant. There is WIFI here in the garden for a small fee. Come here to rest, relax, or plan your next outing. You will come out refreshed.
a place to be with your partner. Although the area is very small but very good to be with partner and close friends. It is well designed and maintained and is very popular among youth.

An oasis of calm. Sometimes Kathmandu is just a bit too much. The garden of dreams allows you to step aside for an hour or so into a beautiful calm space. The fact that there is nice food and drinks available is a plus. Definitely worth a visit.

Only if you have spare time.. Its a very nice garden but only for tusitm. It's like other gardens in any city. It's true that maybe is the only one in Kathmandu and probably in nepal, but dosen't seem a "tipical nepali thing".

Small but beautiful. It is a very small garden; well designed and maintained. In the middle of Kathmandu and very quiet and clean. I wouldn't call this as one of the key attractions of Kathmandu; but if you want to relax and get away from hot sun for a short time, go in and spend some time; otherwise don't waste your money. It is a good place for local youngsters to meet though.

Small, but Quiet. A respite from the noise and chaos of Thamel, albeit expensive at 200 NR. Take a book, find a shady corner--there are lots of them. The foliage aspect is a little disappointing, as there are expanses of turf that could be planted in flowers. Still, not a bad selection.

Amzaing Garden. It's one of the place to hangout in Kathmandu . Good Ambiance and restaurants inside the garden . Garden charges NPR 100 as an entrance . It's just next to Thamel and reflects the Rana Regime architecture of Nepal .

Perfect Hangover @ Town. i love really this place, fresh and prefect for dating and hangover. never ever u will find these kinds of garden else in kathmandu valley. so, i suggest don't forgot to go there once n review it.

I was little disappointed. I thought that it is large place according to the pictures, but it is very small area. I was little disappointed. If you are trying to find some quiet place go rather to Swayambhunath temple.

A beautiful place to visit. No visit to Kathmandu is complete with a visit to the beautiful Garden of Dreams, a lovely landscaped garden with shady nooks where one can sit and absorb the greenery while listening to the splash of water from the fountains. The restaurant serves a very good lunch which is best enjoyed if you can get a table on the verandah upstairs so that you can enjoy the view. My husband and I usually share a steak sandwich and salad. The food is not great, but more than okay, though the service is pretty slow. Waiting isn't a problem, however, because the place is so scenic. Definitely recommended.

Heavenly comforts. Kathmandu is exciting and full of life. Amid all the action is this beautiful garden full of tranquility, peace and charm. There is an abundance of stimulating flora and fabulous pavilions to eat and drink it all in. It is a real gem of a place,

Fabulous. With tired feet I entered this garden of tranquility in a very busy part of Kathmandu. It was beautifully maintained and well worth a visit. My feet felt good after my trip around the gardens a Beautiful place to enjoy a cup of tea!!!

Best place to relax in a busy city.. Its a beautiful garden, with ample benches and lawns to sprawl and indulge in reading a book or listening to music. A must visit when you feel cranky in the busy city.

Breath of fresh air. One of the most beautiful gardens in Kathmandu city that too right next to the busy tourist districts of Kathmandu. Once you enter the garden you will instantly forget that you are in a city. Well preserved historical Mugal style garden. I compare this to Mugal Garden of Sri Nagar except Mugal Garden is 20 times bigger. Kaiser Cafe inside the garden serves great coffee and baked items. Love this place!

Nice place to sit and relax. This is a very nice place to sit and enjoy a tea after a day of shoping in Thamel. It is a quiet place off the busy streets and the garden is quite beautiful. However I would not recommend the restaurant it is expensive and my friend was very ill after eating a meal there (I only had the tea thank heavens!).
It is a dream. In this garden you will find some rest inside busy Kathmandu. When it is sunny it is a good place for sunbathing and reading your book.

Relaxing and amazing green spot. I love gardens. And this one is quiet dreamy. It's nice to just lay down on some ground or grass here and read books. They also have really nice restaurants inside. It's one of my favourite spot in Kathmandu.

Such Peace. It so unbelievable that all this beauty is right in the middle of all the busyness of the city. Come ready to spend some time like 2 hours or so enjoying the gardens stop for a cup of tea or coffee.
Awesome. This was a amazing place in kathmandu,quite environment,Nice decoration, Museum so nice restro.Dream Garden even single,couple, families, friends u can enjoys piety much thanks

Little piece of heaven in the city. Beautiful relaxing gardens just a 5 minute walk from Thamel... Nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle if the city noise , grab a coffee and a piece of cake and lay on the grass and listen to the silence Beautiful place to sit and think about the next destination of your trip

Dream on!. Garden of Dreams is a beautiful island of tranquility in the middle of the craziness of Kathmandu. The gardens are spectacular and one can sit among lotus ponds or flowers and read, write or meditate. It is a great family place, as children can run around and enjoy themselves.If I rated this less than excellent, it is because of the restaurant. Food is definitely tourist food and about average. Service is okay, although waits can sometimes get long. More attention could be paid to keeping tables clean or removing the dinner dishes when dessert arrives. Over all, however, Garden of Dreams is worthwhile visiting, particularly for the charm of the grounds.
A dream Garden. A quiet, beautiful and serene place in the middle of busy town with excellent choices of cuisines. Great place for going with friends in the evening and hosting parties.
Like my own backyard in Kathmandu. Tables in various areas - varied menu - gracious service - quiet place to spend a leisurely meal or longer.

Okay, worth a short visit. This place is worth sticking your head in and just having a quick look round - however it isn't very big and there isnt much in there except some fountains and overpriced cafes, and you have to pay to get in. However there is no doubt that it is pretty peaceful and if 'doing nothing' is your kind of scene then this is a good place to do it!

Great place as long as you're not appalled by PDA. It seems to have now become a dating spot. Be prepared to bump into a LOT of young couples playing tonsil tennis in every nook and cranny of the garden. Having said that, if you can get past the couples indulging in PDA, you'll have a good experience at the garden. It's a peaceful and serene place, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful. One of the most tranquil places in Kathmandu.The perfect escape from the hustle and bustle and chaos of Kathmandu. Spend an hour or two watching the squirrels (very entertaining) and listening to the birds A great place to relax for an afternoon. Very affordable entrance fee.Their is a restaurant on the grounds with excellent food and good wine selection, however be prepared as it is probably the most expensive restaurant in Kathmandu.

A must visit in kathmandu!. A gem of a hidden garden walled off from a busy street. Its a late nineteeth early 20th C summer house with a magical herb garden that has been restored. Dine is a cool white pillared "palace" looking out onto a garden filled with water features and reflecting pools. Wonderful fresh continental food and very competitive pricing. I would go again and again....

Nice garden near Thamel. Very nice garden to go and relax in...built in the back of an old palace it has a cafe with reasonable food... Chipmunks, flowers,..a green space ...must pay entry fee and their wifi did not work when was there..away from the dust and noise..

Awesome garden in the heart of the city. Beautiful small garden in the heart of the city. There is also a restaurant here if you need to enjoy coffee or some snacks. There is a small pond with flowers in it. Dis like - High entry fee of 200 NRP per head.

Pool of calm in a Sea of hectic ness !. Walking down to the Garden of Dreams you have little inkling that beyond the high brick wall is a place of lush greenery that seems far removed from the hustle and bustle of the main road and Thamel 2 minutes walk away. If you want to escape in the City, this is the place to go.

Peaceful. Though it is bombarded by young Nepalese couple... However, it is worth visiting... It is peaceful and surprisingly clean... there is an entrance fee... the restaurant serves good food.. We have Nepalese thali....
A bit of tranquility in chaos. A good place to go for a bit of calm in the chaos of Kathmandu.A nice place to sit and have some lunch or just a drink. Very cheap to get in.

Bit of tranquility in bustling Kathmandu. If you want to place to lay on the lawn and chill out for a few hours this is the place. 200Rs entry but lovely gardens, plenty of seating and even free mats for you to lounge on. Nice place for a drink although be warned the prices here for food and drink are as high as you will find anywhere in Nepal.
Serene Place. Absolutely Serene palace...worth a visit! Especially during evenings, where there is minimal lights available..:)

Semi-peaceful escape.
