The garden of dreams gives a nice quick escape from the hustle and bustle of thamel, all the architecture has been done up and they take care of the gardens. 200 rs entry (I think) nice place to chill out, even though you can still hear the muffled horns from cars. Only problem is that I don't think they are keen on you taking in food/drink with you and the little restaurant/cafes there are SUPER expensive + tax, so a glass of wine could come to almost 1000 rupees!!! If your on holiday, why not spoil yourself, but not realistic for locals and expats all the time to pay those kind of prices.

Quaint. A quiet and very green space just outside the hustle and bustle of Thamel. A bizarre contradiction to the streets of Kathmandu. If you're staying in town and crave some green space it's quite lovely to take a wee break there should you feel you need it
nice. small but pretty and relaxing. amazing contrast with the main street outside. reasonably priced for access.
Garden of Heaven. Any one can sit at peace and enjoy the greenery of the garden. very peaceful place to hangout .Has an entrance fee to get in.

Peaceful break from Kathmandu. Maybe not the best gardens in the world, but it is one of the best in Nepal. Truly heaven in the heart of Kathmandu. Perfect place for a break from chaos, noise and dust.Great place to get some peace and quite time after a hectic day.

The cleanest place in Nepal - worth a visit.. A gorgeous garden that is simply the cleanest place we saw in Nepal - beautifully tendered and cared for. Some great historical photographs are hung in one of the buildings and the cafe although expensive in comparison with other places is still reasonable value compared to European and Australian costs. It makes for a nice relatively peaceful break from the chaos outside if the walls. Traffic noise is certainly reduced but the continuos horns somewhat dampened are able to find their way over the walls.

A piece of Heaven in Kathmandu. This place is a "must see" in Kathmandu. It is like a walled enclave - beautiful gardens in the heart of bustling Kathmandu. Great restaurant and delightful place to escape to. Wonderful service. Great food. More expensive than outside but what a treat. Especially after a long trek. Worth paying the extra money to eat in this place.A piece of "Austria", complete with Schnitzel!
nothing special. It does not have anything like that, which would make sense to pay an entrance fee. Just nice, lovely garden with one small cafe. This is meetingpoint for local young coulpe.

The name says it all. Kathmandu...the name held a mystical fascination for me. The city was very different from my expectations. However, the Garden of Dreams is an idyllic oasis providing respite from the hurly-burly of the city. It is quiet, clean, serene and quite beautiful. It is an ideal place to rest, read, relax and enjoy a pretty good restaurant. There is an entrance fee that is a small price to pay for admission to this island of calm. This is a must see attraction. Don't miss it.

so peaceful, tranquil haven within the middle of kathmandu. just to sit in the quiet and not hear the noise of the cars and bikes out side the walls was amazing. The gardens and structures are equally relaxing and structured. A visit to the resturant for food is worth it, wether lunch or evening meal. I had the Steak sandwich for lunch and the Lamb for evening meal. Yes pricey for Kathmandu but hay its a treat.

amazing garden, perfect to relax and rest (and sleep!). even though you can still hear the faint honking sounds, they seem to be dampened by the lush, gorgeous garden surprisingly located in the middle of the city, just a few min walk from thamel.
careful as you peek around corners though, as you might be interrupting a young couples' intimate moment..

A piece of Heaven. This place really is a piece of heaven in a hustle bustle city. We were advised to go their by friends who had been and we wish we had of known exactly how peaceful it was as we would've taken books and laid in the sun for a while! You can sit about on mats in the sunshine. We did think the food was a little over priced, shame there is not a cheaper option or that they don't serve tea and coffee to you at various places in the gardens. But highly recommended if you need a break from the hype of Thamel.
Relaxing garden. Nice and peaceful garden in Thamel for relaxing or eating good food in the restaurant. Has an entrance fee to get in.
Magnificent Place - Truly a Garden of Dreams. We enjoyed the gardens twice, once for tea and the second time for lunch. Service was great, gardens are beautiful, peaceful and spectacular.
Great Gardens. This Garden is a small corner of busy Kathmandu where one can escape watching the water fountains, and wonderfully kept grounds live.

Hidden Treasure. the Garden of Dream is just a short walk from Thamel market and is a very peaceful place in the middle of the chaotic streets of Kathmandu. Great food and perfect for a afternoon tea or coffee.

Beautiful. Beautiful garden. Cost 200 rupees. Very clean. Seemed to be a place with lots of couples but there were lots of people chilling out on the grass too. A lovely place to get away fromt he hustle and bustle of Kathmandu.

Clean and nice. The garden is a beautiful break from the streets of Thamel, when you sit in the Kaiser cafe and enjoy their delicious, but tourist priced, food you really can't tell where you are. Apart from the relentless honking of Nepalese cars, the location of the Gardens is next to a large road.

royal type of garden in hectic center of Kathmandu. young Nepali lovers go there to sit together on the benches holding hands in the peaceful garden You can lay down on the grass and rest in this beautiful surroundingToerists come to escape the city noise and traffic Beautiful trees exotic plants and flowers The Swiss people we met there in october compared this garden to the Royal garden in Brussels Belgium only open once to the public in MayWe made a photo book of the garden because my friend is a botanist and knows all plants and flowers The squirrels come eat out of your hands Exquisit tea and coffee are served on a palace like patio and on a restaurants terrace 5star gastronomic dishes are served We spent our last two days there taking in all the emotions of our Sawadee tour Nepal What a joy
An Oasis of Calm. Idealic fragrant small garden hidden in the midst of Thamel.If you have an hour to spare pop along relax and unwind

Went there twice it was so nice. A sanctuary in the heart of bustling Kathmandu. My girlfriend said it was "heavenly"..."a place of tranquility, beauty, and intimacy with nature and oneself". I thought it was a great place to relax and have a nap. Definitely worth a trip if you are spending more than a few days in the city.

Garden of Dreams Delights. In the middle of Kathmandu nicely hidden from the traffic and hawkers is the Garden of Dreams. A small oasis with free wifi. Firstly it is beautiful and terraced with day beds laid out on the terraces for you to relax on. Already you understand that they expect you to relax and not rush off. There is a small amount of wild life, squirrels , birds etc, which makes it a little more disney like. Just two blocks from Thamel behind thick brick walls, entry fee is low, but be aware that the gate person may try to short change you. Yes I can add up and 2 x $200 from $1000 is $600 change not $100. Ahem. You can enter by a few entrances, but the side one near the atm is the best I found.Once inside there are a few eating options as well. Twice when we had, had enough of curry, momos and dahl baht we went here for the western food. Steak sandwich to die for. With pickles and cheese and real steak. Not buffalo. The toilets are very clean and very western, a nice surprise as well. So if you need a break from the noise and chaos you should definately go to the Garden of Dreams. AT worst its a pleasant break from everything. At best its a regular morning break for peace and reflection looking at the pools and plants and surrounding buildings.

Behind The Dream. Garden of Dream is one of the best place in Thamel,kathmandu for refresh.Its Provide the roof for the refresh your hassle free from your travel in Kathmandu.We enjoy good meal over there which was very good for us.If you are looking for good and place to visit just near the thamel then thisis the most suitable place for you.

Good place to catch a nap. 200 rupee at the time and you can chill in this spot and catch some sleep. It's clean and nice, the perfect place to clear your head in the center of the city. Also funny to see all the teeny boppers making out everywhere..
No thing special. It is just a small garden and peacful place. Good for teen agers to roam around but no thing special for senior citizens and tourist. Cafe kaiser was quite expensive.

Peace amidst chaos. This gem (returned to earlier glory by the Austrian government) is hidden behind an exterior wall as you walk towards Thamel. It provides a quiet shelter from the madness of Kathmandu, offering zen gardens and several eating and drinking establishments.
like a secret garden. A nice place to take things slow and enjoy a good meal. Cute squirrels running around are fun to watch. The good and service at the cafe is very good.

"Vulgar: Retro Golden Age Euro-trash". For uptight and well heeled Ladies and pampered Gents who've become upset and emotional by the dust, noise and inclement conditions in Kathmandu; who need respite from real life. For those who wish they were back in eighteenth century Europe, with a twist of Asia. Or for those who wish they were anywhere else but Thamel, Kathmandu. People who can't cope with the urban realities of a developing country, really like this place.Lots of hetero couples being openly intimate which is somewhat alienating. And in nooks and crannys around the place; I could swear I was seeing open solicitation; and in broad daylight. A 'lovers lane' with landscaped restaurants. People tend to seat themselves for protracted periods... so if you don't arrive early you will find your behind in an unremarkable part of a very successful illusion. The door charge means that the park excludes a large proportion of Nepali locals, who will never get to appreciate what the idea of eighteenth century; aristocratic Europe was like, for those privileged enough to be part of it. Dining - Expensive dining by anyones standards.

wow its a dream. the moment I arrived I was so surprised how dainty and manicured the gardens were, everything was like make believe, you can buy wi fi at the gate along with a 200 rp entrance fee, theres grass galore, white elephant statues, lotus ponds and a very raj style setting including a balcony serving exkwiset breakfast lunch and dinner.Sweet young Nepalese lovers are spread out all over the place in small pockets, seeing it use to be a place where the crazy Austrian hunter Boris, and the Prince would meet for many aparent indecent happenings, the Austrian government refurbished it beautifuly, I love to go there and escape into this world of magic, take a book and spend some hours, theres alot of hystory and tales to be fed
Peaceful respite from busy Kathmandu. Lovely gardens, peaceful and some nice little restaurants. Perfect place for a rest and recharge after negotiating the Kathmandu streets.

Lovely space, excellent food. The food was insane- we had pork chops, the asparagus soup, Fillet mignon and the Sauchertorte. Expensive by the city's standards, but simply sitting, eating with a view of this beautiful garden is amazing. The weather in June when I was there was lovely. Hidden treasure in the heart of the city! And, there is paid wifi in the garden!
not worth the money and time. It is a very small ordinary park with some water fountains and benches. Lovebirds sitting around holding hands. Some mats on the lawn to lie down - thats it.
tranquil. Nice spot easy to miss with small entrance inside is such a contrast to outside the high walls inside you can rest sunbathe grab a drink and simply relax

Best place to relax in Kathmandu. Want to escape the busy city life of Kathmandu? Go relaxing in the Garden of Dreams where you can wander around the gardens, lay on the grass reading a book, drink a beer in the fancy bar or try the great!! (a bit expensive though) food in the restaurant of the garden.

Very European like garden. Nice, but not Nepali. Good if you want to get away for a short while from the noisy dusty atmosphere of Kathmandu. Otherwise, just a European garden..pretty. Not very impressive.

Peace in the city!. This garden was the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. The gardens are well kept, the water features are lovely and there's a little restaurant you can dine in. Prices for the restaurant seemed potentially a little higher than other spots in Katmandu, but not by much and probably goes with the territory (it was more of a linen-napkin spot rather than side-street cafe).

A nice place to rest. The garden is a nice gateway to the chaos of thamel since its located really close to the heart of thamel. The garden are prettily and neatly maintained. So it's easy to spend hours inside the garden just resting, reading a book or simply just chatting with friends without you even realizing it.

After EBC no place is better!. I really enjoyed this place and i'm sure even more so after EBC. This garden was recently restored with the help of the Austrian government. It was very nice to eat at the cafe and i loved the "real" ketchup we found their! After EPC it's all the little things that matter most.
So peacefull!. A lot of nooks, pairs, fish) Tranquility takes you, and, don't let you go for hours! Ideal place for artists! Mix of the Nature with Human thoughts! Amazing!

Peace in the mad place. Stroll through the mad and hectic streets of Thamel then risk injury whilst negotiating the mad traffic system to then step through the entrance and enter a place of peace & tranquility. It's also clearly a place where young boys & girls meet so they can be that normal couple for a few hours which gives the gardens a even nicer feel. Not a large area but you can easily lose yourself for half a day as we did.
Kaiser Cafe. After trekking to EBC, I was dying for a good meal. I had the mustard chicken with mashed potatoes and it was delicious. Staff was very nice and the grounds were beautiful!

Kaiser Cafe. My sister and I ate lunch outdoors on the porch at the Kaiser Cafe and loved the Nicoise salad. The view of the garden is well worth it. The longer you sit there the more you see. It's a nice break from the hectic life of Kathmandu. It's quiet and refreshing. Highly recommend having lunch here.

Garden of Dreams. A most superb spot to get out of the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu yet right in the middle of town. A lovely place to have a bite to eat, a picnic or just a relaxing place to people watch. The gardens are beautifully designed with lots of colour. I enjoyed watching the squirrels and their antics and couldn't resist having a doze in the shad on the foam mattresses that are provided..

Relief from all the craziness. Kahtmandu is a somewhat chaotic city. The garden was like an oasis in the middle of the craziness of Thamel area. I went there for 2 days just to read and sleep in the matresses

dream of. the place dream of garden is really cool and best place to refresh you after walking around kathamndu all poluted but this place is really clean,and really different environment,there are so many tourist and local people every day ,and it cost 200 for tourist to go inside.

An enchanting place. It was an enchanting place, refreshing to look at and spend a romantic evening with a loved one. it was truly a place you can only dream about, but it comes at a high price. the entrance fee is too much and the food good but overpriced. Ideal if you are celebrating something with your lover and don't mind spending a little more for the romantic setting.
Relax.... The Garden Entry Fees is Rs.200 For Non-Nepali, Silent Garden With Tea Salon, Bar And Restaurant. We Can Get Polyster Mattress And Pillow From Security Guards.

A great way to get away from the chaos. The Garden of Dreams in Kathmandu is a beautiful neo-classical garden which, in collaboration with the Austrians, has been designed as a peaceful oasis in the heart of the city with striking architecture and an array of unique flora and fauna brought here from across the globe.One thing everybody will notice when they arrive in Nepal is the horrible pollution. Yet there are a few parts of Kathmandu where the pollution is not as evident – nor evident at all, actually. The Garden of Dreams, near to Thamel Marg where my hotel was located, is certainly one of those places.It is true that the area is crawling with both tourists and local Nepali people, and it does get very busy. However, if you are willing to brave the crowds, and pay the grossly over-priced 200 Rupees for entry to the Garden, then this will surely be one of the highlights of your short stay in Kathmandu. After hearing many disapproving stories online for such a high admission fee for a ” simple garden”, I did question whether I wanted to spend that kind of money, as I was running low on local currency in my wallet and I didn’t want to use an ATM here for security reasons. In the end, I thought that it would be too good an opportunity to miss, and one afternoon I took a local taxi literally around the corner from my hotel to the entrance of the Garden of Dreams.The Garden of Dreams is unlike anything I have seen before in my travels across Asia and the sub-continent. I am used to Japanese-inspired gardens, landscaped botanic gardens, and of course the tropical settings of the likes of the Lodhi Gardens in Delhi, and the Lake Gardens in Kuala Lumpur. But here at the Garden of Dreams, everything was very European-like, and I think that must be the reason it is so popular with the Nepali people, as it must seem like a form of escapism to them. There were many small groups and romantic couples have a picnic on the grasses here, but there is also a coffee shop called Kaiser Café, which serves international cuisine, albeit at rather expensive prices. The Garden is open from 10am to 9pm each day.

A small haven of peace and quiet. The first time we visited at the beginning of our holiday in Nepal was bliss, it was mid week, and very quiet and relaxing, somewhat of a haven from the madness,. hustle and bustle, noise and pollution that is Kathmandu. We wandered around the lovely gardens admiring the flowers, trees, shrubbery and wildlife (squirrels and birds). We stopped at the restaurant and had drinks and food (a little expensive by Nepal standards but still cheap compared to home). We visited again at the end of our holiday as we were back in Kathmandu just for 1 night prior to our return flight. it was so busy as it was the weekend full of lots of courting couples, noisy children and not quite the haven we'd been fortunate to experience on our previous midweek visit. You pay an entrance fee and if you go out are not allowed back in.

Garden of peace and making money.. The garden is a great place to get away from the chaos that is Kathmandu, but they charge you a small sum of 90 rupees. Which is worth it. However the garden is very small but very beautiful! Worth the visit, take a book and enjoy your escape from the chaos. Just don't expect a huge garden you can lose your self in for hours.
Overhyped.. Even though the garden looks beautiful at night, the restaurant is over prized beyond imagination. You are not missing anything here by not visiting.
Peaceful oasis in the heart of Kathmandu. A perfect way to spend an quiet afternoon in a busy city. Easy to find, tranquil and a great little cafe.

Romantic. What a beautiful romantic place. It is like being in a little oasis away from the big city. Very peaceful and we enjoyed taking photos of the flowers and then just resting on the cushions in the grassed area. My only regret we didn't get to eat at one of the beautiful restaurants.

A small piece of heaven in the craziness of Kathmandu. This is a must... We visited The Garden of Dreams after coming back down from our trek in the mountains. With a book and some lunch it is a great place to relax (you won't find many of those in Kathmandu), people watch and take in the beautiful surroundings. It's difficult to think you are in the middle of a city like Kathmandu when you are tucked away behind the walls of the garden. Just amazing

Blissful!. There is no other place on earth that has captured my imagination like the Garden of Dreams has. The afternoon spent there, just relaxing on the lawn, with many others next to us - but not even a peep out of anyone that could disturb us because sounds just don't seem to have volume even at close range - is possibly the best of my life. Go with friends or go with a book, you won't regret spending an entire day here. The trees and flowers are gorgeous, the grass a spotless green, and the atmosphere is meditative. You will not realize the time going.

a lovely contrast to Kathmandu's busy and dusty streets. It's hard to imagine you're in Kathmandu once you step inside the Garden of Dreams. It was a great surprise to find such peace and quiet in a city filled with dust, blaring car horns and motorcycles whizzing by.Garden of Dreams is an ideal spot for resting, reading, having a quiet conversation and such, if you feel like escaping the chaos of the city. It's within the Thamel district, so I found it very accessible. Entrance fee for foreigners is Rs 200 (US$ 2) and Rs 100 for Nepali citizens (US$ 1), which are fair enough prices. There's a cafe and a snack bar inside, although the food/drinks being served were quite pricey. My friend and I just opted to buy ice cream outside and just have it there inside the garden. Although Garden of Dreams is no Versailles, there's quite a lot to discover in this place as you roam the premises. I found the variety of flora and fauna interesting (there was even an Egyptian papyrus plant!) and it was fun to discover nooks and crannies. Do make sure you find the "secret" garden, which has a fountain.There are many benches within the garden premises, and people are also allowed to use mats and picnic on the grass. It's a great venue for a lazy weekend afternoon.

Tranquility next to a busy road. Located next to the busy road that leads to and from Thamel, Garden of dreams is a nice and quite place, once you get in, you feel far from the noise of the vehicles. Nice garden with a chic restaurant. I have been in this garden several times in the evening and prefer, i find it more calm and more beautiful.

Great place to have a rest. It is a great place to rest being in Kathmandu, one of very few. There is an entrance fee (don't know how much it is as I was a guest) but you should not consider it as an obstacle. It is a green area you can be relaxed and your kids can play. Very good.

A break from the Thamel traffic and shopkeepers. A small walled off and beautiful garden right in the Thamel shopping district. Only $2 USD to enter. Stroll, sit, or have lunch/snack at their small delightful cafes. This is where the lovers and families hang out for respite. After haggling on the Thamel streets for souveniers - it was nice to take a break before heading off to the hotel.

Peaceful Ambience. Its a good place to be if you want to get away from the chaos of thamel city and have some peaceful time. You can get a thin mattress from the counter to sleep or just lay down to relax and rejuvenate your tired body after a long walk around city. The ambience is really best for people who prefer to read books or to those who prefer quiet conversation whether it be with their loved one's, friends or colleagues. Coffee shop restaurant named Kaiser's cafe inside the garden premises serves excellent international quality food.

pity about the noisy kids. This could be a lovely place to spend an hour or so to escape the chaos of Thamel. There are shady benches on which to relax with a book and there is a nice cafe. Unfortunately when we were there on Sunday 25th May 2014 there was a children's party going on so the tranquility was ruined by the little darlings running around like mad things yelling at the tops of their voices. Bah, humbug! By all means go for a quiet dander, but check before you pay your rather hefty entrance fee that the tranquil experience you are expecting is not going to be ruined by a children's party.

A Peaceful Spot. Just around the corner from the busiest spot in Nepal (Thamel) lies a beautiful royal garden, were you can go sit and enjoy a quite afternoon, reading, having a cup of tea or maybe just hanging out with some friends..

A small haven of tranquility in the midst of chaotic dusty Kathmandu. Worth a visit if you are in Thamel. We walked and it is fine, safe and not too far. The problem with walking is the dust and the traffic and crossing the junction in the road we called the road of death because it looked like the traffic would never stop - but somehow we got across. On arrival it is beautiful and full of flowers, plants, trees and some small animals that I think were chipmunks. Very peaceful but it could do with the rubbish being picked up and sadly the buildings were in a pretty poor state in places and it looked a bit tired and in need of some cash being spent - but that could be all of Kathmandu. A nice break fem the madness of Thamel for an hour.

Artificial...Expensive.... From the moment we reached the garden everything seemed to very artificial. The best part was however laying on the grass with the pillows provided (though the entry fee will seem to be a little over the top for this purpose). The cafe and the bar are quite expensive so check your wallet before you decide to drink.

really... its just a garden. if u have a short time in kathmandu dont bother going therego to the stupas, crematoria and trekking....its really well mantained but i have the impression that the owners published about it here just to make it famous....
Order and peace. Small park, nicely looked after, for some rest of Kathmandu's onslaught. You have to pay an entry fee.
Nice retreat. It is a bit small but I found this to be a nice retreat from the chaos of Kathmandu. Worth a visit if you're tired of the shopping scene in Thamel

Bring a book. After 4 days in Kathmandu we wanted to find just one place for us to really relax during the day, and this was it! Brought out kindles along and lay on the provides mats along the grass, it was fantastic! Amazing that so much of the noise is cut out. Make sure you eat beforehand though as the food inside is pricey
Waste of time. Small garden overpriced restaurant not worth the time and money don't see the point to go there I spent there maybe 5 minutes including taking 2 pictures

A Paradise in the middle of chaos. When the hustle and bustle of Thamel gets a little overwhelming, grab a book and head here! After you have explored a little, find a nice spot on the grass or a garden seat under the trees and just chill...a magic place! Great spot to go and have a romantic dinner too!

The Oasis in Kathmandu. If you want to escape from the busy traffic in Thamel, here is the right place for you. The garden is beautiful, well maintenance and relax atmosphere. Food and beverage are tatety and reasonable price.

A place to take a break. If you are visiting Kathmandu I would definitly recomend going to visit the Garden of Dreams. Compared to the madness of the city it is an oasis of calm. Even if youre not interested in some of the stunning plants its a great place to come and chill even if only for an hour or so. Take a lunch and have a cute picnic.

Green Tranquility. A wonderfully clean, green, tranquil oasis in the city with lovely flowers and a very good cafe. An hour or two here helps you forget the dusty, dirty, congested city just outside the walls.
A little heaven. In a dusty and polluted Kathmand, this garden was a perfect place to relax and enjoy some peace. The restaurant in the garden is really over priced.

A peaceful and quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle of KTM. An extremely well landscaped and peaceful garden but if you are in kathmandu to experience the hustle and bustle, the culture and mingle amongst the locals then you will not find it here. This garden is situated on the edge of thamel and but still within good walking distance. It is an exclusive oasis; an area of serene greenery which contrasts with its surroundings. The ticket price is expensive, most of the visitors are foreign. I would only recommend it if you are after a good place for relaxation / a break from the constant energy of thamel. The garden itself is not big, so dont expect to be walking around for hours bring a book or your diary

Peace and quiet. In the middle of Kathmandu and right on the edge of the Thamel district The Garden of Dreams is completely cut off from the noise, smell and bustle of the streets. It's best to go with a book or a pack of cards after a your flight or trek and relax on the lawn cushions in the morning sun.
A haven. An oasisof sanity in a somewhat crazy city. Hard to believe that you're only yards away from the street!
Real Garden. This is a really Dream Garden. Nice food and staffs. Went few times with friends and they all liked the place.
oasis in the middle of thamel. great place away from the Thamel traffic and pollution. place to chill.....get a good book, restros for a quick bite.

A Quiet Place for Reflection and Peace. After two weeks of trekking and time touring the very busy Thamel district in Kathmandu, this was a fantastic place to relax and reflect before heading back home. While we were there in spring before the beauty of the summer plants, it was still so serene and well maintained, and there was stillness and serenity within the walls while the incredibly busy city carried on outside of this peaceful oasis. There is a fee to get in, but it is well worth the price.

Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful place to visit, entry is only NPR 200, but the restaurant/café was very expensive and not very good. Would recommend taking a walk/chill in the beautiful gardens then go spend your money elsewhere
perfect place to relax. A little paradise in the middle of busy Kathmandu, nice cafe, nice places to sit and relax. This is just a very beatiful little paradise

an awesome chill out place. Beautiful gardens! This is the place to go to get away from busy Kathmandu.
And that's all that really needs to be said.
(a bit more expensive though as it appears you have to pay for the peace :) )

An island in the middle of the ocean. The Garden of Dreams is a wonderful little oasis in the middle of the frenetic conurbation of Kathmandu. It is an escape from the dust and noise of the traffic and a chance to find a little bit of sanity amidst the madness of the outside world. It may not quite offer the relief of escaping the pressures of Kolkata or Mumbai, but it is, nonetheless, a welcome retreat, and it is easy to see why it is such a popular spot for young courting couples and older families who come to spend time here, especially at weekends.The area at the back of the Garden, which used to form part of the original and which is now abandoned, offers a glimpse of the past and of the enormous potential for the future. We can only hope that, one day, the entire 1.6 ha area will be restored to the standard of the current 0.5 ha. This will then become one of the great triumphs of Kathmandu.The entry fee, in 2014, was 200 rupee. The money is obviously being reinvested into the Garden and is, therefore, worth paying.
Just a garden. But it's nice to spend some time, having a fresh beer and enjoy the sun, lying on the grass (no grass in Kathmandu).It's the quitest place in the city btw
HEAVEN. An incredible, beautifully-maintained piece of paradise in the centre of the city. It seems a million miles away from the dirt, dust and chaos that is Kathmandu.
Peaceful. The perfect place to rest from the dust and noise of the Kathmandu streets after the day's sightseeing. Bring your own picnic but be prepared to share the lawn with local couples.

a nice quite place. A great place to escape the busy streets of Kathmandu. We spent more than four hours here. The garden it self is very well kept but not very big. The staff put out cushions which you can use for free to relaxon the grass - our best hours in Kathmandu. There is a bar and a cafe inside the garden but you can take your own food and drinks into the garden.
Oasis of beauty and calm in a frantic city. Food in the Kaiser Cafe was excellent and the gardens stunning, a real breath of fresh air in 'dusthmandu'

Greeney in the middle of Kathmandu. What an escape from busy. dusty Kathmandu roadsWe visited during Nepali new year and it was busy with locals on a public holiday.The gardens are beautiful and a great place to rest and have some quiet time

Inner peace amidst the masses. We had shopped until we almost dropped and then remembered The Garden of Dreams. Oh the serenity! We had a pleasant stroll then an even more satisfying lunch (very reasonably priced). We stayed for 2 hours and left refreshed and ready to face the task of just one more shop!!

Slightly overpriced. It is not a very huge garden - although beautiful inside with flowers and fountain / water body. The entrance fees is pricy and was overcrowded the day we went because of public holiday.
A little paradise in mayhem. The Garden of dreams is a hidden gem that gives a great escape from the dust and horns of Kathmandu.

A respite from the noise and dust. Go to the Garden of Dreams as a tourist site and stay because it's quiet and clean! We visited twice just to have a bit of downtime and green space. The restaurant is a bit pricey, but we had tea and enjoyed a table for an hour. The lawn is a nice place to lounge and read, if you can find a spot in the shade.
Peace. Wonderful way to spend an hour or so in the middle oy mayhem...peace, beautiful flowers, squirrels and cosy seating areas.

Beautiful. We happened across the Garden of Dreams because the palace was closed and how glad we were. It is absolutely beautiful, a photographer's paradise. I can thoroughly recommend the Kaiser Café as well.

Nice little peaceful garden. Situated next to the library, the garden of dreams makes a nice little lunch stop away from the hustle and bustle of the Kathmandu streets. The library is quite fascinating so it is good to combine the two.

Garden of Dreams. This aptly named oasis in the heart of Kathmandu is the beautifully restored garden of Keshar Mahal (or Kaiser Mahal), the lavishly adorned former palace of Field Marshal Keshar Shumsher Jung Bahadur Rana, known as "Kaiser" because of his fascination with all things German - and Adolf Hitler in particular. The palace building is now the Ministry of Education and the library houses the largest collection of books by and about Hitler in South Asia.The story is that the garden was built with Keshar's winnings from a game of cowries - a form of gambling popular at the time. There is a statue of Lakshmi, goddess of wealth, in the garden to commemorate this. The garden is set around a series of pavilions representing the six seasons of the year (yes, Nepal has six, not four seasons). There is also a restaurant in the garden, Kaiser Cafe, run by the renowned Dwarika's Hotel. The restaurant is not cheap, but then the quality of the food reflects this. Entrance fees to the garden, payable at the gate, are also high, but well worth the price. The gardens are a wonderful place to escape the bustling streets of the capital and to reflect, perchance to dream, on the glories of the past.
Fantastic food. I have read about garden of dream restaurant and I went one time for my lunch after long journey my trips. food was excellent and very peaceful place in near Thamel

A hidden oasis.. I stumbled upon this beautiful garden while walking randomly outside Thamel. It was really impressive that such garden exists amid the crazy traffic outside. Spend sometime, have a cuppa maybe and just enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.
Quiet Place. It opens at 9 am and closes at 10pm but you should go early or late as it gets busy during the day & you will miss the peacefulness & the squirrel antics. There is a cafe inside also.

Fabulous. A totally unexpected haven of beauty and tranquility in the heart of Kathmandu. An absolute must see. Apart from the catering being a little expensive, this is an absolutely wonderful place.

An oasis in which to chill out. A cheap way to get some quiet time in Kathmandu, I think the entry was about 200 NPR (and no they don't take other currencies). The gardens are serene, take a book, or buy a drink and pick up a paper - you will be transported out of pollution and into tranquility.

A little bit of peace and quiet. This beautiful, peaceful garden is being restored to its former glory. It's worth taking the time to have a meal here, relax and enjoy this little bit of quiet in the middle of this unbelievably noisy and bustling city.

Out of Kathmandu in the middle of Kathmandu. I knew this place is the romantic setting for couples in Kathmandu. I had seen in daylight and it had been a really nice, cool and quiet garden in Ktm, which sometimes gets on your nerves with its difficult and little bit messy feel. Knowing the power shortages in Kathmandu I expected the attraction of this place to go down together with the sun. I was wrong! When the lights get lit in the dark, the beautiful and classically stylish garden aalong with its cafeterias turns into a magical place. So beautiful, so romantic and so intriguing At least in December there was space for a couple of more couples to immerse in each other's company. And the mushoom soup in Café Kaiser fit well in the cool air of the night.
A space to dream.... For relaxing after a strong trekking and dream about the Himalaya ..come to the garden. Very quiet, clean and with good services.Especially we appreciated the pillows to chill...

Peaceful oasis within the gritty city of Kathmandu. Peaceful and harmonious! Quite a small garden, but a must see. Clearly a romantic meeting place for young local Nepalese couples seeking some privacy. So very pretty and well worth a visit! We did have coffee and cake, which was very nice.

For the discerning visitor only .... Clearly this wonderful cultural place doesn't appeal to some ... who would rather have a beer!(I can have a beer anywhere - and have had them in over 50 countries.)But you don't get this type of place anywhere. In large, busy, noisy, dusty, smoggy and dirty cities like Kathmandu, I haven't come across a beautiful, quiet oasis, with such lovely well-maintained gardens, a small museum/display and tastefully run restaurant. It is balm to the soul ... to those who appreciate the finer things in life. Enjoy! And by all means, have a beer too!
must see. in a place to escape from the hustle bustle of this crowded city. and there are few cafe and restaurant in this garden. although the garden are no that big
Beautiful place. Do not leave Kathmandu without going here. It is literally a "garden of dreams" transported into the middle of bustling Kathmandu. Not to be missed!

An Oasis.. What a little gem this is, easily missed as you hurry past on the way to the shops of the Thamel district but ask for it and you wont be disappointed. The gardens are lovely and very tranquil and the restaurant a bit pricey but very good. Try this one.

The Eye of the Storm. Great chillout spot in the middle of chaotic Kathmandu.
There is a restaurant and cafe but was the start of our self described walking tour so we skipped but they looked good.
Some good photo opportunities.

Lovely little spot to get away from the busy streets. So yes it cost around 2 dollars to get in but it's nice to see a lovely looked after garden in the middle of Kathmandu, with an amazing restaurant. The service was slow but was pretty relaxing so didn't mind at all. If u don't like gardens or kinda expensive food for Kathmandu the garden is not for you. But I love it!
Lovely oasis. There is a lot of pollution in Kathmandu but you can relax, read and enjoy people watching here for as long as you like for very little. And the ice creams are delicious.

go get a beer instead. absolutely nothing here you can't see elsewhere.200 rupees admission. for that you can get a bottle of beer at a liquor shop.have the same thing inside, and another 500 rupees, not including tax and service charge.and the place with all those tourists lying on the grass trying to relax certainly does not relax.

Best Place to Rest. I was there with my family after doing some shoppings around in thamel in busy street. I was searching for the place where i can get no crowed and peace, then something arrived in my mind and i have heard about the Gardens of Dream from my friends. So i went there and I find one of the best environment and i love this place.

Lovely place - great cafe. Tranquil, lovely destination in Kathmandu. All the foreigners are reading/relaxing, all the Nepali teenagers are holding hands and escaping society's eyes. Ha!Definitely worth hanging out for an afternoon - be sure to visit all the small museums in the garden. Also, a huge thunbs up to the Cafe. Run by the Dwarika group, you can expect the Nepali fare to be top notch, and it was for me. One of the best Nepali thalis I've ever had. Pro Tip: if you enjoy the cafe, don't order the non-Nepali food, it won't be nearly as tasty as the local fare.
Designed by an Austrian!!!!. This is a relaxing place in Thamel with a nice restaurant. A little expensive but good if you want to send the day lazing around. There is an entry fee.

Garden of Dreams - great place to relax. Great place to relax with reasonably priced food. We stumbled on this place by accident after a lively day in Thamel and found it a great place to relax in peaceful tranquil surroundings
nicely managed. People gathering, I had a nice time seeing people and lying in the garden, it was well managed, small photo gallery showing so many things.

A Dream of A Garden. If you want peace in a busy city then go here and walk around this stunning place.. You will not be disappointed. I have visited Glastonbury several times and the energy here is very similar to there
It's just a garden. As one of the previous reviews said, it's just a garden with nothing extraordinary. Flowers are not much as expected. They should improve if they would charge the fee like this.

Great place to be in summer !!!!!!. I have been to this garden quite few time. Every time I have visited this place I feel peace of mind. wonderful garden take a book read and relax. If they have better WIFI that will make Hugh change. If they upgrade their internet connection. I will spend even more time during weekend. I highly recommend other traveler who want have bit of relaxation. This place would disappoint you. on the side of the garden there is really nice gallery worth to visit. They need to make effort to keep clean the pool. I really enjoyed my time there. I am sure you will have good time too. Not many places left in kathmandu for cooling for the in summer.Keep it up its market Garden of Dreams.

Small garden to relax. Went there on an overcast day so didn't really get to appreciate the gardens that much. I can see that it could be a great relief to get away from the noise and bustle and just chill here with a few friends or read a book. Wouldn't rate it highly but worth a visit.

A Calm Greenery with Peace. It is one of the most wonderful places that I've seen in Kathmandu. Its a restaurant (Or maybe a bunch of them) with a huge outdoor seating arrangement. Has some sort of historical influence. Mostly crowded with couples. Old people are also observed reading books. A good place to chill or meditate.
Beautiful garden. A place to relax, read a book or just lie down on the grass.. Have lunch at Kaser cafe which is inside the garden, good food but little expensive.
not much happening. Not much to do or see but if you are wanting an hrs peace and quiet away from Thamel area this would be a good place to recharge youself.

Peaceful. After a few hours of walking around Thamel this a beautiful place to come and relax. Even though there is a busy road just over the wall it feels like you are a world away. Visited the gardens at the end of February and then again in the middle of March. It was lovely to see how the plants had progressed and I am sure in the middle of summer it would be very pretty. Had a good time just relaxing and watching the squirrels. The cafe does a very good coffee and fruit plate. If you need a break from the hustle and bustle of the Thamel streets I would recommend these gardens.

From chaos to calm............... Through a gate in a high wall, off one of the busiest roads in Kathmandu, is this oasis of calm and trnaquility. This formal and stunningly beautiful garden is laid out in classical lines with flower beds, pools, walls, and walkways. The grassed areas are provided with comfortable mats for visitors to relax upon, and there is a cafe/restaurant for those who want refreshment. But the real refreshment comes from strolling slowly through the garden, admiring the abundant flowers, and enjoying the fresher air. It is the ideal place to stop, reflect and take stock of all the myriad experiences in this amazing city.

nothing to see, wasting of money. nothing to see, it is a garden, with flowers and tree which is dirty, and basically just a garden and park, and they charge 200npr for it. I felt I was wasting my money to go in there.

An oasis of calm & beauty. A beautiful garden and restaurant in tranquil settings off the main road into Thamel (although there is a small charge to get in). Good restaurant overlooking the garden, in which we had a very pleasant leisurely lunch.

Walk the Garden of Dreams. This is a delightful attraction which is set out beautifully, wonder it slowly as there are passageways and stairs that need to be explored. They do have a restaurant, (we did not eat there, checked the prices and they were ok. Do not miss it if you go to Kathmandu.

What a dull dream. It is nice I guess, but nothing to write home about. It does make a nice spot to power nap before heading to Thamel for dinner. Went during February, the garden like rest of the Nepal vegetation was very dry and lackluster. Consider most people are only spending 1-2 days in KMandu, you should have better stuff to spend your time on.
remodelled palace garden. its located right in the city. one of the popular place for local people as well to spend some time.

Great place to relax in central Kathmandu. I have been coming here for years now. It is a one off in Kathmandu. It is clean, well kept and for being bang in the centre of the city it's incredibly peaceful and quiet. There are mats you can take to relax on the grass or just go and hideaway from the world on one of the benches in one of the corners.... Let's remember that this is Kathmandu and life here is far from perfect, so for where we are this is one of the little hidden gems.

An Unimaginative Dreamer. The name really does give you high expectations. It's a lovely garden, and a great way to escape some of the busy feel of Thamal. But it's rather small, pretty expensive (for Nepal anyhow), and doesn't really live up to any botanical gardens, or other gardens I've been to. Still, if you want a quiet place to visit, it's worth a look.
relaxing. Good place to escape and a great place to eatVery colourful with all the differnt natinalities , and very nice Nepaleze workers.

Tranquility in the middle of chaos. Relaxing and quiet attraction in the middle of chaotic Kathmandu. Entry was reasonably expensive by Nepal standards but was nice to chill for an hour or two in the beautiful surrounds. Certainly worthy of a visit, if only to escape for a while.
nice place to relax. I really loved the garden, near to Thamel, went there with my husband. So many people, couples, young teenagers, tourists... I felt a little crowd but overall nice place..

Oasis in the chaos that is Thamel. What's not to like. Grass, trees, flowering plants, birds, fountains and ostentatious architecture on the inside and utter chaos on the outside. If Thamel/Kathmandu is overwhelming you take a break here. They also have a restaurant on the grounds that we did not try but looked fine if a little expensive.

Nice but.... I only got to visit the place on the last day of stay in nepal. It was very beautiful and peaceful inside especially considering the sensory overload that is going around outside in the thamel. It has a very Greek kind of Architecture and the garden was beautiful too ( I was there in Feb, so not a lot of flowers to see but it was well kept). However, the restaurant inside was very expensive, I much prefered the Fire and Ice pizzeria right opposite of the garden.
a good time filler. it is a good time filler but it is not worth a special trip, if you are not in the area. We didn't eat there so I am not sure about the quality of the restaurant.

I spent 3 days here. The garden of dreams is perfect for a quiet read and escape from the crazy Thamel streets. For 200 rupees, once you're in you wouldn't believe that the main road is right next door. Take a picnic, a good book and chill.

Little piece of sanity in the city. The place is great. Full of locals and tourists alike - seems to be a popular date destinations for the locals and a chance to catch a breath for the tourists not used to the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu.Pity there is an entrance charge but 200 rupee is a small price to pay.

Not so fantastic. Reviews for the place was quite good some how, pictures were indeed attractive. However, as i went in, i was surprised, the garden was really small, not much to see, I covered the whole place in like 15 minutes. It does nice architecture and buildings, great place for a wedding photoshot though...but if you have visited some of the gardens in Europe or US or even Asia, you can probably give this a miss

Great, but not spectacular.. I was hoping to see a huge garden filled with flowers and cute white benches just like in a dream, but i got disappointed. Especially after paying the tickets. Make no mistake, the garden is beautiful, yes! but it was rather small and there's just no stand-out points. It is perfect for reading in the afternoon with sandwiches and tea, but definitely not for a tourist sight-seeing.
small peace of heaven. This garden is very quite, all the outside noise is reduced by the surrounding walls. The food is a bit expensive though!
Garden of Dreams. This is an oasis of peace and quiet within the hustle and bustle of cars and people outside! The entry fee is not exorbitant...

Oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. A wonderful place!! It's a sheer delight to walk into such a peaceful garden after being in the noisy streets outside. The gardens are well looked after, there are places to sit and relax, the Kaiser café is very good. $2 entry, and well worth it.

Quiet in the middle of chaos. Lovely garden, with a very quiet and nice (yet expensive) restaurant. Great if you have some extra time and want to read a book, relax or plan the rest of your tour... Very well kept and clean!

Lush, peaceful garden in bustling city. The Garden of Dreams was actually our first 'site' upon arrival in Kathmandu. We walked about 10 minutes from our hotel, Hotel Shanker. We were not very pleased about the high entry fee, particularly not knowing the size of the garden. However, it is a gorgeous garden full of flowers, water features, and creatures such as fish, birds, squirrels, and monkeys. Inside one of the buildings is an exhibit of photographs showing the refurbishing that the garden has undergone over the years. There is a large area for people to lay down to relax or sleep, a swing, and cafe for refreshments. Our children really enjoyed the beautiful garden.
Best place in the heart of Thamel. Really nice garden and good restaurant with excellent food. I went to Kathmandu many times and even didn't imagine that there is such nice place Kathmandu.

Lush - an oasis of calm in a busy place. It was well worth the entrance fee to go in and look around in such a beautiful and calm place. It was so pretty and clean. The restaurant on site is not cheap, but it is excellent food. Highly recommended!!!

nice calm relaxing place. As the title suggests, it is a nice, calm, and relaxing place. Great place to take some touristy photographs too. Nothing much else to do though, so an hour is the max you should allocate for the visit.

Relaxing spot. After a tiring day of sightseeing, we went to Garden of Dreams to chill down and we really enjoyed it. The gardens are very beautiful, nice landscaping and a old-good-times feeling to it. There is a bar and a restaurant that remain open till around 10 at night, though expensive by Thamel standard, they have good quality food and drinks.

Not Worth the Visit. We don't particularly like the place too much, because it's just another western garden, nothing special. Just in a place like Kathmandu, it might be specially quiet and clean...that's all.The restaurant inside was pretty good, but overpriced because of its location. And for people who want to dine there, they have to pay the entrance fee as well - which I don't really understand why.

This garden doesn't deserve the word "dream". Common, nothing more nothing less. The ticket is very expensive for that garden. No interest, quite annoying. A lot of nepalese loudly and noisy people and they don't pay the same price than yours...for the same visit!!!! to say the least
Nice garden. The garden was nice, althou its wintertime most of the trees have no leaves, the staff said its prettier during summer when all of the trees are green.
Stunning. Stunning gardens, definitely worth spending some time here. There is lovely café inside the Garden of Dreams. Have a cup of tea, and watch the world go by.

Not that well tended. When we were there it was crowded with young adults or students. I was told they were attempting to apply for visas/jobs outside of Nepal. Maybe I didn't wander in far enough, but what I saw of the gardens was mediocre compared to most gardens I have seen.

My favourite place in KTM!. Spending so much time trapped in Thamel it's so nice to be able to escape it for a moment or afternoon in the garden of dreams. Super expensive if you want to go to the café/restaurant, but reasonable entry fee and so nice to hang out! Love it!

A peaceful haven in the midst of the choas of Kathmandu. A peaceful, unexpected haven in the midst of the bustling Kathmandu. Take a book and lay in the gardens and enjoy the serenity before tackling the chaos again..

Oasis in the middle of Chaos. A beautiful oasis in an otherwise smoggy, dusty, chaotic city. You can rent some mats and pillows and relax, read and just escape all day. I went with a group of friends I met at my hostel and it was hands down the best day I spent in Kathmandu.

Quite space. In the middle of the chaos is the Garden of Dreams. It was hard to believe just behind the wall is a crazy and busy Kathmandu. It was a beautiful and peaceful place to hang out if you just needed some peace.

An extraordinary relaxing oasis in the middle of a crazy city :). It is a great place to relax. I went there with the intention to spend a few hours, but I ended up staying the whole day. It's really nice to just sit around and read, have a picknik, or just enjoy the tranquility after the craziness of Kathmandu. Although it's not huge, there are some nice "hidden" and quiet corners inside, where it's just great to relax. Just get a good book, some snacks and fruits, and you're good for the whole day. They even have wifi inside, for those who can't leave the phone aside (although it's a pity to surf the web, one should just enjoy the place). It's great even for a nap :)

Beautiful garden. We had a lovely time at the garden of dreams. The entrance fee was reasonable for what you got. We didnt believe we were still in Thamel! It is so peaceful and beautiful behind the gates with grass, architecture and water arrangements. It wasnt too busy so we could walk around peacefully and take photos. There are big cusions out for visitors to sit on which was a nice addition. We sat in the sun for a few hours relaxing. The big swing was cool and we had a few shots on that before leaving. Definately worth a visit!
Small and expensive. There is nothing interesting to see inside, better use your money to drink a coffee elsewhere rather than paying the entry fees.

Avereage. I had never been to The Garden of Dreams, and I have been to Kathmandu many times.On my last trip a friend suggested that we go and have an evening meal there.Yes-It was a peaceful retreat and we witnessed a few young lovers smooching in the shadows.We dined at the restaraunt and I ordered pork schnitzels and associated vegetables.The food was pretty average-but Hey I am spoilt at home with my wife being Czech and schnitzels being one of her specialities.In short, I would say that The Garden of Dreams is woth a visit but needs to lift its game to woo me back.

Green Haven. A lovely lush garden to relax in and unwind in this busy city - it is a real oasis. Many varieties of plants and trees, always something in bloom, fountains and interesting architecture as well. You can laze on grassy areas with free mats and cushions - this is a haven for young couples as it is one of the few places where PDA are acceptable! We enjoyed the gardens, but found the restaurant to be overpriced and not good value for money - took ages to get served. My advice is take your own picnic, you're sure to find a nice spot to enjoy it.

Beautiful place, nice food. Garden of dreams is really a beautiful place. It is managed by Dwarikas group. So obviously food would have been great and I was not disappointed. I really enjoyed the food and its view. Nice and beautiful place
Oasis in the chaos of the city. Great place for locals and travellers alike. An escape from the chaos of Kathmandu. Serene and peaceful surroundings.

Nice, quiet enclave in the city. Beautiful garden setting contains the Kaiser Cafe, an upscale restaurant. A spot for amorous Nepali coupels to come hang out so sometimes you feel like an intruder! Entrance fee of $2.00 pp even to eat at the restaurant.

An aptly named oasis. NRP 200 (= USD 2) for adults/NRP 100 (=USD 1) for kids.
A great place to just chill .... bring a book/a picnic and chill. There are mats/pillows freely available and there is a mix of tourists and locals. The cafe is good - prices are definitely geared towards tourists.

Tranquil gardens in the middle of chaos. Brilliantly restored garden in the heart of the busy city. Tankful,y due to the high walls surrounding these gardens the noises of the city were completely shut off.
Very tranquil gardens, and with an entry cost of ~2$us it shouldn't be missed. A nice place to visit for meditation or just some time out.

An Oasis in Thamel. Worth the visit, at minimum, to get rid of the noise, traffic, horns and dust of Thamel. Am beautiful garden, a peaceful place. Worths going in the daylight and coming back to see the gardens at night.

Dreams are the word. Thank you! a haven in a crazy place where you can sit and relax in a nice garden with some areas to sit in or have a cup of tea. It is well looked after and 200 rupees to get in. Everyone who went there loved it and it takes you away from the madness of katmandu- well done Austria embassy.

Nothing special ..... If you are staying at a backpacker's hostel and need a place to relax on some grass then this might be the place to visit. It is a small garden and they have some grassy areas with cushions for patrons to sit on. Bring a picnic lunch or dine at the cafe. We were disappointed however, and thought the gardens would be more expansive showcasing the local flora and fauna. Oh well.

Bleh! BORING!. This garden is nothing but a place for lovers to make out. Went there at around 5-6 in the evening. All that was happening was couples cozing up to each other in corners or on benches. There is one room with photo's of different flowers, a cafe and that's it. Waste of money and time.
Most relaxing place in Kathmandu. Garden of Dreams is the most relaxing place in Kathmandu and definitely worth a visit. Good place to spent a couple of hours at the end of your holiday.

Beautiful oasis. This place was a great find in Kathmandu, it's amazing now quickly you can leave the chaos of the city behind. The gardens are beautiful and so peaceful. Had some food and beers here which were all good quality and with high service. This place is well worth a visit.
One of the most beautiful garden parks in the world!. It is simply brilliant in its simplicity and beauty, and perfectly attended...do please go and pay the $2 entry - you will not be dissapointed.

Great place to escape too. Wow, rated num 5? Don't know about that, but I liked this place for its closeness to Thamel, well maintained gardens and fountains, less people here so no crowds, and dust free environment!
Nice gardens and grounds!

dreams. a beautiful public garden, probably the only on of its kind in nepal, well restored and maintained. the evening l;laying around in the garden is total fun. the food and the bar is also excellent. needless to say, the ambiance is created through contributions of small and well thought of components in the garden.

The most inspiring garden in Nepal. Best to see it after sunset (if electric power is supplied!). if you go during the daylight, I suggest you to bring a book with you, take a nepalesee tea, and just relax (could't imagine outside it's Kathmandu!)

Overrated and underwhelming. Amazed that this is ranked as the 5th best attraction on TripAdvisor. It's a pleasant escape from the city- that's about it. It really isn't that stunning, but perhaps a nice place to take a book and read for a few hours. With all the incredible sights in Kathmandu, I'm surprised this place even gets a mention. Entrance is $2.
Small, Expensive, Worth Visiting. Like everyone else wrote, it's a relaxing place, but we thought that the costs for tourists and also for local are high.

Former formal garden. Partially restored (about a third the original area). Pleasant refuge from the bustle (if not the din) of Thamel, but there is an admission fee, and the garden was not that special.

Not worth the money. We were enticed by the "oasis" reputation of this garden away from the bustle of Kathmandu and while that is true, the garden is very small, and unless you want to watch amorous Nepali couples making out, it really isn't worth the entrance fee. There were a few folks just hanging out on the lawn so maybe its OK on a warm day but we would have been happier on our hotel rooftop.

Beautiful place to relax. I enjoyed the garden of dreams so much I went back for a second time just to chill out and read a book. It is a great place to escape from the hustle and bustle. We enjoyed lunch at the Kaiser Cafe inside the gardens but it was quite expensive.

Pleasant but alienating. Pleasant green place, but felt uncomfortably alienated from the surroundings. A bit small and full of tourists laying and chatting around. If you are a keen nature appreciator, than highly recommended. Other than that, don't waste your 200 rupees at entrance. Wifi is available but paid per hour.
Dream Island in the Heart of Kathmandu !!. Great well kept gardens - wonderful Resturants - well spend two hours - great place fr loads of wonderful pictures !!

chill out area. this is a very nice area to relax if your looking for somewhere quite in Thamel,it cost 200r entrance and it has a cafe and toilets inside,yoga mats layed out on the grass and a bamboo swing,and you can hardly notice the beeping horns from outside....

get-away in Kathmandu. On the streets its really busy, cars, people, street shops everywhere.
The garden of dreams is a place to relax, read a book, spent 3 hours with your love. just go there, for only 200rs

Beautiful. I loved walking around this secret garden, an oasis in the heart of Kathmandu. Definitely eat here. It wasn't expensive but felt very luxurious sitting on a veranda overlooking the beautiful flowers and ponds.
Peace admid chaos. Well worth a visit especially if you're feeling a little overwhelmed by the noise and traffic - it's quiet and peaceful and walled off from the rest of Kathmandu

Lovely and tranquil. It is a beautiful and tranquil garden set amongst the craziness of Thamel, however if you are visiting Nepal I am not sure this would necessarily be your best stop. If you are in Thamel for a while you might enjoy the chance to get away from the hustle and bustle, but it is not at all typical of Nepal or a reflection of their local culture.

Great Food and Service!. Prices were extremely high for Kathmandu, but beef is imported and food was great!! Service was excellent. I was prepared for slow service after reading other reviews but our food came out very quickly.

One of my favourites!. Be sure to bring a good book to read, as they lay out mattresses and pillows upon which you can rest and enjoy the beautiful gardens. Check out the hidden garden inside the wall, but bring your own food and drink. It's expensive to eat at the restaurant there.

Romantic at Night. The garden is illuminated very well in the evenings. We visited in the end of November, so the nights are a bit cool but it was nice to stroll through the unique garden. The garden itself has a very European feel to it. If you get thirsty or hungry there are two places inside to accommodate your needs. Big thumbs up.

An oasis in Thamel. The gardens are lovely- given that you are in KTM. The restaurant is average, try to get a table in the beAutiful old part of the building. Have a cocktail in the bar at the other end of the garden.

Nice garden, just little bit kitch, expensive enterance. This is very nice garden just beside the main street. It's excellent place to relax. Some of the decoration is bit kitchy, but doesn't matter. Only real problem is enterance of 500 Rs for westerners. That's way too much. Restaurant inside is very good.

Tourist Relaxation. A peaceful place that is ideal for relaxation and quiet reading, the garden has a variety of suitable spots to spend a few minutes or hours. There is an entrance fee for westerners of 200 rupees--and you can buy a number of passes for reduced rates if you plan to frequent the place. Although it remains free for locals, it's very very rare to see Nepali people inside (unless they are employed inside the garden). This strictly a spot for tourists just down the street from the Thamel tourist hotel, restaurant, and shopping mecca.
A good place to get away. It's a good place to see some green in a dusty city like Kathmandu. Beware... anyone who looks western is required to pay a 200 rupee entrance fee.

Tranquil Haven in Kathmandu. The Garden of Dreams is a beautiful place to visit and to sit under trees and by lakes and ponds. Look out for concerts that are arranged there too and visit the cafe/restaurant.

OMG, how awesome is ot that there are places like it!. Tired of noisy amd dusty Thamel? Have had your riksha, hashish, tiger ball, pashmina etc? Need some time to relax and enjoy the sun? Or want to lie down on grass and read the book? Thats why i tried to get to Garden of Dreams everyday...
Quit Place in Bustling town!!!. We had visited this Garden of dream feb 2013.Though had a good time to enjoy in Garden.Cafe serve nice food .Quit place in bustling city.

A welcome place for time out. This is the place to go when the hustle of Kathmandu gets too much. I spent 3 wonderful afternoons unwinding in this oasis of tranquility. There are matresses and bolsters available to make that nap more comfortable and the cafes serve nice food, although a little more expensive than in most of Thamel. Wifi is available at a small additional cost anywhere in the garden and is reasonably fast. I don't think I would have survived 5 days in Kathmandu without this bolt hole.

calm location in the middle of the bustling city. calm location in the middle of the bustling city.very nice garden.entry fee is worthwhile paying if one has time to enjoy the great garden.Not for a rushed lunch. take your time and a book!nice restaurant with good food.
Excellent Campari and soda!. Spent 2 lovely afternoons in the gardens - it is so relaxing after the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu and the bar upstairs is just lovely as the sun goes down!
An Oasis in KTM. Tucked behind the walls is a peaceful beautifully restored garden. Stroll around or bring your book and a few hours to escape the craziness of Thamel.
wicked litel chilling spot. a hidden stunning resting place defo worth a visit !!! close to shopping area and main hotels. nearby great coffee shop
An Oasis in Chaos!. Great place to pause and take a rest from the chaos of Kathmandu. Beautiful garden & looked like nice cafe.
Serene. Nice change from the traffic & busyness of the rest of the city. Kaisers cafe Food provided by the dwarika group is more expensive, but appreciated western cuisine.

Visit if you have the extra time. A pity that this Garden of Dreams did not really live up to its dreams. I visited early in the morning at 9am just before my flight departure. The place is a small compound and is a bit run down. There isn't really much to see. A relatively quiet place and perhaps pleasant for dating couples. The swing seems to be an iconic feature in Nepal (I have not seen it anywhere else except Nepal). It's amazing how sturdy it can be for 2 persons standing on it. One gets relive his/her childhood happy moments...

Oasis of calm. Having walked passed the entrance many times on a previous visit to Kathmandu and with a couple of hours to spare my wife suggested we give it a try. It is a delightful oasis hidden behind tall walls from the chaotic traffic outside. Just 200 rupees to enter. A bargain!Take your time and just enjoy the flowing water features, the beautifully laid out lawns and gardens. Explore the small gallery explaining how the pavilion was almost demolished, but saved at the last moment, to be restored to it's current grandeur. The only negative ... the price of the meals/drinks in the restaurant was rather expensive, especially for Kathmandu. However we did treat ourselves to some lemon cheesecake, which was probably the best we'd ever tasted!!
Well worth a visit. ... especially if you're 'templed out'. Handy for Thamel, quiet and very green. Good escape from it all.

a serene place to visit in a busy city. Brilliant little place -originally went only for a drink and some wifi internet but ended up having a meal there as it was so lovely and peaceful. It was evening when I visited so didnt really see the gardens properly but could tell they were lovely with water features.

A haven of peace. This is a really wonderful oasis of peace and quiet. And in Kathmandu you really need that at times. The gardens were beautiful and the Kaiser cafe great but really expensive. In the evening this place turns really magical when lights are turned on.

peaceful garden with open-air restaurant. We enjoyed our afternoon at the Garden of Dreams- it is walled off and has a 200 rupee entrance fee, but was still quite crowded on the weekend we visited. We explored the paths, the little museums, and really enjoyed our lunch at the gardenside cafe.

A beautifully quiet Oasis. If you want an hour or two away from the hustle bustle of Kathmandu, this is a wonderful place to relax amongst the beautifully kept gardens, ponds and lawn. The Flower beds are immaculately kept and against the white of the surrounding buildings gives an air of days gone by. An added bonus is watching the Chipmunks racing around digging for food and other snippets. The Cafe / Restaurant although more expensive than the local Cafes serve a fine selection of food. It is a must visit place if you're in Thamel.

hipster paradise. don't bother visiting this place, it's full of neo-hippie couples playing guitar and reading obscure books wearing hemp flip-flops. it's not even a pretty garden either, compared to what it looked like before it was restored it even felt sterile and boring.

Lovely spot; so-so food. Beautiful gardens, well kept, obviously a hangout place for couples and those wishing to find a spot of peace and quiet in Kathmandu. Food was mediocre. We had a group of 15 and reservations and it was still mind numbingly slow.

Hangout spot. Found this hidden gem at the end of our trip. Lovely to just sit on the supplied mats and enjoy the locals, that's right. The only place where you can see giggly young Nepalese teens going on there first date. Next to that it's a great place to just read a book and enjoy this well maintained piece of peace.

Green Park Amidst Dusty Kathmandu. Despite the history, it's basically a huge, beautiful complex with Edwardian mansion, and a calming pool, and a big lawn for picnic, and all that's dreamy and pretty. A great park within the dusty Kathmandu, I must say. It serves well for locals and tourists, and of course pre-wedding photography. The squirrels are cute, too. The only thing off is the noise from the street.

If Kathmandu air pollution is getting to you, this might help slightly. 200 rupees for entry, if you're going in to take photos then don't even bother. 200 rupees is better spent on Thali. Very mediocre, I tried to take photos but none are worthy to be kept in the grand scheme of things when compared to the rest of Nepal. For a conservative country many couples come here to make out, a lot of tourist come here to lay on the grass and read although all the flies usually ruin that. Only plus side is this place has slightly less air pollution.

Definitely pay it a visit. This is a great place to go on your last day or in the last days of your travels in Nepal - Nepal is a crrrrrazy place with so much happening and everything happening at once. Here you can lay down in the garden with a good book, enjoy a pleasant day under the trees and away from the thick black traffic smoke of Kathmandu. Come hither for a relaxing afternoon.

Beautiful garden in the midst of chaos. This was such a pearl in the midst of a chaotic, busy district that is full of cars and exhaust. You have to pay to enter and there were very lettle flowers blooming when I was there but the landscaping and statuary was something out of a fairytale. Nice place to take a date. I was with by buddy Phil... Two guys in a romantic garden... Nice garden but wrong partner. No offense Phil...

Perfect Oasis. The Garden of Dreams – wow what a beautiful spot amid the mayhem of Thamel in Kathmandu. The Garden is a tranquil, peaceful place where you can take a picnic and a good book and just relax in the quiet atmosphere. It was created in early 1920 with a beautiful mix of fountains, pavilions, pergolas, ponds etc, but after the death of its creator, the garden was handed over to the Nepali Government and left to go into decline. Between 2000 and 2007 extensive restoration took place thanks to the Austrian Government who provided the necessary funding, and today we see this magical garden in all its glory. Don't miss it.

Garden of dreams. The best time to visit this place is in the evening while all the lights are turned on, not as big as expected, well kept grounds and a very expensive restaurant within the gardens. The evening view gives the gardens am eccentric feel and look. Worth the 200 rupees entrance fee but not a must see destination of kathmandu
Amazing place!. A quiet retreat from the loud streets of Kathmandu- loved the serenity and gardens. We enjoyed our food and they had great coffee!
A quiet place to relax after crazy Thamel.. A nice park close to Thamel. Good to relax, Internet and Kaiser Cafe has excellent continental food.

oasis in the middle of crazy Thamel. for 200 rupees to enter, this was a nice place to visit. It is a restored garden which is nice to walk around in. There is a cafe that is in there ,but it is quite expensive. There is not much to see besides the nice garden, but they put mats out on the lawn and we layed out in the sunshine and took a siesta! That in itself was worth it b/c everyone needs a short break from Thamel. You can also get wifi for 50 rupees an hour if you want. It would be a nice place to buy some lunch and enjoy it inside the garden

The garden is pleasant. I had seen in tripadvisor.com that the garden is considered one of the top sites in Katmandu (which is why I spent my last two hours in Katmandu there) but I think that's mainly because it's quiet and Katmandu isn't. Personally, I prefer a temple court in Thamel, even though there I would be besieged by guides and peddlers and by noise. The garden is pleasant but not why I choose to visit Katmandu.

really stunning gardens. This is a really nice place to call in to, very peaceful behind the walls and away from the tumult of the Kathmandu chaos outside. Inside is a really nice (if expensive) café where you can sit and watch the lovely gardens from, too.

Gorgeous & Peaceful. Set in the midst of a crazy street and area of the city, this quiet hide-away is gorgeous and peaceful. So if you want to picnic, or read a book, or rest, or see green plants and freest, this could be your place! It's superb! Watch out for couples making out…but besides this you want regret it!

A quiet place in the chaos. Hidden behind walls you would think you were miles away from the chaos that is Kathmandu. Beautifully restored and well maintained gardens and buildings it is a lovely place to sit, read and re-invigorate before going back on the streets to face the hawkers and the traffic.

Quaint and Quiet. A nice quiet spot to relax in the heart of Kathmandu. Worth a visit, especially as it's only 200Rs to enter (about $2). They provide mats with a cyclindrical pillow rest as well, so you can sit in the sun or shade and enjoy a book. Miraculously quiet place considering it's location!

It's all true!. I can only confirm the opinions of the last few contributors. After fighting your way through the crowds and traffic of Kathmandu, the walled Garden of Dreams is an oasis of calm and quiet. The entry fee of 200 Rupees (100 Rupees for 70's and over) is well worth it. We had lunch in the small cafe near the main restaurant, and were totally satisfied. Like most things in Nepal (except the motorbikes) it's not fast, but who would want to rush in such a serene atmosphere. We spent the whole morning there. Highly recommended.

Dream like. This garden built over hundred years ago is like a secluded heaven in the heart of the city. Kathmandu does not boast of any good park. But this small jewel makes it up for all. there is an excellent, and rather expensive, restaurant in the premises.
Quiet and nice place. It's quiet and calm, almost unbelievable to find a place like this in the middle of kathmandu, but it's not really big.

A wonderful oasis in this busy city. Walk thro' the door in the wall and leave the busy traffic behind you. What a wonderful garden to wander round and relax. If you have time, and you should, then relax with lunch and a beatiful view of the park. I can't belive a gem like this was hidden behind these walls !!

OASIS!. It's like an oasis in a busy city full of pollution, Kathmandu. I really liked this place since the air inside was much fresher than outside, the main street to Thamel.
