I felt really peaceful and relax. There's much less dust and noise. It's really a good place for reading, taking nap, eating, or whatever. I just loved this place!
Peaceful Garden. An oasis of peacefulness and beauty in the midst of mayhem, dust and noise that is Kathmandu. Walls all around keep the noise down.
Oasis in the middle of the caos. Very nice restaurant, some what overpriced. Nice garden, too crowded to relax, but much better than the rest of the city.

peaceful land in crowd city. As i live in thamel, thamel is very crowd , rush, and noisy. if you are irritate with vehicle noise, pollution and loud music you just can go to dreams of garden and relax. i often go there with my favorite books or with gadget. A good place to go.

Garden of Dreams is a haven. This lovely garden has a wonderful history and has been lovingly restored by a master gardener and maintained. The pavilions are peaceful and just a short walk from the madness of Thamel.
little island in Kathmandu. it's one of the best place in Kathmandu, if you want to take a rest. It's realy peacful amd quiet. IT's so green and nice. If you have some hours just visit this place!:)

Peaceful. If you need some quite time and break from the chaos of Kathmandu this is the place to go. It is a beautiful garden with plenty of places to sit and relax. It is like walking into another world. The restaurant/cafe is expensive but you can bring your own pick nick and blanket and have a great time.

Nice, but small and very expensive. It's a nice place, but very small and the food is much to expensive. The small garden is nice and well kept. For the restaurant you must pay a ticket? The food is good but much to expensive.

Peaceful!. Kathmandu is crazy busy! This is a nice place to escape that chaotic environment. It costs 2 USD to get in, but it's worth it. The gardens are beautiful. I would recommend coming only when you can spend about a half day and just read or soak up the environment. One of best places in the city. So peaceful!

A little heaven in the center of Kathmandu. I was on my way to visit the Royal Palace and stumbled into this place which I didn't know about. It was a revelation. Beautiful gardens and a peaceful arena where you can sit for meditation or just lie down and enjoy the surroundings. There a very good restaurant on site as well.
Nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. beautiful garden setting, nice and cool and great food, nice place to chill out and escape the crazy city.

A great place to visit and relax. The garden of dreams was lovely ad people were lying around on the grass on the mats provided enjoying solitude away from the streets of Kathmandu. Food at the restaurant was great too.
Enjoy your lunch. Its Ranas,, the rulars of past Nepal, home gurden ussed to be veraitys of Books found and lovely gurden as well, near Thamel the tourist hubs,eassy walk shouldnot misse it..
Relaxing day. If you have a spare day to relax, bring a book and a blanket. It will be a relaxing day for you to recharge your batteries and take a break from the crazy streets of Kathmandu

don't waste your money. you have to pay to sit in a garden, pay for WiFi That is free in any back street café. Restaurant expensive and extremely slow. This is not the place to see for an authentic Kathmandu experience.

Best coffee and cake in town!. Visited and stayed for hours just taking in the beauty of the gardens and the quietness. Especially after all the hussle and bussle of Kathmandu it was a very welcome place of peace and rest. The coffee and Sachertorte cake was amazing!

An Oasis in the City. We heard about this from some members of the group we were travelling with and, although it isn't signposted the best, it was well worth the effort to find. It really is an Oasis in the middle of the City and wonderful distraction from the hustle and bustle, even the constant tooting from the traffic outside was muted! Unfortunately due to time spent trying to locate it we only got to spend about an hour in the gardens, but you could easily spend a good half day just lazing about.So cheap for entry and would be prepared to pay more if it assisted in renovating the rest of the building & library to what was once a palatial building.Definitely not to be missed when in Kathmandu.

Pure Tranquility. After a full day fighting our way through busy tourist 'must see's as well as noisy and very dusty streets of Kathmandu. This was a heavenly and relaxing break surrounded by beautiful gardens and bird song. Also the local amorous teenagers certainly use the camouflage to their advantage which was amusing to us!The restaurant is a definite must, coffee and cake is excellent.A great relaxing way to end a busy day!

tranquility away from the hussle of Thamel. nice place and a bit of tranquility. Nice to chill out for an hour or so after a hard days sightseeing / shopping. Recommend that you don't go as the sun is setting due to mosquitos

a haven inside Katmandu. in the thamel district this small but beautifully manicured garden is a great place to chill out. The restaurant there has a small set menu but all the dishes are very well prepared. For traditionalists, they also offer "high tea" which is an old English custom of tea with scones, and pastries. For Nepal this place is a bit expensive, but worth a visit and a meal before you leave Kathmandu.
You can still hear the noise. That said it was nice to visit and have a cold coffee. Interesting place and well kept. The should refurbish the buildings and make it a nice hotel.

Great retreat. This is a great place to go and get away from the hussle and bussle of the city. Very relaxing and tranquil. We stumbled upon this place on a hot and sunny day, and had a great time chilling in the garden and drinking teas and coffees.

Chilling in a pocket of calm. This garden is a wonderful little spot of tranquility right on the edge of Thamel and noise! It's 200 rupees to get in, but you can sit on the lawn with a picnic for as long as you like.Currently in Dasian, there is also a massive bamboo swing!
Charming Garden, very very poor resto services. nice garde, an oasis for a rest !!!!!We (a group) were disappointed with the resto - I waited 2 hours for a capuccino + apple pie ;-(cheers

An oasis in a busy city. A great place to get away from the chaotic and busy city of Kathmandu. This place is very peaceful and tranquil, and for getting some quiet "down time". We had lunch at the Kaiser Café and sat outside under a pergola, which we found quite enjoyable. The food from our point of view, was reasonably priced. There were "gluten free" options on the menu which pleased my wife. We would certainly go back.

Slice of Heaven. You enter the gardens and you immediately start to relax after the bustle of the streets of Kathmandu. There are mats and bolsters to lay on or you can just wander around the beautiful gardens. Cost 200 rupees to get in and open till 10 at night
A pocket of stillness. Loved it, such a quiet place very tranquil and I walked around the gardens and had a beer at the restaurant.

Great dining experience. We had a group of 5 and enjoyed dinner in the restaurant at Gardens of Dreams. Lovely gardens with interesting plants that are lit up at night, we dined alfresco, service was a little slow, prices were a little high......would I go back........you bet.

garden but no dreams. a pleasant walled garden area, with walkways and a good range of interesting plants, bushes and trees - suitable for tea or to sit and watch the other visitors, often young couples, presumably getting away from things...but was not particularly impressed.
Restaurant. In order to get to the restaurant you have to pay for the garden tour. But if you eat at the restaurant they will not re-embers you for the admission. Strange

a little heaven,but unreal. the Garden of dreams is an old Rana property just in front of the royal palace,at the entrance of Thamel area.it is definitely a very pleasant place, well kept,which can give an idea of the lifestyle of this famous family who ruled Nepal for about 100 years.the restaurant is decent ,but overpriced.places like that are made for the sort of upperclass residents,working in Embassies and "Umanitarian" organizations,people who don't like to mix with the commoners and live apart from the real country.for this reason there I feel "out of the real world",staying in a sort od Disneyland ,and i do not enjoy it.

Heaven. Tranquility in the centre of bustling Kathmandu! Spent a few hours here lying on the cushions reading a book, taking strolls around every now and again to admire the ponds, trees and other sights

The most common dating spot in Kathmandu. Garden of dreams is the first name that comes to anybody's mind when looking for best dating spot in Kathmandu. Good place in heart of city. Just the disappointment was restaurant over there were over priced.

Beautiful oasis of tranquility from the hubbub outside!. A beautiful oasis of calm and tranquility behind the high walls that separate it from the busy roads and traffic of Tamal. Good plants, some interesting species of trees with plenty of areas where a visitor,and local alike, can take five on the grass or on one of the many benches.Would definitely recommend.
Peaceful Place. This garden is a real oasis in Kathmandu. The restaurant inside serves delicious food and great coffee and desserts.

Majestic retreat. Tranquil garden beside the former Royal Palace. Lots of statues and water features, and a terrific restaurant/cafe for coffee or the works. Bordered by crazy roads and the sounds of motorbikes honking their horns this is the best place to relax with a book, rest on the grass, or while away time taking photographs. Many exotic plant species too. Don't be put off by talk of an entrance fee. There is one but it is only 200 rupees (ie 20 cents Australian).

Kaiser Cafe has (surprisingly) amazing food!. It IS like a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of Thamel. Rest in the garden with a book, and have lunch here. It isn't "typical" Kathmandu, but you can people watch as some of the locals come here to have some "privacy" - you can see lots of local couples sitting on park benches. Lots of tourists as well, but it's worth experiencing a great value lunch (more expensive back in Sydney Botanical Gardens) to soak in the romantic history and the local romantics. :)

Ideal place to have a break in busy Kathmandu. We were there several times to catch a break from noise, traffic and dust in the centre of Kathmandu. It was also a perfect place for our son to have his afternoon nap. Many other babies, local and foreign, were also crawling there and were amused by birds and golden fish. The garden looks well-maintained and clean. However, the bathroom in the garden is dirty. We liked the museum that has a collection of photos of how the garden looked before and now. Having a small pond and fountains is also a plus. There are many couples of college students there having a date or studying, please be aware that benches are occupied at almost all times, you have to have a look for an empty one. The entrance is 200 rupee. If you go only to Kaiser Cafe that is located in the garden you still have to pay 200 rupee. Overall, we enjoyed our time in the garden and miss our pomelo tree. Good memories.

A quiet and serene spot!. I like the way the gardens have been designed and that this space has been made available to the public. There is a small entrance fee, which I did not consider to be an issue. It was a nice serene location which allows you to have a relaxed dinner. I had supper there with a friend and considered the food and service to be good. Prices are more in line with hotel prices, but not over the top. A worthwhile alternative whilst in Kathmandu

Serene and very beautiful. Quite an interesting place to be, especially because it’s in the neighbourhood of Thamel, which otherwise is very crowded place and full of shops, vendors and hustle and bustle of typical back-packer's hub. The Garden of Dreams is serene with a pond in centre and four different monuments in four opposite sides. The sculptures are influenced by European garden and the ambience is spectacular. We visited there in late afternoon and stayed there till it was dark. The lighting placement was very creative and made it worth staying there till late.Tip: You could carry light snacks; arrive in daylight and if possible stay until the place glows in light (interesting for night photography fanatics)

My place of Dreams. The Garden of Dreams, is a neo-classical historical garden situated in Kathmandu, Nepal. It consists of 6,895 square meters of gardens with three pavilions, an amphitheater, central ponds, pergolas, and urns.

A Peaceful and Quiet Oasis. This garden and beautifully trimmed lawns provides a peaceful and serene setting to spend a few hours at. There are yoga mats and pillows provided and many benches the allow you to relax and enjoy the views. It's a nice place to retreat to when you are constantly dealing with the smog, noise, and traffic of Katmandu. For 2000 rupees, it's a bargain. Yes, the restaurant is spendy for Nepal but certainly was delicious and the service was excellent! Suggestion: perhaps bring your own blanket/towel to sit on as the mats provided fill up fast.

Beautiful Peace and Quiet from the craziness of Nepal. This is the only place to get away from the craziness of nepal's streets for some peace and quiet. It's a beautiful if small garden with an area for relaxation and lying down, complete with soft, yoga-type mats and headrests. 200 rupee entrance definitely worth it. The restaurant on the south side is a bit expensive but you can also get takeaway stuff on the opposite side, and actually the food in the restaurant is delicious.
Sight?. Not worth the effort despite the hype. I expected more, but sadly disappointed. Can't say much more as it was less than a good garden.

Get away from the traffic. This is such a calm place to spend an afternoon. So relaxing and a great escape from the busy roads and touts. The cafe is a little expensive but you pay for excellent food in beautiful surroundings.

Time Magazine got it right. March 25 2013, a selection of 'Best-Kept Secrets' in their Travel section, and Time magazine lists this treasure in the heart of Kathmandu. Lovers love it (there's little privacy elsewhere in this hectic city) and I tell people that while it's beautiful in the day, at night it is magic, pure magic - try to be there when he lights the dark lotus shapes in the middle of the pond and fire burns in the water.

very calm and nicely groomed grounds. There is a small 200 rp fee to enter. Everyone is lying around relaxing on green mats. There are benches to stop and look around. It is a nice place to get away from the noise of Kathmandu. Gardens are decent but nothing spectacular. There is a bar and café.
A beautiful, peaceful place. A beautiful place to retreat to from the chaos and noise of Thamel. Worthwhile if you have a couple of hours to just relax.
An Oasis of tranquility. Really good place to get away from the hectic pace of life (and poverty) in Thamel.Great food but expensive for Nepal. Extensive, tranquil gardens.

Most beautiful and relaxing!. The minute you walk in it feels so peaceful. We walked around, took great photos, relaxed,
and even saw some monkeys jumping around on the trees. Fantastic place to spend a morning or the afternoon.

Hammer and Chisel. It's a very pretty spot, but it's expensive and the food sucks.First time I went some guy wouldn't stop staring at my lady friend.The second time I went nobody would stop the incessant banging for "repairs" being done in the middle of the garden! I go to get away from the noise. I got my money back and left.
So different. It's just like a breath of fresh air in chaotic Kathmandu. So tranquil and calm place that you might think you're not in Kathmandu at all.

*peuh*. A relieve to get away from the dust and noise of the streets of Kathmandu, well kept, fresh and beautiful - this garden is a civilized haven compared to much of the city it's in. Good wifi, could skype home. Nice koi pond. Expensive to eat and drink here though so a picnic is recommendable.

Don't stay at Dwarki's hotel - just go here!. These are a little piece of peace and clam in the middle of the hustle and bustle of KathmanduThe cafe has nice snacks and drinks... bit priceyThe gardens are really nicely done and keptWorth going to the gardens every day for a little pace and calmLoved them!

Loosing its charm than it's name. As per name, there used to be different seasonal garden inside . The Castle been used by RANAS, and the garden was created by themselves. But, nowadays it has been loosing its charming, though some part had been renovated. The garden does not look like really a garden than a dating spot. Visiting with relatives or senior can make SHAME of the activities of some couple, which is not common in Nepalese culture.The scenario is ok. The restaurant looks nice but of course the price is about double or more than a common restaurant.For a single visit, this place can be worth, but still there are things to be improved.
god...... its a wonderful place to visit with fabulous environment....will surely come back to garden of dreams
Wall separates reality and dream. When tired or choked in Kathmandu's smoke and dust .. you walk into this place and you are taken to a different world... Well worth visiting
Paradise. the land scape, the collection of flowers, cleaning and tidyness are excellent. you feel relaxed and happy in the garden

Amazing oasis in busy Kathmandu. If you find yourself in Kathmandu, you must visit this reclaimed colonial era garden just next to the central tourist district of Thamel. Quite simply it is stunning and amazingly peaceful, exaggerated further by its proximity to one of the busiest parts of kathmandu.There is also a good quality kitchen run by the people at Dwarika's Hotel, so the food is pretty decent too.enjoy.
The carden is really beautiful.. The place has very beautiful sight.When you walk into the garden, it's Just like be in dreams. Everyone get Kathmandu should go there to have a wonderful afternoon.

Peace in a busy city.. This garden has been restored to a [ smaller version of] its former glory and an exhibition in the house, is worth seeing because it demonstrates just how badly it had degenerated, and what has been done. The garden is now very European in style, but is well kept and a joy to wander round. We had lunch in the cafe, which was tasty, if a tad pricey and spent our last day in Kathmandu here.

Garden of Eden!. A nice getaway from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu!! And don't forget to go around the block to visit the Kaiser Library. It is a collection of books, pictures, and menagerie of things from his private collection. It is a great place to visit.

Restaurant within a Garden. It's a former extension of a palace. The restaurant is fenced up by a high brick wall reducing the dust & noise pollution from vehicles outside. Nice garden & well maintained. Food was okay. Ordered the mutton Thakali set meal with a Banana lassi drink. Great serving & good food although a bit pricey based on Asian standards. Nice atmosphere from day to dawn but annoyed by the crows gawking all day long.
BEAUTIFUL. This is europian style garden .Once you enter after paid nominal entry fee you will see fountain,path on the grass and perfect peaceful place listen only birds sound .

A beautiful and peaceful spot. This garden is the peaceful Shangri-La of KTM. It is right before the entrance to Thamel, the tourist area of KTM. It is not large in size like similar gardens in other cities and countries. But it is a wonderful place for KTM. There are flowers, fountains, stone pathways, and a pond. It's the perfect place to relax with a book like many do. There is a small entry fee. There is a bar and restaurant inside. Some complain about the prices of dining and drinking here. But then again, you are paying for the setting, not the food, this should be expected. And it's why I didn't eat or drink there, not worth it.My favorite spot is the fountain directly on the right of the entrance. Sit and watch the peaceful spot and you will completely lose yourself and forget the passage of time. There are couples relaxing and sitting together closely, but I witnessed nothing inappropriate. Affection does not particularly offend me anyway. It is open until 10 at night. It is a nice place to visit to get away. Unfortunately, the walls are not high enough to block out all the noise and honking. But if the chaos of KTM doesn't bother you anyway, the place will not be so important for you to visit. The place is quite nice and a welcome escape. But to rank it as one of the top attractions of KTM, I think it's too much. It's a unique spot in KTM, but not one of the biggest attractions of KTM. Just my two cents.

One of the Best Sites. I loved this walled garden located between the Royal Palace and Thamel. Inside the garden has many lovely garden structures in Edwardian Classical style and the atmosphere in the garden is very relaxing. There are many gardens, pools, trees and sculpture. The highlight is a very nice cafe restored by the Austrian government that serves good coffee and excellent meals. I had a pork chip dinner that was great. I visited the Garden several times and loved it. It was at one time a Royal Garden.

Restaurant service inside not good. It is too hard to find the garden like such in such a busy place of kathmandu. But garden of dream has fulfilled the beauty of valley. But the customer service of the restaurant inside it is not good. the staffs are gathering outside the restaurant and hanging around but they dont have good service to customer

Go at night only. In the day, the place is a veritable couples corner. I was the only single person walking around taking photos of grass and pools, most others were trying to reach down each others' throats with their tongues. At night, the place is lit up nicely and is quite cute. The restaurant/cafe has some good, above-average food. Although it is only international / continental cuisine.

The only quiet spot in Kathmandu. After three weeks of trekking, we returned the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. When we were overwhelmed by noise, people and traffic, we found this lovely garden. Yes, it is small and there are a lot of couples looking for a quiet kissing spot but still worth the visit. We ducked into one of the cafes for dessert when the rain started, making for a very pleasant afternoon!

Take a deep breath and relax. The Garden of Dreams is a recently restored garden that is just lovely. You won't believe the calm behind the walls, given the chaos of the traffic outside. Plenty of places to sit and relax, ponds, water features, lovely plants. The restaurant is excellent although I have no idea how much it costs.

Good place for dining, candle light dinner.. We were visiting Nepal, and headed here for a quiet candle light dinner for my birthday. It's just a beautiful escape from the buzz of city. We arrived quite late evening, though I would advice you to be there early evening to enjoy the scenery of the garden. There's an entrance fee to enter. The restaurant food price is not too pricy. Worth it. The garden is well maintained. Food is definitely a must try. Though they didn't serve chicken while we were there. And the staffs were very nice to sing me a birthday song! :)

Tranquility amidst the mayhem. We arrived late in the afternoon and had a stroll around the beautiful grounds before booking in for dinner. Service was very slow but the food was very good for this part of the world. Although a little on the expensive side, it is worth it for the wonderful setting.

Interesting. This is a chadming little park between thamel and the king's road. Buil at the end of the 19teen century, it is a good example of the nepalese neo-classical style as mutuated through the British Empire. Very nice selection of plants too.
Peaceful Spot. Lovely peaceful spot just yards away from the chaos of Thamel. Lovely to spend a quiet hour reading stretched out on the cushions provided on the grass. You can pay for wifi.

A beautiful restoration. The Garden was within walking distance of our hotel. We took a wild bicycle drawn carriage (tuk-tuk) ride there and walked back. The Garden is being beautifully restored and many local people were there just enjoying the surroundings. The admission price was 200 NR. There is a restaurant on site as well as a bar serving cocktails, mocktails, wine and beer. Once the entire garden is restored, this will be a beautiful oasis in a noisy, busy area of Kathmandu.

A beautiful respite. Kathmandu can be a tough city to negotiate all day: it's loud with traffic noises; dirty, dusty and polluted; and, depending on where you have traveled that day, emotionally draining. The Garden of Dreams is a great place to catch your breath, take in some beautiful gardens and treat yourself to yummy food and/or drinks at the Kaiser Cafe.
Tranquil but touristy. You can tell this place was just built for tourists but it was a nice quiet part of a very busy, noisy and polluted Kathmandu

Relax in peace. Probably the best thing to do in Kathmandu (there didn't seem to be much). The grass is a great place to just relax without being pestered and the restaurant was expensive but nice enough.
Great food - beautiful surroundings. A little pricey for Kathmandu, but well worth it. The gardens are serene and beautiful, and the restaurant has extremely friendly waitstaff. Don't miss this!

A nice shady respite from the chaos of Thamel. A nice place to pass the time, and an amazing contrast in tranquility compared to the surrounding area. Food options are good, but much more expensive than restaurants elsewhere.
Oasis. This is a real treat of a place to go and recharge from the craziness of Kathmandu.... Take a book and/or a pick-nick and laze the afternoon away.....

Beautiful garden in Thamel. It is a good place to relax in Thamel. The garden has an entry charge but its worth and it shows that the property is being managed and maintained very well. There is a bar and ice cream place on one side and a small restaurant on the other side. We enjoyed the romantic walk!

nice for lovers or dating. its very nice place for dating, or to hangout with friends, I went with some friends and it was nice time, some museum styles posters were nice too, and there's a cafe it was nice too
The Great Escape. What a delightful haven in the middle of a very busy city. Beautiful, clean and tranquil. A must to see and experience.

Small piece of tranquility in Thamel (Exept from car horns!). The garden is a beautiful break from the streets of Thamel, when you sit in the Kaiser cafe and enjoy their delicious, but tourist priced, food you really can't tell where you are.. Apart from the relentless honking of Nepalese cars, the location of the Gardens is next to a large road. Unfortunately the large walls which block out the hustle and bustle view, the noise is let into the gardens which ruins the ambience, but not the overall experience.Still a must see for Rs200!!

An oasis in the madness that is Kathmandu. This provided a well needed break from the reality of Kathmandu. The gardens are beautiful, and the restaurant provided delicious foods. We even got to see a traditional wedding shoot that was taking place.

Peaceful. When you've had your fill of sightseeing and the hustle, bustle and noise of traffic stop by the Garden of Dreams. The gardens are lovely and well maintained. There were many places to just sit and think. The relaxing nature and calming effect of being in the gardens was appreciated. The gardens would be the perfect backdrop for a wedding. This was one of my favorite attractions in Kathmandu.

Garden in Thamel. Though cannot be compared to similar gardens in Europe, Thailand, Malaysia and Singapore, it is nevertheless a well maintained garden. It is not a botanic or flowering or orchid garden though, it can be visited if one has plenty of time to kill while at Themel. The entrance fee is high ( like any thing within Nepal). Beware of the Kaiser cafe there which charges at NY Manhattan rates.
Absolutely my dream garden. I have visited the place a couple of tims so far and enjoyed the peaceful environment with delicious food there. It is an ideal place to relax and enjoy good food.
WONDERFUL. An excellent break from the hustle and bustle! mats available for lounging and relaxing in the beautiful setting!

lovely. Loved the gardens, the old buildings, the swing, the photo opportunities & the yummy food.
Disliked the price of the food.

Not Acceptable. Its nice concept, but not the best, its prompting like a Dating spot, so you can see the couples more which is not acceptable position in Nepali society. Visited with the family and not the right choice, need to make the family environmental and give the good message of Nepali Garden.No place for Parking, so if you have any means of vehicles, no need to think about the parking.
just enjoy. a lovely garden! Walk around and get impressed of the architecture of the buildings with beautiful plants around.

Beauty in a noisy city. Fabulous garden - an oasis of calmness and beauty in a frenetic city. Very well cared for, good quality food. It was a peaceful surrounding and we enjoyed strolling around. Many young people took the opportunity to study or quietly chat.

Finally a bit of peace. In many other cities, this beautiful garden would have deserved 4 stars, but in Kathmandu, I would give it 10 , if the possibility existed.It is right next to Thamel and once you step through the gates, a cloud of peace surrounds you in a way you probably haven't felt for days.Walk around and enjoy a Chocolate Brownie at the cafe. Pricey for Nepal but worth every penny.There is space for children to run around and it is rather empty. The entry price for foreigners is 100 rupees for children and 200 for adults

Peace, perfect peace. I have recently returned from a month's volunteering at a school near Kathmandu. I stayed in hot dusty, busy Thamel and when I discovered the Garden of Dreams I was in heaven! It was the perfect place to recover from each busy and stressful week. I was able to sit and relax with a delicious latte and cake while I sat and wrote my diary and reflected on my experiences. Thank you so much.

Oasis of Kathmandu. Kathmandu is always messy and noisy and you easily get tired. Then this is the place to go and relax as the last destination of a hectic day. In other words, you don't need to visit this garden for other purpose. Actually, local people use this garden as a dating spot. The admission costs Rs 200. Wifi is available anywhere in the garden for Rs 50 per hour. The restaurant in the garden is a bit pricey.

Take a break. This is another of my regular haunts in Kathmandu. It's a real haven away from the hustle and bustle and just a few minutes walk from the noise of Thamel. Great choices of places to get a lemon and soda or a bite to eat and also plenty of choice to kick back, get a lie down and finish your book.If you want to go and come back- just ask the man at the gate to sign your entrance ticket, and you can re-enter no problem.
A Little Bit of Heaven. Beautiful gardens offer a cool, relaxing ambience and wonderful restaurant. It is a pleasant surprise to see such a place tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu.

Quiet, Clean Air in the Middle of the Noise of the City. We went to Kaiser Cafe in Garden of Dreams for our last morning in the city. You have to pay a small entrance fee just to get in (about 2 USD), but it was well worth it. The prices are a little more expensive than other areas of the city, but still a very reasonable price. The food was very clean and they dealt with my gluten-allergy very well when ensuring none of my food was made with wheat flour.We got the boiled eggs, sausage, omlette, fresh fruit, coffee, and fruit juice and it was delicious! We had a seat overlooking the garden and were never rushed out, we had to ask for the check when we were ready to go.We spent a little time walking around the garden as well, it's incredible how clean the air felt in this little pocket of the city and if you can stomach all the romantic couples wandering the garden, it's well worth a visit.
Marvelious. Very beautiful Place to visit, calm and wonderful environment attracts visitor and natural beauty with modern design is a good blend.

Cute and fun - nice enough bar. Fun place, very well done. Go for a nice chilled out evening, or try to catch a 'show' they put up in the amphitheater. The bar is quite cute - average alcohol selection which is the case through most bars in Kathmandu.
Peace amidst chaos. The garden of dreams brings such wonderful silence amidst the chaos and noice of Kathandu city life. A wonderful place to meditate.

The green side of Kathmandu. I would have wished that this garden would be larger. Beautiful well-groomed green garden to relax, calming down mind, listening birds singing and splashing water, lovely shade to take a nap (as long as it doesn't rain), reading books, enjoying picnic. Best visit would be in the evening time when the sun is about to set. Food and drink are a bit pricey, there is entrance fee to pay. The garden can be slightly crowded with young couples who spend their great time though

Garden of peace and tranquility in the middle of Kathmandu mayhem. This gorgeous little corner of Thamel is just bizarre. you could walk by and not even know it is there behind the high walls. The Garden of Dreams is a beautiful, peaceful garden just minutes from the crazy buzz of KTM and Thamel. It was restored with funding and aid from the Austrian government and is simply delightful. Got to be seen! A must if you are visiting Kathmandu.

One of the Peace place near Thamel. It is really a good and silence place near to the thamel. Those traveler who want to relax after your day activities in city i would suggest you to go there around 3 to 4 pm to stay in cool place.
Tranquil spot just on the edge of Thamel. Its always nice to take a break from the chaos of Thamel and enjoy the quiet and the beautiful trees and shrubs. Also, kept very clean.

Nice place to chill out. The Garden of dreams is an oasis within the madness that is Kathmandu. You pay a small entrance fee and then the gardens are yours. Wonderful gardens with a few wild animals (squirrel type things) thrown in. Food is also reasonably priced and tasty. We had a nice relaxing couple of hours here and caught up on writing our journals and posting to facebook etc as wifi is also available. One tip though is to sit where the locals arn't as they tend to bring their children, and whilst it's nice to mix, it's not relaxing.
love this place. was a little heaven in this noisy city !!!bring a book or a note pad and pencil .... have a siesta on the grass !

a little paradise. Peace that the most. It is a bit awkward to find such a place in Kathmundu. The garden is simply beautifull very well arragned. The food is OK a bit a pricey for what is, i think. But it was a break from the noise and pollution. You have to pay an entrance fee (200nrps) you can use mattress to lay down on the grass. Humm it was so relaxing.

Amazing!. I really liked this place. A lot of couples come here to snuggle, but if you can get past that it is really nice to walk quietly, meditatively, away from the noise and streets of Kathmandu. A little paradise I never knew about until now :)

Need a little peace & quiet?. This is a very impressive garden to relax and if you have a special someone, it is a very romantic location with a cafe on the premises. It was quite simply beautiful and well worth the admission.
carlos. Garden of dreams is a bit of europe parks inside kathmandu, you can stay out of the noisy, and take a coffe relaxing.

Great place for relaxation. Many couples came to this place. It looks like the foreigner place. You can sit on the grass and chatting with friends. The entrance price is reasonable. You can have photo taking in this place.

A Surprise behind the walls. Having returned from our two week trek we headed to the Garden to ease our reentry into Kathmandu and had a terrifiic lunch, with my friends who are meat eaters, 'oohing' and 'ahhhing' over the quality of their meat. Would have liked more vegetarian choices, nevertheless we returned our last night for a calm and lovely end to a terrific vacation. The only disappointment that night was in ordering their ice cream with chocolate sauce , which was delivered sans sauce. Were were charged nonetheless.
A Dream Garden. Amazing Place! Really colourful. If you are going there for the first time, it will surely be a gret experience to you.
excellent. lovely , superb, at least once in your life time any one must be there. Its a wonderful place with peace............lovely garden......lovely place between the crowd
Peaceful green area in Kathmandu. Pretty area with lots of plants, a couple small eating areas, and places to chill. A nice place to get away from the noise and smells of the busy streets.

Escape. When you need a break from the busy streets of thamel. The beautiful manicured garden is an oasis. With a first class café cooling ponds personal places of hindu worship offer the perfect escape.

Beautiful Garden. Wow what a garden. IT surely can be called garden of dreams. Once u enter this garden, u will forget the chaos outside at thamel and enjoy the cool and beautiful garden while enjoying lemon tea

A garden in the city!. Kathmandu is fast becoming a cluster of houses, restaurants, apartments, narrow streets, too many vehicles - yes, all of that a small city that has seen too much activity in a short space of time has. The Garden of Dreams is an escapist's dream into what true Nepal is just outside of Kathmandu honestly. Located just before the busy, dirty and interesting maze of a tourist hub Thamel - I simply love the Garden in all its seasons. Don't go there for the food though as it is a major disappointment - just go there for a breath of fresh air :)

Beautiful & quite. Right after you enter the Garden of Dreams you are like in a different world. The garden is kept immaculate and is surrounded by a big wall - which makes the place more silent.Only the restaurant is very expensive - but it was not really a surprise at such location. Just having a drink over there is worth the money.Afterwards you can also go to the small museum in the gardens.
Well maintained garden. The garden is very well maintained. We spent sometime peacefully and enjoyed the greenery in the middle of the noisy city.
Peace in the caos. Kathmandu is very very interesting, but is a caotic city. Garden of Dreams is a peaceful island in this city. Very beautiful garden, good food, an interesting option.
A haven of peace in Kathmandu's chaos.. Another haven of peace in noisy Kathmandu, particularly at night, with its walled, water gardens and wonderful dining. Try the fish soup.

Small but nice. It is green peceful patch right at the heart of the crowded city. The entry ticket seemed a bit overpriced. More of a lovers' nest than a family place. But just ignore the couples and you can relax on the scattered mats or directly on the grass enjoying the fresh air & greenery & water bodies.

Bring a book!. This is a surreal attraction - just right outside is one of Kathmandu's main streets, with the noise and pollution to go with it. But step inside Garden of Dreams and you're in a different time and place. The grounds are well-manicured, there's a well-stocked cafe (wine, beers and ice cream!) and the lawn is inviting enough to read on all day, far far away from the crowds and buzz outside. Interestingly, it's not just the tourists that go - there are young local couples in every nook and crevice of the Garden!

average. not much, if you have nothing else to do visit it, its nice, but thats about it... Its located very well between durbar marg and thamel. There is a cafe inside and lots of greenery , cafe was fine, but wouldnt go there again. hey have an entrance fee.

So cool in the midst of Thammel. Get get away right in Thammel, interesting architecture, nice historic story, this is not stour head or Versailles, but it is a nice quiet place to rest for an hour or two. Go when it is toward dusk and see it in daylight and after the lights come on. The food is pricy for Kathmandu, but enjoy a bowl of good soup if you have the time.

Lovely oasis amongst the noise and traffic. The Garden of Dreams was a surprise find on our visit in Kathmandu. Surrounded by a large wall, you can almost forget that outside is the chaotic traffic, dirt and noise of Thamel. Some wonderful photo opportunities and a lovely place to take your book and relax an afternoon away

Cleanses the soul........ This restored garden is a gem, ok, it does cost you to get in but you can stay all day if you want, bring a book,or a picnic, its just heaven. The high walls keep the street noise out and the flowers and bushes are beautifully maintained by very quiet unobtrusive staff. You can get a bite to eat inside if you want to but the main attraction is the peace and quiet and clean air !!!! Worth every penny.

A hidden gem if there ever was one. After 4 days of the dusty, noisy, crowded but thrilling streets of Kathmandu, I visited The Garden of Dreams before eating lunch and going the airport. Surrounded by a high wall, and with only one small door to enter, I had actually walked by there every day and not known it. It is what remains of a formal Brittish style garden built by one of the princes in the early 20th century. It was abandoned and in a shambles when money was provided by a European country (I don't recall which) to restore about 3 of the original 6 acres. It is a peaceful, quiet retreat just on the edge of Thamel, which is where many toursists stay. While archetechturally and culturally it does not fit in Nepal, it is beautiful nonetheless.
an oasis in Kathmandu. I was very impressed by this gardens, a quiet place and a relaxing one after visiting temples and other attractions.

very clean and nice.. It is a small garden just steps from Thamel. It is very clean and nice.We have spent 2 hours there hanging out on the mats just enjoying the weather and peace and quiet.As foreigner you pay a fee at the entrance.Note: we were told that if you leave you need to pay to re-enter the garden again.

Greenery & Beautiful Flowers. Not too far from where I stayed, Hotel Blue Horizon, walking distance, you can visit this beautiful garden. Suddenly I felt freshness in the air, as outside on the streets it looks so brown, dusty, pollution in the air. The garden of dreams became a place of peaceful oasis with full of unique architect and varieties of flowers and fauna brought from the different countries. Entrance to go in is 200 nepali rupees

An Oasis in the Middle of Kathmandu. When you are finally fed up with the traffic, noise and pollution of Kathmandu, grab a book and a picnic and head here for a day of daydreaming and escapism.Mats and cushions are provided, there is a cafe and the toilets are clean. It's easy to loose a day/afternoon here.

a little oasis of peace in the bustle of Kathmandu. The gardens are peaceful and beautiful and one of the only spots of green in central Kathmandu. The cocktail bar in the left corner and the restaurant on the other side are both great!

Dream Park like in Europe. Park and residence was reconstructed by Austria.You pay 200 nr for entrance and can spend a whole day there.Its small,but you can relax in amphitheater,read a book next to the pond,enjoy the flowers and have a great lunch-dinner there (service/quality of food/price combination is great)!Perfect place to come with family or friends and enjoy small Schonbrunn :)

A little oasis. I spoilt myself to some time out from the frantic streets of Kathmandu. Had a pot of tea and a slice of lime cheesecake - rather a colonial experience. The walls are high enough to shut out most of the noise and the flowers, shrubs and trees are a delight. No dust here!

Breathe the air!. I visited the garden to take a break from the exhaust fumes ingested after a day of orienting myself in and around Thamel. It is just NR200 and you can stay all day if you like! The butterscotch icecream from the bar is delicious. The restaurat the other side is expensive but you could always take a picnic. If you are spending any length of time in the city reward yourself with a few visits. Best time is when it opens up until lunchtime as it is not so busy as the afternon. Several people told me they couldn't find it. It is on the main road on a block adjacent to the old palace (also well worth a visit). The walls are high and keep out much of the traffic noise. The lilypond is gorgeous. Well done for creating an oasis in this fascinating but busy city.
Worth a stop if you have the time. A refreshingly clean place in mostly dirty Kathmandu. A bit artificial and European, but nevertheless a nice change of pace.

Unbelievable!. I ahave read much about the garden in net and was eager to visit the place. The location is in the middle of a crowded street but as you enter the gate, you will forget all the noises and pollution. The good thing is that everyone can relax on the matts and benches and enjoy the views. The sound of water running in small fountains, the trees and the elegant cafes are a trip to remember

must visit. a place most different from all the historical places in nepal.. a must visit if you like simple architecture and u like gardens.... the kaiser cafe housed there has snack and meal options... but it's pricey...

Take a book for some time out. Entrance fee to pay to visit and not a large place but feels miles away from the busy road outside. I wished I'd taken a book with me as it would have been a brand place to while away a few hours.

A moment to dream. This place is not that big but it is big in the presence it beholds. The garden offers a great way to relax our minds and we can easily get very cozy in its calm atmosphere. The place is well construct and beautiful. A nice walk in this garden lets our dreams come out of us. A very peaceful place to be.

just walking around. really nice place that is hidden close to the palace. you would never expect this if you were just walking around. you will see that there is also a bar called Kaiser there. have a dragonfly or a casablanca. its actually nice. a good place to walk through.
Stunning garden. A beautiful retreat. Unexpected getaway in Kathmandu. You wouldn't think something this peaceful could exist in the hussle of the city

Garden Oasis. Oh My Gosh.....was this for real....a little peace of tranquillity in the middle of a bustling city. Once you paid the Rp200 (AUS $2.50) and step in through the arch behind the massive stone walls.......silence, peace, tranquillity.....amazing. Visit the little museum and find out all about the history behind the restoration of this little slice of heaven tucked behind massive blocks walls in the heart of Kathmandu...settle on the grass with your own mattress and pillow and read or enjoy a bite to eat and a drink at one of the cafes....pure heaven and a must visit!!!!!!

Great place to relax. I took a season pass to the Garden. It is beautiful, yet so quiet. Be sure to visit when the sun is going down, the lights on the fountains are very quaint. Good food in Kaiser Cafe inside.
Wonderful garden. Its my second visit to garden of dreams..and I found it more beautiful than before..well maintained, nice attraction..lush greenery..wonderful at eve..
50 rupee short of entry fee... unfortunatly I was not alowed in due to9 shortage of entrance fee.. seemed like a piece of tranquility amidst all the hustle and bustle of katmandu..
"Simply Beautiful". Well i have been here for couple of times and it has been a very good memory every time while i see beautiful greenery garden, with lovely decorated design.

Best hang-out. The garden of dream is a place near Thamel which is the best place for couples to hang out in and to spend a lovely evening together.
It is a huge garden which is close to the Palace of Kathmandu

Liked everything beside public affection. I hadn't imagined about this place from outside of the wall. Attached to too much crowded Thamel area, its a heaven inside. I loved the whole architecture which must be a century old. It is not Nepali but European structure, revived some years ago and well maintained. Only thing I didn't liked was the young couples doing movie style activities in public.

The place to relax and escape the heat. It does cost a couple hundred rupees, but on a hot day it can be worth it to find a clean, green area to just kick back and relax. Though it's not overly large, the flowers, trees, fountains and lawns are well taken care of and the atmosphere is very pleasant. Somehow, it seems to be 5-10 degrees cooler inside the gardens compared to outside of the walls even though it's open to air. It seems to be a popular place for young couples and families as well.

An oasis in a bustling city. It is definitely worth the 200 rupee entry fee (as a foreigner). After spending a few days exploring Kathmandu it was lovely to spend a relaxing afternoon in the gardens with a good book. The restaurant is quite expensive, but considering the location it's worth the extravagance.

oasis. This park is an oasis in the hearth of the city. Small as it is, it is full of very beautiful and well kept plant, gazebos and water features. The visit can be combined with shopping in Thamel, on the way out preferably. There is a fine restaurant in the premises.
excellent Excellent Excellent. But Expensive Restaurant - but good value - and sometime unfriendly staff -- i love taking my family there to chill and for good lunch.

A peaceful oasis. It is worth the Rs200 each you pay as a foreigner, the gardens are in great condition and the chance to relax on your own pillow and mat on the grass is heavenly. Quiet and shaded spots abound, do go!
Gardens. Beautiful,relaxing,quiet.Good to see something so special being returned to its glory .good place to go to sit,read and enjoy

An oasis in a sea of dust and pollution. Well worth a visit. Dragged two friends along who hadn't heard of it and they were delighted that I did. It's such a juxtaposition between the beautiful scented gardens and the lepers and street children begging outside. We had a Bombay sapphire and tonic at the Kaiser Cafe in the gardens and it was a blissful experience in the most beautiful gardens I have ever been in - all for RS200.
Formal restored garden in central Kathmandu. Wonderful array of exotic flower beds. Superb restaurant. Gallery of amazing pre-restoration photographs .Do not miss!

Beautiful oasis. A nice 'man this city is dirty and loud, I need to escape for a bit' kind of place. It's a beautifully restored colonial garden. Bring a book, stay for a while. Enjoy the Kaiser Cafe, for good western food.

A wonderful retreat from the downtown bustle of Kathmandu. We greatly enjoyed a visit to this beautiful garden, a veritable oasis in the middle of Kathmandu's downtown chaos, with the pleasure of having a great meal. Good service, good value and a great atmosphere. Highly recommended if you have a spare few hours in Kathmandu.
chtf. Lovely relaxing place in the middle of Kathmadu, Thamel.We had a nice meal in the restaurant within the gardens and we were so happy that this tranquil retreat has been created.
Oasis in the middle of Kathmandu!. If you need to get away from the dust and noise of Kathmandu, visit this place, it is so tranquil and the food at the cafe is delicious!
Nice little oasis. This is a green spot in Kathmandu, within the Thamel district. Very nice for an hour of quite relaxation.

Lovely. This is a great place to unwind in the busy city of Kathmandu. There is a real calm and peace to it even though it is in the middle of noisy Thamel. It is well kept and a great place to relax and people watch.

Nice for a walk through. A great place to spend an hour relaxing out of the chaos of thamel! The history of the place is interesting and amongst the smoke, fog, and pollution of Kathmandu it is nice to experieince a bit of a green oasis. There is so much more that could be done!

What an oasis!. Walked from Kathmandu Guest House/Thamel area to Palace museum and fellow tourist told us about this place. We were ready for a respite from the streets of KTM big time. It's a real oasis in the city, brace yourself for a small and pricey lunch, but hey, it's a real treat. They charge admission too but worth it.
a haven - Garden of Dreams. So close to the chaos, but a world of tranquility. Loved the gardens. A great place to quietly finish writing up your travel diary!
Piece of heaven. A wonderful, wonderful place in the middle of madness. Perfect place to recharge your batteries and just chill. Bring your own picnic and crash on the lawn!

Heaven!. We were told to make sure we visited the gardens and were so pleased that we did! A gorgeous escape from the bustling city outside the walls! Although you had to pay an entry fee and for the wi fi, it was well worth the money to sit in such divine gardens. Awesome coffee and the key lime pie was brilliant!

Lovely and an utter relief from the city. Lovely lovely, lovely walled garden full of peace, tranquility and beauty, with a good restaurant. Utter relief from the chaos of the city, The entry price is worth every rupee. However, coffee lovers, avoid the cappuccino in the restaurant.

Well worth a couple of hours. An oasis of tranquility ! Well laid out and well-tended gardens, and a very good cup of coffee too. A good place to retreat with a book if the chaos of Kathmandu is overwhelming you
Little escape of Kathmandu. It was quite a nice escape from the crazy Kathmandu streets. Beautiful landscape, peaceful cafe for a nice coffee.

Birthday Treat. An oasis in this crazy, dusty, city! Calm, beautiful, tranquil even.Stepping into a dream, literally...A perfect place to meditate, centre yourself, or simple share a bottle of Perrier with a friend..An absolut must!

Sanctuary from the chaos of the city. Located right at the entrance to Thamel, the tourist hotspot in Kathmandu, the Garden of Dreams is the ideal place to escape the chaos of the city. A dream project of Kaiser Shumsher Rana, it was constructed in the early 1920s. It was however neglected later and was occupied by the ministry of education which almost demolished it before being restored with the support of Austrian Development Aid from 2000 to 2007.It is a neo-classical styled garden with fountains, sculptures and a wide variety of flowers. It does not cover a large area but does provide a open space feeling. It also houses a museum, a restaurant (aptly named Kaiser Cafe) and a bar.You can also ask for rugs and pillow for resting in the garden.All in all, its a nice place to relax and escape the hustle and bustle of the city without having to go too far from the city.

An escape. We spent a whole afternoon here as it is a stark contrast to the dusty chaos outside. I would recomend bringing in your lunch with you, although there is a cafe, I would imagine it is overpriced (we did not check, I know, we shouldnt assume, but it was a safe assumption to make). There is also a very small photography gallery about the restoration, which is quite interesting. There are also toilets in the grounds, that, wait for it... have toilet roll! (they did when we went there anyways)

Probably the cleanest air you will breath in Kathmandu Valley. A pleasant surprise when you enter this place. It is so serene and only a wall separates it from the chaos of the city. Beautifully landscaped and very well maintained. It feels like you are somewhere in Europe until you start hearing the horns tooting from the traffic outside. Check out the photos of the before and after transformation of the Garden. The cafe and bar prices are expensive. This place probably the cleanest air you will breathe in Kathmandu Valley.
Beautiful day in a Dream!. Get out of the hussle and bussel of Kathmandu! Beggars outside made me rather sad to know what was on both sides of teh garden walls!

Total relaxation. We went to the Garden of Dreams with the intention of 'seeing' it and maybe spending an hour there. We ended up spending 5 hours there - reading, people watching, having lunch, sun bathing and even had a nap! The garden is the perfect relaxation spot for anyone who needs an escape from the crowds of Kathmandu, is tired after a hike, is waiting for a flight and wants some time to reflect on their trip or catch up on journal writing. The garden itself is beautiful, incredibly well kept and clean. The café there serves lovely food and drinks, although a little expensive by Nepali standards but you can bring in your own picnic. There are even padded mats and cushions that you can lie on. Highly recommend the Garden to everyone.

Nice place to refresh mind. You can enjoy at any time, any season and in any mood. whether you are alone or with family or friends, whether to relax or read or just to lie down on lawn watching the blue sky or stars after sun set. Really beautiful and the heart of the capital
garden of dreams. spent only short time there but its really a quiet green oasis in the middle of kathmandu. the 200 rps fee is worth it, if you ask, you can also leave and come back later.

A place to relax. You pay a small fee to enter the garden, but in this case, convert it back to your home country currency and it will seem like a small price to pay to enjoy such a pleasant setting. Next time I go there, I will be armed with my book, the newspaper, my diary, some snacks, and I will spend a leisurely afternoon recharging the batteries.We had a snack at the Kaiser restaurant. Yes, for Nepal it was expensive, but it was worth it to us because we had just spent 2 busy weeks traveling, in meetings and visiting projects and so it was great to have such a relaxed evening. We were sipping on our drinks as the sun went down, and the lights/candles/fires in the pond were all lit. Beautiful.
Nice place to relax and read your travel guide. I enjoyed spending some time in this quiet garden. Bring your own snack and water, as the restaurant is very expensive.

Oasis in the middle of Thamel. If this garden was in a western country, it will be quite average. But set in the chaos of Thamel, it becomes an oasis. We had food at the Kaiser here as well which was expensive by Nepal standards but average in a western country.
Beauty in the city. This beautiful garden is an oasis in an otherwise noisy, dirty city. A real delight to sit and relax and watch the squirrels run around.

Truly mesmerising!. Before my girlfriend took off for France, we had our last date (for that season, of course) at the Garden of Dreams. I always wanted to check it out but I could only do it when she told me about it. Then when we were inside, I was truly amazed. I'd never seen any other garden like this before. All the other gardens we had been before were nothing compared to this one. You should not miss this place if you are in Nepal because the history that it preserves (about Kaiser and his family) is another trait of this garden. I was really happy to be there for two hours because it was the first time ever that my girlfriend was so happy.In one word, 'mesmerising'."Jardin de rêves, je vous rendrai visite de nouveau!!" Did I say it correctly? :)

A nice break from the chaos of Thamel.. The best thing about the garden is what it lacks. It is not noisy. One can breath without a face mask as there are neither thousands of motorcycles nor clouds of dirt hanging in the air. There are no stray dogs, goats, or cows. No one tries to sale you anything. It is just very peaceful and beautiful. It is a nice respite from the streets of Thamel.
great spot for couples. it is worthwhile visiting because it trully is a garden of dreams, its beautiful inside, and you can find yourself with your significant other sharing wonderful time inside.

What an oasis in Kathmandu!. This was the perfect place to spend our last few hours in Kathmandu! The Gardens are beautifully restored and it truly is an oasis within the very polluted, congested city. The museum showing before and after pictures of the restoration process was fantastic! The restaurant is a bit pricey but it was delicious food. A definite must see in Kathmandu and a very short 5 minute walk from Thamel.
Garden Of Dreams in the heart of Kathmandu. Very good restaurant but not cheap. entrance fee is extra. Garden is very nice to have a rest from the busy Thamel.

Relaxing Place to Visit. A good place to visit for 200Rs to read, chat, write, eat (well maybe, I didn't try) and feel like you are outside of Kathmandu's smells and sounds. Its a nice enough garden, with places to sit and relax. Especially since you are coming from Thamel, you just feel like you are in an oasis.
make sure you book ahead. We tried to get dinner reservations but was unlucky but we saw the gardens and was such a beautiful setting .

Garden of dreams.. The Garden of Dreams is well worth a visit. It offers a tranquil setting amongst the chaos of Katmandu. The food is fine dining and fantastic and good value. It is a well restored area with pretty gardens. There is a small entrance charge which is well worth paying.

When you're ready to leave Kathmandu for an hour or two. One does not go to Kathmandu to see quiet, peaceful gardens. But when one has had one's fill of Kathmandu, Garden of Dreams offers an antithesis to its dusty, dirty, crowded, and chaotic surroundings. A few steps from Thamel, this restored European garden has abundant plant life, fountains, and a decent restaurant. The admission fee keeps out the cheapskate backpackers and beggars. It's the perfect -and only - place in Kathmandu to spend a sunny afternoon reading a book on the lawn.

Relaxing oasis in the chaos of Thamel. Worth a visit if you want to spend some time in a relaxing setting when in the chaos of Thamel then this is the place. It is very small and the cafes are lovely but overpriced but I spent an enjoyable time reading a book and people watching in the sun.......

The perfect place after a busy morning. This delightfully restored garden with a reasonably good restaurant is THE place to go for a quiet lunch followed by a siesta on the lawn, upon a mattress which can be rented for the purpose.

Relaxing place in dusty and hectic Kathmandu. Relaxing place in dusty and hectic Kathmandu. You can relax on a bench reading a book or sitting in the grass field enjoying the tranquility and the beautiful garden. I had lunch here. The food was good but quite expensive, and you have anyway pay the price from 200 rupees.

Oasis in the city. The entry fee is Rs 200, inside there is a restaurant with a pricy menu for Nepal standards and not as good as one would think but the lovely gardens totally makes up for it, more if you wish to scape Thamel's craziness. They are lovely creatures that live in the trees, I'm not sure if they are squirrels or not.
Don't miss it. if you are traveling to Nepal then don't forget to visit this place, it seems like a heaven, beautiful garden with best breakfast. As i understood, it opens only after 9am..

Not a must see but worth a visit. I didn´t know what to expect but as a professional landscaper I had to take a look. My brother and son probably found it less entertaining than I did. It is a small very well cared for & mantained garden (this in itself is unsual for much of asia, but then it´s not an open public space dependent on municipal financing).It is very european in form and even planting perhaps and contains no real surprises, challenges or adventures. But it is a very solid and nice garden with just enough sense of place so as to reflect asia and I would argue that it´s size is a plus for even non gardeners can enjoy it without feeling that they are being ovewhelmed (or perhaps underwhelmed).We visited during the winter so much of the charm of flowering and leafiness was lacking. Instead I could enjoy the structure (sometimes I am such a nerd).As most people have pointed out it is a very, very nice refuge from the grime and noise of Kathmandu.It is easy to visit as it is of no distance from Thamel.The prices I saw for the cafe and restaurant seemed a bit high for me and I am generally not non indulgent of myself. But perhaps my memory is at fault. My recomendation would be to visit this garden as sort of breathing out place between sites (Thamel shopping and Boudha stupa or vice versa perhaps). I´m not sure about their picnic policy but buying sandwiches and such in Thamel and taking a lunch here on the grass would be an excelent part of a tourist day. An hour for a visit would suffice even for the most fanatical gardener. But for chilling....?

Refreshing oasis. We had a lunch here on our last day in Kathmandu. After rather busy streets and taxi's leaking exhaust pipe causing a near death by suffocation :) the garden was a pleasant suprise. Despite the restaurant being quite busy service was prompt and food was up to our expectations. Lovely place!
Bliss. When the dirt, hustle, bustle and street vendors get too much.. stroll into the Garden of Dreams. It is an absolute haven from the outside world, beautifully restores with a wonderful cafe.

small respite from Thamel chaos. short wakling distance from Thamel's rows of shops. Look for a white walled embassy and walk onwards, only 5 mins from one edge of Thamel. NPR200 entrance fee for foreigners. I finished walking around in 30 mins, quite a small place but the horning wasn't quite as ear-splitting and the air was slightly easier to breath. Nice place to read a book, watch the pigeons or young couples on their dates and generally not get harrassed by shopkeepers or trickshaw drivers. I stayed on till early evening when the lights came on, made the place more atmospheric.

A nice place to escape dirty air of Kathmandu. If you are looking for a park, you will not find easily a real one in Kathmandu. This is kind of a park, however it is quite small. It is nice to stay there while reading a book on the sunny day. There are some mats, so that you can lie down on the ground.There is also a restaurant there, the food is good.You have to pay for the entrance.

Wow. This was my second trip to Nepal and the first time I have ever been to the garden of dreams. What a fabulous place it feels like you could be in the middle of nowhere its so quiet. Very romantic location in a very busy city. Well worth a visit

Absolutely delightful.. I loved this place. I am an English gardener who lives in India and it was a real treat to see so many European plants. Everything very well maintained. I spent a large chunk of a day walking and sitting and admiring these gardens whilst there was a Bandh(strike) going on outside.It was truely a safe and beautiful place to be on that morning.Very reasonable entry fee too.
wonderful. wonderful place to be..... a piece of heaven in the mid of the city.... green scenery and flowers make it a lovers delight.... must go!

Respite from the din.... It costs a few rupees for entry, but if you want to stroll the lovely gardens and fountains, or have a cup of tea, a drink, lunch or a gourmet dinner, it is worth the price of entry. The gardens are beautifully maintained, and a nice respite from the craziness of Kathmandu streets, noise and traffic.
Silence in crowd.. Many lovers visit there but its interesting to see people so well mannered there. And perfect place for reading or taking a nap in sun. The coffee they serve in there is great!

Peace in the busy city. Located in the middle of the city near Thamel, Garden of Dreams is a much to see place for tourist. In order to get a bit of peace from the dusty busy city environment, one can come to garden of dreams to enjoy the green surrounding with old buildings and some cafe inside. you can grab a cup of coffee and sit in the corner a enjoy the quiet peaceful environment throughout the day. It is specially filled with couples as this is the perfect place for romance where people doesnt bother who are doing what.Entrance fee to the venue is little bit high though it is worth spending :)

Oasis in the Desert Feel !! A Must Visit !!. Brilliant Place in the Heart of the City - Nice Restaurant - Beautiful Garden laid out by Italian landscaper - centuries back in time !!very romantic in the evening !!

Relaxing atmosphere. + this place for you if you want to have a rest from the noise of Thamel+ plenty of hidden benches to sit in privacy+ nice smelling flowers + in the evening they light lotus-fire in the middle of the pond, looks mysterious- the garden is very small and looks rather old and unattended, but what can you expect from Kathmandu

very nice gardens but very small. 200 rupees per person to enter... it is not expensive but what you get is a small relaxing area away from the hustle and bustle.slightly dissapointed. unless you took a book to waste a few hours away here your 200 rupees would make for a brief visit. A nice place but i wouldnt go as far as to say its a must see in kathmandu.
A sleeper. Right in the center of Kathmandu, this leafy refuge is an oasis of calm. It also has a restaurant withing the formal gardens.

The "Secret Garden" of Thamel. A nice place to get away from the daily hustle and bustle of Thamel. You literally walk into a different world as you step inside the main garden area. A large swing awaits with plenty of space to simply relax and enjoy the quiet. The restaurant is a bit expensive compared to other places in Thamel, but the food taste good and is of decent quality.

interesting place with history. I enjoyed going to the Garden of Dreams in the centre of Kathmandu, although it was a lot smaller than what I imagined. It is a beautiful retreat away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu valley.
Beautiful..... You have to find this place. Tranquility away from the madness. Nice lunches available. If you have to spend more than a few days in Kathmandu then you will need to come here!

lovely place but don't eat in the restaurant!. if you're looking for an escape from the crowded and noisy streets of kathmandu... this is a quiet and serene place. not a bad spot to have a coffee and cake, but don't eat in the restaurant! it's food roulette - some of the dishes were fine but several of them were frankly terrible. better to save your appetite for fire&ice across the street, which is always delicious!
It was average. The garden was nearby so we dropped by, the garden was just average, but quiet, good hang out for a peaceful afternoon.
Nice garden. Clean and nice place to hang out in the sunshine.Garden is well maintained. Lots of young crowd is always there.Entry fee applicable.

Serene and cultural. A great escape from the bustle hustle of the city. It was a peaceful and relaxing place. A wonderful place to wind down after a long day out. I recommend staying long enough for star gazing at night. Very romantic. And very interesting to watch people.

Beautiful place, not the best kitchen in town. Garden of dreams is a beautiful green oasis near the entrance of Thamel. It's very beautiful and worth visiting during different times of the day. Unfortunately the food isn't amazing, so I'd take a book and a pot of tea instead.

A lovely peaceful garden. This was a great place to visit. A beautifully laid out garden with many places to sit and enjoy the warmth of the sun. The many courting couples provided an entertaining diversion. Coffee and cake in the Kaiser Cafe in the garden was excellent too.
Oasis. The Garden of Dreams is great for escaping the chaos which surrounds it. The compound is immaculate, beautiful, and peaceful. Well worth the roughly $2 admission.
Nice and quiet. After some days in Kathmandu it was nice to relax in the beautiful garden with no noises. It is like coming to Vienna - it is restored by the Austrians. But one hour is enough.
Stunning. Absolutley beautiful garden and really good restaurant. Romanitic setting, a real oasis in the city!

A Nice Respite in the Middle of Kathmandu. The Garden of Dreams is a beautiful little park, walled in from the noisy city outside, and provides a peaceful place to re-coup while doing a city tour. There is a cafe and bar which are acceptable.

Oasis in Thamel. If we are really honest overall Kathmandu is a dump. It gets full marks for the temples, Thamel and the people are great but it does grind you down. The Garden of Dreams offers a nice respite from all this. Behind those tall walls (which block some of the KTM noise) are beautiful manicured gardens, water features and a lovely cafe. When Kathmandu ground you down come here to recharge your batteries.

Nice garden, not certain it is worth paying to get into. I expected the garden to be much larger than it was because there was a fee. It only took about 10 minutes to walk around. I do agree that it is a nice place to lay around, but not much an attraction beyond that. The garden aspect wasn't overly lovely. They had a few nice water fountains. It looked like they were doing construction on more of the garden, but it still isn't very large. Not many flowers in January that is for sure. The garden was full of young local couples. Definitely a lover's spot.

A must when in Kathmandu. Visited this Oasis twice- evening and during the day. Highly recommended to do this as it is stunning all lit up at night and during the day it is a lovely place to go and chill. Had a meal in the restaurant which was ok but very expensive especially wine. I would suggest go for coffee and cake during the day. Lots of stunning plants and flowers so some stunning opportunities. Was my favourite place to visit in Kathmandu. Opposite entrance on the other side of the road is Fire and Ice pizza restaurant - ideal for lunch or dinner after the gardens if you are craving western food!

Gorgeous place to laze around and escape. Well worth the entrance to fee to have some peace and quiet (although, honestly, KTM is not at all as hectic as all that, compared to any Indian city!!), and just be. Pretty flowers, nice grassy areas and benches to sit on, (good toilets too), a real little haven. The café is mega expensive though, so unless you want to blow a week's budget on lunch then I'd come here before or after eating in Thamel.There's also a little 'museum' that shows fascinating 'before and after' photos of how the garden used to be after it had fallen into horrific neglect, makes it even more special that it's so gorgeous now!Came here twice we liked it so much.

Peace in the middle of Thamel. This is a little gem being a beautiful garden setting only 5 minutes walk from Thamel. Great for reading a book, talking quietly to friends or simply cooling down after a busy day.

Peace and quiet in the middle of Kathmandu. Don't be put off by the high walled entrance, because inside is a real treat. The Garden of Dreams is a beautiful haven and clearly favoured by young courting Kathmandu couples. Discretion and beauty are popular in every city!

Serenity. The title best describes it. Clean...a large fountain surrounded by beautiful flowering plants, trees, etc. A place to simply relax, read a book or chat with a friend, and soak under the warm sun especially during my trip last Dec 2012. The surrounding architecture blends superbly and also a good restaurant - Kaiser Cafe - is available within the property. Entrance fee for foreigners is 200 rupees. Don't leave Kathmandu without spending the morning in this place. Beautiful!

It IS really a garden of dream!. In the heart of the crowdy, busy, noisy, polluted KTM you'll find the pieceful garden, in where you really can relax. There's huge amount of trees and flowers. Very beautiful garden!

A place of quiet. The first thing I wanted to do when I arrived in kathmandu was to leave, ehat a filthy,dirty, polluted place, however we had to spent a day...So we went to the gardens of dreams, and had a really nice relaxing time, so different from the city. It turned out to be at walking distance from our hotel (shanker hotel) and I can really recommmend it for a good start of the day !
Clean & Quiet. The garden is very clean & quiet, compared with ducty road & heavy polluted air, Garden of Dreams is a place you could not missing.

A haven of calm in busy Thamel. Beautiful gardens and well worth the 200 rupees on a busy day in Kathmandu....a nice cafe(though a little expensive), but it's lovely just to sit out in the lovely manicured gardens to enjoy the sunshine.

Lovely reprise from the busy streets. Is a lovely place to visit to get away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu-- there is a great cafe inside (a bit pricey though, but lovely ambience), and free wifi for entrants. Well worth a visit!
Serenity. A beautiful green peaceful garden away from the noise of Thamel.. take a book and lie around enjoying the peace and quiet

Tanquility in a mad City. A wonderful Oasis of calm in a busy noisy exciting City.
There is an entrance fee which works out to be £3-£4. There is a bar, cafe and restaurant where you can sit and enjoy the peaceful surroundings.

Quiet and relaxing. It is well maintained, lovely and peaceful, with an excellent restaurant. Kathmandu can be so noisy and chaotic, and the Garden of Dreams had a very serene quality to it. It was an oasis.

Sanctuary in the city. Garden of dreams lives up to its name, a lovely little laid out garden right in the centre of the city. You have to pay 200 NRP to enter, but you can spend the whole day here relaxing on the lawns in the peace and quiet. Good toilets at no charge. The cafes do very nice food, although pricey, but nice for a treat with great service and posh table settings.

Garden of Dreams. A wonderful big garden for couples in love or other just want to have peace and relax.Nice reataurants with friendly and kindly staff.A great place for relax with a good book or just sit down of one of the many nice benches you will find everywhere around in the garden and just dream....
Very couply.... Nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. The gardens are very relaxed. However, it is full of couples wherever you look!

THE best!. This was an incredible place- I still have dreams about it. Thamel can give you a huge headache after a while, and this place is ideal to get away and relax. Just order a mango juice, sit by the shady trees and relax.
Tranquil. An area of respite in a very busy city, it is lovely to take a book, bottle of water with you and just lie on the grass and chill out.

Pleasant refuge in chaos. The garden of dreams is an escape; in the middle of Kathmandu, on the edge of Thamel, it offers some space, some green, and a chance to have noone selling anything to you. It's well worth spending an afternoon there, when you're feeling over-Thamel-ed by the chaos - which is still just round the corner, if you need anything. It's fun to go on a holiday, and watch middle-class Nepalese families and couples enjoying themselves.

An illusion of peace. We went here for lunch on our last day in Kathmandu. The food at the Kaiser Café was very good, and the atmosphere was one of joy and gaiety more than peace and quiet, as you could hear the traffic on the street outside only too well. We were there in early January and only a few azaleas were in bloom. Must be wonderful in spring!
