An unexpected oasis. What a great place! If Thamel gets a little too much, just stroll down the road to pop in here and relax. An amazing little oasis to recharge in.
Oasis in Thamel. A lovely place to spend a quiet afternoon after shopping in the chaos of Thamel. The high walls protect the beautifully laid out gardens from the bustle of the city.

A little bit expensive but fun anyways. The garden is a really nice place to relax and read a book. You can still hear the horns of the cars outside on the main road but the garden seems to take away the stress that you build up in the narrow streets of Thamel. It is worst visiting one afternoon.

Beautiful Dreams in the Garden of Dreams. This is a wonderful place to get away from the dust and noise of the city. We spent hours here just talking and relaxing. I recommend everyone to go and visit here. The place is well looked after and I thought it was beautiful.
A quiet get-a-way. In the midst of the noise and pollution, you find this peaceful garden--a nice place to sit or lay around, perhaps after a long trek. Costs about $2-$3 per person.
Beautiful. Beautiful and very interesting gardens in neo classical style. A lot of attention given to rare plants. Closed to Thamel, so good for a green escape from the tourist hub.

It is easy to sit and Dream in the Garden of Dreams. Worth paying the entrance fee and spending some time chilling in a peaceful garden. This has been well renovated and is very pleasant a good place to catch up mail.

Take a break and relax here.... It is a peacefull place, ideal to end your busy day in Kathamandu there. We bought a little picnic and stayed for a long time resting in some cool cushions that are laying on the grass.
Very relaxing place to sit and have a tea. Gorgeous garden, great place to relax.make sure to check out the library which is very beautiful and worthy of a tour

Beautiful oasis of tranquility. This garden is the perfect place to sit and relax for a few hours. It is simply stunning and incredibly well maintained. There's also an interesting room which documents its recovery from overgrown wasteland to what it is today.
stepping into another world. In the middle of town but when I need a classy escape I go here for an early evening drink, fantastic setting
it s not Nepal. really peaceful!!!!!nice place!you have to pay 200 rupees but inside u can totally relax and just enjoy it!!
Oasis of paradise. Just 500 metres from the busy city centre is a garden of dreams literally cafe staff food location price all excellent

Paradise in the middle of busy Kathmandu. I loved this place. There's something beautiful at look at wherever you turn, without being to much. Just remember to bring your own food if you plan on staying longer (which you should), since the food inside is very expensive. You can just sit down wherever you want and relax or walk around and just look at the flowers and architecture.
Relaxing Place in the middle of the dust. An excellent place to forget that you are in the middle of dust and road works. So peaceful and relaxing.
Oasis. It is a nice place to take a rest in the middle of Thmels hustle and hustler, beautifully restored gardens, very peaceful and very LARGE monkeys.!
Nice place. nice place to visit for young couple and even for old. they are also serving good breakfast but its costly little bit, anyway worth for money
Tranquil Oasis. A nice quiet green spot away fromthe fumes and traffic! Nice to just sit and relax here for a while. The cafe is very good but also quite pricey.

Nice place but needs more care. Garden of Dreams is a nice garden located right next to entrance of Thamel and a great escape from busy Kathmandu. I was willing to give it 4 star plus rating but for two reasons. 1. Very expensive cafe inside the Garden and 2. Dirt on the street right outside their garden. However, I still recommend that you visit this place.
it's a garden..... go for ur self and see the nature with the city..within the heart of city...sit relax.. photo shoot meditate what else...

Beautiful. A peaceful tranquility in the middle of crazy Kathmandu! Beatiful and unusual plants, water features and even chinchillas (or something that looked like one). Take your book, find a patch and have an afternoon chilling out.
total chillout. was really nice to take time out and relax in this really nice place, down fall, was the poor people outside, begging for money,

Oasis of calm. In the middle of the city, amidst the chaos, the traffic and the dust a beautiful garden... could located in Italy, India... a gem worth a visit. Allow enough time to enjoy refreshments in the pavilion - first class catering offering breakfast, coffee and cake, salad bar or hot menu.
Kaiser Cafe. The cafe is in the garden of dreams and does good food in a fabulous environment. This is right at the entrance to the Thamil district and a good place for people who aren't risk takers
The Oasis. ... just outside Thamel.You ll love it.Theres even Wifi available!!Coming from Thamel, its hard to believe, zoure still in Kathmandu ...

An oasis of calm delight. I have been to KTM many times but have overlooked this gem. Meeting friends in the sunshine and enjoying the sublime setting so unlike anything else in Nepal. A friend eat there and reported the sea bass to be the best fish he had ever eaten!

Picture perfect oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. One would never think to visit just by looking at the exterior high walls. But step inside and you'll find yourself in a world away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel and Kathmandu. The gardens, though only partly restored is just the spot to relax - you can sit on the grass, have tea at the cafe or just stroll around the garden. A must visit!

Always happy to visit this restaurant. Be aware, the service isn't quick but the food is amazing, try the Madagascan steak, wow, a really succulent steak served with veggies of the day, can't go wrong, and all in the atmosphere of the most chilled out place in Kathmandu

Peaceful Haven. This was a lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon lying on the grass, reading a book and generally 'chilling out'. A welcome respite from the fumes and tooting horns of Kathmandu. We enjoyed seeing the tiny squirrels scurrying about and appreciated the beauty of the gardens.

beautiful and peaceful. Go here one sunny day and find yourself a quiet spot to relax and read your book. its wonderful to find a place like this to get a bit away from the stressful Thamel. Also take a walk through the garden in the evening to se all the light.
Post Trek Bliss. After a couple weeks in the mountains, warm sunny days with wifi in this peaceful escape was a treasure. A must go if you desire some peace...
Peaceful. It can get busy here but the salad bar was fantastic. Bring a book and sit out and read or just wander around.

A real surprise. These gardens are well worth seeing and you may want to have a meal there. Stepping from the chaos of Kathmandu traffic into the garden provides a stark contrast. It is both beautiful and serene. Worth seeing in early evening.
Charming escape from Kathmandu chaos. Loved this place. When the noise, pollution and general craziness get too much this is the perfect antidote. Perfect to chill out.
most relaxing place in Kathmandhu. Loved this place! I went here to get away from all the noise and hustle of Kathmandhu and spent hours there doing some quiet reading. Highly recommended
An oasis of quiet. Beautifully kept, a wonderful place to take a rest from the bustle of Thamel. The resturant has good food, but the service is very slow.

Beautiful escape from Thamel's noise. this place is amazing. Bring something to read otherwise you will be distracted by the couples here. The grounds are incredible, the 200 rupees entrance fee was well worth it. There's also wifi available that can be purchased one hr at a time. The restaurant and tea house on the grounds are well rated. You have to try the bamboo swing!

Lovely oasis in the heart of Kathmandu. Not far from the main entrance to Thamel, this is a delightful gem tucked behind high walls where you can chill out away from the hustle and bustle of the rest o Kathmandu and enjoy the ambience and gardens

Pleasant oasis from chaos of Kathmandu. This beautiful, Greek-styled garden is a breath of fresh air from the dirt and chaos of the surrounding city. Bring a book and spend an afternoon relaxing on the grass with a cushion they provide. Cafe is very nice too.

A quiet pause in Kathmandu but busy. A large garden being quite novel in bustling Kathmandu, we dropped in to experience the calm amid the chaos in Thamel. There is an entrance fee of Rs 200 presumably to limit entry but by mid-afternoon in the high season, it cannot honestly be described as peaceful and tranquil due to the sheer number of people, especially tourists and loved-up Nepalese couples! The high walls do seem to block out the rest of Kathmandu but the Kaiser cafe was full as were all the benches although there was room to lay out on the grass. Worth seeing but won't necessarily bother returning.
A quiet wonderful garden.. It was a five minute walk from the heart of Thamel to the garden. It is a great place to relax and calm down from the cacophony that is Kathmandu.
What a world away!. Sitting in the garden writing in my travel journal was a surreal experience given the hustle and bustle of ordinary Thamel.Wonderful, despite the entry fee.
Beautiful setting- great food. This used to be a royal garden. beautifully lanscaped- excellent food. Definitely a must visit in Kathmandu

Paradise. Serene, manicured garden with plenty of private spaces for quite reflection. Historic architecture and well-maintained fountains make this a lovely escape from the chaotic streets of Kathmandu.
A perfect place to take a pause before or after Thamel. Beautiful gardens, nice coffee shop, benches, shade, nice spots to take pictures! Be prepared to pay 250 Rps (approx. $3). It will be worth it.
lover's retreat. Beautifull gardens, and really an oasis. Th pricing is very fair, and wish they had a bit more beverage offerings variety

A great escape from the traffic and noise. For only a very small entrance fee you can enjoy some time out from the busy Kathmandu streets and enter this oasis. Wonderful lawns, plants, cafe and architecture are there to roam and enjoy. They even supply mats and cushions for the weary traveller to sit in comfort on the lawns. From the outside it appears to only be a restuarant and bar but thankfully my wife knew better. Definitely worth a look for a different side of the Nepali streets!

tranquility amongst the chaos. Behind the high walls that surround the gardens who would believe there could be such a contrast from the noise and the fumes of Kathmandu's busy main roads. Its like stepping into another world. Beautifully manicured lawns and flower beds, a selection of white painted small buildings that house coffee boutique cafes and a quaint little museum that shows the gardens before and after renovation. Here is a place to lay on the grass or find a secluded bench and just sit and take in the peace and quiet. Go here, you wont be disappointed.

Oasis, relaxation, wifi if wanted. As others have said- oasis in the hub of KTM, 200 rps entrance fee, 250 rps for 5 hours WiFi- your entrance ticket lasts all day so you can go back in evening to sit, lovely to sit with a beer or wine- tho dear for KTM- 1250 rps for large white wine and 500mls beer.- worth it. Lots nooks and crannies to sit on benches, beware the pigeons above you in the entrance to restaurant-lots of feathers and "presents' dropping on us !

Yummy. When you enter the place it's lovely. It is a bit more on the expensive side but well worth the money to have a delicious and proper meal with a beautiful view and peace and quiet away form the city madness.

A place to chill. Nice calm colonial style gardens which are a nice retreat away from the hassle of crazy Kathmandu. It is not very big, just a small ground, somewhere to sit and rest quietly for a while - there is an entrance fee.
Very beautiful. Very beautiful but smallish garden. Interesting neoclassic features and a great variety of rather curious plants. there is a bar and a restaurant inside but did not try them.

so refreshing!. it is not as quiet as it is said to be, as it is in the middle of a busy street, but it is absolutely fabulous nonetheless. the garden is neatly cared for, and it feels like being elsewhere altogether - as it was intended when first built! but keep in mind that you have to pay to go, that it is not especially a big garden, but that you can linger to read a book, be romantic, or slowly eat a scrumptious pomagranate as i did!

A nice get away. Curiosity got me in the door. I was pleased to find a eden from the intensity of Kathmandu. Lots of travelers relaxing on the grassy field surrounded by ponds, statues and an antique European setting. Many local couples doing the romantic handholding excape . Nice photo op for couples.

paradise in a busy city. this is like finding a secret sanctuary in the madness of Kathmandu. you can just lie on the grass with a book, eat at the restaurant or drink at Kaiser Cafe. its a very pleasant way to spend some downtime between treks or shopping

a heavan compared to the crap outside!. wow what a pleasant surprise this place was. so peaceful and quiet and clean! I would totally recommed this place to get away from the hustle, noise and rubbish outside in the city!

Oasis In The City. I spent a total of 3 hours in this rather small enclave just outside of Thamel, I meditated twice in a quiet corner without being too disturbed. It is laid back, quiet and peaceful in the boiling cauldron of human activity that Kathmandu represents. My favorite place in Kathmandu.

Relaxing... sort of. Well maintained garden a short walk from Thamel. Peaceful, and a rare bit of green in a dirty town. Would be perfect if not for the nearby intersection, and orchestra of horns constantly honking outside the walls.
quiet. good food. quiet.. Waiter did not know what kind of fish was on the menu. My companion had something Nepalese, which was a better choice tenants my sandwich.

A haven of peace amongst the dirt and squalor that is Kathmandu. Lovely quiet gardens with a very pleasant restaurant within the grounds.
It was clean and the staff attentive and we had a very pleasant lunch relishing the calm before again enduring the chaos and traffic of Kathmandu

Dont miss this garden. Stunning peaceful garden in middle of manic Thamel area. You can stroll around for ages, or lay down and read a book. such a great spot. There is a cafe there to have a drink or bite to eat. Built over a hundred years ago and restored by a guy who won a cowrie game against his father ( who was a key figure in Nepal) and used the winnings to build this stunning oasis.

Great food. The food was divine and the gardens were lovely. We did not make a reservation but there were only two of us. If you have a larger party, I would recommend making reservations as the place is busy.

Oasis in a Chaotic City. A hidden jewel set in the bustling city of Kathmandu.200 rupees to enter this oasis of beautiful sculptured garden in an ancient setting. Well worth the money. The food at the cafe was also moderately priced and excellent quality. We felt like royalty.
Nice break from the city. It's in the center of town, but feels peaceful and tranquil. If you need a break - bring a book and sit in the grass admiring the architecture.

peaceful. Beautiful garden. Entry fee was 2 rupees per person. We only had American dollars and the ticket person refused to accept our $5 bill because it had a tiny tear in one edge. Finally worked it out but he made it difficult. The restaurant is very expensive - avoid it.
Oasis amid the traffic. Liked the calm, the clean toilet, the good cafe/restaurant, the shade and the opportuniity to take a break from the bustle of the tourist shopping area.
Most amazing place. This is the most amazing green space in Kathmandu. Peaceful, relaxing - well worth price of admission.I'd skip the cafe, though - overpriced and way underserved.

Tranquil oasis. A very welcome day at this garden was a real treat, like a spa after a week of madness. Lovely restaurant, with a wide range of food. Beautiful terrace to sit and read or just sit......

Overpriced but if you want somewhere to chill for a whole day this may be your place. We visited this garden expecting it to be far larger. I can see why people find this a tranquil haven from the bustle of the city but if you just want to pop in to see something, this although quite pretty is too small to be truly impressive and therefore I would say unless you have considerable time to spend there, dont bother.
Beautiful place. its something I did not expect in Kathamdu...among all the chaos lies a peaceful garden. The restaurant is also very good. A rather romantic place I think.
A small piece of heaven. You would never know you are in Kathmandu when you are here, its peaceful, beautiful and the restaurant is great
Oasis of peace. Surrounded by a wall - the 200 rupee admission keeps out hawkers and beggars. Very relaxing and calm. Lots of shady places to read quietly

A good refuge from the chaos. If you are getting a bit jaded by the negative aspects of Kathmandu, this is a nice place to spend a lazy afternoon just relaxing or reading. I also was interested to see the gallery of photos of the garden in it's overrun condition before it was restored. The high walls don't completely exclude the sound of the nearby busy traffic but it still seems civilised compared to the world outside.I also ate at the Kaiser Cafe. There probably aren't too many places in Kathmandu where you could dine in the open air with such an outlook. The standard of food and drink was high and so are the prices.
Dreams????. This is very small garden and if you don't have a rooftop at your hotel, this is the place to relax. Don;'t expect to much of it, but the location is convenient.

Garden of dreams Have a peace environment. Located in the city center and kept in a quiet than outside the entrance.Old classical type of the building where we drink with nice cofee. Naba officially from the mountain air guided adventures recognize me that places. Easy and fast from a busy thamel , it give a new sense in your day walking, really i enjoy this.
A little peace in Thamel. The garden was much smaller than I expected but it was a welcome break from the hustle and bustle if you’re in the area of Thamel.

Ok. It is a nice garden with flowers and a restaurant but it is very small. It also has hardly any shade and is quite bare. I would recommend taking a day trip to the hills, godavari boutanical garden or just leaving the vallley. If you are staying here only for a short time than this a nice place to go to.

... amazing in the middle of Kathmandu .... Like the clean, uncharactaristically well kept garden and buildings. They should spread that knowhow throughout Kathmandu! Amazing that a person could build such a thing so long ago. also nice to see the number of young couples making use of the Garden's numerous places to sit together.Don't like: Entree fee for the park does not get deducted from the restaurant/bar bill. It is the least they could d I would think. It is funny to have to pay entry fees for a a bar

Little Oasis. We went at Sunset - it was lovely and peaceful (if you can filter out the traffic noise) Excellent little museum with before and after pictures. There is a very good restaurant in the pavillion.

Relaxing place away from the city streets. This truly is a garden of dreams away from the cayos of the streets of Kathmandu around Thamel. The garden is well maintained. By reading the history it sounds like the garden was neglected and just about destroyed a number of years ago. What a great idea to restore it. It was so nice to get away from the noise of the streets and relax here and have lunch. the lunch was a bit pricey would be my only negative comment.

Beautiful and calm place. The Garden of Dreams in Kathmandu is the place to go to get a little peace and quiet from the hectic Thamel. It's beautiful and peaceful, and many people just come there to read or to relax (we even saw some tourists sleeping on the grass!). Although it's not very big, the atmosphere is great, and we spent a lovely afternoon there. There's a 200 rupees per person fee, no doubt it's worth it.

A very pleasant oasis. In a hectic city such as Kathmandu it's a treat to find a sanctuary like the Garden of Dreams. Beautifully restored gardens and pools add an elegance to dining after the dust and hustle of Thamel. The one turn-off: 200Rs to enter, even if you are dining. A small price to be sure, but still...

Garden of Peace and quiet. Great place on the edge of Thamel to get away from the noise and crowds. We went to have a look and ended up staying for the afternoon. It's beautiful and one of those places which instills people to whisper. We fell asleep on the well manicured lawn with other travellers and Nepalese all seeking refuge in this peaceful oasis

A beautiful haven. Spent a morning wandering the beautiful gardens. It reminded me of the granduer of British India. Couple of great cafes where the food was well priced and good quality. Great place to take a book and laze away a morning or afternoon. Open from 9am till 10pm......wish I'd seen it a night!

Calm in the Storm. This walled off garden was the calm admidst the pandemonium, dust and noise...while we truly enjoy Kathmandu, chaos and all, this was a nice quiet break. You can relax, enjoy the beautiful lawns, roam the gardens, utilize the wireless network there or have lunch. We actually were in the area of the Garden of Dreams twice during our trip, each time we stopped in, enjoyed the peace and quiet and had lunch both times. Great photo opportunities, peaceful, relaxing, and lunch was good.

If you need a break, this is your place. If you need a break from noisy and chaotic Kathmandu come here....On my flight back home I had to kill 7 hours in Kathmandu and this is where I spent two of them.I couldn´t believe that Kathmandu had such a spot...Perfect for hanging out, reading, taking pictures....the lawn is almost manicured and the flowers are beautiful.

Nice Garden. The gardens were very nice and it was a relaxing place to go away from the chaos of Thamel - that being said - if you've been to any other garden in the US it is probably bigger and nicer than this one..... I may have liked it more if it were free although the cost was still cheap - but after we paid and walked in there wasnt really much to do - it was like any "park" type environment you'd find in the US .... the bar/restuarant was closed when we were there unfortunately. it was okay all in all.

Am I still in Thamel?. Quite surreal walking into this garden. Instantly transported into quite another world, with its beautifully manicured lawns, colurful flowers and even tame squirrels and crows. A real respite from the madness that is Thamel just over the wall. The cafe there serves the best brownie we've had in years. And it was a relief to use a clean restroom. A nice recharge before negotiating the narrow dusty streets of Thamel again, if you don't mind paying the entrance fee of 200 Rupees.
relaxation!. A great place to relax in the heart of a hectic city, brilliant to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and calm surroundings after negotiating Kathmandu traffic and streets for a while.

a haven.... quiet and peaceful...absolutely beautifully restored with exceptional gardens. The restaurant was OK. It does get busy but recommended to visit as a great place to read a book or plan your trip outside Kathmandu...

a really nice place to take a break.. Wifi, comfy mats and a beautiful environment make for a very pleasant break from the madness that is Kathmandu. Also, very clean restrooms and pleasant dining options make this a good spot for lunch.

Garden of dreams. Yeah great place to escape Thamel But over priced to sit on the grass and even have to pay if going to restaurant which i find a bit much… still nice and pleasant Staff will get you mats and cushions to sit on so not having to sit directly on grass
Very beautiful and serene. Just off Thamel and yet feels like a hundred thousand miles away.Nice to sit there for few hours with a book..

quiet spot in Thamel area. Pros- nice quiet and well-kept area great for fotos and relaxation, not far from the street noises of Thamel district.Cons: Unless you are bringing a firfriend or boyfriend to photograph the admission cost for foreigners is a little high for the amount of time spend.General-- pleasant and happy I went

Peace and Beauty. Living for a long time in Kathmandu, I only visited the place recently. I knew it existed and always wanted to check it out but never imagined it to be so beautiful. Only a stonethrow from the dirt, rip-off and noise of Thamel, the Garden of Dreams is a real Oasis of Peace. Had I known it before, I would probably have spent a lot of time here.The Garden of Dreams is a historical garden that has been renovated after it had been falling apart for many years. It is kept up really well for Nepali standards, there lots of Flower gardens, water ponds and fountains... and clean toilets. Couchins and mats are placed on the greens, inviting you to take a nap or read the book you always wanted to finish. On one side of the garden, the Kaiser Café is located, a Coffee Shop / Restaurant run by the 5-star Dwarika's Hotel. The food is good but extremely overpriced (what could you expect). Anyhow, the guards don't mind if you bring you own bag of crisps and a softdrink, as long as you don't start a campfire...For the couples of Kathmandu, there are few places where can actually meet to hold hands and talk to each other - public "affection" even if it is not more than innocent holding hands is still quite a taboo in Nepal and young couples often get trouble with the police if doing so. The Garden of Dreams has somehow become the most popular meeting ground for young couples and it is often quite difficult to find a sitting place, as all benches are occupied by the romantic young of the city - in tears or not... but there is the wonderful greens, which have enough space for everybody. The toilets are clean and it seems like a pretty safe place to let your kids run around and enjoy some nature which is otherwise seldom in a place like Kathmandu city. Go for it, a must see place after a long dirty day in the city.

An unsuspected oasis. Discovered this place near Thamel almost by coincidence. We had been passing by everyday day during 3 weeks. Turned out to be an amazing beautiful place. You can go there with your laptop and use their wifi connection for very little $ while enjoying a rare peaceful moment in Kathmandu.

A pleasant walk. The food is expensive there but the portions are so huge that a sandwich easily makes up for an entire meal. Of course the quality is excellent. Nice for a little walk. And this is one of those places that locals also frequent, which always makes the place feel more 'authentic'. Great for a walk in the late afternoon before you head into the casinos!

Valentine's Event. We came to this place after reading an ad of a valentine event. We were disappointed that the organizers were not organized as they should have. We did not receive the advertized welcome drinks. The program started so late that they were just setting up when we arrived at the supposed start time. However we liked the park and we took a few photos of ourselves to pass the time. We left in the middle of the program because it was so cold already and the lights kept of going out during the program.
dream... realy realy amazing place with amzing options...... nice place to chill and relax....when u get inside u feel in dream ........everybody must see :D

beautiii-ful!. nice nice nice . Just so nice and beautiful and well kept. A real retreat in Thamel. Perhaps a little difficult to find without a map, but I think you can ask around. It seems, anyway, nothing in thamel is more than 5 minutes walk away
Worth a trip. Definitley one to cross off whilst there. Dwarikas restaurant worth visiting if your not staying at the main resort.
great place to visit. it's really a great place in the middle of city with nice and pleasant view. the ambiance is great and good place to visit

Surprise in the middle of Kathmandu. We discovered this beautiful eating place as we were walking towards Thamel. They have a NR 200 entrance fee but we went to have dinner so we could not really look around the Garden. The food was great ... most of had the Nepali thali which was quite a quantity to handle. Service was good and the ambience great.

The Garden of Dreams is - a garden of dreams ; )). If you happen to stay in noisy, touristic Thamel at your first night in Kathmandu - spend the whole next day here. The Kaiser Cafe. The Garden of Dreams. Have a chilled glass of champagne in the morning. The lobster for lunch (if the lobster is out, try the Wiener Backhaendel or the Jumbo Prawns - all superbe cuisine by The Dwarika's Hotel & extremely excellent). The rest of the day just chill in the garden (of dreams ; ) on the provided matrasses to catch up with the sleep you didn't get last night. It's a one minute walk from the eastern spot of Thamel (Tri Devi Marg direction Kantipath and the ex-king's-palace). Entrance fee: 2 USD. Worth it! Sweet dreams ; ))
Oasis. That is a cliche but it truly is an oasis - we valued it for group debriefings and for the simple pleasure of relaxing in a gorgeous garden.

peaceful despite the location. good food - fresh and interesting. Good service. But it is the setting that makes this place special - a beautiful garden with koi fish ponds and you are only yards from a busy intersection leading to Thamel and all the noise and commerce.

Little Oasis in the middle of Chaos. We loved this place. It is well worth the price of admission. There is a very nice restaurant there and you have wifi available. Kathmandu has become quite noisy in the last few years with the huge influx of motorcycles, so this is a very quiet respite.

Didnt meet the expectations. The entrance was spectacular but the gardens are way too overplayed. They are essentially a hide out for young couples who want privacy from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. For the average traveler there is not much to see. Its a very small plot of land that is converted into a nicely manicured garden, but it is ideal only for young romancers.

Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful Gardens. Lots of local young couples canoodling (or more) so not very kid friendly. The restaurant/cafe is run by Dwarika's (one of the most expensive eateries in the city) and thus the food is WAY over priced. The gardens have been nicely restored by the Austrian Government.

A lovely respite amidst Kathmandu's "lively" scene. Upon recommendation from a Scottish expat living in Kathmandu, we checked out the Garden of Dreams. It's a wonderful place to take a break from the chaos of the city. It's amazing how the air quality changes (for the better) once you step into this urban oasis. There are restaurants, an art gallery, and lovely gardens to relax and enjoy the day/evening. I highly recommend a visit there !!
Good place to hide from the beggars.. Pleasant gardens a nice place to get some quiet and read a book. A romantic spot. We wanted to eat at the cafe but the power was out.

Slice of Heaven. This is a little slice of heaven hidden right in the heart of Kathmandu's tourist district, Thamel. The Garden is a lush paradise with green lawns, tropical plants, statues, a beautiful pavillion restaurant and Koi pond. Everbody was happy to just sit, relax and enjoy. The restaurant has a wonderful menu and the food is very reasonable for the qaulity. I almost didn't want to leave!
Dreamy food. The gardens are lovely to walk around in and sit and people watch, but the highlight for me was the delicious lunch and drinks we had in the cafe.

A place to relax. First trip to the east? Stressed by Katmandu? Then simply come in here and sit in the gardens (in the morning there are sometimes school groups but they're well behaved) you'll forget you're in the centre of Katmandu. The cafes not too over priced and although theres not a lot here its well kept and so bring a book (or sketch pad) and while away a few chilled out hours before leaping back into the wonders of Katmandu.

relax. very nice place go there after a long day of roaming around have a nap enjoying the nice breez ( if its not raining) it has nice cafe and resturant if you wish to eat or have something to drink
Gorgeeeeouuus. Wow wow wow - Amazing place! We came here with family and I am blown away - soo quiet relaxed and absolutely beautiful. Must-visit when in Kathmandu

Beautifully designed and manicured gardens away from the chaos of Kathmandu. Pros:Security guards at entrance and within the walled premises make you feel safe.Relaxed atmosphere (if you tune out of the adjacent traffic noise).There are lots of romantic couples and young families.Features of the walled gardens include fountains, lily ponds/fish, flower beds, lawns, trees, shrubs and hedgerows, along with several sculptures and benches. Main plants are labelled in Latin and English. Gardeners were clipping the hedgerows and sweeping away the leaves during my visit, so everything is immaculately maintained.A surprisingly large variety of birds were flying or perched overhead.Padded lawn matts available (no charge) if you want to lie on the grass.There is a small building containing a gallery of photographs showing the site before and after renovation. Go to the 'Kaiser Cafe Restaurant' (turn right after entrance) within the grounds for drink or food and views along the length of the gardens.There is a 'Barkha Bar' (turn left at entrance) serving alcohol, snacks and ice cream. There's a small covered outdoor seating area as well.Numerous toilets available.There is a library within the main house, but this was closed during my visit.Cons:Entrance fee.WiFi chargeable (Rs 250 for 5 hours).Traffic noise - mainly horns - can still be heard over sections of the wall.Tip: Take a book to read and relax.Tip: The gardens are partially illuminated at nightfall. Tip: If, with the Gardens entrance/exit on your left, you walk straight ahead across the crossroads, then first right (after approx 10 mins walking), you enter a street containing a Pizza Hut, KFC, an authorised Apple dealer and other 'western' shops.

Peace in Kathmandu.. The Garden of Dreams is a lovely, tranquil space to get away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. Beautiful gardens and a great cafe, making it the perfect place to spend a relaxed morning.

100 % gourmet. I loved everything about this sophisticated restaurant with a prayer bell outside, located inside the Garden of Dreams. There is a huge amount of gourmet vegetarian and vegan fare to chose from, beautiful decoration (warm reds and oranges, artwork) and wonderful French wines. Beautiful luxury.

A Diamond in the Rough.... The Garden of Dreams is a diamond in the rough and tumble Thamel district. It gives you a place to relax and chill out after being constantly accosted by rickshaw drivers, tiger balm salesmen, etc. It is a nice place to take the book you're reading. Enjoy the beautifully kept garden. Don 't forget your camera!
nice place to hangout. i have visited it twice with my friends. we love hanging out there.. very relaxing place and peaceful. nice place to read books.. must visit!! beautiful garden as well!!

A genuine oasis. After your fifteenth shop selling faux North Face gear and sixteenth conversation about whether or not your really need a tent, then this place is a genuine and much-needed oasis.  The entrance fee (duh!) is clearly designed to keep the riff-raff out, but leave the class angst at the door and just lie back and enjoyed the manicured lawns and delicate water features.  If you've been dragging kids around Thamel then this place is obligatory pay-back.  Kaiser's Cafe (part of the Dwarika's Group) is in the south east corner of the garden and good for an ice cream (stupidly off menu) or an iced coffee.
Peaceful. A hidden gem close to Thamel, 5 minutes walk, with very nice lawns and garden. A quiet place to relax from the continued hustle & bustle of Thamel and Kathmandu.

Give a try!. This place is near by Thamel with very easy access of walking distance from there. Try to give a chance to visit this place and you will be amazed. I frequently go here with my wife and it's always amazing. The garden is really dreamy and may be that is why it is garden of dreams! It feels like so peaceful inside and nothing is disturbing you. Give it a visit!

Smells like plants!. This is a sweet oasis just on the edge of Thamel. You can still hear the traffic, but the beautiful garden nearly makes you forget the craziness outside the walls. It feels so much cooler and fresher that anywhere else in Kathmandu. Lots of gorgeous flowers, and the food at the cafe is really nice too, although a bit more expensive than the local places. Worth it though.

Wow Wow Wow. Small but beautiful garden..... in thamel. Once you enter you will feel like you are very far from Kathmandu and it's traffic. To go inside you have to pay Rs180 (if I am not wrong) but it is worth paying. evening dinner with lights .... you will enjoy it as i did.

bustling tranquility. Garden of dreams is a nice place to relax with a beer and picnic. The classical architecture is designed on London houses and so has a slightly British-Indian colonial feel, although it was actually built by a Prince from the winning of a bet with his father. Suprisingly tranquil for Kathmandu, but you cannot come to Kathmandu for peace and quiet.

WAY TOO EXPENSIVE. But the food is good. I don't understand why they don't give you the 'entrance fee' back on your bill if you eat at the restaurant. Since they don't it is a really expensive meal. The food is good but expensive and add on the entrance fee??? I never take anyone here.
Romantic. Gorgeous. At dusk the lights came on and it was lovely. Ate at the restaurant. Fun.

Relax. Need time of from Thamel? Go to the Garden of Dreams!
Take a good book, borrow a mat and enjoy this "Thamel free area"

Pleasant spot to come for a few hours. It's kind of ridiculous that tourists have to pay to get in, (especially if you are going to spend money at the overpriced cafe anyway!) but I guess the money helps to maintain the gardens. This is certainly one of the nicest spots in Kathmandu if you are looking for somewhere to get away from the craziness of the city.

Beautiful corner of heaven. The Garden of Dreams is a corner set aside from the hustle and bustle of big city life. It is an easy walk from The Hotel Shanker or Thamel. It is meticulously tended and colorful with tropical vegetation. We even went back a second time to have dinner.

dream comes true in dream garden. Dream garden is very pretty and it is impressive to see the before and after pictures. Take a picnic lunch or eat at the little cafe there.
The garden is a sanctuary from the outside world, with two places to get food and drinks and lovely gardens to sit and relax in.

Amazing place around thamel. It is the greatest pleasure for those who visit This garden with a Couple or a Book, Those who love nature & like European Cuisine, this is the fantastic and relaxing places, no more places I found in Kathmandu rather this one.................
www.toursnepalvision.com

Refuge from the madness. Lovely garden in the centre of Kathmandu to sit and relax in. 200 NPR entrance fee but definitely worth it.
Cafe is very expensive.
Very beautiful but expensive. Nice place to chill out in beautiful surroundings, but prices are very high to Kathmandu standards. And paying wifi while it's free in all of Thamel...
Stunning. Beautiful, tranquil garden in the heart of bustling Kathmandu.
Pretty. The garden is very pretty and it is impressive to see the before and after pictures. Take a picnic lunch or eat at the little cafe there. The german fried chicken was pretty good!

couple resort. when we were there we mainly saw all couples there, its very relaxing and nice set up, fountains, garden, great atmosphere to sit or lie down and spend quality time with your loved lone
Hidden gem. Magnificent grounds are hidden behind a wall on a busy street. Beautiful tranquil place to have a really good meal.

The oasis in the cesspool. The must see of Kathmandu! We spent as much free time as we could in the Garden of Dreams. The cafe is supremely tasty and inexpensive (Everything under $10). The garden is beautifully manicured and very quiet. The little museum is nice and shows before and after preservation photographs. Entrance is less than $2.

Nice place to visit and have a snack at Kaiser Cafe. The garden is a sanctuary from the outside world, with two places to get food and drinks and lovely gardens to sit and relax in. There is a fee to gain entry and this must be paid even if you just want to eat/drink at Kaiser Cafe. Realistically, it's cheap in comparison to western prices.

A break from Kathmandu. there is no better place to go after your taxi has just driven in to a motorbike (he was ok). As soon as you walk behind the wall you can relax! Plus the food at the Cafe was really good no tummy problems from eating there. Go in the gallery and see how much work they have done restoring the gardens.
Haven in a busy city. Beautiful and peaceful. A good place to relax with a book

Should be called The Haven. Step out of the busy street and into this amazing garden and stunning historical group of beautiful buildings. We had just been to the Palace and were dying for lunch and were greeting with not only a tranquil haven but a delicious lunch. Recommended to visit if you want to get out of the hustle and bustle of this main drag, full of beggars.
Loved the peace. Very well presented garden. Great for a quiet afternoon to people watch!
Amazing Venue disappointing food. The venue is an old palace garden redone up and is a beautiful place to sit in the evening... but the food is a let down.
Very good place. A small Garden but beautifully decorated and maintained. One will feel very pleasure over there.

What a property. We ate at the restaurant in the Garden of Dreams... It was a wonderful experience since we were set in the middle of this beautiful (and extremely huge!) field of flowers and grass.. The food was excellent..The set up seemed surreal. Felt like we were in another world!

Great escape from the city. Kathmandu is the noisiest city we've ever been to and that's why it's so relaxing to come to Garden of Dreams to escape from the city. This garden makes you feel like you are NOT in Kathmandu. You don't hear horns, and don't breathe polluted air in. The garden is nice, well maintained. The entrance is 160 rupees, but it's worth paying. We recommend you to go early in a day, read your book or relax on the grass, and have a lunch at Kaiser Cafe.

Wow!. It is hard to believe that this place sits hard up against the noise and chaos. It is so peaceful and very beautiful and a lovely spot to sit as the sun goes down. The Kaiser Cafe provides a nice evening meal with the accompanying sounds of the frogs singing.
oasis in central Kathmandu. a lovely place to spend some chill out time after a day in the chaos of Kathmandu.

Oasis. I came to the Garden during the strikes in May 2012, as all the shops and restaurants were closed. I'm so glad I did! the Garden is quiet and seems far removed from the sensory overload of Thamel. One could spend all day drinking masala tea and browsing the beds of flowers here!

A vey peaceful place. The gardens are a welcome respite from the busy city. The flower gardens are lovely to look at, here, one can have a short stroll, or sit and read a book, meet with friends, or have a coffee or all of these. It is such an unexpected treat in the middle of such a busy place.

Brilliant. When the noise and hussle-and-bustle of Kathmandu gets too much, here is where is is quiet, tranquil and great to relax. Bring a book and your diary, and relax. The food seemed more expensive than elsewhere, but you can still enjoy the gardens and have a drink.

Garden of Peace. A 10 minute walk from Thamel along Tridevi Marg will bring you to the peace and tranquility of The Garden. I discovered what was behind this wall 30 years ago and would often come and wander around in the overgrown garden admiring the surprises being choked by weeds, watching a million bats hanging in the big tree. The Austrian Govt. funded restoration, is a pleasure to now see. The bats are long gone and the garden's neo classic arcitecture is along the lines of many of the formal gardens of Europe. The rup160 and( 40 for a child) entrance fee is well worth it .Wifi is also available at rup250 for 5 hours. If you are into flowers you will be treated with a great variety of constantly changing blooms.The lush green lawns have lounge mats to lay on and there are many shady spots to just sit and enjoy. The temperature is noticeably cooler than out on the streets which can be a blessing in Spring and Summer in Kathmandu.The pond is full of fish lazily playing "follow the leader". The food in the cafe is excellent and if you have been living on dhal bhat for weeks it is worth the higher prices. Also the toilets are worth a mention if you are missing home.

Garden of Dreams. The garden od Dreams was an oasis in chaos. Once you stepped into the garden the craziness of the streets outside disappeared. It was very much old Colonial English style architecture and lovely to see these places still exist. The food was good but a bit pricey but the service was A La Carte so that was fair.The plant life was beautiful and it was really pleasant to be amongst the green, clean surroundings. You can take a book and settle in for the afternoon on mats provided in the gardens or just inhale some CO2 for a while.

Luxurious getaway and retreat from Thamel. No other place can compare to the beautifully restored garden right next to Thamel. The food is expensive and yes, there is an entrance fee, but it is worth the visit. Make sure to visit the bathrooms in the restaurant. Their elegant old fixtures and black and white tile are special. In the fall when it is cool, plop down on their mats that are placed on the grass and listen to the birds. You can even bring a picnic lunch.

OK to escape from noise and chaos. Hyped here on TA, but actually a nice but rather small city garden that makes a welcome escape from the city noise and chaos, but as a park or garden has not so much to offer.
beautiful and peacful. very beautiful and peaceful garden. It is nice spending some time there away from hustle and bustle of Kathmandu centre. The coffee shop there was expensive though.

Paradise in Kathmandu. When inside the garden, you could be a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel. Peace and quiet, beautiful flowers and trees, calming water features and a fantastic cafe, combine to make you relax.

Nice garden, boring food. The garden itself is very nice, and can be a great break from Thamel, however the Cafe there serves really boring and expensive food. Go for the garden and maybe coffee, but visit some of the much more exciting restaurants and cafes in Thamel for food.

Oasis. In the center of this busy city, a restored mansion and it's gardens allow you to take a breath. There is ample space on the grass to lie down (cushions are provided) and read through your tourist guide as you give your legs a rest from walking around town our mountains. There are 2 nice cafes as well. Sweet resting place and ideally located to be the starting point for an evening out in Thamel, which is just a 2min walk from here.

A first rate spot for total relaxation. This beautiful garden welcomes loungers ready to read a good book, or tourists just wanting to look around. The restaurant offers a beautiful view of the garden, and by Asian standards is a bit pricey but by Western standards is a good deal. Check out the room with pictures showing the site before and after renovation. What a lovely contrast!
WOW!! what a amazing place. An amazing beautiful place in the middle of Kathmandu, words cannot express what a gem this garden is. Go and see it for yourself.

An oasis in the middle of noisy City. Heading down from the old Royal Palace towards Thamel, it is a tiny entrance on the right. Worth paying to go in, this is Nepal's secret garden. A sea of tranquility amidst the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu's tourist area, you will immediately be calmed by the tinkling sound of water and a restful vista of plants and neo-classical architecture. And yes, the Kaiser Cafe is open now, serving wonderful food and coffee. Not the cheapest place in town, but probably the best ambience.Entry fees is 160 NPR and inter net access is 250 NPS for 5 hrs.

Garden of Dreams, Kathmandu. A haven away from the madness that is Kathmandu in peaceful surroundings. A beautifully restored garden which is an ideal place to spend half a day chilling. It was originally built by a Prime Minister's son after he won 100,000 rupees in a gambling game with his father. I would like to know more about the history of the garden but it was a bit thin on the ground The only downside was the lack of availability of tea at the cafe because of power cuts but that is a standard Kathmandu/Nepal happening which no one can do anything about.

Chilling in the midst of the chaos. the garden of dreams is an excellent break in the buzzing madness of Kathmandu. best pick a week date that is not a holiday or enjoy observing Nepalese enjoying the serene garden and taking pictures of their loved ones.

An Oasis in the heart of the hussle and bussle. This was once the garden of Keshar Rana one of the royal's in the Rana era. I was alowed to go into to disrepair and 6 year ago it was restored to it's formal glory... A must to do visit, It's full of Nepal's history go and visit the library which hold some very rare book's some of which a first additions. Then sit in the garden with your book and have a cup of coffee or tea or even have lunch there.

Calming and serene. If sometimes the chaos of Thamel in Kathmandu is too much, come to the Garden of Dreams and you'll feel like you're in an entirely different city. It's so pretty and very quiet. Its a perfect place to have a snack, drink some tea, or read a book. They have wifi in the entire garden as well so bring your laptop!
Time better spent somewhere else. Honestly if your short on time in Nepal, it can be better spent on other sites. Just a garden really.

An oasis......... Garden of Dreams is a former place garden with some buildings that was restored from dereliction in the 90s. You have to pay to get in but it's worth it.The gardens are a perfect oasis from the hustle and bustle of Thamel, beautifully kept with nice water features and manicured lawns and borders. Tourists are spread over the lawns and local couples huddle in corners furtively getting some privacy.There is a very nice cafe and restaurant where you can sip on a drink or have some food and while away the hours before stepping back out into the madness of Thamel.

a dream indeed. once again, the sould and body need rest from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu and what a lovely place to chill and stretch out ...either in the cafe with a good capucino or lunch or on the grass with a good book lounging on a mat in the genlt sun.... hard to believe one is in the middle of the city and all its noises!
Quite place in a busy city. Easy to find, and offered a peaceful place to read, write, etc ... especially after having been in the moutains for so long.
Garden of Dreams. Escape the madness of Thamel and pollution. Lovely cafe, small entrance fee, or buy a season ticket

Worth visiting. Beautiful and very well maintained garden right in the middle of the bustling city. excellent landscaping. The entrance fee was a bit expensive. There are coffee shops and restaurants to sit a relax, enjoying the view. We visited during the daytime but were told that the lighting at night is also worth watching.

Worth a visit!. Very beautiful place, a real oasis in the middle of the Kathmandu chaos. Worth to visit both during day and night, spend some time relaxing in the gardens and then enjoy a drink in the bar.

The name says it all.. We loved this little spot. I have walked right past it before, but on this trip we made a point of going in to have a look around. We were not disappointed. Just a slight doorway in a long brick wall is all you will see, alongside the busy, crazy Thamel street that leads to the palace. But once inside, it is quiet and beautiful. You almost forget you are in Kathmandu! We wanted to get an espresso coffee, but the stupid government decided it was time to shut off the power, so we had Nescafe instead. Oh well. It was relaxing and beautiful nonetheless. Also make a point of visiting the small information room about the garden and how it was been restored from total neglect. The 150rs cost to get in is well worth the work that is involved for upkeep.

It's really a dream. If you want to escape from the crowded Kathmandu, and enjoy peace and nature, you must visit this garden, which could be also in France or Vienna. It worth to sit on the grass and just enjoy the sun and the flowers.

An escape!. Perfect to escape the hussle and bussle of the chaos! you would never imagine that this place exists! Very beautiful to go for a chill out. You can use the mats to relax on and come back to earth after the chaos of Katmandhu beyond the walls of the Garden of Dreams!
Haven of Peace. Lovely, really relaxing way to spend a few hours after the hussle and bussle of central KTM. Lie on the green cushions watching the birds play in the trees.

Not quite as good as you hoped. Really was looking forward to this but the garden is much smaller than I expected. Interesting restoration and design but it can't be much bigger than a football field in size and for all the great restoration it was not really as much of dream respite from restless Thamel outside as I had hoped. If you have cash and can afford the upmarket bar inside then I would say that this might be a cool place to hang out. You have to pay an entrance fee to get in though.
oasis. historic and interesting garden with excellent food and drinks forming a peaceful retreat in Kathmandu
Alittle bit of paradise. Just pop in here for a couple of hours to escape the amazing madness of Thamel in Kathmandu. It is an oasis of calm and well worth the 160 rupees!

An oasis of peace. When Kathmandu in general and Thamel in particular is getting a bit too noisy and dusty, duck into the Garden of Dreams with a book and a pillow and just chill out. Even when it's busy, it's calm and quiet. Beautiful.
nice but expensive. Nice garden to relax but very expensive. You don't feel like you are in Nepal : it looks more like an English garden

Overly hyped. It is a garden that has been renovated. It looks pretty but its just a garden with hardly much of a history.If you are on a short time limit and in Kathmandu there are hundreds of other better, more interesting places to visit. Do not waste your time here.
Kathmandu stopover. Good variety, reasonable prices, enjoyed the meal.

Serenity and Peace near Thamel. After a long day of walking the city, dashing across streets fearing for your life and being covered in dust; paying a couple of dollars to enter the Garden of Dreams seemed underpriced. An oasis dreamed up by the Dwarika family, it is a peaceful place to read, journal or nap right in the heart of Kathmandu and a stone's throw from bustling Thamel.
Worth to visit. A good plce to visit if you are around Thamel, Kathmandu
Fantastic place to relax in Thamel area.. It's the best place for enjoying a good relax and reading in this garden, really it's the garden of dreams in Thamel area.

Lovely garden. Thamel and the whole of Kathmandu is very busy, and this is a really lovely place to enjoy some peace, read a book, enjoy the silence. As you have to pay to enter the gardens, no beggars, and not too many visitors. A fantastic place to spend some quiet time, to read and to enjoy the sun.

Oasis in the centre of the city. Beautiful garden designed in the 1920s and redeveloped recently. I visited at least 5 times during my time in Kathmandu and each time I found something new to appreciate: the statues, the hedges carefully trimmed, the range of flowers, the ponds... The garden is a very peaceful place to sit and read, or just wander in peace. There is a restaurant which is rather pricey, but has great food and is good for a special treat.

A welcome retreat. The Garden of Dreams is located conveniently in the heart of Kathmandu.It is possible to spend a very pleasant couple of hours enjoying its delights. There is also a very good restaurant offering a varied menu which ranges from light bites to more substantial meals.If you wish to re-enter after your initial visit then just tell the ticket office and they will make a note on your entry ticket.

Charming little garden. It is at the entrance of Thamel district so it is nice to go there after some tiring sightseeing. One can relax on the mats provided by the Garden and also have something to eat in the restaurant which however is very pricey.

A Beautiful oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. Located just a few blocks from the Thamel area, The Garden of Dreams is a lovely secluded garden located within the walls of a refurbished palace. Restaurant on site was excellent with great service. They do charge a fee to get in, but someplace you can spend a quiet afternoon, sitting on the tiered steps of an amphitheatre or on one of the many benches within the grounds. Wifi available at a cost.
Breakfast in the Garden of Dreams. Peaceful oasis in a busy, polluted part of town. Excellent coffee, good breakfast menu and helpful waiters.

Oasis in Kathmandu. Inside the walls of this establishment are beautiful grounds/gardens. There is a bar and restaurant or you can just sit in the grounds and enjoy the ambience. The meal at the Kaiser Cafe was most enjoyable. You will possibly need to make a reservation and make sure you advise the gate keeper on arrival or you will be up for an entry fee.
Lovely. Very special place in the middle of Thamel / Kathmandu. Good and romantic for couples but also for relaxing...
Excellent place to click pics.. I really loved the garden very much and its really a nice place to click pics with flowers. Muct visit.

Most beautiful garden/park in Nepal. Absolutely stunning garden - renovated so beautifully and has so many cute corners and details that you can easily spend a few good hours in there. Nice pastries in the coffee shop as well.Highly recommended
Hidden gem. What a wonderful garden, hidden away from sight. Well worth the entrance fee.Recommended!

Wonderful. A little oasis in the middle of Kathmandu. I went early to take photos before it got busy and didnt want to leave. I would happily go back again with a book just to relax on one of the cushions that were laid down.
Place to chill. If you have a day to spare and staying at thamel...its a nice garden to chill where couples go to hang out....it has a nice restaurant and a coffee place...

Best viewed at night!. We went there on our honeymoon, the first time was at night. Our first candlelight dinner took place in the Garden of Dreams' restaurant. The food was great, although a bit expensive. The place had ancient Roman architecture and was very pleasing. During the day it was not as romantic as it seemed at night; the place was swarming with couples and families and seemed a bit shabbier, but at night the place was very romantically lit and seemed indeed to be a garden of one's dreams! It's a good place for couples or simply to spend some time alone to read a book in a quiet, clean atmosphere. The mocktails are great too, and if you want to grab a snack, those aren't as pricy as the main course items. It's definitely worth a visit.

A paradise in the middle of the city. It is definitly worth a visit. This garden behind high walls is a paradise. It is a very elegant place to go to have a chat between friends on the grass or a bench. The little cafe is offering delicious pastry for an afternoon tea in the sun. Even if you have to pay for the entrance and the Wifi, it is quickly forgiven with the beauty of the flowers and architecture. Not surprise to see young couples having romantic rendez vous in this garden!

Have a short release off Asia.... If you tired of rust, noise and crowds... if you willing to escape hawkers, stalls and beeps of Tamel and got a smell of luxury in the middle of poverty for a peanuts... just drop hear

Good Visit. It is worth able to visit.Welcome to Nepal "known the Kingdom of Himalaya",roof of the World “Mt. Everest”. . A tiny Country Nepal has named as a Heaven on Earth, is a wonder in the Himalayas. It is the Shangri-La, living cultural Museum, birth place of the Lord Buddha and is the country of living Goddess. Nepal offers an astonishing diversity of sightseeing attractions and adventure opportunities found nowhere else on earth. It is also known as a melting pot of Hinduism & Buddhism offering non-stop festivals throughout the year. Nowhere else on the world is found the astonishing diversity of sightseeing attractions and adventure opportunities as Nepal offers. The country is a potpourri of ethnic groups and this is nest of more than 103 different groups and 90 different dialects in this tiny country, and their one different custom, tradition, religion, fest and festival have been dragging from centuries. Come & Join with us! In fact while you travel to Nepal you may encounter with different adventure tours such as Trekking, White water rafting, mountaineering, Wild life jungle safaris, sightseeing at different shrines and old heritage sites, educational tours, flight for Mt. Everest, bungee Jumping honey hunting tour and many more because as we are young and professional for various mountain of Nepal. We are highly delighted to offer you the trip on your favor.
